stanzas.sanskrit: अबो॑ध्य॒ग्निः स॒मिधा॒ जना॑नां॒ प्रति॑ धे॒नुमि॑वाय॒तीमु॒षास॑म् य॒ह्वा इ॑व॒ प्र व॒यामु॒ज्जिहा॑नाः॒ प्र भा॒नवः॑ सिस्रते॒ नाक॒मच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ábodhy agníḥ samídhā jánānām práti dhenúm ivāyatī́m uṣā́sam yahvā́ iva prá vayā́m ujjíhānāḥ prá bhānávaḥ sisrate nā́kam ácha
stanzas.translation: Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow. Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.

translations.griffith: Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow. Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Agni has been wakened by the fuel of men, in face of the Dawn who approaches like a milch-cow. His flames stream forward to the sky like quick (birds) that fly up to a branch.

stanzas.sanskrit: अबो॑धि॒ होता॑ य॒जथा॑य दे॒वानू॒र्ध्वो अ॒ग्निः सु॒मनाः॑ प्रा॒तर॑स्थात् समि॑द्धस्य॒ रुश॑ददर्शि॒ पाजो॑ म॒हान्दे॒वस्तम॑सो॒ निर॑मोचि
stanzas.transliteration: ábodhi hótā yajáthāya devā́n ūrdhvó agníḥ sumánāḥ prātár asthāt sámiddhasya rúśad adarśi pā́jo mahā́n devás támaso nír amoci
stanzas.translation: For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen. Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.

translations.griffith: For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen. Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.
translations.oldenberg: The Hotri has been wakened that there may be sacrifice for the gods. Gracious Agni has stood upright in the morning. When he has been kindled, his brilliant stream of flames has been seen. The great god has been released from darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदीं॑ ग॒णस्य॑ रश॒नामजी॑गः॒ शुचि॑रङ्क्ते॒ शुचि॑भि॒र्गोभि॑र॒ग्निः आद्दक्षि॑णा युज्यते वाज॒यन्त्यु॑त्ता॒नामू॒र्ध्वो अ॑धयज्जु॒हूभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yád īṃ gaṇásya raśanā́m ájīgaḥ śúcir aṅkte śúcibhir góbhir agníḥ ā́d dákṣiṇā yujyate vājayántī- uttānā́m ūrdhvó adhayaj juhū́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed. The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh.

translations.griffith: When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed. The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh.
translations.oldenberg: When he has wakened the string of the crowd (of worshippers) 1, the bright Agni anoints himself with bright cows 2. Then the Dakshinâ is yoked, striving for gain 3. He who stands upright has, by the sacrificial ladles, sucked her who lies extended 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निमच्छा॑ देवय॒तां मनां॑सि॒ चक्षूं॑षीव॒ सूर्ये॒ सं च॑रन्ति यदीं॒ सुवा॑ते उ॒षसा॒ विरू॑पे श्वे॒तो वा॒जी जा॑यते॒ अग्रे॒ अह्ना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agním áchā devayatā́m mánāṃsi cákṣūṃṣīva sū́rye sáṃ caranti yád īṃ súvāte uṣásā vírūpe śvetó vājī́ jāyate ágre áhnām
stanzas.translation: The spirits of the pious turn together to Agni, as the eyes of all to Sûrya. He, when both Dawns of different hues have borne him, springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.

translations.griffith: The spirits of the pious turn together to Agni, as the eyes of all to Sûrya. He, when both Dawns of different hues have borne him, springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.
translations.oldenberg: Towards Agni the minds of the pious turn together as (all) eyes (turn) to the sun. When both Dawns of different colour 1 give birth to him, the white racer is born at the beginning of days.

stanzas.sanskrit: जनि॑ष्ट॒ हि जेन्यो॒ अग्रे॒ अह्नां॑ हि॒तो हि॒तेष्व॑रु॒षो वने॑षु दमे॑दमे स॒प्त रत्ना॒ दधा॑नो॒ऽग्निर्होता॒ नि ष॑सादा॒ यजी॑यान्
stanzas.transliteration: jániṣṭa hí jényo ágre áhnāṃ hitó hitéṣv aruṣó váneṣu dáme-dame saptá rátnā dádhāno -agnír hótā ní ṣasādā yájīyān
stanzas.translation: The noble One was born at days' beginning, laid red in colour mid the well-laid fuel. Yielding in every house his seven rich treasures, Agni is seated, Priest most skilled in worship.

translations.griffith: The noble One was born at days' beginning, laid red in colour mid the well-laid fuel. Yielding in every house his seven rich treasures, Agni is seated, Priest most skilled in worship.
translations.oldenberg: For He, the noble one, has been born at the beginning of days, the red one has been laid down in the woods that have been laid down. Agni, the Hotri, the best sacrificer, has sat down, bestowing his seven treasures on every house.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्होता॒ न्य॑सीद॒द्यजी॑यानु॒पस्थे॑ मा॒तुः सु॑र॒भा उ॑ लो॒के युवा॑ क॒विः पु॑रुनि॒ष्ठ ऋ॒तावा॑ ध॒र्ता कृ॑ष्टी॒नामु॒त मध्य॑ इ॒द्धः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hótā ny àsīdad yájīyān upásthe mātúḥ surabhā́ uloké yúvā kavíḥ puruniṣṭhá r̥tā́vā dhartā́ kr̥ṣṭīnā́m utá mádhya iddháḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni hath sat him down, a Priest most skilful, on a sweet-smelling place, his Mother's bosom. Young, faithful, sage, preeminent o'er many, kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.

translations.griffith: Agni hath sat him down, a Priest most skilful, on a sweet-smelling place, his Mother's bosom. Young, faithful, sage, preeminent o'er many, kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the Hotri, the best sacrificer, sat down in the mother's lap, in the sweet-smelling place, the young sage growing up in many places, the righteous one, the supporter of tribes, and kindled in their midst.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र णु त्यं विप्र॑मध्व॒रेषु॑ सा॒धुम॒ग्निं होता॑रमीळते॒ नमो॑भिः आ यस्त॒तान॒ रोद॑सी ऋ॒तेन॒ नित्यं॑ मृजन्ति वा॒जिनं॑ घृ॒तेन॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá ṇú tyáṃ vípram adhvaréṣu sādhúm agníṃ hótāram īḷate námobhiḥ ā́ yás tatā́na ródasī r̥téna nítyam mr̥janti vājínaṃ ghr̥téna
stanzas.translation: This Singer excellent at sacrifices, Agni the Priest, they glorify with homage. Him who spread out both worlds by Law Eternal they balm with oil, strong Steed who never faileth.

translations.griffith: This Singer excellent at sacrifices, Agni the Priest, they glorify with homage. Him who spread out both worlds by Law Eternal they balm with oil, strong Steed who never faileth.
translations.oldenberg: They magnify with adorations that priest efficacious at sacrifices, Agni the Hotri, who has spread himself over heaven and earth according to Rita; they groom (Agni), the own racer (of men), with Ghrita.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा॒र्जा॒ल्यो॑ मृज्यते॒ स्वे दमू॑नाः कविप्रश॒स्तो अति॑थिः शि॒वो नः॑ स॒हस्र॑शृङ्गो वृष॒भस्तदो॑जा॒ विश्वाँ॑ अग्ने॒ सह॑सा॒ प्रास्य॒न्यान्
stanzas.transliteration: mārjālyò mr̥jyate své dámūnāḥ kavipraśastó átithiḥ śivó naḥ sahásraśr̥ṅgo vr̥ṣabhás tádojāḥ- víśvām̐ agne sáhasā prā́sy anyā́n
stanzas.translation: He, worshipful House-Friend, in his home is worshipped, our own auspicious guest, lauded by sages. That strength the Bull with thousand horns possesses. In might, O Agni, thou excellest others.

translations.griffith: He, worshipful House-Friend, in his home is worshipped, our own auspicious guest, lauded by sages. That strength the Bull with thousand horns possesses. In might, O Agni, thou excellest others.
translations.oldenberg: He who likes to be groomed, is groomed in his own (abode), the house-friend 1, praised by sages, our auspicious guest, the bull with a thousand horns who has the strength of such a one. O Agni! By this power thou surpassest all other (beings).

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र स॒द्यो अ॑ग्ने॒ अत्ये॑ष्य॒न्याना॒विर्यस्मै॒ चारु॑तमो ब॒भूथ॑ ई॒ळेन्यो॑ वपु॒ष्यो॑ वि॒भावा॑ प्रि॒यो वि॒शामति॑थि॒र्मानु॑षीणाम्
stanzas.transliteration: prá sadyó agne áty eṣy anyā́n āvír yásmai cā́rutamo babhū́tha īḷényo vapuṣyò vibhā́vā priyó viśā́m átithir mā́nuṣīṇām
stanzas.translation: Thou quickly passest by all others, Agni, for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely, Wondrously fair, adorable, effulgent, the guest of men, the darling of the people.

translations.griffith: Thou quickly passest by all others, Agni, for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely, Wondrously fair, adorable, effulgent, the guest of men, the darling of the people.
translations.oldenberg: O Agni! Thou overtakest all other (beings) in one moment (for the sake of him) to whom Thou hast become visible as the fairest one, thou who shouldst be magnified, the wonderful, brilliant one, the beloved guest of human clans.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॑ भरन्ति क्षि॒तयो॑ यविष्ठ ब॒लिम॑ग्ने॒ अन्ति॑त॒ ओत दू॒रात् आ भन्दि॑ष्ठस्य सुम॒तिं चि॑किद्धि बृ॒हत्ते॑ अग्ने॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ भ॒द्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyam bharanti kṣitáyo yaviṣṭha balím agne ántita ótá dūrā́t ā́ bhándiṣṭhasya sumatíṃ cikiddhi br̥hát te agne máhi śárma bhadrám
stanzas.translation: To thee, Most Youthful God! to thee, O Agni from near and far the people bring their tribute. Mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee. Great, high, auspicious, Agni, is thy shelter.

translations.griffith: To thee, Most Youthful God! to thee, O Agni from near and far the people bring their tribute. Mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee. Great, high, auspicious, Agni, is thy shelter.
translations.oldenberg: To thee, O youngest (god), the tribes bring tribute, O Agni, from near and far. Behold 1 the grace of the most glorious (god)! Mighty, O Agni, is thy great and glorious shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: आद्य रथं॑ भानुमो भानु॒मन्त॒मग्ने॒ तिष्ठ॑ यज॒तेभिः॒ सम॑न्तम् वि॒द्वान्प॑थी॒नामु॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्ष॒मेह दे॒वान्ह॑वि॒रद्या॑य वक्षि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́dyá rátham bhānumo bhānumántam ágne tíṣṭha yajatébhiḥ sámantam vidvā́n pathīnā́m urv àntárikṣam éhá devā́n havirádyāya vakṣi
stanzas.translation: Ascend to-day thy splendid car, O Agni, in splendour, with the Holy Ones around it. Knowing the paths by mid-air's spacious region bring hither Gods to feast on our oblation.

translations.griffith: Ascend to-day thy splendid car, O Agni, in splendour, with the Holy Ones around it. Knowing the paths by mid-air's spacious region bring hither Gods to feast on our oblation.
translations.oldenberg: Mount to-day, O shining Agni, the shining car, in the neighbourhood of the worshipful (gods). Knowing the paths, the wide air 1, bring hither the gods that they may eat the oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: अवो॑चाम क॒वये॒ मेध्या॑य॒ वचो॑ व॒न्दारु॑ वृष॒भाय॒ वृष्णे॑ गवि॑ष्ठिरो॒ नम॑सा॒ स्तोम॑म॒ग्नौ दि॒वी॑व रु॒क्ममु॑रु॒व्यञ्च॑मश्रेत्
stanzas.transliteration: ávocāma kaváye médhyāya váco vandā́ru vr̥ṣabhā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe gáviṣṭhiro námasā stómam agnaú divī̀va rukmám uruvyáñcam aśret
stanzas.translation: To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage. Gavishṭhira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud far-reaching, like gold light to heaven.

translations.griffith: To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage. Gavishṭhira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud far-reaching, like gold light to heaven.
translations.oldenberg: We have pronounced an adoring speech to the holy sage, to the manly bull. Gavishthira adoringly has sent his song of praise to Agni as the gold (i. e. the sun) far-reaching (is sent by the gods upward) to the sky.

stanzas.sanskrit: कु॒मा॒रं मा॒ता यु॑व॒तिः समु॑ब्धं॒ गुहा॑ बिभर्ति॒ न द॑दाति पि॒त्रे अनी॑कमस्य॒ न मि॒नज्जना॑सः पु॒रः प॑श्यन्ति॒ निहि॑तमर॒तौ
stanzas.transliteration: kumārám mātā́ yuvatíḥ sámubdhaṃ gúhā bibharti ná dadāti pitré ánīkam asya ná mináj jánāsaḥ puráḥ paśyanti níhitam arataú
stanzas.translation: THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father. But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.

translations.griffith: THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father. But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.
translations.oldenberg: The young mother carries in secret the boy confined 1; she does not yield him to the father. People do not see before them his fading 2 face laid down with the Arâti 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: कमे॒तं त्वं यु॑वते कुमा॒रं पेषी॑ बिभर्षि॒ महि॑षी जजान पू॒र्वीर्हि गर्भः॑ श॒रदो॑ व॒वर्धाप॑श्यं जा॒तं यदसू॑त मा॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: kám etáṃ tváṃ yuvate kumārám péṣī bibharṣi máhiṣī jajāna pūrvī́r hí gárbhaḥ śarádo vavárdha- -ápaśyaṃ jātáṃ yád ásūta mātā́
stanzas.translation: What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath bome him. The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.

translations.griffith: What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath bome him. The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.
translations.oldenberg: Who is that boy, O young woman, whom thou, the Peshî 1, carriest? It is the queen who has borne him. Through many autumns the fruit of the womb has increased. I saw him born when his mother gave birth to him.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यदन्तं॒ शुचि॑वर्णमा॒रात्क्षेत्रा॑दपश्य॒मायु॑धा॒ मिमा॑नम् द॒दा॒नो अ॑स्मा अ॒मृतं॑ वि॒पृक्व॒त्किं माम॑नि॒न्द्राः कृ॑णवन्ननु॒क्थाः
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyadantaṃ śúcivarṇam ārā́t kṣétrād apaśyam ā́yudhā mímānam dadānó asmā amŕ̥taṃ vipŕ̥kvat kím mā́m anindrā́ḥ kr̥ṇavann anukthā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation, What time I gave him Amrit free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?

translations.griffith: I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation, What time I gave him Amrit free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?
translations.oldenberg: I saw him the gold-toothed, brilliant-coloured preparing his weapons far from his dwelling-place 1. After I have offered to him the ambrosia cleared (from all impure mixture) 2—what may the Indra-less, the hymnless do to me?

stanzas.sanskrit: क्षेत्रा॑दपश्यं सनु॒तश्चर॑न्तं सु॒मद्यू॒थं न पु॒रु शोभ॑मानम् न ता अ॑गृभ्र॒न्नज॑निष्ट॒ हि षः पलि॑क्नी॒रिद्यु॑व॒तयो॑ भवन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: kṣétrād apaśyaṃ sanutáś cárantaṃ sumád yūtháṃ ná purú śóbhamānam ná tā́ agr̥bhrann ájaniṣṭa hí ṣáḥ páliknīr íd yuvatáyo bhavanti
stanzas.translation: I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining. These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.

translations.griffith: I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining. These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.
translations.oldenberg: I saw him, the highly shining (Agni), walking far from his dwelling-place, like (a bull) together with the herd 1. Those (women) have not held him, for he has been born. The young women become grey 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: के मे॑ मर्य॒कं वि य॑वन्त॒ गोभि॒र्न येषां॑ गो॒पा अर॑णश्चि॒दास॑ य ईं॑ जगृ॒भुरव॒ ते सृ॑ज॒न्त्वाजा॑ति प॒श्व उप॑ नश्चिकि॒त्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: ké me maryakáṃ ví yavanta góbhir ná yéṣāṃ gopā́ áraṇaś cid ā́sa yá īṃ jagr̥bhúr áva té sr̥jantu- ā́jāti paśvá úpa naś cikitvā́n
stanzas.translation: Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger? Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to usward.

translations.griffith: Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger? Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to usward.
translations.oldenberg: Who have separated my young bull from the cows that 1 had no cow-herd, not even a stranger? May those who have held him, let him loose. May he, the knowing one, lead the cattle towards us.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒सां राजा॑नं वस॒तिं जना॑ना॒मरा॑तयो॒ नि द॑धु॒र्मर्त्ये॑षु ब्रह्मा॒ण्यत्रे॒रव॒ तं सृ॑जन्तु निन्दि॒तारो॒ निन्द्या॑सो भवन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: vasā́ṃ rā́jānaṃ vasatíṃ jánānām árātayo ní dadhur mártyeṣu bráhmāṇy átrer áva táṃ sr̥jantu ninditā́ro níndyāso bhavantu
stanzas.translation: Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people. So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.

translations.griffith: Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people. So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.
translations.oldenberg: Him, the king of dwellings (?) 1, the dwelling-place of people, the Arâtis have laid down 2 among men. May the spells of Atri loose him. May the reproachers become reproachable (themselves).

stanzas.sanskrit: शुन॑श्चि॒च्छेपं॒ निदि॑तं स॒हस्रा॒द्यूपा॑दमुञ्चो॒ अश॑मिष्ट॒ हि षः ए॒वास्मद॑ग्ने॒ वि मु॑मुग्धि॒ पाशा॒न्होत॑श्चिकित्व इ॒ह तू नि॒षद्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: śúnaś cic chépaṃ níditaṃ sahásrād yū́pād amuñco áśamiṣṭa hí ṣáḥ evā́smád agne ví mumugdhi pā́śān hótaś cikitva ihá tū́ niṣádya
stanzas.translation: Thou from the stake didst loose e'en Ṣunaḥṣepa bound for a thousand; for he prayed with fervour. So, Agni, loose from us the bonds that bind us, when thou art seated here, O Priest who knowest.

translations.griffith: Thou from the stake didst loose e'en Ṣunaḥṣepa bound for a thousand; for he prayed with fervour. So, Agni, loose from us the bonds that bind us, when thou art seated here, O Priest who knowest.
translations.oldenberg: Thou hast loosed the bound Sunahsepa from the thousand sacrificial posts; for he toiled (worshipping thee). Thus, O Agni, loose from us the fetters, O knowing Hotri, sitting down here.

stanzas.sanskrit: हृ॒णी॒यमा॑नो॒ अप॒ हि मदैयेः॒ प्र मे॑ दे॒वानां॑ व्रत॒पा उ॑वाच इन्द्रो॑ वि॒द्वाँ अनु॒ हि त्वा॑ च॒चक्ष॒ तेना॒हम॑ग्ने॒ अनु॑शिष्ट॒ आगा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: hr̥ṇīyámāno ápa hí mád aíyeḥ prá me devā́nāṃ vratapā́ uvāca índro vidvā́m̐ ánu hí tvā cacákṣa ténāhám agne ánuśiṣṭa ā́gām
stanzas.translation: Thou hast sped from me, Agni, in thine anger: this the protector of Gods' Laws hath told me. Indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee: by him instructed am I come, O Agni.

translations.griffith: Thou hast sped from me, Agni, in thine anger: this the protector of Gods' Laws hath told me. Indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee: by him instructed am I come, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: 1 For thou hast gone away 2 from me, because thou wert angry; (this) the protector of the laws of the gods 3 has told me. (But) Indra, the knowing one, has looked after thee. Instructed by him, O Agni, I have come hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि ज्योति॑षा बृह॒ता भा॑त्य॒ग्निरा॒विर्विश्वा॑नि कृणुते महि॒त्वा प्रादे॑वीर्मा॒याः स॑हते दु॒रेवाः॒ शिशी॑ते॒ शृङ्गे॒ रक्ष॑से वि॒निक्षे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví jyótiṣā br̥hatā́ bhāty agnír āvír víśvāni kr̥ṇute mahitvā́ prā́devīr māyā́ḥ sahate durévāḥ śíśīte śŕ̥ṅge rákṣase viníkṣe
stanzas.translation: Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his greatness makes all things apparent. He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the Raksas.

translations.griffith: Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his greatness makes all things apparent. He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the Raksas.
translations.oldenberg: Agni shines with mighty light; he makes all things visible by his greatness. He conquers godless, wicked wiles. He sharpens his two horns in order to pierce the Rakshas.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्वा॒नासो॑ दि॒वि ष॑न्त्व॒ग्नेस्ति॒ग्मायु॑धा॒ रक्ष॑से॒ हन्त॒वा उ॑ मदे॑ चिदस्य॒ प्र रु॑जन्ति॒ भामा॒ न व॑रन्ते परि॒बाधो॒ अदे॑वीः
stanzas.transliteration: utá svānā́so diví ṣantv agnés tigmā́yudhā rákṣase hántavā́ u máde cid asya prá rujanti bhā́māḥ- ná varante paribā́dho ádevīḥ
stanzas.translation: Loud in the heaven above be Agni's roarings with keen-edged weapons to destroy the demons. Forth burst his splendours in the Soma's rapture. The godless bands press round but cannot stayhim.

translations.griffith: Loud in the heaven above be Agni's roarings with keen-edged weapons to destroy the demons. Forth burst his splendours in the Soma's rapture. The godless bands press round but cannot stayhim.
translations.oldenberg: And may the roarings of Agni mount up to the sky, with sharp weapons in order to kill the Rakshas. In his rapture his flames break down (everything); the godless hindrances do not hold him back.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तं ते॒ स्तोमं॑ तुविजात॒ विप्रो॒ रथं॒ न धीरः॒ स्वपा॑ अतक्षम् यदीद॑ग्ने॒ प्रति॒ त्वं दे॑व॒ हर्याः॒ स्व॑र्वतीर॒प ए॑ना जयेम
stanzas.transliteration: etáṃ te stómaṃ tuvijāta vípro ráthaṃ ná dhī́raḥ svápā atakṣam yádī́d agne práti tváṃ deva háryāḥ svàrvatīr apá enā jayema
stanzas.translation: As a skilled craftsman makes a car, a singer I, Mighty One! this hymn for thee have fashioned. If thou, O Agni, God, accept it gladly, may we obtain thereby the heavenly Waters.

translations.griffith: As a skilled craftsman makes a car, a singer I, Mighty One! this hymn for thee have fashioned. If thou, O Agni, God, accept it gladly, may we obtain thereby the heavenly Waters.
translations.oldenberg: This song of praise, O strong-born (Agni), I, the priest, have fashioned for thee, as a skilful workman (builds) a chariot 1. If thou acceptest that (praise), O god Agni, may we conquer thereby waters together with the sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: तु॒वि॒ग्रीवो॑ वृष॒भो वा॑वृधा॒नो॑ऽश॒त्र्व१॒॑र्यः सम॑जाति॒ वेदः॑ इती॒मम॒ग्निम॒मृता॑ अवोचन्ब॒र्हिष्म॑ते॒ मन॑वे॒ शर्म॑ यंसद्ध॒विष्म॑ते॒ मन॑वे॒ शर्म॑ यंसत्
stanzas.transliteration: tuvigrī́vo vr̥ṣabhó vāvr̥dhānáḥ- -aśatrv àryáḥ sám ajāti védaḥ ítīmám agním amŕ̥tā avocan barhíṣmate mánave śárma yaṃsad -havíṣmate mánave śárma yaṃsat
stanzas.translation: May he, the strong-necked Steer, waxing in vigour, gather the foeman's wealth with none to check him. Thus to this Agni have the Immortals spoken. To man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter, grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.

translations.griffith: May he, the strong-necked Steer, waxing in vigour, gather the foeman's wealth with none to check him. Thus to this Agni have the Immortals spoken. To man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter, grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.
translations.oldenberg: May the bull 1 with mighty neck, grown strong, with no foe to resist him, get together the niggard's wealth. Thus the immortal (gods) have spoken to this Agni: may he grant protection to the man who has spread the Barhis; may he grant protection to the man who brings offerings.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ वरु॑णो॒ जाय॑से॒ यत्त्वं मि॒त्रो भ॑वसि॒ यत्समि॑द्धः त्वे विश्वे॑ सहसस्पुत्र दे॒वास्त्वमिन्द्रो॑ दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne váruṇo jā́yase yát tvám mitró bhavasi yát sámiddhaḥ tvé víśve sahasas putra devā́s tvám índro dāśúṣe mártyāya
stanzas.translation: THOU at thy birth art Varuṇa, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra. In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.

translations.griffith: THOU at thy birth art Varuṇa, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra. In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art Varuna, when born; thou becomest Mitra when kindled. In thee, O son of strength, the Visvedevâs (dwell). Thou art Indra for the mortal worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑र्य॒मा भ॑वसि॒ यत्क॒नीनां॒ नाम॑ स्वधाव॒न्गुह्यं॑ बिभर्षि अ॒ञ्जन्ति॑ मि॒त्रं सुधि॑तं॒ न गोभि॒र्यद्दम्प॑ती॒ सम॑नसा कृ॒णोषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám aryamā́ bhavasi yát kanī́nāṃ nā́ma svadhāvan gúhyam bibharṣi añjánti mitráṃ súdhitaṃ ná góbhir yád dámpatī sámanasā kr̥ṇóṣi
stanzas.translation: Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer. As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makcst wife and lord oneminded.

translations.griffith: Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer. As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makcst wife and lord oneminded.
translations.oldenberg: Thou becomest Aryaman when thou bearest 1 the secret name of the maidens, O self-dependent one. They anoint (thee) with cows 2 like the well-established Mitra 3, when thou makest husband and wife one-minded.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ श्रि॒ये म॒रुतो॑ मर्जयन्त॒ रुद्र॒ यत्ते॒ जनि॑म॒ चारु॑ चि॒त्रम् प॒दं यद्विष्णो॑रुप॒मं नि॒धायि॒ तेन॑ पासि॒ गुह्यं॒ नाम॒ गोना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táva śriyé marúto marjayanta rúdra yát te jánima cā́ru citrám padáṃ yád víṣṇor upamáṃ nidhā́yi téna pāsi gúhyaṃ nā́ma gónām
stanzas.translation: The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured. That which was fixed as Vishṇu's loftiest station-therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.

translations.griffith: The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured. That which was fixed as Vishṇu's loftiest station-therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.
translations.oldenberg: For thy glory the Maruts have cleansed themselves 1, who are thy fair and brilliant offspring, O Rudra 2! The footprint of Vishnu which is put down in the highest place: therewith thou protectest the secret name of the cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ श्रि॒या सु॒दृशो॑ देव दे॒वाः पु॒रू दधा॑ना अ॒मृतं॑ सपन्त होता॑रम॒ग्निं मनु॑षो॒ नि षे॑दुर्दश॒स्यन्त॑ उ॒शिजः॒ शंस॑मा॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: táva śriyā́ sudŕ̥śo deva devā́ḥ purū́ dádhānā amŕ̥taṃ sapanta hótāram agním mánuṣo ní ṣedur daśasyánta uśíjaḥ śáṃsam āyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal. As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.

translations.griffith: Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal. As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.
translations.oldenberg: By thy beauty, O god, the gods are beautiful to behold 1. Assuming many (powers or goods) they attached themselves to immortality. Men have set down Agni as the Hotri, the Usigs, honouring (him), the praise of Âyu 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: न त्वद्धोता॒ पूर्वो॑ अग्ने॒ यजी॑या॒न्न काव्यैः॑ प॒रो अ॑स्ति स्वधावः वि॒शश्च॒ यस्या॒ अति॑थि॒र्भवा॑सि॒ स य॒ज्ञेन॑ वनवद्देव॒ मर्ता॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ná tvád dhótā pū́rvo agne yájīyān ná kā́vyaiḥ paró asti svadhāvaḥ viśáś ca yásyā átithir bhávāsi sá yajñéna vanavad deva mártān
stanzas.translation: There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom. Ile man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.

translations.griffith: There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom. Ile man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.
translations.oldenberg: There is no (other) Hotri before thee, a better sacrificer 1; no one surpasses thee, O self-dependent one, by wisdom. And that house of which thou art the guest, he 2, O god, will overcome the mortals by his sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यम॑ग्ने वनुयाम॒ त्वोता॑ वसू॒यवो॑ ह॒विषा॒ बुध्य॑मानाः व॒यं स॑म॒र्ये वि॒दथे॒ष्वह्नां॑ व॒यं रा॒या स॑हसस्पुत्र॒ मर्ता॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: vayám agne vanuyāma tvótāḥ- vasūyávo havíṣā búdhyamānāḥ vayáṃ samaryé vidátheṣv áhnāṃ vayáṃ rāyā́ sahasas putra mártān
stanzas.translation: Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened: May we in battle, in the days' assemblies,O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened: May we in battle, in the days' assemblies,O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.
translations.oldenberg: May we overcome the mortals, O Agni, protected by thee, striving for wealth, awaking (thee) with offerings; may we (overcome mortals) in the contest, in the distribution 1 of days; may we (overcome them) by wealth, O son of strength!

stanzas.sanskrit: यो न॒ आगो॑ अ॒भ्येनो॒ भरा॒त्यधीद॒घम॒घशं॑से दधात ज॒ही चि॑कित्वो अ॒भिश॑स्तिमे॒तामग्ने॒ यो नो॑ म॒र्चय॑ति द्व॒येन॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó na ā́go abhy éno bhárāti- ádhī́d aghám agháśaṃse dadhāta jahī́ cikitvo abhíśastim etā́m ágne yó no marcáyati dvayéna
stanzas.translation: He shall bring evil on the evil-plottcr whoever turns against us sin and outrage. Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.

translations.griffith: He shall bring evil on the evil-plottcr whoever turns against us sin and outrage. Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.
translations.oldenberg: If a man should turn upon us sin or guilt, bring ye the evil on him who pronounces evil spells (against us). Destroy, O knowing one, such a curse, O Agni, (of a man) who injures us by falsehood.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॒स्या व्युषि॑ देव॒ पूर्वे॑ दू॒तं कृ॑ण्वा॒ना अ॑यजन्त ह॒व्यैः सं॒स्थे यद॑ग्न॒ ईय॑से रयी॒णां दे॒वो मर्तै॒र्वसु॑भिरि॒ध्यमा॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m asyā́ vyúṣi deva pū́rve dūtáṃ kr̥ṇvānā́ ayajanta havyaíḥ saṃsthé yád agna ī́yase rayīṇā́ṃ devó mártair vásubhir idhyámānaḥ
stanzas.translation: At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy, When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God cnkindled with good things by mortals.

translations.griffith: At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy, When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God cnkindled with good things by mortals.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O god, the ancient (mortals) have made their messenger at the break of this (dawn), and have sacrificed with their oblations, when thou goest along, O Agni, in the abode of wealth, a god kindled by the mortals and by the Vasus.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑ स्पृधि पि॒तरं॒ योधि॑ वि॒द्वान्पु॒त्रो यस्ते॑ सहसः सून ऊ॒हे क॒दा चि॑कित्वो अ॒भि च॑क्षसे॒ नोऽग्ने॑ क॒दाँ ऋ॑त॒चिद्या॑तयासे
stanzas.transliteration: áva spr̥dhi pitáraṃ yódhi vidvā́n putró yás te sahasaḥ sūna ūhé kadā́ cikitvo abhí cakṣase naḥ- -ágne kadā́m̐ r̥tacíd yātayāse
stanzas.translation: Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power. O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?

translations.griffith: Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power. O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?
translations.oldenberg: Protect the father—drive away (evil) as the knowing one—(the father) who is considered 1 as thy son, O son of strength 2. When, O sapient (Agni), wilt thou look upon us? When wilt thou, who knowest Rita, requite (human deeds)?

stanzas.sanskrit: भूरि॒ नाम॒ वन्द॑मानो दधाति पि॒ता व॑सो॒ यदि॒ तज्जो॒षया॑से कु॒विद्दे॒वस्य॒ सह॑सा चका॒नः सु॒म्नम॒ग्निर्व॑नते वावृधा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: bhū́ri nā́ma vándamāno dadhāti pitā́ vaso yádi táj joṣáyāse kuvíd devásya sáhasā cakānáḥ sumnám agnír vanate vāvr̥dhānáḥ
stanzas.translation: Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father. And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?

translations.griffith: Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father. And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?
translations.oldenberg: The father 1 adoring gives many names to thee, O Vasu, if thou shouldst take pleasure therein. Will not Agni, delighting in his divine power, grant us his favour, he who has grown strong?

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॒ङ्ग ज॑रि॒तारं॑ यविष्ठ॒ विश्वा॑न्यग्ने दुरि॒ताति॑ पर्षि स्ते॒ना अ॑दृश्रन्रि॒पवो॒ जना॒सोऽज्ञा॑तकेता वृजि॒ना अ॑भूवन्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám aṅgá jaritā́raṃ yaviṣṭha víśvāny agne duritā́ti parṣi stenā́ adr̥śran ripávo jánāsaḥ- -ájñātaketā vr̥jinā́ abhūvan
stanzas.translation: Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles. Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.

translations.griffith: Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles. Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.
translations.oldenberg: Thou indeed, O Agni, youngest one, bringest thy praiser across all dangers. Thieves have been seen and deceitful men; dishonest people have come with unknown designs.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मे यामा॑सस्त्व॒द्रिग॑भूव॒न्वस॑वे वा॒ तदिदागो॑ अवाचि नाहा॒यम॒ग्निर॒भिश॑स्तये नो॒ न रीष॑ते वावृधा॒नः परा॑ दात्
stanzas.transliteration: imé yā́māsas tvadríg abhūvan vásave vā tád íd ā́go avāci nā́hāyám agnír abhíśastaye no ná rī́ṣate vāvr̥dhānáḥ párā dāt
stanzas.translation: To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken. But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.

translations.griffith: To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken. But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.
translations.oldenberg: These our processions have been directed towards thee. Yes, to thee, the Vasu, this guilt has been confessed. Verily this Agni, grown strong, will never surrender us to the curse nor to him who does harm to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ वसु॑पतिं॒ वसू॑नाम॒भि प्र म॑न्दे अध्व॒रेषु॑ राजन् त्वया॒ वाजं॑ वाज॒यन्तो॑ जयेमा॒भि ष्या॑म पृत्सु॒तीर्मर्त्या॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne vásupatiṃ vásūnām abhí prá mande adhvaréṣu rājan tváyā vā́jaṃ vājayánto jayema- -abhí ṣyāma pr̥tsutī́r mártyānām
stanzas.translation: O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices. Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.

translations.griffith: O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices. Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the treasure-lord of treasures, I gladden at the sacrifices, O king! May we, striving for gain, conquer gain through thee; may we overcome the hostilities of mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒व्य॒वाळ॒ग्निर॒जरः॑ पि॒ता नो॑ वि॒भुर्वि॒भावा॑ सु॒दृशी॑को अ॒स्मे सु॒गा॒र्ह॒प॒त्याः समिषो॑ दिदीह्यस्म॒द्र्य१॒॑क्सं मि॑मीहि॒ श्रवां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: havyavā́ḷ agnír ajáraḥ pitā́ no vibhúr vibhā́vā sudŕ̥śīko asmé sugārhapatyā́ḥ sám íṣo didīhi- asmadryàk sám mimīhi śrávāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Agni, Eternal Father, offering- bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent, From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.

translations.griffith: Agni, Eternal Father, offering- bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent, From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the bearer of oblations, our ever-young father, is mighty, brilliant, beautiful to behold among us. Shine (on us) food with a good household 1. Turn all glory towards us 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒शां क॒विं वि॒श्पतिं॒ मानु॑षीणां॒ शुचिं॑ पाव॒कं घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठम॒ग्निम् नि होता॑रं विश्व॒विदं॑ दधिध्वे॒ स दे॒वेषु॑ वनते॒ वार्या॑णि
stanzas.transliteration: viśā́ṃ kavíṃ viśpátim mā́nuṣīṇāṃ śúcim pāvakáṃ ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭham agním ní hótāraṃ viśvavídaṃ dadhidhve sá devéṣu vanate vā́ryāṇi
stanzas.translation: The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter, Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.

translations.griffith: The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter, Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.
translations.oldenberg: Establish Agni as the Hotri, the sage of the clans, the lord of human clans, the bright purifier, whose back is covered with ghee, the omniscient. May he obtain the best goods (for us) among the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: जु॒षस्वा॑ग्न॒ इळ॑या स॒जोषा॒ यत॑मानो र॒श्मिभिः॒ सूर्य॑स्य जु॒षस्व॑ नः स॒मिधं॑ जातवेद॒ आ च॑ दे॒वान्ह॑वि॒रद्या॑य वक्षि
stanzas.transliteration: juṣásvāgna íḷayā sajóṣāḥ- yátamāno raśmíbhiḥ sū́ryasya juṣásva naḥ samídhaṃ jātavedaḥ- ā́ ca devā́n havirádyāya vakṣi
stanzas.translation: Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Iḷâ, striving in rivalry with beams of Sarya, Enjoy, O Jâtavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.

translations.griffith: Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Iḷâ, striving in rivalry with beams of Sarya, Enjoy, O Jâtavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.
translations.oldenberg: Enjoy thyself, O Agni, joined with Idâ, uniting thyself with the rays of the sun. Enjoy our fuel, O Gâtavedas, and bring the gods hither that they may eat our offerings.

stanzas.sanskrit: जुष्टो॒ दमू॑ना॒ अति॑थिर्दुरो॒ण इ॒मं नो॑ य॒ज्ञमुप॑ याहि वि॒द्वान् विश्वा॑ अग्ने अभि॒युजो॑ वि॒हत्या॑ शत्रूय॒तामा भ॑रा॒ भोज॑नानि
stanzas.transliteration: júṣṭo dámūnā átithir duroṇé- imáṃ no yajñám úpa yāhi vidvā́n víśvā agne abhiyújo vihátyā śatrūyatā́m ā́ bharā bhójanāni
stanzas.translation: As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest. And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.

translations.griffith: As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest. And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.
translations.oldenberg: Welcome, as our household-god and the guest in our dwelling, come to this our sacrifice as the knowing one. Dispelling, O Agni, all (hostile) attempts, bring to us the possessions of those who are at enmity with us.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒धेन॒ दस्युं॒ प्र हि चा॒तय॑स्व॒ वयः॑ कृण्वा॒नस्त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ स्वायै॑ पिप॑र्षि॒ यत्स॑हसस्पुत्र दे॒वान्त्सो अ॑ग्ने पाहि नृतम॒ वाजे॑ अ॒स्मान्
stanzas.transliteration: vadhéna dásyum prá hí cātáyasva váyaḥ kr̥ṇvānás tanvè svā́yai píparṣi yát sahasas putra devā́n só agne pāhi nr̥tama vā́je asmā́n
stanzas.translation: Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body, O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.

translations.griffith: Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body, O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.
translations.oldenberg: Drive away the Dasyu with thy weapon, creating strength for thy own body. When thou bringest the gods across (to us), O son of strength, then, O manliest Agni, protect us in (our striving for) gain.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं ते॑ अग्न उ॒क्थैर्वि॑धेम व॒यं ह॒व्यैः पा॑वक भद्रशोचे अ॒स्मे र॒यिं वि॒श्ववा॑रं॒ समि॑न्वा॒स्मे विश्वा॑नि॒ द्रवि॑णानि धेहि
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ te agna ukthaír vidhema vayáṃ havyaíḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce asmé rayíṃ viśvávāraṃ sám inva- -asmé víśvāni dráviṇāni dhehi
stanzas.translation: May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier! Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.

translations.griffith: May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier! Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.
translations.oldenberg: May we worship thee, O Agni, with hymns, with offerings, O purifier with glorious light. Stir for us wealth with all goods; bestow on us all riches!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मग्ने अध्व॒रं जु॑षस्व॒ सह॑सः सूनो त्रिषधस्थ ह॒व्यम् व॒यं दे॒वेषु॑ सु॒कृतः॑ स्याम॒ शर्म॑णा नस्त्रि॒वरू॑थेन पाहि
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam agne adhvaráṃ juṣasva sáhasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyám vayáṃ devéṣu sukŕ̥taḥ syāma śármaṇā nas trivárūthena pāhi
stanzas.translation: Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation. Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.

translations.griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation. Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.
translations.oldenberg: Gâtavedas, as with a boat across a river. Agni, being praised with adoration as (thou hast been praised) by Atri, be a protector of our bodies.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑नि नो दु॒र्गहा॑ जातवेदः॒ सिन्धुं॒ न ना॒वा दु॑रि॒ताति॑ पर्षि अग्ने॑ अत्रि॒वन्नम॑सा गृणा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽस्माकं॑ बोध्यवि॒ता त॒नूना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: víśvāni no durgáhā jātavedaḥ síndhuṃ ná nāvā́ duritā́ti parṣi ágne atriván námasā gr̥ṇānáḥ- -asmā́kam bodhy avitā́ tanū́nām
stanzas.translation: Over all woes and dangers, Jâtavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river. Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.

translations.griffith: Over all woes and dangers, Jâtavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river. Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.
translations.oldenberg: Bring us across all difficulties and dangers,

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वा॑ हृ॒दा की॒रिणा॒ मन्य॑मा॒नोऽम॑र्त्यं॒ मर्त्यो॒ जोह॑वीमि जात॑वेदो॒ यशो॑ अ॒स्मासु॑ धेहि प्र॒जाभि॑रग्ने अमृत॒त्वम॑श्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvā hr̥dā́ kīríṇā mányamānaḥ- -ámartyam mártyo jóhavīmi jā́tavedo yáśo asmā́su dhehi prajā́bhir agne amr̥tatvám aśyām
stanzas.translation: As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal, Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jâtavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.

translations.griffith: As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal, Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jâtavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.
translations.oldenberg: When I, the mortal, call thee, the immortal, thinking of thee with humble mind 1, bestow glory on us, O Gâtavedas; may I attain immortality, O Agni, with my offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्मै॒ त्वं सु॒कृते॑ जातवेद उ लो॒कम॑ग्ने कृ॒णवः॑ स्यो॒नम् अ॒श्विनं॒ स पु॒त्रिणं॑ वी॒रव॑न्तं॒ गोम॑न्तं र॒यिं न॑शते स्व॒स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: yásmai tváṃ sukŕ̥te jātavedaḥ- ulokám agne kr̥ṇávaḥ syonám aśvínaṃ sá putríṇaṃ vīrávantaṃ gómantaṃ rayíṃ naśate svastí
stanzas.translation: The pious man, O Jâtavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure, Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.

translations.griffith: The pious man, O Jâtavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure, Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.
translations.oldenberg: The well-doer to whom thou, O Agni Gâtavedas, createst pleasant freedom, will happily attain wealth with horses and sons, with valiant men and cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: सुस॑मिद्धाय शो॒चिषे॑ घृ॒तं ती॒व्रं जु॑होतन अ॒ग्नये॑ जा॒तवे॑दसे
stanzas.transliteration: súsamiddhāya śocíṣe ghr̥táṃ tīvráṃ juhotana agnáye jātávedase
stanzas.translation: To Agni, Jâtavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God, Offer thick sacrificial oil.

translations.griffith: To Agni, Jâtavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God, Offer thick sacrificial oil.
translations.oldenberg: Sacrifice sharp ghrita to the well-kindled light, to Agni Gâtavedas.

stanzas.sanskrit: नरा॒शंसः॑ सुषूदती॒मं य॒ज्ञमदा॑भ्यः क॒विर्हि मधु॑हस्त्यः
stanzas.transliteration: nárāśáṃsaḥ suṣūdati- -imáṃ yajñám ádābhyaḥ kavír hí mádhuhastyaḥ
stanzas.translation: He, Narâṣansa, ne'er beguiled, inspiriteth this sacrifice: For sage is he, with sweets in hand.

translations.griffith: He, Narâṣansa, ne'er beguiled, inspiriteth this sacrifice: For sage is he, with sweets in hand.
translations.oldenberg: May the unbeguiled Narâsamsa make this sacrifice ready; for he is a sage with honey in his hand.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒ळि॒तो अ॑ग्न॒ आ व॒हेन्द्रं॑ चि॒त्रमि॒ह प्रि॒यम् सु॒खै रथे॑भिरू॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: īḷitó agna ā́ vaha- -índraṃ citrám ihá priyám sukhaí ráthebhir ūtáye
stanzas.translation: Adored, O Agni, hither bring Indra the Wonderful, the Friend, On lightly-rolling car to aid.

translations.griffith: Adored, O Agni, hither bring Indra the Wonderful, the Friend, On lightly-rolling car to aid.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Agni, magnified by us, bring hither to our help the bright, beloved Indra, with easy-going chariots.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊर्ण॑म्रदा॒ वि प्र॑थस्वा॒भ्य१॒॑र्का अ॑नूषत भवा॑ नः शुभ्र सा॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ū́rṇamradā ví prathasva- -abhy àrkā́ anūṣata bhávā naḥ śubhra sātáye
stanzas.translation: Spread thyself out, thou soft as wool The holy hymns have sung to thee. Bring gain to us, O beautiful!

translations.griffith: Spread thyself out, thou soft as wool The holy hymns have sung to thee. Bring gain to us, O beautiful!
translations.oldenberg: Soft like wool 1 spread thyself (O Barhis). The hymns have been sung to thee. Be to us for success, O beautiful (Barhis)!

stanzas.sanskrit: देवी॑र्द्वारो॒ वि श्र॑यध्वं सुप्राय॒णा न॑ ऊ॒तये॑ प्रप्र॑ य॒ज्ञं पृ॑णीतन
stanzas.transliteration: dévīr dvāro ví śrayadhvaṃ suprāyaṇā́ na ūtáye prá-pra yajñám pr̥ṇītana
stanzas.translation: Open yourselves, ye Doors Divine, easy of access for our aid: Fill, more and more, the sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Open yourselves, ye Doors Divine, easy of access for our aid: Fill, more and more, the sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: O divine, easily passable doors, open yourselves for our protection. Fill the sacrifice (with bliss) further and further!

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒प्रती॑के वयो॒वृधा॑ य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑ मा॒तरा॑ दो॒षामु॒षास॑मीमहे
stanzas.transliteration: suprátīke vayovŕ̥dhā yahvī́ r̥tásya mātárā doṣā́m uṣā́sam īmahe
stanzas.translation: Fair strengtheners of vital power, young Mothers of eternal Law, Morning and Night we supplicate.

translations.griffith: Fair strengtheners of vital power, young Mothers of eternal Law, Morning and Night we supplicate.
translations.oldenberg: We approach (with prayers) Night and Morning, whose face is beautiful, the increasers of vital strength, the two young mothers of Rita.

stanzas.sanskrit: वात॑स्य॒ पत्म॑न्नीळि॒ता दैव्या॒ होता॑रा॒ मनु॑षः इ॒मं नो॑ य॒ज्ञमा ग॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: vā́tasya pátmann īḷitā́ daívyā hótārā mánuṣaḥ imáṃ no yajñám ā́ gatam
stanzas.translation: On the wind's flight come, glorified, ye two celestial Priests of man Come ye to this our sacrifice.

translations.griffith: On the wind's flight come, glorified, ye two celestial Priests of man Come ye to this our sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: On the wind's flight, magnified, ye two divine Hotris of man, come hither to this our sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॒ सर॑स्वती म॒ही ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्म॑यो॒भुवः॑ ब॒र्हिः सी॑दन्त्व॒स्रिधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: íḷā sárasvatī mahī́ tisró devī́r mayobhúvaḥ barhíḥ sīdantv asrídhaḥ
stanzas.translation: lḷâ, Sarasvatî, Mahî, three Goddesses who bring us weal, Be seated harmless on the grass.

translations.griffith: lḷâ, Sarasvatî, Mahî, three Goddesses who bring us weal, Be seated harmless on the grass.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Ilâ, Sarasvatî, and Mahî, the three comfort-giving goddesses, they who do not fail, shall sit down on the sacrificial grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: शि॒वस्त्व॑ष्टरि॒हा ग॑हि वि॒भुः पोष॑ उ॒त त्मना॑ य॒ज्ञेय॑ज्ञे न॒ उद॑व
stanzas.transliteration: śivás tvaṣṭar ihā́ gahi vibhúḥ póṣa utá tmánā yajñé-yajñe na úd ava
stanzas.translation: Rich in all plenty, Tvashṭar, come auspicious of thine own accord Help us in every sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Rich in all plenty, Tvashṭar, come auspicious of thine own accord Help us in every sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: Come hither as a friend, Tvashtri and mighty in welfare, and also by thyself, protect us in every sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॒ वेत्थ॑ वनस्पते दे॒वानां॒ गुह्या॒ नामा॑नि तत्र॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ गामय
stanzas.transliteration: yátra véttha vanaspate devā́nāṃ gúhyā nā́māni tátra havyā́ni gāmaya
stanzas.translation: Vanaspati, wherever thou knowest the Gods' mysterious names, Send our oblations thitherward.

translations.griffith: Vanaspati, wherever thou knowest the Gods' mysterious names, Send our oblations thitherward.
translations.oldenberg: Where thou knowest, O tree (i. e. sacrificial post), the secret names of the gods, to that place make the offerings go.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्वाहा॒ग्नये॒ वरु॑णाय॒ स्वाहेन्द्रा॑य म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ स्वाहा॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ह॒विः
stanzas.transliteration: svā́hāgnáye váruṇāya svā́héndrāya marúdbhyaḥ svā́hā devébhyo havíḥ
stanzas.translation: To Agni and to Varuṇa, Indra, the Maruts, and the Gods, With Svâhâ be oblation brought.

translations.griffith: To Agni and to Varuṇa, Indra, the Maruts, and the Gods, With Svâhâ be oblation brought.
translations.oldenberg: Svâhâ to Agni and Varuna! Svâhâ to Indra and the Maruts! Svâhâ to the gods for our offering!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं तं म॑न्ये॒ यो वसु॒रस्तं॒ यं यन्ति॑ धे॒नवः॑ अस्त॒मर्व॑न्त आ॒शवोऽस्तं॒ नित्या॑सो वा॒जिन॒ इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ tám manye yó vásur ástaṃ yáṃ yánti dhenávaḥ ástam árvanta āśávaḥ- -ástaṃ nítyāso vājínaḥ- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: I VALUE Agni that good Lord, the home to which the kine return: Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: I VALUE Agni that good Lord, the home to which the kine return: Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: I think of that Agni who is a Vasu, to whom the milch-cows go home, the swift horses (go) home, (our) own racers (go) home. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: सो अ॒ग्निर्यो वसु॑र्गृ॒णे सं यमा॒यन्ति॑ धे॒नवः॑ समर्व॑न्तो रघु॒द्रुवः॒ सं सु॑जा॒तासः॑ सू॒रय॒ इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: só agnír yó vásur gr̥ṇé sáṃ yám āyánti dhenávaḥ sám árvanto raghudrúvaḥ sáṃ sujātā́saḥ sūráyaḥ- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: 'Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine come in herds, To whom the chargers swift of foot, to whom our well-born princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: 'Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine come in herds, To whom the chargers swift of foot, to whom our well-born princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: He is Agni who is praised as the Vasu, he to whom the milch-cows come together, and the quickly running horses, and the well-born liberal patrons. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्हि वा॒जिनं॑ वि॒शे ददा॑ति वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिः अ॒ग्नी रा॒ये स्वा॒भुवं॒ स प्री॒तो या॑ति॒ वार्य॒मिषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hí vājínaṃ viśé dádāti viśvácarṣaṇiḥ agnī́ rāyé svābhúvaṃ sá prītó yāti vā́ryam íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: Agni the God of all mankind, gives, verily, a steed to man. Agni gives precious gear for wealth, treasure he gives when he is pleased. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: Agni the God of all mankind, gives, verily, a steed to man. Agni gives precious gear for wealth, treasure he gives when he is pleased. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: For Agni, dwelling among all tribes, gives a racer to the clan. Agni (gives a racer) that is truly helpful for (winning) wealth 1: he (the racer) being well cherished, will attain precious gain. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ अग्न इधीमहि द्यु॒मन्तं॑ देवा॒जर॑म् यद्ध॒ स्या ते॒ पनी॑यसी स॒मिद्दी॒दय॑ति॒ द्यवीषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te agna idhīmahi dyumántaṃ devājáram yád dha syā́ te pánīyasī samíd dīdáyati dyávi- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: God, Agni, we will kindle thee, rich in thy splendour, fading not, So that this glorious fuel may send forth by day its light for thee. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: God, Agni, we will kindle thee, rich in thy splendour, fading not, So that this glorious fuel may send forth by day its light for thee. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: May we kindle thee 1, Agni, O god, the brilliant, never ageing, in order that yon highly miraculous fuel of thine 2 may shine in the sky. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ अग्न ऋ॒चा ह॒विः शुक्र॑स्य शोचिषस्पते सुश्च॑न्द्र॒ दस्म॒ विश्प॑ते॒ हव्य॑वा॒ट् तुभ्यं॑ हूयत॒ इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te agna r̥cā́ havíḥ śúkrasya śociṣas pate súścandra dásma víśpate hávyavāṭ túbhyaṃ hūyate- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: To thee the splendid, Lord of flame, bright, wondrous, Prince of men, is brought. Oblation with the holy verse, O Agni, bearer of our gifts. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: To thee the splendid, Lord of flame, bright, wondrous, Prince of men, is brought. Oblation with the holy verse, O Agni, bearer of our gifts. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: To thee 1, O Agni, our oblation is offered with a Rik, O lord of bright splendour, highly brilliant, wonderful lord of the clan, carrier of oblations! Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रो त्ये अ॒ग्नयो॒ऽग्निषु॒ विश्वं॑ पुष्यन्ति॒ वार्य॑म् ते हि॑न्विरे॒ त इ॑न्विरे॒ त इ॑षण्यन्त्यानु॒षगिषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: pró tyé agnáyo 'gníṣu víśvam puṣyanti vā́ryam té hinvire tá invire tá iṣaṇyanty ānuṣág íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: These Agnis in the seats of the fire nourish each thing most excellent. They give delight, they spread abroad, they move themselves continually. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: These Agnis in the seats of the fire nourish each thing most excellent. They give delight, they spread abroad, they move themselves continually. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: Those Agnis make everything precious prosper in the Agnis; they drive forward (precious wealth); they incite it; they speed it hither in the due way 1. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ त्ये अ॑ग्ने अ॒र्चयो॒ महि॑ व्राधन्त वा॒जिनः॑ ये पत्व॑भिः श॒फानां॑ व्र॒जा भु॒रन्त॒ गोना॒मिषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: táva tyé agne arcáyo máhi vrādhanta vājínaḥ yé pátvabhiḥ śaphā́nāṃ vrajā́ bhuránta gónām íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: Agni, these brilliant flames of thine wax like strong chargers mightily, Who with the treadings of their hoofs go swiftly to the stalls of kine. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: Agni, these brilliant flames of thine wax like strong chargers mightily, Who with the treadings of their hoofs go swiftly to the stalls of kine. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: Those flames of thine, O Agni, the racers, have boasted mightily—they who with the flight of their hoofs have made tremble 1 the stables of the cows. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: नवा॑ नो अग्न॒ आ भ॑र स्तो॒तृभ्यः॑ सुक्षि॒तीरिषः॑ ते स्या॑म॒ य आ॑नृ॒चुस्त्वादू॑तासो॒ दमे॑दम॒ इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: návā no agna ā́ bhara stotŕ̥bhyaḥ sukṣitī́r íṣaḥ té syāma yá ānr̥cús tvā́dūtāso dáme-dame- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: To us who laud thee, Agni, bring fresh food and safe and happy homes. May we who have sung hymns to thee have thee for envoy in each house. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: To us who laud thee, Agni, bring fresh food and safe and happy homes. May we who have sung hymns to thee have thee for envoy in each house. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: Bring fresh food with fine dwellings, O Agni, to us, thy praisers! May we be of those who have praised (thee), who have thee as their messenger, house by house. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भे सु॑श्चन्द्र स॒र्पिषो॒ दर्वी॑ श्रीणीष आ॒सनि॑ उ॒तो न॒ उत्पु॑पूर्या उ॒क्थेषु॑ शवसस्पत॒ इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: ubhé suścandra sarpíṣo dárvī śrīṇīṣa āsáni utó na út pupūryāḥ- ukthéṣu śavasas pate- íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: Thou, brilliant God, within thy mouth warmest both ladies of the oil. So fill us also, in our hymns, abundantly, O Lord of Strength,Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: Thou, brilliant God, within thy mouth warmest both ladies of the oil. So fill us also, in our hymns, abundantly, O Lord of Strength,Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: Thou warmest in thy mouth, O highly brilliant one, the two (sacrificial) ladles full of butter. And mayst thou fill us (with gifts) at our hymns, O lord of strength! Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वाँ अ॒ग्निम॑जुर्यमुर्गी॒र्भिर्य॒ज्ञेभि॑रानु॒षक् दध॑द॒स्मे सु॒वीर्य॑मु॒त त्यदा॒श्वश्व्य॒मिषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: evā́m̐ agním ajuryamur gīrbhír yajñébhir ānuṣák dádhad asmé suvī́ryam utá tyád āśváśvyam íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhya ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: Thus Agni have we duly served with sacrifices and with hymns. So may he give us what we crave, store of brave sons and fleet-foot steeds. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: Thus Agni have we duly served with sacrifices and with hymns. So may he give us what we crave, store of brave sons and fleet-foot steeds. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
translations.oldenberg: Thus 1 they have driven, they have led 2, Agni in the due way by prayers and sacrifices. May he bestow on us plenty of valiant men, and that plenty of swift horses (wished for) 3. Bring food to thy praisers!

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॑यः॒ सं वः॑ स॒म्यञ्च॒मिषं॒ स्तोमं॑ चा॒ग्नये॑ वर्षि॑ष्ठाय क्षिती॒नामू॒र्जो नप्त्रे॒ सह॑स्वते
stanzas.transliteration: sákhāyaḥ sáṃ vaḥ samyáñcam íṣaṃ stómaṃ cāgnáye várṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnā́m ūrjó náptre sáhasvate
stanzas.translation: OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise; To him supremest o'er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:

translations.griffith: OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise; To him supremest o'er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:
translations.oldenberg: O friends, (bring) together your united food and praise to Agni, the strongest (god) of (human) dwellings, the offspring of Vigour, the mighty one—

stanzas.sanskrit: कुत्रा॑ चि॒द्यस्य॒ समृ॑तौ र॒ण्वा नरो॑ नृ॒षद॑ने अर्ह॑न्तश्चि॒द्यमि॑न्ध॒ते सं॑ज॒नय॑न्ति ज॒न्तवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kútrā cid yásya sámr̥tau raṇvā́ náro nr̥ṣádane árhantaś cid yám indhaté saṃjanáyanti jantávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice; Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.

translations.griffith: Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice; Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.
translations.oldenberg: At whose onslaught 1, wherever it be, men rejoice in the seat of men, whom the worthy ones kindle, whom (human) creatures produce.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं यदि॒षो वना॑महे॒ सं ह॒व्या मानु॑षाणाम् उ॒त द्यु॒म्नस्य॒ शव॑स ऋ॒तस्य॑ र॒श्मिमा द॑दे
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ yád iṣó vánāmahe sáṃ havyā́ mā́nuṣāṇām utá dyumnásya śávasā- r̥tásya raśmím ā́ dade
stanzas.translation: When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men, He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.

translations.griffith: When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men, He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.
translations.oldenberg: When we get together the food and the offerings of men, he has grasped, with the strength of his splendour, the rein of Rita.

stanzas.sanskrit: स स्मा॑ कृणोति के॒तुमा नक्तं॑ चिद्दू॒र आ स॒ते पा॒व॒को यद्वन॒स्पती॒न्प्र स्मा॑ मि॒नात्य॒जरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá smā kr̥ṇoti ketúm~ā́ náktaṃ cid dūrá ā́ saté pāvakó yád vánaspátīn prá smā minā́ty ajáraḥ
stanzas.translation: He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar, When he, the Bright, unchanged by eld, consumes the sovrans of the wood.

translations.griffith: He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar, When he, the Bright, unchanged by eld, consumes the sovrans of the wood.
translations.oldenberg: He indeed produces light even by night to him who is afar, when he, the ever-young purifier, destroys the lords of the forest.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑ स्म॒ यस्य॒ वेष॑णे॒ स्वेदं॑ प॒थिषु॒ जुह्व॑ति अ॒भीमह॒ स्वजे॑न्यं॒ भूमा॑ पृ॒ष्ठेव॑ रुरुहुः
stanzas.transliteration: áva sma yásya véṣaṇe svédam pathíṣu júhvati abhī́m áha svájenyam bhū́mā pr̥ṣṭhéva ruruhuḥ
stanzas.translation: He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat, On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.

translations.griffith: He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat, On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.
translations.oldenberg: He at whose officiating (men) pour down the offering of their sweat on the paths—to Him who is noble by his own nature, the worlds have risen as to ridges (of hills)—

stanzas.sanskrit: यं मर्त्यः॑ पुरु॒स्पृहं॑ वि॒दद्विश्व॑स्य॒ धाय॑से प्र स्वाद॑नं पितू॒नामस्त॑तातिं चिदा॒यवे॑
stanzas.transliteration: yám mártyaḥ puruspŕ̥haṃ vidád víśvasya dhā́yase prá svā́danam pitūnā́m ástatātiṃ cid āyáve
stanzas.translation: Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all; He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.

translations.griffith: Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all; He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.
translations.oldenberg: He whom the mortal has acquired, the much-desired (god), for the refreshment of every one, the sweetener of nourishment, the homestead for the Âyu—

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि ष्मा॒ धन्वाक्षि॑तं॒ दाता॒ न दात्या प॒शुः हिरि॑श्मश्रुः॒ शुचि॑दन्नृ॒भुरनि॑भृष्टतविषिः
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí ṣmā dhánvā́kṣitaṃ dā́tā ná dā́ty ā́ paśúḥ híriśmaśruḥ śúcidann r̥bhúr ánibhr̥ṣṭataviṣiḥ
stanzas.translation: Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness, With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.

translations.griffith: Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness, With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.
translations.oldenberg: He indeed, the beast, mows off deserts and habitable land like a mower, the golden-bearded with brilliant teeth, the Ribhu of undecaying strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: शुचिः॑ ष्म॒ यस्मा॑ अत्रि॒वत्प्र स्वधि॑तीव॒ रीय॑ते सु॒षूर॑सूत मा॒ता क्रा॒णा यदा॑न॒शे भग॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: śúciḥ ṣma yásmā atrivát prá svádhitīva rī́yate suṣū́r asūta mātā́ krāṇā́ yád ānaśé bhágam
stanzas.translation: For him, to whom, bright as an axe he, as to Atri, hath flashed forth, Hath the well-bearing Mother borne, producing when her time is come.

translations.griffith: For him, to whom, bright as an axe he, as to Atri, hath flashed forth, Hath the well-bearing Mother borne, producing when her time is come.
translations.oldenberg: The bright one for whom (the ghrita) streams (quickly) like an axe 1, as at (the sacrifice of) Atri. Him the well-bearing mother has born, as soon as 2 she had enjoyed love 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यस्ते॑ सर्पिरासु॒तेऽग्ने॒ शमस्ति॒ धाय॑से ऐषु॑ द्यु॒म्नमु॒त श्रव॒ आ चि॒त्तं मर्त्ये॑षु धाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yás te sarpirāsute- -ágne śám ásti dhā́yase aíṣu dyumnám utá śrávaḥ- ā́ cittám mártyeṣu dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support, Bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.

translations.griffith: Agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support, Bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.
translations.oldenberg: He who satisfies thee for refreshment, O Agni who drinkest butter: mayst thou bestow splendour, renown, and (wise) mind on such mortals 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: इति॑ चिन्म॒न्युम॒ध्रिज॒स्त्वादा॑त॒मा प॒शुं द॑दे आद॑ग्ने॒ अपृ॑ण॒तोऽत्रिः॑ सासह्या॒द्दस्यू॑नि॒षः सा॑सह्या॒न्नॄन्
stanzas.transliteration: íti cin manyúm adhríjas tvā́dātam ā́ paśúṃ dade ā́d agne ápr̥ṇataḥ- -átriḥ sāsahyād dásyūn iṣáḥ sāsahyān nr̥̄́n
stanzas.translation: Such zeal hath he, resistless one: he gained the cattle given by thee. Agni, may Atri overcome the Dasyus who bestow no gifts, subdue the men who give no food.

translations.griffith: Such zeal hath he, resistless one: he gained the cattle given by thee. Agni, may Atri overcome the Dasyus who bestow no gifts, subdue the men who give no food.
translations.oldenberg: Thus I have seized upon the spirit of Adhrig(?) as upon a head of cattle given by thee 1. May then Atri, O Agni, overcome the Dasyus who do not give (to the Brahmans); may Isha overcome the men (who do not give).

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्न ऋता॒यवः॒ समी॑धिरे प्र॒त्नं प्र॒त्नास॑ ऊ॒तये॑ सहस्कृत पु॒रु॒श्च॒न्द्रं य॑ज॒तं वि॒श्वधा॑यसं॒ दमू॑नसं गृ॒हप॑तिं॒ वरे॑ण्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agna r̥tāyávaḥ sám īdhire pratnám pratnā́sa ūtáye sahaskr̥ta puruścandráṃ yajatáṃ viśvádhāyasaṃ dámūnasaṃ gr̥hápatiṃ váreṇyam
stanzas.translation: O AGNI urged to strength, the men of old who loved the Law enkindled thee, the Ancient, for their aid, Thee very bright, and holy, nourisher of all, most excellent, the Friend and Master of the home.

translations.griffith: O AGNI urged to strength, the men of old who loved the Law enkindled thee, the Ancient, for their aid, Thee very bright, and holy, nourisher of all, most excellent, the Friend and Master of the home.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the men who love Rita have kindled, the ancient ones thee the ancient, for the sake of bliss, O (god) who art produced by strength; the highly-brilliant, worshipful, in whom all refreshment dwells, the household god, the lord of the house, the chosen.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ अति॑थिं पू॒र्व्यं विशः॑ शो॒चिष्के॑शं गृ॒हप॑तिं॒ नि षे॑दिरे बृ॒हत्के॑तुं पुरु॒रूपं॑ धन॒स्पृतं॑ सु॒शर्मा॑णं॒ स्वव॑सं जर॒द्विष॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne átithim pūrvyáṃ víśaḥ śocíṣkeśaṃ gr̥hápatiṃ ní ṣedire br̥hátketum pururū́paṃ dhanaspŕ̥taṃ suśármāṇaṃ svávasaṃ jaradvíṣam
stanzas.translation: Thee, Agni, men have stablished as their guest of old, as Master of the household, thee, with hair of flame; High-bannered, multiform, distributor of wealth, kind helper, good protector, drier of the floods.

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, men have stablished as their guest of old, as Master of the household, thee, with hair of flame; High-bannered, multiform, distributor of wealth, kind helper, good protector, drier of the floods.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the clans have set down, the ancient guest, the flame-haired lord of the house, with mighty light, with many shapes, the winner of prizes, giving good shelter and good help, who is busy among the decayed (wood) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ मानु॑षीरीळते॒ विशो॑ होत्रा॒विदं॒ विवि॑चिं रत्न॒धात॑मम् गुहा॒ सन्तं॑ सुभग वि॒श्वद॑र्शतं तुविष्व॒णसं॑ सु॒यजं॑ घृत॒श्रिय॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne mā́nuṣīr īḷate víśo hotrāvídaṃ víviciṃ ratnadhā́tamam gúhā sántaṃ subhaga viśvádarśataṃ tuviṣvaṇásaṃ suyájaṃ ghr̥taśríyam
stanzas.translation: The tribes of men praise thee, Agni, who knowest well burnt offerings, the Discerner, lavishest of wealth, Dwelling in secret, Blest One! visible to all, loud-roaring, skilled in worship, glorified with oil.

translations.griffith: The tribes of men praise thee, Agni, who knowest well burnt offerings, the Discerner, lavishest of wealth, Dwelling in secret, Blest One! visible to all, loud-roaring, skilled in worship, glorified with oil.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the human clans magnify, who knowest (the art of sacrificial) libations, who separatest (what was mixed) 1, the highest bestower of treasures, who, (though) dwelling in secret, O blessed one, (yet) art visible to all, mightily roaring, an excellent sacrificer, shining with ghee.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने धर्ण॒सिं वि॒श्वधा॑ व॒यं गी॒र्भिर्गृ॒णन्तो॒ नम॒सोप॑ सेदिम स नो॑ जुषस्व समिधा॒नो अ॑ङ्गिरो दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य य॒शसा॑ सुदी॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne dharṇasíṃ viśvádhā vayáṃ gīrbhír gr̥ṇánto námasópa sedima sá no juṣasva samidhānó aṅgiro devó mártasya yaśásā sudītíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Ever to thee, O Agni, as exceeding strong have we drawn nigh with songs and reverence singing hymns. So be thou pleased with us, Angiras! as a God enkindled by the noble with man's goodly light.

translations.griffith: Ever to thee, O Agni, as exceeding strong have we drawn nigh with songs and reverence singing hymns. So be thou pleased with us, Angiras! as a God enkindled by the noble with man's goodly light.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the supporter, we always have praised with our songs and have sat down near thee with adoration. Thus being kindled, O Aṅgiras, be pleased with us, as a god through the mortal's brilliant (offering) 1, with thy glorious splendours.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने पुरु॒रूपो॑ वि॒शेवि॑शे॒ वयो॑ दधासि प्र॒त्नथा॑ पुरुष्टुत पु॒रूण्यन्ना॒ सह॑सा॒ वि रा॑जसि॒ त्विषिः॒ सा ते॑ तित्विषा॒णस्य॒ नाधृषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne pururū́po viśé-viśe váyo dadhāsi pratnáthā puruṣṭuta purū́ṇy ánnā sáhasā ví rājasi tvíṣiḥ sā́ te titviṣāṇásya nā́dhŕ̥ṣe
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni! multiform, God who art lauded much! givest in every house subsistence as of old. Thou rulest by thy might o'er food of many a sort: that light of thine when blazing may not be opposed.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni! multiform, God who art lauded much! givest in every house subsistence as of old. Thou rulest by thy might o'er food of many a sort: that light of thine when blazing may not be opposed.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, manifold-shaped, bestowest vigour on every house in thy ancient way, O much-praised one.! Thou rulest with might over much food. This impetuousness of thine, when thou rushest forward impetuously, is not to be defied.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने समिधा॒नं य॑विष्ठ्य दे॒वा दू॒तं च॑क्रिरे हव्य॒वाह॑नम् उ॒रु॒ज्रय॑सं घृ॒तयो॑नि॒माहु॑तं त्वे॒षं चक्षु॑र्दधिरे चोद॒यन्म॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne samidhānáṃ yaviṣṭhya devā́ dūtáṃ cakrire havyavā́hanam urujráyasaṃ ghr̥táyonim ā́hutaṃ tveṣáṃ cákṣur dadhire codayánmati
stanzas.translation: The Gods, Most Youthful Agni, have made thee, inflamed, the bearer of oblations and the messenger. Thee, widely-reaching, homed in sacred oil, invoked, effulgent, have they made the Eye that stirs the thought.

translations.griffith: The Gods, Most Youthful Agni, have made thee, inflamed, the bearer of oblations and the messenger. Thee, widely-reaching, homed in sacred oil, invoked, effulgent, have they made the Eye that stirs the thought.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, when kindled, O youngest one, the gods have made their messenger and bearer of oblations. Thee who extendest over wide spaces, who dwellest in ghee, into whom offerings are poured, they have made their eye, impetuous, stirring thoughts.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने प्र॒दिव॒ आहु॑तं घृ॒तैः सु॑म्ना॒यवः॑ सुष॒मिधा॒ समी॑धिरे स वा॑वृधा॒न ओष॑धीभिरुक्षि॒तो॒३॒॑ऽभि ज्रयां॑सि॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ वि ति॑ष्ठसे
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne pradíva ā́hutaṃ ghr̥taíḥ sumnāyávaḥ suṣamídhā sám īdhire sá vāvr̥dhāná óṣadhībhir ukṣitáḥ- -abhí jráyāṃsi pā́rthivā ví tiṣṭhase
stanzas.translation: Men seeking joy have lit thee worshipped from of old, O Agni, with good fuel and with sacred oil. So thou, bedewed and waxing mighty by the plants, spreadest thyself abroad over the realms of earth.

translations.griffith: Men seeking joy have lit thee worshipped from of old, O Agni, with good fuel and with sacred oil. So thou, bedewed and waxing mighty by the plants, spreadest thyself abroad over the realms of earth.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, on whom offerings of ghee are poured, (men) desirous of thy favour have kindled from of old with good fuel. Thus, grown strong, increased by the plants, thou spreadest thyself over the terrestrial spaces.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने ह॒विष्म॑न्तो दे॒वं मर्ता॑स ईळते मन्ये॑ त्वा जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ स ह॒व्या व॑क्ष्यानु॒षक्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne havíṣmanto devám mártāsa īḷate mánye tvā jātávedasaṃ sá havyā́ vakṣy ānuṣák
stanzas.translation: BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God. I deem thee Jâtavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.

translations.griffith: BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God. I deem thee Jâtavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the god, mortals bringing offerings magnify. I deem thee the Gâtavedas. Carry then the offerings (to the gods) in thy due way.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्होता॒ दास्व॑तः॒ क्षय॑स्य वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः सं य॒ज्ञास॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ यं सं वाजा॑सः श्रव॒स्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hótā dā́svataḥ kṣáyasya vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ sáṃ yajñā́saś cáranti yáṃ sáṃ vā́jāsaḥ śravasyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest, To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.

translations.griffith: In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest, To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is the Hotri of the dwelling where they offer gifts and spread the sacrificial grass, he with whom sacrifices, with whom glorious gains assemble.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्म॒ यं शिशुं॑ यथा॒ नवं॒ जनि॑ष्टा॒रणी॑ ध॒र्तारं॒ मानु॑षीणां वि॒शाम॒ग्निं स्व॑ध्व॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá sma yáṃ śíśuṃ yathā návaṃ jániṣṭāráṇī dhartā́ram mā́nuṣīṇāṃ viśā́m agníṃ svadhvarám
stanzas.translation: Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life, Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life, Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: And he whom the kindling-stick has born, the young one, like a young (calf), the supporter of human clans, Agni the best sacrificer—

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्म॑ दुर्गृभीयसे पु॒त्रो न ह्वा॒र्याणा॑म् पु॒रू यो दग्धासि॒ वनाग्ने॑ प॒शुर्न यव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: utá sma durgr̥bhīyase putró ná hvāryā́ṇām purū́ yó dágdhā́si vánā- -ágne paśúr ná yávase
stanzas.translation: Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes, When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.

translations.griffith: Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes, When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.
translations.oldenberg: And thou showest thyself hard to seize like a son of … 1, thou who art a burner of many woods, O Agni, like an animal (that consumes all grass) on a meadow 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ स्म॒ यस्या॒र्चयः॑ स॒म्यक्सं॒यन्ति॑ धू॒मिनः॑ यदी॒मह॑ त्रि॒तो दि॒व्युप॒ ध्माते॑व॒ धम॑ति॒ शिशी॑ते ध्मा॒तरी॑ यथा
stanzas.transliteration: ádha sma yásyārcáyaḥ samyák saṃyánti dhūmínaḥ yád īm áha tritó diví- úpa dhmā́teva dhámati śíśīte dhmātárī yathā
stanzas.translation: Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark, When Trita in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e'en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.

translations.griffith: Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark, When Trita in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e'en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.
translations.oldenberg: 1 And he whose smoky 2 flames come together, when Trita in heaven blows upon him like a smelter, sharpens (him) as in smelting (him) 3…

stanzas.sanskrit: तवा॒हम॑ग्न ऊ॒तिभि॑र्मि॒त्रस्य॑ च॒ प्रश॑स्तिभिः द्वे॒षो॒युतो॒ न दु॑रि॒ता तु॒र्याम॒ मर्त्या॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: távāhám agna ūtíbhir mitrásya ca práśastibhiḥ dveṣoyúto ná duritā́ turyā́ma mártyānām
stanzas.translation: O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance, May we, averting hate, subbue the wickedness of mortal men.

translations.griffith: O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance, May we, averting hate, subbue the wickedness of mortal men.
translations.oldenberg: May I through thy protection, O Agni, and through the praises of Mitra—may we 1, like dispellers of malice, overcome the dangers of mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं नो॑ अग्ने अ॒भी नरो॑ र॒यिं स॑हस्व॒ आ भ॑र स क्षे॑पय॒त्स पो॑षय॒द्भुव॒द्वाज॑स्य सा॒तय॑ उ॒तैधि॑ पृ॒त्सु नो॑ वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ no agne abhī́ náro rayíṃ sahasva ā́ bhara sá kṣepayat sá poṣayad bhúvad vā́jasya sātáye- utaídhi pr̥tsú no vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God. May he protect and nourish us, and help in aining strength: be thou near us in 6rht for our success.

translations.griffith: O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God. May he protect and nourish us, and help in aining strength: be thou near us in 6rht for our success.
translations.oldenberg: Bring this wealth to us, O powerful Agni, to (these our) men. May he 1 give us dwelling; may he 1 give us prosperity; may he 1 help us in winning booty. And help us to grow strong in fights!

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्न॒ ओजि॑ष्ठ॒मा भ॑र द्यु॒म्नम॒स्मभ्य॑मध्रिगो प्र नो॑ रा॒या परी॑णसा॒ रत्सि॒ वाजा॑य॒ पन्था॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ágna ójiṣṭham ā́ bhara dyumnám asmábhyam adhrigo prá no rāyā́ párīṇasā rátsi vā́jāya pánthām
stanzas.translation: BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way. With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.

translations.griffith: BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way. With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, bring us the mightiest splendour, O liberal one 1! With wealth and plenty cleave a path for us to booty.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने अद्भुत॒ क्रत्वा॒ दक्ष॑स्य मं॒हना॑ त्वे अ॑सु॒र्य१॒॑मारु॑हत्क्रा॒णा मि॒त्रो न य॒ज्ञियः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no agne adbhuta krátvā dákṣasya maṃhánā tvé asuryàm ā́ruhat krāṇā́ mitró ná yajñíyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, bywisdom and bounteousness of power. The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.

translations.griffith: Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, bywisdom and bounteousness of power. The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O wonderful Agni, (protect) us, through thy power of mind, through the bounteousness of thy strength. Upon thee mysterious power has entered. (Thou art) indeed 1 like worshipful Mitra.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ अग्न एषां॒ गयं॑ पु॒ष्टिं च॑ वर्धय ये स्तोमे॑भिः॒ प्र सू॒रयो॒ नरो॑ म॒घान्या॑न॒शुः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no agna eṣāṃ gáyam puṣṭíṃ ca vardhaya yé stómebhiḥ prá sūráyo náro maghā́ny ānaśúḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these, The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.
