translations.griffith: Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these, The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, increase for our sake the dominion and the prosperity of those liberal givers, (of those) men who have accomplished liberalities (towards us) for our songs of praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये अ॑ग्ने चन्द्र ते॒ गिरः॑ शु॒म्भन्त्यश्व॑राधसः शुष्मे॑भिः शु॒ष्मिणो॒ नरो॑ दि॒वश्चि॒द्येषां॑ बृ॒हत्सु॑की॒र्तिर्बोध॑ति॒ त्मना॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé agne candra te gíraḥ śumbhánty áśvarādhasaḥ śúṣmebhiḥ śuṣmíṇo náro diváś cid yéṣām br̥hát sukīrtír bódhati tmánā
stanzas.translation: Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed. The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own accord.

translations.griffith: Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed. The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own accord.
translations.oldenberg: They who adorn prayers for thee, O bright Agni, the givers of horses 1: those men are powerful in their power, whose glory awakes by itself (shining) more mightily than even the sky 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ त्ये अ॑ग्ने अ॒र्चयो॒ भ्राज॑न्तो यन्ति धृष्णु॒या परि॑ज्मानो॒ न वि॒द्युतः॑ स्वा॒नो रथो॒ न वा॑ज॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: táva tyé agne arcáyo bhrā́janto yanti dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ párijmāno ná vidyútaḥ svānó rátho ná vājayúḥ
stanzas.translation: O Agni, those resplendent flames of thine go valorously forth, Like lightnings flashing round us, like a rattling car that seeks the spoil.

translations.griffith: O Agni, those resplendent flames of thine go valorously forth, Like lightnings flashing round us, like a rattling car that seeks the spoil.
translations.oldenberg: Those shining flames of thine, Agni, go fiercely along, like lightnings (flashing) around the earth, like a thundering chariot bent on victory.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू नो॑ अग्न ऊ॒तये॑ स॒बाध॑सश्च रा॒तये॑ अ॒स्माका॑सश्च सू॒रयो॒ विश्वा॒ आशा॑स्तरी॒षणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ no agna ūtáye sabā́dhasaś ca rātáye asmā́kāsaś ca sūráyo víśvā ā́śās tarīṣáṇi
stanzas.translation: Now, Agni, come to succour us; let priests draw nigh to offer gifts; And let the patrons of our rites subdue all regions of the earth.

translations.griffith: Now, Agni, come to succour us; let priests draw nigh to offer gifts; And let the patrons of our rites subdue all regions of the earth.
translations.oldenberg: Now then, Agni, (come) for our protection, and for the reward of the urgent (worshipper)! May our liberal patrons pass across 1 all regions 2!

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने अङ्गिरः स्तु॒तः स्तवा॑न॒ आ भ॑र होत॑र्विभ्वा॒सहं॑ र॒यिं स्तो॒तृभ्यः॒ स्तव॑से च न उ॒तैधि॑ पृ॒त्सु नो॑ वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no agne aṅgiraḥ- stutá stávāna ā́ bhara hótar vibhvāsáhaṃ rayíṃ stotŕ̥bhya stávase ca naḥ- utaídhi pr̥tsú no vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: Bring to us, Agni, Angiras, lauded of old and lauded now, Invoker! wealth to quell the strong, that singers may extol thee. Be near us in fight for our success.

translations.griffith: Bring to us, Agni, Angiras, lauded of old and lauded now, Invoker! wealth to quell the strong, that singers may extol thee. Be near us in fight for our success.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, Aṅgiras, who hast been praised and who art being praised, bring us, O Hotri, wealth which overpowers (even) skilful men, to thy praisers, and thou shalt be praised by us. And help us to grow strong in fights 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: जन॑स्य गो॒पा अ॑जनिष्ट॒ जागृ॑विर॒ग्निः सु॒दक्षः॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से घृ॒तप्र॑तीको बृह॒ता दि॑वि॒स्पृशा॑ द्यु॒मद्वि भा॑ति भर॒तेभ्यः॒ शुचिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: jánasya gopā́ ajaniṣṭa jā́gr̥vir agníḥ sudákṣaḥ suvitā́ya návyase ghr̥tápratīko br̥hatā́ divispŕ̥śā dyumád ví bhāti bharatébhyaḥ śúciḥ
stanzas.translation: THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity. With oil upon his face, with high heaventouching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.

translations.griffith: THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity. With oil upon his face, with high heaventouching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.
translations.oldenberg: The guardian of people, the watchful one, Agni, the highly dexterous, has been born, for the sake of new welfare. With ghrita on his face, with his mighty, heaven-touching (light) he, the bright one, brilliantly shines for the Bharatas.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मं पु॒रोहि॑तम॒ग्निं नर॑स्त्रिषध॒स्थे समी॑धिरे इन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैः स॒रथं॒ स ब॒र्हिषि॒ सीद॒न्नि होता॑ य॒जथा॑य सु॒क्रतुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yajñásya ketúm prathamám puróhitam agníṃ náras triṣadhasthé sám īdhire índreṇa devaíḥ saráthaṃ sá barhíṣi sī́dan ní hótā yajáthāya sukrátuḥ
stanzas.translation: Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the. men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat, With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the. men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat, With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the beacon of sacrifice, the first Purohita 1 men have kindled in the threefold abode 2. (Driving) on the same chariot with Indra and with the gods, he, the highly wise Hotri, has sat down on the Barhis for sacrificing.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस॑म्मृष्टो जायसे मा॒त्रोः शुचि॑र्म॒न्द्रः क॒विरुद॑तिष्ठो वि॒वस्व॑तः घृ॒तेन॑ त्वावर्धयन्नग्न आहुत धू॒मस्ते॑ के॒तुर॑भवद्दि॒वि श्रि॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: ásammr̥ṣṭo jāyase mātróḥ śúcir mandráḥ kavír úd atiṣṭho vivásvataḥ ghr̥téna tvāvardhayann agna āhuta dhūmás te ketúr abhavad diví śritáḥ
stanzas.translation: Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest fromVivasvan as a charming Sage. With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the sky.

translations.griffith: Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest fromVivasvan as a charming Sage. With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the sky.
translations.oldenberg: Though not cleansed, thou art born bright from thy two mothers 1. Thou hast arisen as the joy-giving sage belonging to Vivasvant 2 They have strengthened thee by ghrita, O Agni, into whom oblations are poured. Smoke, reaching the sky, has become thy beacon.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्नो॑ य॒ज्ञमुप॑ वेतु साधु॒याग्निं नरो॒ वि भ॑रन्ते गृ॒हेगृ॑हे अ॒ग्निर्दू॒तो अ॑भवद्धव्य॒वाह॑नो॒ऽग्निं वृ॑णा॒ना वृ॑णते क॒विक्र॑तुम्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír no yajñám úpa vetu sādhuyā́- -ágníṃ náro ví bharante gr̥hé-gr̥he agnír dūtó abhavad dhavyavā́hano -agníṃ vr̥ṇānā́ vr̥ṇate kavíkratum
stanzas.translation: May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house. He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.

translations.griffith: May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house. He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.
translations.oldenberg: May Agni straightway come to our sacrifice. Men carry Agni here and there, house by house. Agni has become the messenger, the carrier of oblations. Choosing Agni they choose a thoughtful (god).

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्ये॒दम॑ग्ने॒ मधु॑मत्तमं॒ वच॒स्तुभ्यं॑ मनी॒षा इ॒यम॑स्तु॒ शं हृ॒दे त्वां गिरः॒ सिन्धु॑मिवा॒वनी॑र्म॒हीरा पृ॑णन्ति॒ शव॑सा व॒र्धय॑न्ति च
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyedám agne mádhumattamaṃ vácas túbhyam manīṣā́ iyám astu śáṃ hr̥dé tvā́ṃ gíraḥ síndhum ivāvánīr mahī́r ā́ pr̥ṇanti śávasā vardháyanti ca
stanzas.translation: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought. As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy strength.

translations.griffith: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought. As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy strength.
translations.oldenberg: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest speech, for thee this prayer; may this one do thy heart good 1! The prayers fill thee with power and strengthen thee, like great rivers the Sindhu.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ अङ्गि॑रसो॒ गुहा॑ हि॒तमन्व॑विन्दञ्छिश्रिया॒णं वने॑वने स जा॑यसे म॒थ्यमा॑नः॒ सहो॑ म॒हत्त्वामा॑हुः॒ सह॑सस्पु॒त्रम॑ङ्गिरः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne áṅgiraso gúhā hitám ánv avindañ chiśriyāṇáṃ váne-vane sá jāyase mathyámānaḥ sáho mahát tvā́m āhuḥ sáhasas putrám aṅgiraḥ
stanzas.translation: O Agni, the Angirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood. Thou by attrition art produced as conquer.ing might, and men, O Angiras, call thee the Son of Strength.

translations.griffith: O Agni, the Angirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood. Thou by attrition art produced as conquer.ing might, and men, O Angiras, call thee the Son of Strength.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, who wert hidden, dwelling here and there in every wood, the Aṅgiras have discovered 1. Thus thou art born, produced by attrition, a mighty force. Thee, O Aṅgiras, they call the son of strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्राग्नये॑ बृह॒ते य॒ज्ञिया॑य ऋ॒तस्य॒ वृष्णे॒ असु॑राय॒ मन्म॑ घृ॒तं न य॒ज्ञ आ॒स्ये॒३॒॑ सुपू॑तं॒ गिरं॑ भरे वृष॒भाय॑ प्रती॒चीम्
stanzas.transliteration: prā́gnáye br̥haté yajñíyāya r̥tásya vŕ̥ṣṇe ásurāya mánma ghr̥táṃ ná yajñá āsyè súpūtaṃ gíram bhare vr̥ṣabhā́ya pratīcī́m
stanzas.translation: To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer; I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.

translations.griffith: To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer; I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.
translations.oldenberg: To the mighty, sacrificial Agni, to the bull of Rita 1, the Asura, I bring this prayer and this song, which is turned towards him, to (him) the bull, as well-clarified ghrita (is poured) into his mouth at the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तं चि॑कित्व ऋ॒तमिच्चि॑किद्ध्यृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॒ अनु॑ तृन्धि पू॒र्वीः नाहं या॒तुं सह॑सा॒ न द्व॒येन॑ ऋ॒तं स॑पाम्यरु॒षस्य॒ वृष्णः॑
stanzas.transliteration: r̥táṃ cikitva r̥tám íc cikiddhi- r̥tásya dhā́rā ánu tr̥ndhi pūrvī́ḥ nā́háṃ yātúṃ sáhasā ná dvayéna r̥táṃ sapāmy aruṣásya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: Mark the Law, thou who knowest, yea, observe it: send forth the full streams of eternal Order. I use no sorcery with might or falsehood the sacred Law of the Red Steer I follow.

translations.griffith: Mark the Law, thou who knowest, yea, observe it: send forth the full streams of eternal Order. I use no sorcery with might or falsehood the sacred Law of the Red Steer I follow.
translations.oldenberg: O knower of Rita, know the Rita! Bore for many streams of Rita. I (do) not (serve) a Yâtu 1 by violence nor by falsehood; I serve the Rita of the red bull 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: कया॑ नो अग्न ऋ॒तय॑न्नृ॒तेन॒ भुवो॒ नवे॑दा उ॒चथ॑स्य॒ नव्यः॑ वेदा॑ मे दे॒व ऋ॑तु॒पा ऋ॑तू॒नां नाहं पतिं॑ सनि॒तुर॒स्य रा॒यः
stanzas.transliteration: káyā no agna r̥táyann r̥téna bhúvo návedā ucáthasya návyaḥ védā me devá r̥tupā́ r̥tūnā́ṃ nā́hám pátiṃ sanitúr asyá rāyáḥ
stanzas.translation: How hast thou, follower of the Law eternal, become the knower of a new song, Agni? The God, the Guardian of the seasons, knows me: the Lord of him who won this wealth I know not.

translations.griffith: How hast thou, follower of the Law eternal, become the knower of a new song, Agni? The God, the Guardian of the seasons, knows me: the Lord of him who won this wealth I know not.
translations.oldenberg: How, O Agni, performing the Rita through Rita, mayst thou become a witness of our newest 1 hymn? The god, the protector of the seasons, knows of my seasons 2. I (do) not (know another) lord but him who attains (for us) this wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: के ते॑ अग्ने रि॒पवे॒ बन्ध॑नासः॒ के पा॒यवः॑ सनिषन्त द्यु॒मन्तः॑ के धा॒सिम॑ग्ने॒ अनृ॑तस्य पान्ति॒ क आस॑तो॒ वच॑सः सन्ति गो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: ké te agne ripáve bándhanāsaḥ ké pāyávaḥ saniṣanta dyumántaḥ ké dhāsím agne ánr̥tasya pānti ká ā́sato vácasaḥ santi gopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Who, Agni, in alliance with thy foeman, what splendid helpers won for them their riches? Agni, who guard the dwelling-place of falsehood? Who are protectors of the speech of liars?

translations.griffith: Who, Agni, in alliance with thy foeman, what splendid helpers won for them their riches? Agni, who guard the dwelling-place of falsehood? Who are protectors of the speech of liars?
translations.oldenberg: Who, O Agni, are thy fetterers to (fetter) the impostor 1? What brilliant guardians were successful? Who, O Agni, drink the drink of falsehood? Who are the protectors of untrue speech?

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॑यस्ते॒ विषु॑णा अग्न ए॒ते शि॒वासः॒ सन्तो॒ अशि॑वा अभूवन् अधू॑र्षत स्व॒यमे॒ते वचो॑भिर्ऋजूय॒ते वृ॑जि॒नानि॑ ब्रु॒वन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sákhāyas te víṣuṇā agna eté śivā́saḥ sánto áśivā abhūvan ádhūrṣata svayám eté vácobhir r̥jūyaté vr̥jinā́ni bruvántaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, those friends of thine have turned them from thee: gracious of old, they have become ungracious. They have deceived themselves by their own speeches, uttering wicked words against the righteous.

translations.griffith: Agni, those friends of thine have turned them from thee: gracious of old, they have become ungracious. They have deceived themselves by their own speeches, uttering wicked words against the righteous.
translations.oldenberg: These friends of thine, O Agni, turning themselves from (thee) 1, they who had been kind, have become unkind. They have harmed themselves by their own speeches, uttering wrong words to the righteous.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॑ अग्ने॒ नम॑सा य॒ज्ञमीट्ट॑ ऋ॒तं स पा॑त्यरु॒षस्य॒ वृष्णः॑ तस्य॒ क्षयः॑ पृ॒थुरा सा॒धुरे॑तु प्र॒सर्स्रा॑णस्य॒ नहु॑षस्य॒ शेषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yás te agne námasā yajñám ī́ṭṭe- r̥táṃ sápāty aruṣásya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ tásya kṣáyaḥ pr̥thúr ā́ sādhúr etu prasársrāṇasya náhuṣasya śéṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: He who pays sacrifice to thee with homage, O Agni, keeps the Red Steer's Law eternal; Wide is his dwelling. May the noble offspring of Nahusha who wandered forth come hither.

translations.griffith: He who pays sacrifice to thee with homage, O Agni, keeps the Red Steer's Law eternal; Wide is his dwelling. May the noble offspring of Nahusha who wandered forth come hither.
translations.oldenberg: He who magnifies thy sacrifice, O Agni, by adoration, and serves 1 the Rita of the red bull: may a large, good dwelling come to him, to the offspring of the advancing Nahusha.

stanzas.sanskrit: अर्च॑न्तस्त्वा हवाम॒हेऽर्च॑न्तः॒ समि॑धीमहि अग्ने॒ अर्च॑न्त ऊ॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: árcantas tvā havāmahe- -árcantaḥ sám idhīmahi ágne árcanta ūtáye
stanzas.translation: WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise, Agni, -with songs of praise, for help.

translations.griffith: WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise, Agni, -with songs of praise, for help.
translations.oldenberg: Praising we call 1 thee; praising let us kindle 1 thee, Agni, praising, for thy help.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्नेः स्तोमं॑ मनामहे सि॒ध्रम॒द्य दि॑वि॒स्पृशः॑ दे॒वस्य॑ द्रविण॒स्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agné stómam manāmahe sidhrám adyá divispŕ̥śaḥ devásya draviṇasyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day, Praise of the God who touches heaven.

translations.griffith: Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day, Praise of the God who touches heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Desirous of riches, we devise to-day an effective song of praise, of Agni the heaven-touching god 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्जु॑षत नो॒ गिरो॒ होता॒ यो मानु॑षे॒ष्वा स य॑क्ष॒द्दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír juṣata no gíro hótā yó mā́nuṣeṣv ā́ sá yakṣad daívyaṃ jánam
stanzas.translation: May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise, And worship the Celestial Folk.

translations.griffith: May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise, And worship the Celestial Folk.
translations.oldenberg: May Agni take pleasure in our prayers, he who is the Hotri among men. May he sacrifice 1 to the divine host.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने स॒प्रथा॑ असि॒ जुष्टो॒ होता॒ वरे॑ण्यः त्वया॑ य॒ज्ञं वि त॑न्वते
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne sapráthā asi júṣṭo hótā váreṇyaḥ tváyā yajñáṃ ví tanvate
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee Men make the sacrifice complete.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee Men make the sacrifice complete.
translations.oldenberg: Thou, O Agni, art widely extended, the gladly accepted, desirable Hotri; through thee they spread out the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने वाज॒सात॑मं॒ विप्रा॑ वर्धन्ति॒ सुष्टु॑तम् स नो॑ रास्व सु॒वीर्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne vājasā́tamaṃ víprā vardhanti súṣṭutam sá no rāsva suvī́ryam
stanzas.translation: Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength: So grant thou us heroic might.

translations.griffith: Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength: So grant thou us heroic might.
translations.oldenberg: The priests make thee grow, O Agni, the greatest acquirer of wealth, the highly praised one. Bestow thou on us abundance of heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ ने॒मिर॒राँ इ॑व दे॒वाँस्त्वं प॑रि॒भूर॑सि आ राध॑श्चि॒त्रमृ॑ञ्जसे
stanzas.transliteration: ágne nemír arā́m̐ iva devā́ṃs tvám paribhū́r asi ā́ rā́dhaś citrám r̥ñjase
stanzas.translation: Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods.

translations.griffith: Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Agni! Thou encompassest the gods as the felly (encompasses) the spokes (of a wheel). Thou strivest 1 for brilliant wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं स्तोमे॑न बोधय समिधा॒नो अम॑र्त्यम् ह॒व्या दे॒वेषु॑ नो दधत्
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ stómena bodhaya samidhānó ámartyam havyā́ devéṣu no dadhat
stanzas.translation: ENKINDLING the Immortal, wake Agni with song of praise: may he bear our oblations to the Gods.

translations.griffith: ENKINDLING the Immortal, wake Agni with song of praise: may he bear our oblations to the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Awaken 1 Agni by thy song of praise, kindling (him) the immortal one. May he place our offerings among the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: तम॑ध्व॒रेष्वी॑ळते दे॒वं मर्ता॒ अम॑र्त्यम् यजि॑ष्ठं॒ मानु॑षे॒ जने॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám adhvaréṣv īḷate devám mártā ámartyam yájiṣṭham mā́nuṣe jáne
stanzas.translation: At high solemnities mortal men glorify him the Immortal, best At sacrifice among mankind.

translations.griffith: At high solemnities mortal men glorify him the Immortal, best At sacrifice among mankind.
translations.oldenberg: Him, the immortal god, the mortals magnify at their sacrifices, the best sacrificer among the tribe of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं हि शश्व॑न्त॒ ईळ॑ते स्रु॒चा दे॒वं घृ॑त॒श्चुता॑ अ॒ग्निं ह॒व्याय॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ hí śáśvanta ī́ḷate srucā́ deváṃ ghr̥taścútā agníṃ havyā́ya vóḷhave
stanzas.translation: That he may bear their gifts to heaven, all glorify him Agni, God, With ladle that distilleth oil.

translations.griffith: That he may bear their gifts to heaven, all glorify him Agni, God, With ladle that distilleth oil.
translations.oldenberg: Him indeed they all magnify, the god, with the (sacrificial) ladle that overflows with ghrita, Agni, in order that he may bear the oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्जा॒तो अ॑रोचत॒ घ्नन्दस्यू॒ञ्ज्योति॑षा॒ तमः॑ अवि॑न्द॒द्गा अ॒पः स्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír jātó arocata ghnán dásyūñ jyótiṣā támaḥ ávindad gā́ apáḥ svàḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni shone bright when born, with light killing the Dasyus and the dark: He found the Kine, the Floods, the Sun.

translations.griffith: Agni shone bright when born, with light killing the Dasyus and the dark: He found the Kine, the Floods, the Sun.
translations.oldenberg: Agni when born has shone, killing the Dasyus, (killing) darkness by light. He has found the cows, the waters, the sun 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निमी॒ळेन्यं॑ क॒विं घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठं सपर्यत वेतु॑ मे शृ॒णव॒द्धव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agním īḷényaṃ kavíṃ ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭhaṃ saparyata vétu me śr̥ṇávad dhávam
stanzas.translation: Serve Agni, God adorable, the Sage whose back is balmed with oil: Let him approach, and hear my call.

translations.griffith: Serve Agni, God adorable, the Sage whose back is balmed with oil: Let him approach, and hear my call.
translations.oldenberg: Worship Agni, the sage who should be magnified, whose back is covered with ghrita. May he come and hear my call 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं घृ॒तेन॑ वावृधुः॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिम् स्वा॒धीभि॑र्वच॒स्युभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ ghr̥téna vāvr̥dhuḥ- stómebhir viśvácarṣaṇim svādhī́bhir vacasyúbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: They have exalted Agni, God of all mankind, with oil and hymns Of praise, devout and eloquent.

translations.griffith: They have exalted Agni, God of all mankind, with oil and hymns Of praise, devout and eloquent.
translations.oldenberg: They have made Agni grow by ghrita, him who dwells among all tribes, and by longing, eloquent praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वे॒धसे॑ क॒वये॒ वेद्या॑य॒ गिरं॑ भरे य॒शसे॑ पू॒र्व्याय॑ घृ॒तप्र॑सत्तो॒ असु॑रः सु॒शेवो॑ रा॒यो ध॒र्ता ध॒रुणो॒ वस्वो॑ अ॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: prá vedháse kaváye védyāya gíram bhare yaśáse pūrvyā́ya ghr̥táprasatto ásuraḥ suśévo rāyó dhartā́ dharúṇo vásvo agníḥ
stanzas.translation: To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer. Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.

translations.griffith: To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer. Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.
translations.oldenberg: I bring a prayer to the worshipper, the renowned sage, the glorious, ancient one. Agni is the highly gracious Asura, taking his seat in ghrita, the holder of wealth, supporting goods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒तं ध॒रुणं॑ धारयन्त य॒ज्ञस्य॑ शा॒के प॑र॒मे व्यो॑मन् दि॒वो धर्म॑न्ध॒रुणे॑ से॒दुषो॒ नॄञ्जा॒तैरजा॑ताँ अ॒भि ये न॑न॒क्षुः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥téna r̥táṃ dharúṇaṃ dhārayanta yajñásya śāké paramé vyòman divó dhárman dharúṇe sedúṣo nr̥̄́ñ jātaír ájātām̐ abhí yé nanakṣúḥ
stanzas.translation: By holy Law they kept supporting Order, by help of sacrifice, in loftiest heaven,– They who attained with born men to the unborn, men seated on that stay, heaven's firm sustainer.

translations.griffith: By holy Law they kept supporting Order, by help of sacrifice, in loftiest heaven,– They who attained with born men to the unborn, men seated on that stay, heaven's firm sustainer.
translations.oldenberg: By Rita they have supported the supporting Rita, near the powerful (performer) 1 of sacrifice, in highest heaven, the men who sit 2 on the supporting support of the sky, and who with born (men) attained to the unborn.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ङ्हो॒युव॑स्त॒न्व॑स्तन्वते॒ वि वयो॑ म॒हद्दु॒ष्टरं॑ पू॒र्व्याय॑ स सं॒वतो॒ नव॑जातस्तुतुर्यात्सि॒ङ्हं न क्रु॒द्धम॒भितः॒ परि॑ ष्ठुः
stanzas.transliteration: aṃhoyúvas tanvàs tanvate ví váyo mahád duṣṭáram pūrvyā́ya sá saṃváto návajātas tuturyāt siṅháṃ ná kruddhám abhítaḥ pári ṣṭhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Averting woe, they labour hard to bring him, the ancient, plenteous food as power resistless. May he, born newly, conquer his assailants: round him they stand as round an angry lion.

translations.griffith: Averting woe, they labour hard to bring him, the ancient, plenteous food as power resistless. May he, born newly, conquer his assailants: round him they stand as round an angry lion.
translations.oldenberg: Dispelling anguish 1 they spread out for the ancient one 2 his bodies 3, mighty vital power, difficult to overcome. May he, the new-born, traverse the spaces. They have stood round him as round an angry lion.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा॒तेव॒ यद्भर॑से पप्रथा॒नो जनं॑जनं॒ धाय॑से॒ चक्ष॑से च वयो॑वयो जरसे॒ यद्दधा॑नः॒ परि॒ त्मना॒ विषु॑रूपो जिगासि
stanzas.transliteration: mātéva yád bhárase paprathānó jánaṃ-janaṃ dhā́yase cákṣase ca váyo-vayo jarase yád dádhānaḥ pári tmánā víṣurūpo jigāsi
stanzas.translation: When, like a mother, spreading forth to nourish, to cherish and regard each man that liveth,– Consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten, thou wanderest round, thyself, in varied fashion.

translations.griffith: When, like a mother, spreading forth to nourish, to cherish and regard each man that liveth,– Consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten, thou wanderest round, thyself, in varied fashion.
translations.oldenberg: When thou carriest, spreading out, man after man like a mother, for their nourishment and for their sight, when thou growest old 1 assuming life after life, thou goest around by thyself in manifold shapes.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाजो॒ नु ते॒ शव॑सस्पा॒त्वन्त॑मु॒रुं दोघं॑ ध॒रुणं॑ देव रा॒यः प॒दं न ता॒युर्गुहा॒ दधा॑नो म॒हो रा॒ये चि॒तय॒न्नत्रि॑मस्पः
stanzas.transliteration: vā́jo nú te śávasas pātv ántam urúṃ dóghaṃ dharúṇaṃ deva rāyáḥ padáṃ ná tāyúr gúhā dádhāno mahó rāyé citáyann átrim aspaḥ
stanzas.translation: May strength preserve the compass of thy vigour, God! that broad stream of thine that beareth riches. Thou, like a thief who keeps his refuge secret, hast holpen Atri to great wealth, by teaching.

translations.griffith: May strength preserve the compass of thy vigour, God! that broad stream of thine that beareth riches. Thou, like a thief who keeps his refuge secret, hast holpen Atri to great wealth, by teaching.
translations.oldenberg: May gain protect now the boundaries of thy strength, the wide, firmly supporting milkstream 1 of wealth, O god! Putting down thy foot in secret like a thief 2, thou hast enlightened and freed Atri for the sake of wealth mightily 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हद्वयो॒ हि भा॒नवेऽर्चा॑ दे॒वाया॒ग्नये॑ यं मि॒त्रं न प्रश॑स्तिभि॒र्मर्ता॑सो दधि॒रे पु॒रः
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hád váyo hí bhānáve- -árcā devā́yāgnáye yám mitráṃ ná práśastibhir mártāso dadhiré puráḥ
stanzas.translation: GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.

translations.griffith: GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.
translations.oldenberg: Sing 1 (a song that gives) mighty vital power, to the light, to god Agni, whom the mortals have placed in front 2 like Mitra by their praises 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि द्युभि॒र्जना॑नां॒ होता॒ दक्ष॑स्य बा॒ह्वोः वि ह॒व्यम॒ग्निरा॑नु॒षग्भगो॒ न वार॑मृण्वति
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí dyúbhir jánānāṃ hótā dákṣasya bāhvóḥ ví havyám agnír ānuṣág bhágo ná vā́ram r̥ṇvati
stanzas.translation: He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man. Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.

translations.griffith: He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man. Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.
translations.oldenberg: For he, Agni, the Hotri of men, day by day, in the arms of Daksha, discloses the offering in the due way, as Bhaga 1 (discloses) a treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य स्तोमे॑ म॒घोनः॑ स॒ख्ये वृ॒द्धशो॑चिषः विश्वा॒ यस्मि॑न्तुवि॒ष्वणि॒ सम॒र्ये शुष्म॑माद॒धुः
stanzas.transliteration: asyá stóme maghónaḥ sakhyé vr̥ddháśociṣaḥ víśvā yásmin tuviṣváṇi sám aryé śúṣmam ādadhúḥ
stanzas.translation: All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God, On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.

translations.griffith: All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God, On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.
translations.oldenberg: (We abide [?]) in his praise, the liberal (god's), in his friendship, the mightily brilliant one's, in whom, the loudly roaring Aryan, all (beings) have put together their strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ ह्य॑ग्न एषां सु॒वीर्य॑स्य मं॒हना॑ तमिद्य॒ह्वं न रोद॑सी॒ परि॒ श्रवो॑ बभूवतुः
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā hy àgna eṣāṃ suvī́ryasya maṃhánā tám íd yahváṃ ná ródasī pári śrávo babhūvatuḥ
stanzas.translation: So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength. Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.

translations.griffith: So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength. Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.
translations.oldenberg: For verily, O Agni, (thou belongest [?]) to them 1 through thy bounteousness 2 in (bestowing) abundance of heroes. Him indeed, the vigorous one, his glory the two worlds could not encompass 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू न॒ एहि॒ वार्य॒मग्ने॑ गृणा॒न आ भ॑र ये व॒यं ये च॑ सू॒रयः॑ स्व॒स्ति धाम॑हे॒ सचो॒तैधि॑ पृ॒त्सु नो॑ वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ na éhi vā́ryam ágne gr̥ṇāná ā́ bhara yé vayáṃ yé ca sūráyaḥ svastí dhā́mahe sácā- utaídhi pr̥tsú no vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth. So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.

translations.griffith: O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth. So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.
translations.oldenberg: Now then, Agni, come hither and, being praised, bring treasure 1 to us who, we ourselves and our liberal givers, may acquire welfare together. And help us to grow strong in fights.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ य॒ज्ञैर्दे॑व॒ मर्त्य॑ इ॒त्था तव्यां॑समू॒तये॑ अ॒ग्निं कृ॒ते स्व॑ध्व॒रे पू॒रुरी॑ळी॒ताव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yajñaír deva mártyaḥ- itthā́ távyāṃsam ūtáye agníṃ kr̥té svadhvaré pūrúr īḷītā́vase
stanzas.translation: GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid, A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.

translations.griffith: GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid, A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.
translations.oldenberg: May the mortal truly by sacrifices, O god, (magnify) the stronger one for help; may the Pûru, when good service has been performed, magnify Agni (and thereby draw him) hither for his aid.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्य॒ हि स्वय॑शस्तर आ॒सा वि॑धर्म॒न्मन्य॑से तं नाकं॑ चि॒त्रशो॑चिषं म॒न्द्रं प॒रो म॑नी॒षया॑
stanzas.transliteration: ásya hí sváyaśastaraḥ- āsā́ vidharman mányase táṃ nā́kaṃ citráśociṣam mandrám paró manīṣáyā
stanzas.translation: Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.

translations.griffith: Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.
translations.oldenberg: For thou art manifestly considered as his (i. e. Agni's) disposer, highly brilliant by thyself 1: (magnify then Agni who is) a firmament of bright splendour, lovely beyond 2 thought 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य वासा उ॑ अ॒र्चिषा॒ य आयु॑क्त तु॒जा गि॒रा दि॒वो न यस्य॒ रेत॑सा बृ॒हच्छोच॑न्त्य॒र्चयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asyá vā́sā́ u arcíṣā yá ā́yukta tujā́ girā́ divó ná yásya rétasā br̥hác chócanty arcáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful siong hath bound to act, Whose bearns of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.

translations.griffith: Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful siong hath bound to act, Whose bearns of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.
translations.oldenberg: (It is) yonder (sun?) who verily has been yoked by his (i. e. Agni's) light 1 through the impetuous speech 2—(by the light of Agni) whose flames mightily shine as if (they were made to shine) by the sperm of heaven 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य क्रत्वा॒ विचे॑तसो द॒स्मस्य॒ वसु॒ रथ॒ आ अधा॒ विश्वा॑सु॒ हव्यो॒ऽग्निर्वि॒क्षु प्र श॑स्यते
stanzas.transliteration: asyá krátvā vícetaso dasmásya vásu rátha ā́ ádhā víśvāsu hávyo -agnír vikṣú prá śasyate
stanzas.translation: Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power. Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni ghorified.

translations.griffith: Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power. Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni ghorified.
translations.oldenberg: Through his, the wise one's, insight there is wealth on his, the wonderful (Agni's), chariot. And Agni is praised, he who is to be invoked among all peoples.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू न॒ इद्धि वार्य॑मा॒सा स॑चन्त सू॒रयः॑ ऊर्जो॑ नपाद॒भिष्ट॑ये पा॒हि श॒ग्धि स्व॒स्तय॑ उ॒तैधि॑ पृ॒त्सु नो॑ वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ na íd dhí vā́ryam āsā́ sacanta sūráyaḥ ū́rjo napād abhíṣṭaye pāhí śagdhí svastáyaḥ- utaídhi pr̥tsú no vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips. Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.

translations.griffith: Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips. Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.
translations.oldenberg: Now indeed our liberal lords have manifestly attained 1 treasure. Offspring of vigour! Protect us for the sake of victory! Help us to welfare! And assist us to grow strong in fights i

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒तर॒ग्निः पु॑रुप्रि॒यो वि॒शः स्त॑वे॒ताति॑थिः विश्वा॑नि॒ यो अम॑र्त्यो ह॒व्या मर्ते॑षु॒ रण्य॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: prātár agníḥ purupriyó viśá stavetā́tithiḥ víśvāni yó ámartyo havyā́ márteṣu ráṇyati
stanzas.translation: AT dawn let: Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified; Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.

translations.griffith: AT dawn let: Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified; Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.
translations.oldenberg: May Agni, beloved of many, the guest of the house 1, be praised in the morning, the immortal who delights 2 in all offerings among the mortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्वि॒ताय॑ मृ॒क्तवा॑हसे॒ स्वस्य॒ दक्ष॑स्य मं॒हना॑ इन्दुं॒ स ध॑त्त आनु॒षक्स्तो॒ता चि॑त्ते अमर्त्य
stanzas.transliteration: dvitā́ya mr̥ktávāhase svásya dákṣasya maṃhánā índuṃ sá dhatta ānuṣák stotā́ cit te amartya
stanzas.translation: For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings, Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!

translations.griffith: For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings, Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!
translations.oldenberg: 1 To Dvita who by the liberal power of his dexterousness carries away injury 2, this praiser of thine, O immortal, prepares Soma in the due way.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वो॑ दी॒र्घायु॑शोचिषं गि॒रा हु॑वे म॒घोना॑म् अरि॑ष्टो॒ येषां॒ रथो॒ व्य॑श्वदाव॒न्नीय॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vo dīrghā́yuśociṣaṃ girā́ huve maghónām áriṣṭo yéṣāṃ rátho vy àśvadāvann ī́yate
stanzas.translation: Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life, For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.

translations.griffith: Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life, For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.
translations.oldenberg: I call for your sake Him who flames through long life, with the speech that belongs to the liberal patrons 1 whose chariot moves uninjured, O giver of horses 2;

stanzas.sanskrit: चि॒त्रा वा॒ येषु॒ दीधि॑तिरा॒सन्नु॒क्था पान्ति॒ ये स्ती॒र्णं ब॒र्हिः स्व॑र्णरे॒ श्रवां॑सि दधिरे॒ परि॑
stanzas.transliteration: citrā́ vā yéṣu dī́dhitir āsánn ukthā́ pā́nti yé stīrṇám barhíḥ svàrṇare śrávāṃsi dadhire pári
stanzas.translation: They who have varied ways of thought, who guard, the lauds within their lips, And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.

translations.griffith: They who have varied ways of thought, who guard, the lauds within their lips, And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.
translations.oldenberg: And in whom (dwells) brilliant thought, who guard the hymns of praise in their mouth, (whose) sacrificial grass is spread in the realm of the sun: they have invested themselves with glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये मे॑ पञ्चा॒शतं॑ द॒दुरश्वा॑नां स॒धस्तु॑ति द्यु॒मद॑ग्ने॒ महि॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हत्कृ॑धि म॒घोनां॑ नृ॒वद॑मृत नृ॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yé me pañcāśátaṃ dadúr áśvānāṃ sadhástuti dyumád agne máhi śrávo br̥hát kr̥dhi maghónāṃ nr̥vád amr̥ta nr̥ṇā́m
stanzas.translation: Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite, Heroes' illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite, Heroes' illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.
translations.oldenberg: On the liberal patrons who have given me fifty horses for my song of praise 1, bestow brilliant, mighty, high glory, O Agni; on those men (bestow glory) with (valiant) men, O immortal!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भ्य॑व॒स्थाः प्र जा॑यन्ते॒ प्र व॒व्रेर्व॒व्रिश्चि॑केत उ॒पस्थे॑ मा॒तुर्वि च॑ष्टे
stanzas.transliteration: abhy àvasthā́ḥ prá jāyante prá vavrér vavríś ciketa upásthe mātúr ví caṣṭe
stanzas.translation: ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk: Within his Mother's side he speaks.

translations.griffith: ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk: Within his Mother's side he speaks.
translations.oldenberg: They are born for retirement 1. Out of the cover he 2 has shone forth, being a cover himself. In the lap of the mother he looks about 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: जु॒हु॒रे वि चि॒तय॒न्तोऽनि॑मिषं नृ॒म्णं पा॑न्ति आ दृ॒ळ्हां पुरं॑ विविशुः
stanzas.transliteration: juhuré ví citáyantaḥ- -ánimiṣaṃ nr̥mṇám pānti ā́ dr̥ḷhā́m púraṃ viviśuḥ
stanzas.translation: Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes. To a strong fort have they pressed in.

translations.griffith: Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes. To a strong fort have they pressed in.
translations.oldenberg: Causing him to discern (the pious and the impious?), they have sacrificed. With unwinking eyes they protect his manly power. They have penetrated into the firm stronghold 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ श्वै॑त्रे॒यस्य॑ ज॒न्तवो॑ द्यु॒मद्व॑र्धन्त कृ॒ष्टयः॑ नि॒ष्कग्री॑वो बृ॒हदु॑क्थ ए॒ना मध्वा॒ न वा॑ज॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ śvaitreyásya jantávo dyumád vardhanta kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ niṣkágrīvo br̥hádukthaḥ- enā́ mádhvā ná vājayúḥ
stanzas.translation: Ṣvaitreya's people, all his men, have gloriously increased in might. A gold chain Br̥ihaduktha wears, as, through this Soma, seeking spoil.

translations.griffith: Ṣvaitreya's people, all his men, have gloriously increased in might. A gold chain Br̥ihaduktha wears, as, through this Soma, seeking spoil.
translations.oldenberg: The people of Svaitreya 1, his clans, have thriven brilliantly. Brihaduktha with a golden ornament at his neck, is eager for the race as if by this honey-drink 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रि॒यं दु॒ग्धं न काम्य॒मजा॑मि जा॒म्योः सचा॑ घ॒र्मो न वाज॑जठ॒रोऽद॑ब्धः॒ शश्व॑तो॒ दभः॑
stanzas.transliteration: priyáṃ dugdháṃ ná kā́myam ájāmi jāmyóḥ sácā gharmó ná vā́jajaṭharaḥ- -ádabdhaḥ śáśvato dábhaḥ
stanzas.translation: I bring, as 'twere, the longed-for milk, the dear milk of the Sister-Pair. Like to a caldron filled with food is he, unconquered, conquering all.

translations.griffith: I bring, as 'twere, the longed-for milk, the dear milk of the Sister-Pair. Like to a caldron filled with food is he, unconquered, conquering all.
translations.oldenberg: Like the dear milk of love 1—(a thing) unrelated with two (things) related 2—like the gharma vessel with booty in its belly—undeceived, the deceiver of all 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्रीळ॑न्नो रश्म॒ आ भु॑वः॒ सं भस्म॑ना वा॒युना॒ वेवि॑दानः ता अ॑स्य सन्धृ॒षजो॒ न ति॒ग्माः सुसं॑शिता व॒क्ष्यो॑ वक्षणे॒स्थाः
stanzas.transliteration: krī́ḷan no raśma ā́ bhuvaḥ sám bhásmanā vāyúnā vévidānaḥ tā́ asya san dhr̥ṣájo ná tigmā́ḥ súsaṃśitā vakṣyò vakṣaṇesthā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Beam of light, come to us in sportive fashion, finding thyself close to the wind that fans thee. These flames of his are wasting flames, like arrows keen-pointed, sharpened, on his breast.

translations.griffith: Beam of light, come to us in sportive fashion, finding thyself close to the wind that fans thee. These flames of his are wasting flames, like arrows keen-pointed, sharpened, on his breast.
translations.oldenberg: Sporting, O beam of light, appear to us, joined with the ash, with the wind. May those well sharpened … of his, standing on …, be sharp like… 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: यम॑ग्ने वाजसातम॒ त्वं चि॒न्मन्य॑से र॒यिम् तं नो॑ गी॒र्भिः श्र॒वाय्यं॑ देव॒त्रा प॑नया॒ युज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yám agne vājasātama tváṃ cin mányase rayím táṃ no gīrbhíḥ śravā́yyaṃ devatrā́ panayā yújam
stanzas.translation: AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.

translations.griffith: AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Whatever good, O Agni, best acquirer of gain, thou thinkest (fit), praise thou 2 that (good), which is celebrated in songs, among the gods as our share.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये अ॑ग्ने॒ नेरय॑न्ति ते वृ॒द्धा उ॒ग्रस्य॒ शव॑सः अप॒ द्वेषो॒ अप॒ ह्वरो॒ऽन्यव्र॑तस्य सश्चिरे
stanzas.transliteration: yé agne néráyanti te vr̥ddhā́ ugrásya śávasaḥ ápa dvéṣo ápa hváro -anyávratasya saścire
stanzas.translation: Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.

translations.griffith: Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.
translations.oldenberg: They, Agni, who do not set into motion for thee (prayers or offerings), when grown full of mighty strength 1, turn away to encounter the hatred and the tricks of him who follows another (i. e. a wrong) law 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: होता॑रं त्वा वृणीम॒हेऽग्ने॒ दक्ष॑स्य॒ साध॑नम् य॒ज्ञेषु॑ पू॒र्व्यं गि॒रा प्रय॑स्वन्तो हवामहे
stanzas.transliteration: hótāraṃ tvā vr̥ṇīmahe- -ágne dákṣasya sā́dhanam yajñéṣu pūrvyáṃ girā́ práyasvanto havāmahe
stanzas.translation: Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill; We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill; We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.
translations.oldenberg: We choose thee as our Hotri, Agni, the giver of skill; offering delight (to thee) we call with our prayer (thee), the foremost at the sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒त्था यथा॑ त ऊ॒तये॒ सह॑सावन्दि॒वेदि॑वे रा॒य ऋ॒ताय॑ सुक्रतो॒ गोभिः॑ ष्याम सध॒मादो॑ वी॒रैः स्या॑म सध॒मादः॑
stanzas.transliteration: itthā́ yáthā ta ūtáye sáhasāvan divé-dive rāyá r̥tā́ya sukrato góbhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamā́do vīraíḥ syāma sadhamā́daḥ
stanzas.translation: Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day, For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at the feast.

translations.griffith: Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day, For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at the feast.
translations.oldenberg: So that we, O strong one, (may be ready) for thy favour, for wealth and Rita, O highly wise one: thus may we day by day rejoice 1 with cows and rejoice with heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒नु॒ष्वत्त्वा॒ नि धी॑महि मनु॒ष्वत्समि॑धीमहि अग्ने॑ मनु॒ष्वद॑ङ्गिरो दे॒वान्दे॑वय॒ते य॑ज
stanzas.transliteration: manuṣvát tvā ní dhīmahi manuṣvát sám idhīmahi ágne manuṣvád aṅgiro devā́n devayaté yaja
stanzas.translation: WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee. Like Manus, for the pious man , Angiras, Agni, worship Gods.

translations.griffith: WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee. Like Manus, for the pious man , Angiras, Agni, worship Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Let us lay thee down, as Manus did. Let us kindle thee, as Manus did. O Agni Aṅgiras, sacrifice to the gods for the worshippers of the gods as (thou didst) for Manus.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं हि मानु॑षे॒ जनेऽग्ने॒ सुप्री॑त इ॒ध्यसे॑ स्रुच॑स्त्वा यन्त्यानु॒षक्सुजा॑त॒ सर्पि॑रासुते
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hí mā́nuṣe jáne- -ágne súprīta idhyáse srúcas tvā yanty ānuṣák sújāta sárpirāsute
stanzas.translation: For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind. Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.

translations.griffith: For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind. Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.
translations.oldenberg: For thou, O Agni, art kindled, highly pleased, among human people. To thee the (sacrificial) ladles proceed in due order, O well-born one who drinkest butter.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां विश्वे॑ स॒जोष॑सो दे॒वासो॑ दू॒तम॑क्रत स॒प॒र्यन्त॑स्त्वा कवे य॒ज्ञेषु॑ दे॒वमी॑ळते
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ víśve sajóṣaso devā́so dūtám akrata saparyántas tvā kave yajñéṣu devám īḷate
stanzas.translation: Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger. Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.

translations.griffith: Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger. Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.
translations.oldenberg: Thee all the gods unanimously have made their messenger. Serving thee, O sage, they magnify at the sacrifices (thee) the god.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वं वो॑ देवय॒ज्यया॒ग्निमी॑ळीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ समि॑द्धः शुक्र दीदिह्यृ॒तस्य॒ योनि॒मास॑दः स॒सस्य॒ योनि॒मास॑दः
stanzas.transliteration: deváṃ vo devayajyáyā- -agním īḷīta mártyaḥ sámiddhaḥ śukra dīdihi- r̥tásya yónim ā́sadaḥ sasásya yónim ā́sadaḥ
stanzas.translation: Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods. Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.

translations.griffith: Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods. Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.
translations.oldenberg: Let the mortal magnify for your sake Agni, the god, with worship as is due to the gods. Being kindled, O brilliant one, shine! Sit down in the abode 1 of Rita; sit down in the abode of herbs 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वि॑श्वसामन्नत्रि॒वदर्चा॑ पाव॒कशो॑चिषे यो अ॑ध्व॒रेष्वीड्यो॒ होता॑ म॒न्द्रत॑मो वि॒शि
stanzas.transliteration: prá viśvasāmann atrivád árcā pāvakáśociṣe yó adhvaréṣv ī́ḍyo hótā mandrátamo viśí
stanzas.translation: LIKE Atri, Viṣvasâman! sing to him of purifying light, Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.

translations.griffith: LIKE Atri, Viṣvasâman! sing to him of purifying light, Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.
translations.oldenberg: Lo, Visvasâman! Like Atri sing to him who purifies with his flames, to the Hotri who should be magnified at the sacrifices, most delightful in the clan.

stanzas.sanskrit: न्य१॒॑ग्निं जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ दधा॑ता दे॒वमृ॒त्विज॑म् प्र य॒ज्ञ ए॑त्वानु॒षग॒द्या दे॒वव्य॑चस्तमः
stanzas.transliteration: ny àgníṃ jātávedasaṃ dádhātā devám r̥tvíjam prá yajñá etv ānuṣág adyā́ devávyacastamaḥ
stanzas.translation: Set Jâtavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister. Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.

translations.griffith: Set Jâtavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister. Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Lay down Agni Gâtavedas, the god, the priest. May the sacrifice which best encompasses the gods, proceed to-day in due order.

stanzas.sanskrit: चि॒कि॒त्विन्म॑नसं त्वा दे॒वं मर्ता॑स ऊ॒तये॑ वरे॑ण्यस्य॒ तेऽव॑स इया॒नासो॑ अमन्महि
stanzas.transliteration: cikitvínmanasaṃ tvā devám mártāsa ūtáye váreṇyasya té 'vasaḥ- iyānā́so amanmahi
stanzas.translation: All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind. Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.

translations.griffith: All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind. Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.
translations.oldenberg: We, the mortals, approaching thee, the attentive-minded god, for thy help, have thought of thy desirable aid.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ चिकि॒द्ध्य१॒॑स्य न॑ इ॒दं वचः॑ सहस्य तं त्वा॑ सुशिप्र दम्पते॒ स्तोमै॑र्वर्ध॒न्त्यत्र॑यो गी॒र्भिः शु॑म्भ॒न्त्यत्र॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: ágne cikiddhy àsyá naḥ- idáṃ vácaḥ sahasya táṃ tvā suśipra dampate stómair vardhanty átrayo gīrbhíḥ śumbhanty átrayaḥ
stanzas.translation: Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One. Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with songs.

translations.griffith: Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One. Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with songs.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, be intent on this—on this our word 1, O strong one. As such, O strong jawed 2 lord of the house, the Atris strengthen thee by their praises; the Atris beautify thee by their prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ सह॑न्त॒मा भ॑र द्यु॒म्नस्य॑ प्रा॒सहा॑ र॒यिम् विश्वा॒ यश्च॑र्ष॒णीर॒भ्या॒३॒॑सा वाजे॑षु सा॒सह॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne sáhantam ā́ bhara dyumnásya prāsáhā rayím víśvā yáś carṣaṇī́r abhí -āsā́ vā́jeṣu sāsáhat
stanzas.translation: By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth, Wealth that o'ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.

translations.griffith: By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth, Wealth that o'ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, bring hither, through the power of thy splendour, powerful wealth which may manifestly prevail over all tribes in the (contests for) booty.

stanzas.sanskrit: तम॑ग्ने पृतना॒षहं॑ र॒यिं स॑हस्व॒ आ भ॑र त्वं हि स॒त्यो अद्भु॑तो दा॒ता वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: tám agne pr̥tanāṣáhaṃ rayíṃ sahasva ā́ bhara tváṃ hí satyó ádbhuto dātā́ vā́jasya gómataḥ
stanzas.translation: Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war; For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.

translations.griffith: Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war; For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.
translations.oldenberg: O powerful Agni! Bring hither that wealth powerful in battles. For thou art the true, wonderful giver of booty rich in cows.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॒ हि त्वा॑ स॒जोष॑सो॒ जना॑सो वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः होता॑रं॒ सद्म॑सु प्रि॒यं व्यन्ति॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु
stanzas.transliteration: víśve hí tvā sajóṣaso jánāso vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ hótāraṃ sádmasu priyáṃ vyánti vā́ryā purú
stanzas.translation: For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn, Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.

translations.griffith: For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn, Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.
translations.oldenberg: For all men who have spread out the sacrificial grass, unanimously ask thee, the beloved Hotri in the seats (of sacrifice), for many boons.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि ष्मा॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिर॒भिमा॑ति॒ सहो॑ द॒धे अग्न॑ ए॒षु क्षये॒ष्वा रे॒वन्नः॑ शुक्र दीदिहि द्यु॒मत्पा॑वक दीदिहि
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí ṣmā viśvácarṣaṇir abhímāti sáho dadhé ágna eṣú kṣáyeṣv~ā́ reván naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumát pāvaka dīdihi
stanzas.translation: For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes. O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

translations.griffith: For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes. O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.
translations.oldenberg: For he who dwells among all tribes, has invested himself with power against assault 1. Agni! In these dwelling-places shine to us richly, O bright one, shine brilliantly, O purifier!

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ त्वं नो॒ अन्त॑म उ॒त त्रा॒ता शि॒वो भ॑वा वरू॒थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne tváṃ no ántamaḥ- utá trātā́ śivó bhavā varūthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.

translations.griffith: O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, be thou our nearest (friend) and our kind, protecting guardian.

stanzas.sanskrit: वसु॑र॒ग्निर्वसु॑श्रवा॒ अच्छा॑ नक्षि द्यु॒मत्त॑मं र॒यिं दाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vásur agnír vásuśravāḥ- áchā nakṣi dyumáttamaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ
stanzas.translation: Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned.

translations.griffith: Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is Vasu, renowned as Vasu (or, renowned by goods). Obtain, (and) bestow (on us), most brilliant wealth 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ बोधि श्रु॒धी हव॑मुरु॒ष्या णो॑ अघाय॒तः स॑मस्मात्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no bodhi śrudhī́ hávam uruṣyā́ ṇo aghāyatáḥ samasmāt
stanzas.translation: So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every sinful man.

translations.griffith: So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every sinful man.
translations.oldenberg: Listen to us then; hear our call; deliver us from every harmful man.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॑ शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सु॒म्नाय॑ नू॒नमी॑महे॒ सखि॑भ्यः
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnā́ya nūnám īmahe sákhibhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee then, O Most Bright, O Radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends.

translations.griffith: To thee then, O Most Bright, O Radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends.
translations.oldenberg: We entreat thee now, O brightest, shining (Agni), for thy grace, for our friends.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ वो अ॒ग्निमव॑से दे॒वं गा॑सि॒ स नो॒ वसुः॑ रास॑त्पु॒त्र ऋ॑षू॒णामृ॒तावा॑ पर्षति द्वि॒षः
stanzas.transliteration: áchā vo agním ávase deváṃ gāsi sá no vásuḥ rā́sat putrá r̥ṣūṇā́m r̥tā́vā parṣati dviṣáḥ
stanzas.translation: I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us. Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.

translations.griffith: I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us. Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.
translations.oldenberg: Address thy song 1 for your sake to the god Agni, for his help. He is our Vasu. May the son of the dawns(?) 2 give us (wealth). May the righteous one help us across our enemies.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि स॒त्यो यं पूर्वे॑ चिद्दे॒वास॑श्चि॒द्यमी॑धि॒रे होता॑रं म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्व॒मित्सु॑दी॒तिभि॑र्वि॒भाव॑सुम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí satyó yám pū́rve cid devā́saś cid yám īdhiré hótāram mandrájihvam ít sudītíbhir vibhā́vasum
stanzas.translation: For be is true, whpm men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves, The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.

translations.griffith: For be is true, whpm men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves, The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.
translations.oldenberg: He is the true one, whom the men of old, whom the gods have kindled, the Hotri with the delightful tongue, rich in splendour with glorious shine.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ धी॒ती वरि॑ष्ठया॒ श्रेष्ठ॑या च सुम॒त्या अग्ने॑ रा॒यो दि॑दीहि नः सुवृ॒क्तिभि॑र्वरेण्य
stanzas.transliteration: sá no dhītī́ váriṣṭhayā śréṣṭhayā ca sumatyā́ ágne rāyó didīhi naḥ suvr̥ktíbhir vareṇya
stanzas.translation: With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent, O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.

translations.griffith: With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent, O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.
translations.oldenberg: As such, with thy widest thought and with thy best favour, shine wealth on us, excellent Agni, for our beautiful praises 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वेषु॑ राजत्य॒ग्निर्मर्ते॑ष्वावि॒शन् अ॒ग्निर्नो॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नो॒ऽग्निं धी॒भिः स॑पर्यत
stanzas.transliteration: agnír devéṣu rājati- agnír márteṣv āviśán agnír no havyavā́hano -agníṃ dhībhíḥ saparyata
stanzas.translation: Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike. Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.

translations.griffith: Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike. Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.
translations.oldenberg: Agni reigns among the gods, Agni among mortals, entering among them. Agni is the carrier of our offerings. Serve ye Agni with prayers!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निस्तु॒विश्र॑वस्तमं तु॒विब्र॑ह्माणमुत्त॒मम् अ॒तूर्तं॑ श्राव॒यत्प॑तिं पु॒त्रं द॑दाति दा॒शुषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnís tuvíśravastamaṃ tuvíbrahmāṇam uttamám atū́rtaṃ śrāvayátpatim putráṃ dadāti dāśúṣe
stanzas.translation: Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame, Of deep devotion, ne'er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.

translations.griffith: Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame, Of deep devotion, ne'er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.
translations.oldenberg: Agni gives to the worshipper a son most mightily renowned, a knower of mighty spells, most excellent, unconquered, who brings renown to his lord 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्द॑दाति॒ सत्प॑तिं सा॒साह॒ यो यु॒धा नृभिः॑ अ॒ग्निरत्यं॑ रघु॒ष्यदं॒ जेता॑र॒मप॑राजितम्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír dadāti sátpatiṃ sāsā́ha yó yudhā́ nŕ̥bhiḥ agnír átyaṃ raghuṣyádaṃ jétāram áparājitam
stanzas.translation: Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight. Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.

translations.griffith: Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight. Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.
translations.oldenberg: Agni gives a good lord who is victorious in battles with his men; Agni (gives) a steed, swiftly running, victorious (in races), unconquered.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्वाहि॑ष्ठं॒ तद॒ग्नये॑ बृ॒हद॑र्च विभावसो महि॑षीव॒ त्वद्र॒यिस्त्वद्वाजा॒ उदी॑रते
stanzas.transliteration: yád vā́hiṣṭhaṃ tád agnáye br̥hád arca vibhāvaso máhiṣīva tvád rayís tvád vā́jā úd īrate
stanzas.translation: The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light. Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed -from thee.

translations.griffith: The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light. Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed -from thee.
translations.oldenberg: Sing mightily to Agni the (song) which may best bring him (to us), O (god) rich in splendour 1! From thee (proceeds) wealth (mighty) like a buffalo-cow 2; from thee proceed gains.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ द्यु॒मन्तो॑ अ॒र्चयो॒ ग्रावे॑वोच्यते बृ॒हत् उ॒तो ते॑ तन्य॒तुर्य॑था स्वा॒नो अ॑र्त॒ त्मना॑ दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: táva dyumánto arcáyo grā́vevocyate br̥hát utó te tanyatúr yathā svānó arta tmánā diváḥ
stanzas.translation: Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones. Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.

translations.griffith: Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones. Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Thy brilliant flames resound mightily like the pressing-stone (of the Soma) 1. And thy roaring arose like thunder by itself from heaven 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वाँ अ॒ग्निं व॑सू॒यवः॑ सहसा॒नं व॑वन्दिम स नो॒ विश्वा॒ अति॒ द्विषः॒ पर्ष॑न्ना॒वेव॑ सु॒क्रतुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́m̐ agníṃ vasūyávaḥ sahasānáṃ vavandima sá no víśvā áti dvíṣaḥ párṣan nāvéva sukrátuḥ
stanzas.translation: Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror. May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.

translations.griffith: Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror. May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.
translations.oldenberg: Thus we have paid homage, desirous of goods, to powerful Agni. May he, the highly wise one, help us, as with a ship, across all enemies.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ पावक रो॒चिषा॑ म॒न्द्रया॑ देव जि॒ह्वया॑ आ दे॒वान्व॑क्षि॒ यक्षि॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: ágne pāvaka rocíṣā mandráyā deva jihváyā ā́ devā́n vakṣi yákṣi ca
stanzas.translation: O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue Bring hither and adore the Gods.

translations.griffith: O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue Bring hither and adore the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, purifier! With thy splendour, with thy delightful tongue, O god, bring hither the gods and perform the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॑ घृतस्नवीमहे॒ चित्र॑भानो स्व॒र्दृश॑म् दे॒वाँ आ वी॒तये॑ वह
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā ghr̥tasnav īmahe cítrabhāno svardŕ̥śam devā́m̐ ā́ vītáye vaha
stanzas.translation: We pray thee, thou who droppest oil, bright-rayed! who lookest on the Sun, Bring the Gods hither to the feast.

translations.griffith: We pray thee, thou who droppest oil, bright-rayed! who lookest on the Sun, Bring the Gods hither to the feast.
translations.oldenberg: Thee therefore we approach, who swimmest in ghrita 1, O (god) with brilliant light, thee of sun-like aspect. Bring hither the gods that they may feast.

stanzas.sanskrit: वी॒तिहो॑त्रं त्वा कवे द्यु॒मन्तं॒ समि॑धीमहि अग्ने॑ बृ॒हन्त॑मध्व॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: vītíhotraṃ tvā kave dyumántaṃ sám idhīmahi ágne br̥hántam adhvaré
stanzas.translation: We have enkindled thee, O Sage, bright caller of the Gods to feast. O Agni, great in Sacrifice.

translations.griffith: We have enkindled thee, O Sage, bright caller of the Gods to feast. O Agni, great in Sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: Let us kindle thee, O sage, the brilliant offerer of feasts (to the gods), O Agni, the mighty (god) at the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भि॒रा ग॑हि दे॒वेभि॑र्ह॒व्यदा॑तये होता॑रं त्वा वृणीमहे
stanzas.transliteration: ágne víśvebhir ā́ gahi devébhir havyádātaye hótāraṃ tvā vr̥ṇīmahe-
stanzas.translation: O Agni, come with all the Gods, come to our sacrificial gift: We choose thee as Invoking Priest.

translations.griffith: O Agni, come with all the Gods, come to our sacrificial gift: We choose thee as Invoking Priest.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, come hither with all the gods to the gift of the offering. We choose thee as our Hotri.

stanzas.sanskrit: यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒त आग्ने॑ सु॒वीर्यं॑ वह दे॒वैरा स॑त्सि ब॒र्हिषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yájamānāya sunvaté- ā́gne suvī́ryaṃ vaha devaír ā́ satsi barhíṣi
stanzas.translation: Bring, Agni, to the worshipper who pours the juice, heroic strength: Sit with the Gods upon the grass.

translations.griffith: Bring, Agni, to the worshipper who pours the juice, heroic strength: Sit with the Gods upon the grass.
translations.oldenberg: Bring to the sacrificer who presses (Soma), Agni, abundance of heroes. Sit down on the sacrificial grass together with the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मि॒धा॒नः स॑हस्रजि॒दग्ने॒ धर्मा॑णि पुष्यसि दे॒वानां॑ दू॒त उ॒क्थ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: samidhānáḥ sahasrajid ágne dhármāṇi puṣyasi devā́nāṃ dūtá ukthyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Victor of thousands, Agni, thou, enkindled, cherishest the laws, Laud-worthy, envoy of the Gods.

translations.griffith: Victor of thousands, Agni, thou, enkindled, cherishest the laws, Laud-worthy, envoy of the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Being kindled, Agni, conqueror of thousandfold (wealth), thou makest the ordinances (of the world) thrive, the praiseworthy messenger of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: न्य१॒॑ग्निं जा॒तवे॑दसं होत्र॒वाहं॒ यवि॑ष्ठ्यम् दधा॑ता दे॒वमृ॒त्विज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ny àgníṃ jātávedasaṃ hotravā́haṃ yáviṣṭhyam dádhātā devám r̥tvíjam
stanzas.translation: Set Agni Jâtavedas down, the bearer of our sacred gifts, MostYouthful, God and Minister.

translations.griffith: Set Agni Jâtavedas down, the bearer of our sacred gifts, MostYouthful, God and Minister.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Lay down Agni Gâtavedas, the carrier of offerings, the youngest, the god, the priest.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र य॒ज्ञ ए॑त्वानु॒षग॒द्या दे॒वव्य॑चस्तमः स्तृ॒णी॒त ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá yajñá etv ānuṣág adyā́ devávyacastamaḥ str̥ṇītá barhír āsáde
stanzas.translation: Duly proceed our sacrifice, comprising all the Gods, to-day: Strew holy grass to be their seat.

translations.griffith: Duly proceed our sacrifice, comprising all the Gods, to-day: Strew holy grass to be their seat.
translations.oldenberg: May the sacrifice which best encompasses the gods, proceed to-day in due order. Spread the sacrificial grass that (the gods) may sit down on it.

stanzas.sanskrit: एदं म॒रुतो॑ अ॒श्विना॑ मि॒त्रः सी॑दन्तु॒ वरु॑णः दे॒वासः॒ सर्व॑या वि॒शा
stanzas.transliteration: édám marúto aśvínā mitráḥ sīdantu váruṇaḥ devā́saḥ sárvayā viśā́
stanzas.translation: So may the Maruts sit thereon, the Aṣvins, Mitra, Varuṇa: The Gods with all their company.

translations.griffith: So may the Maruts sit thereon, the Aṣvins, Mitra, Varuṇa: The Gods with all their company.
translations.oldenberg: May the Maruts, the Asvins, Mitra and Varuna sit down on this (sacrificial grass). the gods with all their folk.

stanzas.sanskrit: अन॑स्वन्ता॒ सत्प॑तिर्मामहे मे॒ गावा॒ चेति॑ष्ठो॒ असु॑रो म॒घोनः॑ त्रै॒वृ॒ष्णो अ॑ग्ने द॒शभिः॑ स॒हस्रै॒र्वैश्वा॑नर॒ त्र्य॑रुणश्चिकेत
stanzas.transliteration: ánasvantā sátpatir māmahe me gā́vā cétiṣṭho ásuro maghónaḥ traivr̥ṣṇó agne daśábhiḥ sahásrair vaíśvānara tryàruṇaś ciketa
stanzas.translation: THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon. Trivr̥ishan's son Tryaruṇa hath distinguished himself, Vaiṣvânara Agni! with ten thousands.

translations.griffith: THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon. Trivr̥ishan's son Tryaruṇa hath distinguished himself, Vaiṣvânara Agni! with ten thousands.
translations.oldenberg: The good lord has presented me with two oxen together with a car, the most brilliant Asura among the liberal givers 1. Tryaruna, the son of Trivrishan, O Agni Vaisvânara 2, has distinguished himself by (his gift of) ten thousand (cows?) 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो मे॑ श॒ता च॑ विंश॒तिं च॒ गोनां॒ हरी॑ च यु॒क्ता सु॒धुरा॒ ददा॑ति वैश्वा॑नर॒ सुष्टु॑तो वावृधा॒नोऽग्ने॒ यच्छ॒ त्र्य॑रुणाय॒ शर्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó me śatā́ ca viṃśatíṃ ca gónāṃ hárī ca yuktā́ sudhúrā dádāti vaíśvānara súṣṭuto vāvr̥dhānó -ágne yácha tryàruṇāya śárma
stanzas.translation: Protect Tryaruṇa, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaiṣvânara Agni! Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.

translations.griffith: Protect Tryaruṇa, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaiṣvânara Agni! Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.
translations.oldenberg: To him who gives me one hundred 1 and twenty cows and two fallow steeds, harnessed and well-yoked, to Tryaruna grant thy protection, Agni Vaisvânara, who art highly praised and grown strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा ते॑ अग्ने सुम॒तिं च॑का॒नो नवि॑ष्ठाय नव॒मं त्र॒सद॑स्युः यो मे॒ गिर॑स्तुविजा॒तस्य॑ पू॒र्वीर्यु॒क्तेना॒भि त्र्य॑रुणो गृ॒णाति॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ te agne sumatíṃ cakānó náviṣṭhāya navamáṃ trasádasyuḥ yó me gíras tuvijātásya pūrvī́r yukténābhí tryàruṇo gr̥ṇā́ti
stanzas.translation: So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni; Tryaruṇa who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.

translations.griffith: So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni; Tryaruṇa who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.
translations.oldenberg: Thus, O Agni, desiring thy favour 1, Trasadasyu 2 (sings) for the ninth time 3 to thee the youngest (god)—Tryaruna who responds to my, the strong-born's, many hymns with (the gift of) a yoked (chariot) 4—

stanzas.sanskrit: यो म॒ इति॑ प्र॒वोच॒त्यश्व॑मेधाय सू॒रये॑ दद॑दृ॒चा स॒निं य॒ते दद॑न्मे॒धामृ॑ताय॒ते
stanzas.transliteration: yó ma íti pravócati- áśvamedhāya sūráye dádad r̥cā́ saníṃ yaté dádan medhā́m r̥tāyaté
stanzas.translation: He who declares his wish to me, to Aṣvamedha, to the Prince, Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.

translations.griffith: He who declares his wish to me, to Aṣvamedha, to the Prince, Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Who may thus announce me 2 to Asvamedha the liberal (prince): may he give to him who with his verse strives for gain; may he give to him who lives in the Rita for (acquiring) wisdom 3—

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ मा परु॒षाः श॒तमु॑द्ध॒र्षय॑न्त्यु॒क्षणः॑ अश्व॑मेधस्य॒ दानाः॒ सोमा॑ इव॒ त्र्या॑शिरः
stanzas.transliteration: yásya mā paruṣā́ḥ śatám uddharṣáyanty ukṣáṇaḥ áśvamedhasya dā́nāḥ sómā iva tryā̀śiraḥ
stanzas.translation: From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart, The gifts of Aṣvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.

translations.griffith: From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart, The gifts of Aṣvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.
translations.oldenberg: Asvamedha whose gifts, a hundred speckled bulls, delight me like Soma juices with threefold admixture 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी शत॒दाव्न्यश्व॑मेधे सु॒वीर्य॑म् क्ष॒त्रं धा॑रयतं बृ॒हद्दि॒वि सूर्य॑मिवा॒जर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī śatadā́vni- áśvamedhe suvī́ryam kṣatráṃ dhārayatam br̥hád diví sū́ryam ivājáram
stanzas.translation: To Aṣvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power, O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.

translations.griffith: To Aṣvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power, O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Indra-Agni! Bestow on Asvamedha, the giver of a hundred (bulls), abundance of heroes and mighty royal power, like the never-ageing Sun in heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धो अ॒ग्निर्दि॒वि शो॒चिर॑श्रेत्प्र॒त्यङ्ङु॒षस॑मुर्वि॒या वि भा॑ति एति॒ प्राची॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रा॒ नमो॑भिर्दे॒वाँ ईळा॑ना ह॒विषा॑ घृ॒ताची॑
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddho agnír diví śocír aśret pratyáṅṅ uṣásam urviyā́ ví bhāti éti prā́cī viśvávārā námobhir devā́m̐ ī́ḷānā havíṣā ghr̥tā́cī
stanzas.translation: AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning. Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.

translations.griffith: AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning. Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.
translations.oldenberg: Agni kindled has sent his light to the sky; turned towards the dawn he shines far and wide. (The sacrificial ladle) goes forward with adoration, rich in all treasures, magnifying the gods with sacrificial food.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मि॒ध्यमा॑नो अ॒मृत॑स्य राजसि ह॒विष्कृ॒ण्वन्तं॑ सचसे स्व॒स्तये॑ विश्वं॒ स ध॑त्ते॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ यमिन्व॑स्याति॒थ्यम॑ग्ने॒ नि च॑ धत्त॒ इत्पु॒रः
stanzas.transliteration: samidhyámāno amŕ̥tasya rājasi havíṣ kr̥ṇvántaṃ sacase svastáye víśvaṃ sá dhatte dráviṇaṃ yám ínvasi- ātithyám agne ní ca dhatta ít puráḥ
stanzas.translation: Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal. He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim.

translations.griffith: Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal. He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim.
translations.oldenberg: Being kindled thou reignest over immortality; thou attendest for welfare the man who prepares the sacrificial food. He whom thou furtherest, acquires all wealth and puts in front hospitality (towards thee), O Agni 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ शर्ध॑ मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय॒ तव॑ द्यु॒म्नान्यु॑त्त॒मानि॑ सन्तु सं जा॑स्प॒त्यं सु॒यम॒मा कृ॑णुष्व शत्रूय॒ताम॒भि ति॑ष्ठा॒ महां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: ágne śárdha mahaté saúbhagāya táva dyumnā́ny uttamā́ni santu sáṃ jāspatyáṃ suyámam ā́ kr̥ṇuṣva śatrūyatā́m abhí tiṣṭhā máhāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours. Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.

translations.griffith: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours. Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, show thy prowess for the sake of great bliss. May thy splendours be highest. Make our householdership easy to conduct 1. Set thy foot on the greatness of those who show enmity to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धस्य॒ प्रम॑ह॒सोऽग्ने॒ वन्दे॒ तव॒ श्रिय॑म् वृ॒ष॒भो द्यु॒म्नवाँ॑ असि॒ सम॑ध्व॒रेष्वि॑ध्यसे
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddhasya prámahasaḥ- -ágne vánde táva śríyam vr̥ṣabhó dyumnávām̐ asi sám adhvaréṣv idhyase
stanzas.translation: Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength. A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.

translations.griffith: Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength. A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.
translations.oldenberg: I adore thy beauty, Agni, who hast been kindled, who art highly exalted. A bull, brilliant art thou. Thou art kindled at the sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धो अग्न आहुत दे॒वान्य॑क्षि स्वध्वर त्वं हि ह॑व्य॒वाळसि॑
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddho agna āhuta devā́n yakṣi svadhvara tváṃ hí havyavā́ḷ ási
stanzas.translation: Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice: For thou art bearer of our gifts.

translations.griffith: Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice: For thou art bearer of our gifts.
translations.oldenberg: Being kindled, Agni into whom offerings are poured, sacrifice to the gods, best sacrificer, for thou art the carrier of oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ जु॑होता दुव॒स्यता॒ग्निं प्र॑य॒त्य॑ध्व॒रे वृ॒णी॒ध्वं ह॑व्य॒वाह॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ juhotā duvasyáta- -agním prayaty àdhvaré vr̥ṇīdhváṃ havyavā́hanam
stanzas.translation: Invoke and worship Agni while the sacrificial rite proceeds: For offering-bearer choose ye him.

translations.griffith: Invoke and worship Agni while the sacrificial rite proceeds: For offering-bearer choose ye him.
translations.oldenberg: Sacrifice into (Agni); exalt Agni, while the sacrifice is going on. Choose him for your carrier of oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्र्य॑र्य॒मा मनु॑षो दे॒वता॑ता॒ त्री रो॑च॒ना दि॒व्या धा॑रयन्त अर्च॑न्ति त्वा म॒रुतः॑ पू॒तद॑क्षा॒स्त्वमे॑षा॒मृषि॑रिन्द्रासि॒ धीरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: try àryamā́ mánuṣo devátātā trī́ rocanā́ divyā́ dhārayanta árcanti tvā marútaḥ pūtádakṣās tvám eṣām ŕ̥ṣir indrāsi dhī́raḥ
stanzas.translation: MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient R̥ishi.

translations.griffith: MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient R̥ishi.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॒ यदीं॑ म॒रुतो॑ मन्दसा॒नमार्च॒न्निन्द्रं॑ पपि॒वांसं॑ सु॒तस्य॑ आद॑त्त॒ वज्र॑म॒भि यदहिं॒ हन्न॒पो य॒ह्वीर॑सृज॒त्सर्त॒वा उ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánu yád īm marúto mandasānám ā́rcann índram papivā́ṃsaṃ sutásya ā́datta vájram abhí yád áhiṃ hánn apó yahvī́r asr̥jat sártavā́ u
stanzas.translation: What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices, He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.

translations.griffith: What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices, He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त ब्र॑ह्माणो मरुतो मे अ॒स्येन्द्रः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ सुषु॑तस्य पेयाः तद्धि ह॒व्यं मनु॑षे॒ गा अवि॑न्द॒दह॒न्नहिं॑ पपि॒वाँ इन्द्रो॑ अस्य
stanzas.transliteration: utá brahmāṇo maruto me asya- -índraḥ sómasya súṣutasya peyāḥ tád dhí havyám mánuṣe gā́ ávindad áhann áhim papivā́m̐ índro asya
stanzas.translation: And, O ye Brahmans, Maruts, so may Indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed Sorna; For this oblation found for man the cattle, and Indra, having quaffed it, slew the Dragon.

translations.griffith: And, O ye Brahmans, Maruts, so may Indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed Sorna; For this oblation found for man the cattle, and Indra, having quaffed it, slew the Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: आद्रोद॑सी वित॒रं वि ष्क॑भायत्संविव्या॒नश्चि॑द्भि॒यसे॑ मृ॒गं कः॑ जिग॑र्ति॒मिन्द्रो॑ अप॒जर्गु॑राणः॒ प्रति॑ श्व॒सन्त॒मव॑ दान॒वं ह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́d ródasī vitaráṃ ví ṣkabhāyat saṃvivyānáś cid bhiyáse mr̥gáṃ kaḥ jígartim índro apajárgurāṇaḥ práti śvasántam áva dānaváṃ han
stanzas.translation: Then heaven and earth he sundered and supported: wrapped even in these he struck the Beast with terror. So Indra forced the Engulfer to disgorgement, and slew the Dânava. panting against him.

translations.griffith: Then heaven and earth he sundered and supported: wrapped even in these he struck the Beast with terror. So Indra forced the Engulfer to disgorgement, and slew the Dânava. panting against him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॒ क्रत्वा॑ मघव॒न्तुभ्यं॑ दे॒वा अनु॒ विश्वे॑ अददुः सोम॒पेय॑म् यत्सूर्य॑स्य ह॒रितः॒ पत॑न्तीः पु॒रः स॒तीरुप॑रा॒ एत॑शे॒ कः
stanzas.transliteration: ádha krátvā maghavan túbhyaṃ devā́ḥ- ánu víśve adaduḥ somapéyam yát sū́ryasya harítaḥ pátantīḥ puráḥ satī́r úparā étaśe káḥ
stanzas.translation: Thus all the Gods, O Maghavan, delivered to thee of their free will the draught of Soma; When thou for Etaṣa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of Sûrya racing forward.
