translations.griffith: Thus all the Gods, O Maghavan, delivered to thee of their free will the draught of Soma; When thou for Etaṣa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of Sûrya racing forward.

stanzas.sanskrit: नव॒ यद॑स्य नव॒तिं च॑ भो॒गान्त्सा॒कं वज्रे॑ण म॒घवा॑ विवृ॒श्चत् अर्च॒न्तीन्द्रं॑ म॒रुतः॑ स॒धस्थे॒ त्रैष्टु॑भेन॒ वच॑सा बाधत॒ द्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: náva yád asya navatíṃ ca bhogā́n sākáṃ vájreṇa maghávā vivr̥ścát árcantī́ndram marútaḥ sadhásthe traíṣṭubhena vácasā bādhata dyā́m
stanzas.translation: When Maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nine-and-ninety castles all together, The Maruts, where they met, glorified Indra: ye with the Trishṭup hymn obstructed heaven.

translations.griffith: When Maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nine-and-ninety castles all together, The Maruts, where they met, glorified Indra: ye with the Trishṭup hymn obstructed heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॒ सख्ये॑ अपच॒त्तूय॑म॒ग्निर॒स्य क्रत्वा॑ महि॒षा त्री श॒तानि॑ त्री सा॒कमिन्द्रो॒ मनु॑षः॒ सरां॑सि सु॒तं पि॑बद्वृत्र॒हत्या॑य॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sákhā sákhye apacat tū́yam agnír asyá krátvā mahiṣā́ trī́ śatā́ni trī́ sākám índro mánuṣaḥ sárāṃsi sutám pibad vr̥trahátyāya sómam
stanzas.translation: As friend to aid a friend, Agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes, even as he willed it. And Indra, from man's gift, for Vr̥itra's slaughter, drank ofr at once three lakes of pressed-out Soma.

translations.griffith: As friend to aid a friend, Agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes, even as he willed it. And Indra, from man's gift, for Vr̥itra's slaughter, drank ofr at once three lakes of pressed-out Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्री यच्छ॒ता म॑हि॒षाणा॒मघो॒ मास्त्री सरां॑सि म॒घवा॑ सो॒म्यापाः॑ का॒रं न विश्वे॑ अह्वन्त दे॒वा भर॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ यदहिं॑ ज॒घान॑
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ yác chatā́ mahiṣā́ṇām ágho mā́s trī́ sárāṃsi maghávā somyā́pāḥ kāráṃ ná víśve ahvanta devā́ḥ- bháram índrāya yád áhiṃ jaghā́na
stanzas.translation: When thou three hundred buffaloes' flesh hadst eaten, and drunk, as Maghavan, three lakes of Soma, All the Gods raised as 'twere a shout of triumph to Indra praise because he slew the Dragon.

translations.griffith: When thou three hundred buffaloes' flesh hadst eaten, and drunk, as Maghavan, three lakes of Soma, All the Gods raised as 'twere a shout of triumph to Indra praise because he slew the Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒शना॒ यत्स॑ह॒स्यै॒३॒॑रया॑तं गृ॒हमि॑न्द्र जूजुवा॒नेभि॒रश्वैः॑ व॒न्वा॒नो अत्र॑ स॒रथं॑ ययाथ॒ कुत्से॑न दे॒वैरव॑नोर्ह॒ शुष्ण॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: uśánā yát sahasyaìr áyātaṃ gr̥hám indra jūjuvānébhir áśvaiḥ vanvānó átra saráthaṃ yayātha kútsena devaír ávanor ha śúṣṇam
stanzas.translation: What time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding, O Uṣanâ and Indra, to the dwelling, Thou camest thither -conquering together with Kutsa and the Gods: thou slewest Ṣushṇa.

translations.griffith: What time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding, O Uṣanâ and Indra, to the dwelling, Thou camest thither -conquering together with Kutsa and the Gods: thou slewest Ṣushṇa.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रान्यच्च॒क्रम॑वृहः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ कुत्सा॑या॒न्यद्वरि॑वो॒ यात॑वेऽकः अ॒नासो॒ दस्यूँ॑रमृणो व॒धेन॒ नि दु॑र्यो॒ण आ॑वृणङ्मृ॒ध्रवा॑चः
stanzas.transliteration: prā́nyác cakrám avr̥haḥ sū́ryasya kútsāyānyád várivo yā́tave 'kaḥ anā́so dásyūm̐r amr̥ṇo vadhéna ní duryoṇá āvr̥ṇaṅ mr̥dhrávācaḥ
stanzas.translation: One car-wheel of the Sun thou rolledst forward, and one thou settest free to move for Kutsa. Thou slewest noseless Dasyus with thy weapon, and in their home o'erthrewest hostile speakers.

translations.griffith: One car-wheel of the Sun thou rolledst forward, and one thou settest free to move for Kutsa. Thou slewest noseless Dasyus with thy weapon, and in their home o'erthrewest hostile speakers.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तोमा॑सस्त्वा॒ गौरि॑वीतेरवर्ध॒न्नर॑न्धयो वैदथि॒नाय॒ पिप्रु॑म् आ त्वामृ॒जिश्वा॑ स॒ख्याय॑ चक्रे॒ पच॑न्प॒क्तीरपि॑बः॒ सोम॑मस्य
stanzas.transliteration: stómāsas tvā gaúrivīter avardhann árandhayo vaidathinā́ya píprum ā́ tvā́m r̥jíśvā sakhyā́ya cakre pácan paktī́r ápibaḥ sómam asya
stanzas.translation: The lauds of Gaurivîti made thee mighty to Vidathin's son, as prey, thou gavest Pipru. R̥ijiṣvan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food, and thou hast drunk his Soma.

translations.griffith: The lauds of Gaurivîti made thee mighty to Vidathin's son, as prey, thou gavest Pipru. R̥ijiṣvan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food, and thou hast drunk his Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: नव॑ग्वासः सु॒तसो॑मास॒ इन्द्रं॒ दश॑ग्वासो अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः गव्यं॑ चिदू॒र्वम॑पि॒धान॑वन्तं॒ तं चि॒न्नरः॑ शशमा॒ना अप॑ व्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: návagvāsaḥ sutásomāsa índraṃ dáśagvāso abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ gávyaṃ cid ūrvám apidhā́navantaṃ táṃ cin náraḥ śaśamānā́ ápa vran
stanzas.translation: Navagvas and Dasgvas with libations of Soma juice sing hymns of praise to Indra. Labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of Kine though firmly closed and fastened.

translations.griffith: Navagvas and Dasgvas with libations of Soma juice sing hymns of praise to Indra. Labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of Kine though firmly closed and fastened.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒थो नु ते॒ परि॑ चराणि वि॒द्वान्वी॒र्या॑ मघव॒न्या च॒कर्थ॑ या चो॒ नु नव्या॑ कृ॒णवः॑ शविष्ठ॒ प्रेदु॒ ता ते॑ वि॒दथे॑षु ब्रवाम
stanzas.transliteration: kathó nú te pári carāṇi vidvā́n vīryā̀ maghavan yā́ cakártha yā́ co nú návyā kr̥ṇávaḥ śaviṣṭha préd u tā́ te vidátheṣu bravāma
stanzas.translation: How shall I serve thee, Maghavan, though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished? And the fresh deeds which thou wilt do, Most Mighty! these, too, will we tell forth in sacred synods.

translations.griffith: How shall I serve thee, Maghavan, though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished? And the fresh deeds which thou wilt do, Most Mighty! these, too, will we tell forth in sacred synods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता विश्वा॑ चकृ॒वाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ भूर्यप॑रीतो ज॒नुषा॑ वी॒र्ये॑ण या चि॒न्नु व॑ज्रिन्कृ॒णवो॑ दधृ॒ष्वान्न ते॑ व॒र्ता तवि॑ष्या अस्ति॒ तस्याः॑
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ víśvā cakr̥vā́m̐ indra bhū́ri- áparīto janúṣā vīryèṇa yā́ cin nú vajrin kr̥ṇávo dadhr̥ṣvā́n ná te vartā́ táviṣyā asti tásyāḥ
stanzas.translation: Resistless from of old through hero courage, thou hast done all these many acts, O Indra. What thou wilt do in bravery, Thunder-wielder! none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.

translations.griffith: Resistless from of old through hero courage, thou hast done all these many acts, O Indra. What thou wilt do in bravery, Thunder-wielder! none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ ब्रह्म॑ क्रि॒यमा॑णा जुषस्व॒ या ते॑ शविष्ठ॒ नव्या॒ अक॑र्म वस्त्रे॑व भ॒द्रा सुकृ॑ता वसू॒यू रथं॒ न धीरः॒ स्वपा॑ अतक्षम्
stanzas.transliteration: índra bráhma kriyámāṇā juṣasva yā́ te śaviṣṭha návyā ákarma vástreva bhadrā́ súkr̥tā vasūyúḥ- ráthaṃ ná dhī́raḥ svápā atakṣam
stanzas.translation: Indra, accept the prayers which now are offered, accept the new prayers, Mightiest! which we utter. Like fair and well-made robes, I, seeking riches, as a deft craftsman makes a car, have wrought them.

translations.griffith: Indra, accept the prayers which now are offered, accept the new prayers, Mightiest! which we utter. Like fair and well-made robes, I, seeking riches, as a deft craftsman makes a car, have wrought them.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्व१॒॑ स्य वी॒रः को अ॑पश्य॒दिन्द्रं॑ सु॒खर॑थ॒मीय॑मानं॒ हरि॑भ्याम् यो रा॒या व॒ज्री सु॒तसो॑ममि॒च्छन्तदोको॒ गन्ता॑ पुरुहू॒त ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: kvà syá vīráḥ kó apaśyad índraṃ sukháratham ī́yamānaṃ háribhyām yó rāyā́ vajrī́ sutásomam ichán tád óko gántā puruhūtá ūtī́
stanzas.translation: WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers, Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?

translations.griffith: WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers, Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?

stanzas.sanskrit: अवा॑चचक्षं प॒दम॑स्य स॒स्वरु॒ग्रं नि॑धा॒तुरन्वा॑यमि॒च्छन् अपृ॑च्छम॒न्याँ उ॒त ते म॑ आहु॒रिन्द्रं॒ नरो॑ बुबुधा॒ना अ॑शेम
stanzas.transliteration: ávācacakṣam padám asya sasvár ugráṃ nidhātúr ánv āyam ichán ápr̥cham anyā́m̐ utá té ma āhur índraṃ náro bubudhānā́ aśema
stanzas.translation: I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation. I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.

translations.griffith: I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation. I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र नु व॒यं सु॒ते या ते॑ कृ॒तानीन्द्र॒ ब्रवा॑म॒ यानि॑ नो॒ जुजो॑षः वेद॒दवि॑द्वाञ्छृ॒णव॑च्च वि॒द्वान्वह॑ते॒ऽयं म॒घवा॒ सर्व॑सेनः
stanzas.transliteration: prá nú vayáṃ suté yā́ te kr̥tā́ni- -índra brávāma yā́ni no jújoṣaḥ védad ávidvāñ chr̥ṇávac ca vidvā́n váhate 'yám maghávā sárvasenaḥ
stanzas.translation: We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us. Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.

translations.griffith: We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us. Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्थि॒रं मन॑श्चकृषे जा॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ वेषीदेको॑ यु॒धये॒ भूय॑सश्चित् अश्मा॑नं चि॒च्छव॑सा दिद्युतो॒ वि वि॒दो गवा॑मू॒र्वमु॒स्रिया॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: sthirám mánaś cakr̥ṣe jātá indra véṣī́d éko yudháye bhū́yasaś cit áśmānaṃ cic chávasā didyuto ví vidó gávām ūrvám usríyāṇām
stanzas.translation: Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many. With might thou clavest e'en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.

translations.griffith: Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many. With might thou clavest e'en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒रो यत्त्वं प॑र॒म आ॒जनि॑ष्ठाः परा॒वति॒ श्रुत्यं॒ नाम॒ बिभ्र॑त् अत॑श्चि॒दिन्द्रा॑दभयन्त दे॒वा विश्वा॑ अ॒पो अ॑जयद्दा॒सप॑त्नीः
stanzas.transliteration: paró yát tvám paramá ājániṣṭhāḥ parāváti śrútyaṃ nā́ma bíbhrat átaś cid índrād abhayanta devā́ḥ- víśvā apó ajayad dāsápatnīḥ
stanzas.translation: When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions, Since then e'en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dâsa.

translations.griffith: When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions, Since then e'en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dâsa.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्येदे॒ते म॒रुतः॑ सु॒शेवा॒ अर्च॑न्त्य॒र्कं सु॒न्वन्त्यन्धः॑ अहि॑मोहा॒नम॒प आ॒शया॑नं॒ प्र मा॒याभि॑र्मा॒यिनं॑ सक्ष॒दिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyéd eté marútaḥ suśévāḥ- árcanty arkáṃ sunvánty ándhaḥ áhim ohānám apá āśáyānam prá māyā́bhir māyínaṃ sakṣad índraḥ
stanzas.translation: These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma. Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.

translations.griffith: These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma. Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि षू मृधो॑ ज॒नुषा॒ दान॒मिन्व॒न्नह॒न्गवा॑ मघवन्त्संचका॒नः अत्रा॑ दा॒सस्य॒ नमु॑चेः॒ शिरो॒ यदव॑र्तयो॒ मन॑वे गा॒तुमि॒च्छन्
stanzas.transliteration: ví ṣū́ mŕ̥dho janúṣā dā́nam ínvann áhan gávā maghavan saṃcakānáḥ átrā dāsásya námuceḥ śíro yád ávartayo mánave gātúm ichán
stanzas.translation: Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver. There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dâsa.

translations.griffith: Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver. There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dâsa.

stanzas.sanskrit: युजं॒ हि मामकृ॑था॒ आदिदि॑न्द्र॒ शिरो॑ दा॒सस्य॒ नमु॑चेर्मथा॒यन् अश्मा॑नं चित्स्व॒र्यं१॒॑ वर्त॑मानं॒ प्र च॒क्रिये॑व॒ रोद॑सी म॒रुद्भ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yújaṃ hí mā́m ákr̥thā ā́d íd indra śíro dāsásya námucer mathāyán áśmānaṃ cit svaryàṃ vártamānam prá cakríyeva ródasī marúdbhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Pounding the head of Namuci the Dâsa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra! Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.

translations.griffith: Pounding the head of Namuci the Dâsa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra! Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्त्रियो॒ हि दा॒स आयु॑धानि च॒क्रे किं मा॑ करन्नब॒ला अ॑स्य॒ सेनाः॑ अ॒न्तर्ह्यख्य॑दु॒भे अ॑स्य॒ धेने॒ अथोप॒ प्रैद्यु॒धये॒ दस्यु॒मिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: stríyo hí dāsá ā́yudhāni cakré kím mā karann abalā́ asya sénāḥ antár hy ákhyad ubhé asya dhéne áthópa praíd yudháye dásyum índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Women for weapons hath the Dâsa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me? Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.

translations.griffith: Women for weapons hath the Dâsa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me? Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: समत्र॒ गावो॒ऽभितो॑ऽनवन्ते॒हेह॑ व॒त्सैर्वियु॑ता॒ यदास॑न् सं ता इन्द्रो॑ असृजदस्य शा॒कैर्यदीं॒ सोमा॑सः॒ सुषु॑ता॒ अम॑न्दन्
stanzas.transliteration: sám átra gā́vo 'bhíto 'navanta- -ihéha vatsaír víyutā yád ā́san sáṃ tā́ índro asr̥jad asya śākaír yád īṃ sómāsaḥ súṣutā ámandan
stanzas.translation: Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither. These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.

translations.griffith: Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither. These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदीं॒ सोमा॑ ब॒भ्रुधू॑ता॒ अम॑न्द॒न्नरो॑रवीद्वृष॒भः साद॑नेषु पु॒रं॒द॒रः प॑पि॒वाँ इन्द्रो॑ अस्य॒ पुन॒र्गवा॑मददादु॒स्रिया॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yád īṃ sómā babhrúdhūtā ámandann ároravīd vr̥ṣabháḥ sā́daneṣu puraṃdaráḥ papivā́m̐ índro asya púnar gávām adadād usríyāṇām
stanzas.translation: What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations. So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.

translations.griffith: What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations. So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒द्रमि॒दं रु॒शमा॑ अग्ने अक्र॒न्गवां॑ च॒त्वारि॒ दद॑तः स॒हस्रा॑ ऋ॒णं॒च॒यस्य॒ प्रय॑ता म॒घानि॒ प्रत्य॑ग्रभीष्म॒ नृत॑मस्य नृ॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: bhadrám idáṃ ruśámā agne akran gávāṃ catvā́ri dádataḥ sahásrā r̥ṇaṃcayásya práyatā maghā́ni práty agrabhīṣma nŕ̥tamasya nr̥ṇā́m
stanzas.translation: This good deed have the Ruṣamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle. We have received R̥iṇanchaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.

translations.griffith: This good deed have the Ruṣamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle. We have received R̥iṇanchaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒पेश॑सं॒ माव॑ सृज॒न्त्यस्तं॒ गवां॑ स॒हस्रै॑ रु॒शमा॑सो अग्ने ती॒व्रा इन्द्र॑मममन्दुः सु॒तासो॒ऽक्तोर्व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ परि॑तक्म्यायाः
stanzas.transliteration: supéśasam mā́va sr̥janty ástaṃ gávāṃ sahásrai ruśámāso agne tīvrā́ índram amamanduḥ sutā́so -aktór vyùṣṭau páritakmyāyāḥ
stanzas.translation: The Ruṣamas, O Agni, sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands. The strong libations have made Indra joyful, when night, whose course was ending, changed to morning.

translations.griffith: The Ruṣamas, O Agni, sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands. The strong libations have made Indra joyful, when night, whose course was ending, changed to morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: औच्छ॒त्सा रात्री॒ परि॑तक्म्या॒ याँ ऋ॑णंच॒ये राज॑नि रु॒शमा॑नाम् अत्यो॒ न वा॒जी र॒घुर॒ज्यमा॑नो ब॒भ्रुश्च॒त्वार्य॑सनत्स॒हस्रा॑
stanzas.transliteration: aúchat sā́ rā́trī páritakmyā yā́m̐ r̥ṇaṃcayé rā́jani ruśámānām átyo ná vājī́ raghúr ajyámāno babhrúś catvā́ry asanat sahásrā
stanzas.translation: Night, well-nigh ended, at R̥iṇanchaya's coming, King of the Ruṣamas, was changed to morning. Like a strong courser, fleet of foot, urged onward, Babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.

translations.griffith: Night, well-nigh ended, at R̥iṇanchaya's coming, King of the Ruṣamas, was changed to morning. Like a strong courser, fleet of foot, urged onward, Babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.

stanzas.sanskrit: चतुः॑सहस्रं॒ गव्य॑स्य प॒श्वः प्रत्य॑ग्रभीष्म रु॒शमे॑ष्वग्ने घ॒र्मश्चि॑त्त॒प्तः प्र॒वृजे॒ य आसी॑दय॒स्मय॒स्तम्वादा॑म॒ विप्राः॑
stanzas.transliteration: cátuḥsahasraṃ gávyasya paśváḥ práty agrabhīṣma ruśámeṣv agne gharmáś cit taptáḥ pravŕ̥je yá ā́sīd ayasmáyas táṃ v ā́dāma víprāḥ
stanzas.translation: We have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the Ruṣamas, O Agni. And we, the singers, have received the caldron of metal which was heated for Pravargya.

translations.griffith: We have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the Ruṣamas, O Agni. And we, the singers, have received the caldron of metal which was heated for Pravargya.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ रथा॑य प्र॒वतं॑ कृणोति॒ यम॒ध्यस्था॑न्म॒घवा॑ वाज॒यन्त॑म् यू॒थेव॑ प॒श्वो व्यु॑नोति गो॒पा अरि॑ष्टो याति प्रथ॒मः सिषा॑सन्
stanzas.transliteration: índro ráthāya pravátaṃ kr̥ṇoti yám adhyásthān maghávā vājayántam yūthéva paśvó vy ùnoti gopā́ḥ- áriṣṭo yāti prathamáḥ síṣāsan
stanzas.translation: MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted. Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.

translations.griffith: MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted. Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ प्र द्र॑व हरिवो॒ मा वि वे॑नः॒ पिश॑ङ्गराते अ॒भि नः॑ सचस्व न॒हि त्वदि॑न्द्र॒ वस्यो॑ अ॒न्यदस्त्य॑मे॒नाँश्चि॒ज्जनि॑वतश्चकर्थ
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ prá drava harivo mā́ ví venaḥ píśaṅgarāte abhí naḥ sacasva nahí tvád indra vásyo anyád ásti- amenā́ṃś cij jánivataś cakartha
stanzas.translation: Haste to us, Lord of Bays; be not ungracious: visit us, lover of gold-hued oblation. There is naught else better than thou art, Indra: e'en to the wifeless hast thou given spouses.

translations.griffith: Haste to us, Lord of Bays; be not ungracious: visit us, lover of gold-hued oblation. There is naught else better than thou art, Indra: e'en to the wifeless hast thou given spouses.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद्यत्सहः॒ सह॑स॒ आज॑निष्ट॒ देदि॑ष्ट॒ इन्द्र॑ इन्द्रि॒याणि॒ विश्वा॑ प्राचो॑दयत्सु॒दुघा॑ व॒व्रे अ॒न्तर्वि ज्योति॑षा संववृ॒त्वत्तमो॑ऽवः
stanzas.transliteration: úd yát sáhaḥ sáhasa ā́janiṣṭa dédiṣṭa índra indriyā́ṇi víśvā prā́codayat sudúghā vavré antár ví jyótiṣā saṃvavr̥tvát támo 'vaḥ
stanzas.translation: When out of strength arose the strength that conquers, Indra displayed all powers that he possesses. Forth from the cave he drove the milky mothers, and with the light laid bare investing darkness.

translations.griffith: When out of strength arose the strength that conquers, Indra displayed all powers that he possesses. Forth from the cave he drove the milky mothers, and with the light laid bare investing darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: अन॑वस्ते॒ रथ॒मश्वा॑य तक्ष॒न्त्वष्टा॒ वज्रं॑ पुरुहूत द्यु॒मन्त॑म् ब्र॒ह्माण॒ इन्द्रं॑ म॒हय॑न्तो अ॒र्कैरव॑र्धय॒न्नह॑ये॒ हन्त॒वा उ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánavas te rátham áśvāya takṣan tváṣṭā vájram puruhūta dyumántam brahmā́ṇa índram maháyanto arkaír ávardhayann áhaye hántavā́ u
stanzas.translation: Anus have wrought a chariot for thy Courser, and Tvashṭar, Much-invoked! thy bolt that glitters. The Brahmans with their songs exalting Indra increased his strength that he might slaughter Ahi.

translations.griffith: Anus have wrought a chariot for thy Courser, and Tvashṭar, Much-invoked! thy bolt that glitters. The Brahmans with their songs exalting Indra increased his strength that he might slaughter Ahi.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृष्णे॒ यत्ते॒ वृष॑णो अ॒र्कमर्चा॒निन्द्र॒ ग्रावा॑णो॒ अदि॑तिः स॒जोषाः॑ अ॒न॒श्वासो॒ ये प॒वयो॑ऽर॒था इन्द्रे॑षिता अ॒भ्यव॑र्तन्त॒ दस्यू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣṇe yát te vŕ̥ṣaṇo arkám árcān índra grā́vāṇo áditiḥ sajóṣāḥ anaśvā́so yé paváyo 'rathā́ḥ- índreṣitā abhy ávartanta dásyūn
stanzas.translation: When heroes sang their laud to thee the Hero, Indra! and stones and Aditi accordant, Without or steed or chariot were the fellies which, sped by Indra, rolled upon the Dasytis.

translations.griffith: When heroes sang their laud to thee the Hero, Indra! and stones and Aditi accordant, Without or steed or chariot were the fellies which, sped by Indra, rolled upon the Dasytis.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॒ पूर्वा॑णि॒ कर॑णानि वोचं॒ प्र नूत॑ना मघव॒न्या च॒कर्थ॑ शक्ती॑वो॒ यद्वि॒भरा॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे जय॑न्न॒पो मन॑वे॒ दानु॑चित्राः
stanzas.transliteration: prá te pū́rvāṇi káraṇāni vocam prá nū́tanā maghavan yā́ cakártha śáktīvo yád vibhárā ródasī ubhé jáyann apó mánave dā́nucitrāḥ
stanzas.translation: I will declare thine exploits wrought aforetime, and, Maghavan, thy deeds of late achievement, When, Lord of Might, thou sunderedst earth and heaven, winning for man the moistly-gleaming waters.

translations.griffith: I will declare thine exploits wrought aforetime, and, Maghavan, thy deeds of late achievement, When, Lord of Might, thou sunderedst earth and heaven, winning for man the moistly-gleaming waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: तदिन्नु ते॒ कर॑णं दस्म वि॒प्राहिं॒ यद्घ्नन्नोजो॒ अत्रामि॑मीथाः शुष्ण॑स्य चि॒त्परि॑ मा॒या अ॑गृभ्णाः प्रपि॒त्वं यन्नप॒ दस्यूँ॑रसेधः
stanzas.transliteration: tád ín nú te káraṇaṃ dasma vipra- -áhiṃ yád ghnánn ójo átrā́mimīthāḥ śúṣṇasya cit pári māyā́ agr̥bhṇāḥ prapitváṃ yánn ápa dásyūm̐r asedhaḥ
stanzas.translation: This is thy deed, e'en this, Wonderful! Singer! that, slaying Ahi, here thy strength thou showedst, Didst check and stay e'en gusna's wiles and magic, and, drawing nigh, didst chase away the Dasytis.

translations.griffith: This is thy deed, e'en this, Wonderful! Singer! that, slaying Ahi, here thy strength thou showedst, Didst check and stay e'en gusna's wiles and magic, and, drawing nigh, didst chase away the Dasytis.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॒पो यद॑वे तु॒र्वशा॒यार॑मयः सु॒दुघाः॑ पा॒र इ॑न्द्र उ॒ग्रम॑यात॒मव॑हो ह॒ कुत्सं॒ सं ह॒ यद्वा॑मु॒शनार॑न्त दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám apó yádave turváśāya- -áramayaḥ sudúghāḥ pārá indra ugrám ayātam ávaho ha kútsaṃ sáṃ ha yád vām uśánā́ranta devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, on the farther bank forYadu and Turvaga didst stay the gushing waters. Ye both assailed the fierce: thou barest Kutsa: when Gods and Uṣanâ came to you together.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, on the farther bank forYadu and Turvaga didst stay the gushing waters. Ye both assailed the fierce: thou barest Kutsa: when Gods and Uṣanâ came to you together.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑कुत्सा॒ वह॑माना॒ रथे॒ना वा॒मत्या॒ अपि॒ कर्णे॑ वहन्तु निः षी॑म॒द्भ्यो धम॑थो॒ निः ष॒धस्था॑न्म॒घोनो॑ हृ॒दो व॑रथ॒स्तमां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: índrākutsā váhamānā ráthena- -ā́ vām átyā ápi kárṇe vahantu níḥ ṣīm adbhyó dhámatho níḥ ṣadhásthāt- maghóno hr̥dó varathas támāṃsi
stanzas.translation: Let the steeds bring you both, Indra and Kutsa, borne on the chariot within hearing-distance. Ye blew him from the waters, from his dwelling, and chased the darkness from the noble's spirit.

translations.griffith: Let the steeds bring you both, Indra and Kutsa, borne on the chariot within hearing-distance. Ye blew him from the waters, from his dwelling, and chased the darkness from the noble's spirit.

stanzas.sanskrit: वात॑स्य यु॒क्तान्त्सु॒युज॑श्चि॒दश्वा॑न्क॒विश्चि॑दे॒षो अ॑जगन्नव॒स्युः विश्वे॑ ते॒ अत्र॑ म॒रुतः॒ सखा॑य॒ इन्द्र॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ तवि॑षीमवर्धन्
stanzas.transliteration: vā́tasya yuktā́n suyújaś cid áśvān kavíś cid eṣó ajagann avasyúḥ víśve te átra marútaḥ sákhāyaḥ- índra bráhmāṇi táviṣīm avardhan
stanzas.translation: Even this sage hath come looking for succour even to Vâta's docile harnessed horses. Here are the Maruts, all, thy dear companions: prayers have increased thy power and might, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Even this sage hath come looking for succour even to Vâta's docile harnessed horses. Here are the Maruts, all, thy dear companions: prayers have increased thy power and might, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: सूर॑श्चि॒द्रथं॒ परि॑तक्म्यायां॒ पूर्वं॑ कर॒दुप॑रं जूजु॒वांस॑म् भर॑च्च॒क्रमेत॑शः॒ सं रि॑णाति पु॒रो दध॑त्सनिष्यति॒ क्रतुं॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: sū́raś cid rátham páritakmyāyām pū́rvaṃ karad úparaṃ jūjuvā́ṃsam bhárac cakrám étaśaḥ sáṃ riṇāti puró dádhat saniṣyati krátuṃ naḥ
stanzas.translation: When night was near its close he carried forward e'en the Sun's chariot backward in its running. Etaga brought his wheel and firmly stays it: setting it eastward he shall give us courage.

translations.griffith: When night was near its close he carried forward e'en the Sun's chariot backward in its running. Etaga brought his wheel and firmly stays it: setting it eastward he shall give us courage.

stanzas.sanskrit: आयं ज॑ना अभि॒चक्षे॑ जगा॒मेन्द्रः॒ सखा॑यं सु॒तसो॑ममि॒च्छन् वद॒न्ग्रावाव॒ वेदिं॑ भ्रियाते॒ यस्य॑ जी॒रम॑ध्व॒र्यव॒श्चर॑न्ति
stanzas.transliteration: ā́yáṃ janā abhicákṣe jagāma- -índraḥ sákhāyaṃ sutásomam ichán vádan grā́vā́va védim bhriyāte yásya jīrám adhvaryávaś cáranti
stanzas.translation: This Indra, O ye men, hath come to see you, seeking a friend who hath expressed the Soma. The creaking stone is laid upon the altar, and the Adhvaryus come to turn it quickly.

translations.griffith: This Indra, O ye men, hath come to see you, seeking a friend who hath expressed the Soma. The creaking stone is laid upon the altar, and the Adhvaryus come to turn it quickly.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये चा॒कन॑न्त चा॒कन॑न्त॒ नू ते मर्ता॑ अमृत॒ मो ते अंह॒ आर॑न् वा॒व॒न्धि यज्यूँ॑रु॒त तेषु॑ धे॒ह्योजो॒ जने॑षु॒ येषु॑ ते॒ स्याम॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé cākánanta cākánanta nū́ té mártā amr̥ta mó té áṃha ā́ran vāvandhí yájyūm̐r utá téṣu dhehi- ójo jáneṣu yéṣu te syā́ma
stanzas.translation: Let mortals who were happy still be happy; let them not come to sorrow, O Immortal. Love thou the pious, and to these thy people-with whom may we be numbered-give thou vigour.

translations.griffith: Let mortals who were happy still be happy; let them not come to sorrow, O Immortal. Love thou the pious, and to these thy people-with whom may we be numbered-give thou vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अद॑र्द॒रुत्स॒मसृ॑जो॒ वि खानि॒ त्वम॑र्ण॒वान्ब॑द्बधा॒नाँ अ॑रम्णाः म॒हान्त॑मिन्द्र॒ पर्व॑तं॒ वि यद्वः सृ॒जो वि धारा॒ अव॑ दान॒वं ह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ádardar útsam ásr̥jo ví khā́ni tvám arṇavā́n badbadhānā́m̐ aramṇāḥ mahā́ntam indra párvataṃ ví yád váḥ sr̥jó ví dhā́rā áva dānaváṃ han
stanzas.translation: THE well thou clavest, settest free the fountains, and gavest rest to floods that were obstructed. Thou, Indra, laying the great mountain open, slaying the Dânava, didst loose the torrents.

translations.griffith: THE well thou clavest, settest free the fountains, and gavest rest to floods that were obstructed. Thou, Indra, laying the great mountain open, slaying the Dânava, didst loose the torrents.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वमुत्साँ॑ ऋ॒तुभि॑र्बद्बधा॒नाँ अरं॑ह॒ ऊधः॒ पर्व॑तस्य वज्रिन् अहिं॑ चिदुग्र॒ प्रयु॑तं॒ शया॑नं जघ॒न्वाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ तवि॑षीमधत्थाः
stanzas.transliteration: tvám útsām̐ r̥túbhir badbadhānā́m̐ áraṃha ū́dhaḥ párvatasya vajrin áhiṃ cid ugra práyutaṃ śáyānaṃ jaghanvā́m̐ indra táviṣīm adhatthāḥ
stanzas.translation: The fountain-depths obstructed in their seasons, thou, Thunderer! madest flow, the mountain's udder. Strong Indra, thou by slaying e'en the Dragon that lay extended there hast shown thy vigour.

translations.griffith: The fountain-depths obstructed in their seasons, thou, Thunderer! madest flow, the mountain's udder. Strong Indra, thou by slaying e'en the Dragon that lay extended there hast shown thy vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यस्य॑ चिन्मह॒तो निर्मृ॒गस्य॒ वध॑र्जघान॒ तवि॑षीभि॒रिन्द्रः॑ य एक॒ इद॑प्र॒तिर्मन्य॑मान॒ आद॑स्माद॒न्यो अ॑जनिष्ट॒ तव्या॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: tyásya cin maható nír mr̥gásya vádhar jaghāna táviṣībhir índraḥ yá éka íd apratír mányamānaḥ- ā́d asmād anyó ajaniṣṭa távyān
stanzas.translation: Indra with violence smote down the weapon, yea, even of that wild and mighty creature. Although he deemed himself alone unequalled, another had been born e'en yet more potent.

translations.griffith: Indra with violence smote down the weapon, yea, even of that wild and mighty creature. Although he deemed himself alone unequalled, another had been born e'en yet more potent.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यं चि॑देषां स्व॒धया॒ मद॑न्तं मि॒हो नपा॑तं सु॒वृधं॑ तमो॒गाम् वृष॑प्रभर्मा दान॒वस्य॒ भामं॒ वज्रे॑ण व॒ज्री नि ज॑घान॒ शुष्ण॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tyáṃ cid eṣāṃ svadháyā mádantam mihó nápātaṃ suvŕ̥dhaṃ tamogā́m vŕ̥ṣaprabharmā dānavásya bhā́maṃ vájreṇa vajrī́ ní jaghāna śúṣṇam
stanzas.translation: Him, whom the heavenly food of these delighted, child of the mist, strong waxing, couched in darkness, Him the bolt-hurling Thunderer with his lightning smote down and slew, the Dânava's wrath-fire, Ṣushṇa.

translations.griffith: Him, whom the heavenly food of these delighted, child of the mist, strong waxing, couched in darkness, Him the bolt-hurling Thunderer with his lightning smote down and slew, the Dânava's wrath-fire, Ṣushṇa.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यं चि॑दस्य॒ क्रतु॑भि॒र्निष॑त्तमम॒र्मणो॑ वि॒ददिद॑स्य॒ मर्म॑ यदीं॑ सुक्षत्र॒ प्रभृ॑ता॒ मद॑स्य॒ युयु॑त्सन्तं॒ तम॑सि ह॒र्म्ये धाः
stanzas.transliteration: tyáṃ cid asya krátubhir níṣattam amarmáṇo vidád íd asya márma yád īṃ sukṣatra prábhr̥tā mádasya yúyutsantaṃ támasi harmyé dhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Though he might ne'er be wounded still his vitals felt that, the God's bolt, which his powers supported, When, after offered draughts, Strong Lord, thou laidest him, fain to battle, in the pit in darkness.

translations.griffith: Though he might ne'er be wounded still his vitals felt that, the God's bolt, which his powers supported, When, after offered draughts, Strong Lord, thou laidest him, fain to battle, in the pit in darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यं चि॑दि॒त्था क॑त्प॒यं शया॑नमसू॒र्ये तम॑सि वावृधा॒नम् तं चि॑न्मन्दा॒नो वृ॑ष॒भः सु॒तस्यो॒च्चैरिन्द्रो॑ अप॒गूर्या॑ जघान
stanzas.transliteration: tyáṃ cid itthā́ katpayáṃ śáyānam asūryé támasi vāvr̥dhānám táṃ cin mandānó vr̥ṣabháḥ sutásya- -uccaír índro apagū́ryā jaghāna
stanzas.translation: Him as he lay there huge in length extended, still waxing in the gloom which no sun lightened, Him, after loud-voiced threats, the Hero Indra, rejoicing in the poured libation, slaughtered.

translations.griffith: Him as he lay there huge in length extended, still waxing in the gloom which no sun lightened, Him, after loud-voiced threats, the Hero Indra, rejoicing in the poured libation, slaughtered.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद्यदिन्द्रो॑ मह॒ते दा॑न॒वाय॒ वध॒र्यमि॑ष्ट॒ सहो॒ अप्र॑तीतम् यदीं॒ वज्र॑स्य॒ प्रभृ॑तौ द॒दाभ॒ विश्व॑स्य ज॒न्तोर॑ध॒मं च॑कार
stanzas.transliteration: úd yád índro mahaté dānavā́ya vádhar yámiṣṭa sáho ápratītam yád īṃ vájrasya prábhr̥tau dadā́bha víśvasya jantór adhamáṃ cakāra
stanzas.translation: When 'gainst the mighty Dânava his weapon Indra uplifted, power which none could combat, When at the hurling of his bolt he smote him, he made him lower than all living creatures.

translations.griffith: When 'gainst the mighty Dânava his weapon Indra uplifted, power which none could combat, When at the hurling of his bolt he smote him, he made him lower than all living creatures.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यं चि॒दर्णं॑ मधु॒पं शया॑नमसि॒न्वं व॒व्रं मह्याद॑दु॒ग्रः अ॒पाद॑म॒त्रं म॑ह॒ता व॒धेन॒ नि दु॑र्यो॒ण आ॑वृणङ्मृ॒ध्रवा॑चम्
stanzas.transliteration: tyáṃ cid árṇam madhupáṃ śáyānam asinváṃ vavrám máhy ā́dad ugráḥ apā́dam atrám mahatā́ vadhéna ní duryoṇá āvr̥ṇaṅ mr̥dhrávācam
stanzas.translation: The fierce God seized that huge and restless coiler, insatiate, drinker of the sweets, recumbent, And with his mighty weapon in his dwelling smote down the footless evil-speaking ogre.

translations.griffith: The fierce God seized that huge and restless coiler, insatiate, drinker of the sweets, recumbent, And with his mighty weapon in his dwelling smote down the footless evil-speaking ogre.

stanzas.sanskrit: को अ॑स्य॒ शुष्मं॒ तवि॑षीं वरात॒ एको॒ धना॑ भरते॒ अप्र॑तीतः इ॒मे चि॑दस्य॒ ज्रय॑सो॒ नु दे॒वी इन्द्र॒स्यौज॑सो भि॒यसा॑ जिहाते
stanzas.transliteration: kó asya śúṣmaṃ táviṣīṃ varāte- éko dhánā bharate ápratītaḥ imé cid asya jráyaso nú devī́ índrasyaújaso bhiyásā jihāte
stanzas.translation: Who may arrest his strength or cheek his vigour? Alone, resistless, he bears off all riches. Even these Twain, these Goddesses, through terror of Indra's might, retire from his dominion.

translations.griffith: Who may arrest his strength or cheek his vigour? Alone, resistless, he bears off all riches. Even these Twain, these Goddesses, through terror of Indra's might, retire from his dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: न्य॑स्मै दे॒वी स्वधि॑तिर्जिहीत॒ इन्द्रा॑य गा॒तुरु॑श॒तीव॑ येमे सं यदोजो॑ यु॒वते॒ विश्व॑माभि॒रनु॑ स्व॒धाव्ने॑ क्षि॒तयो॑ नमन्त
stanzas.transliteration: ny àsmai devī́ svádhitir jihīte- índrāya gātúr uśatī́va yeme sáṃ yád ójo yuváte víśvam ābhir ánu svadhā́vne kṣitáyo namanta
stanzas.translation: E'en the Celestial Axe bows down before him, and the Earth, lover-like, gives way to Indra. As he imparts all vigour to these people, straightway the folk bend them to him the Godlike.

translations.griffith: E'en the Celestial Axe bows down before him, and the Earth, lover-like, gives way to Indra. As he imparts all vigour to these people, straightway the folk bend them to him the Godlike.

stanzas.sanskrit: एकं॒ नु त्वा॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यं जा॒तं शृ॑णोमि य॒शसं॒ जने॑षु तं मे॑ जगृभ्र आ॒शसो॒ नवि॑ष्ठं दो॒षा वस्तो॒र्हव॑मानास॒ इन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ékaṃ nú tvā sátpatim pā́ñcajanyaṃ jātáṃ śr̥ṇomi yaśásaṃ jáneṣu tám me jagr̥bhra āśáso náviṣṭhaṃ doṣā́ vástor hávamānāsa índram
stanzas.translation: I hear that thou wast born sole Lord of heroes of the Five Races, famed among the people. As such my wishes have most lately grasped him, invoking Indra both at eve and morning.

translations.griffith: I hear that thou wast born sole Lord of heroes of the Five Races, famed among the people. As such my wishes have most lately grasped him, invoking Indra both at eve and morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा हि त्वामृ॑तु॒था या॒तय॑न्तं म॒घा विप्रे॑भ्यो॒ दद॑तं शृ॒णोमि॑ किं ते॑ ब्र॒ह्माणो॑ गृहते॒ सखा॑यो॒ ये त्वा॒या नि॑द॒धुः काम॑मिन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ hí tvā́m r̥tuthā́ yātáyantam maghā́ víprebhyo dádataṃ śr̥ṇómi kíṃ te brahmā́ṇo gr̥hate sákhāyo yé tvāyā́ nidadhúḥ kā́mam indra
stanzas.translation: So, too, I hear of thee as in due season urging to action and enriching singers. What have thy friends received from thee, the Brahmans who, faithful, rest their hopes on thee, O Indra?

translations.griffith: So, too, I hear of thee as in due season urging to action and enriching singers. What have thy friends received from thee, the Brahmans who, faithful, rest their hopes on thee, O Indra?

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॑ म॒हे त॒वसे॑ दीध्ये॒ नॄनिन्द्रा॑ये॒त्था त॒वसे॒ अत॑व्यान् यो अ॑स्मै सुम॒तिं वाज॑सातौ स्तु॒तो जने॑ सम॒र्य॑श्चि॒केत॑
stanzas.transliteration: máhi mahé taváse dīdhye nr̥̄́n índrāyetthā́ taváse átavyān yó asmai sumatíṃ vā́jasātau stutó jáne samaryàś cikéta
stanzas.translation: GREAT praise to Indra, great and strong mid heroes, I ponder thus, the feeble to the Mighty, Who with his band shows favour to this people, when lauded, in the fight where spoil is gathered.

translations.griffith: GREAT praise to Indra, great and strong mid heroes, I ponder thus, the feeble to the Mighty, Who with his band shows favour to this people, when lauded, in the fight where spoil is gathered.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं न॑ इन्द्र धियसा॒नो अ॒र्कैर्हरी॑णां वृष॒न्योक्त्र॑मश्रेः या इ॒त्था म॑घव॒न्ननु॒ जोषं॒ वक्षो॑ अ॒भि प्रार्यः स॑क्षि॒ जना॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ na indra dhiyasānó arkaír hárīṇāṃ vr̥ṣan yóktram aśreḥ yā́ itthā́ maghavann ánu jóṣaṃ vákṣo abhí prā́ryáḥ sakṣi jánān
stanzas.translation: So made attentive by our hymns, Steer! Indra! thou fastenedst the girth of thy Bay Coursers, Which, Maghavan, at thy will thou drivest hither. With these subdue for us the men who hate us.

translations.griffith: So made attentive by our hymns, Steer! Indra! thou fastenedst the girth of thy Bay Coursers, Which, Maghavan, at thy will thou drivest hither. With these subdue for us the men who hate us.

stanzas.sanskrit: न ते त॑ इन्द्रा॒भ्य१॒॑स्मदृ॒ष्वायु॑क्तासो अब्र॒ह्मता॒ यदस॑न् तिष्ठा॒ रथ॒मधि॒ तं व॑ज्रह॒स्ता र॒श्मिं दे॑व यमसे॒ स्वश्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ná té ta indrābhy àsmád r̥ṣva- -áyuktāso abrahmátā yád ásan tíṣṭhā rátham ádhi táṃ vajrahasta- -ā́ raśmíṃ deva yamase sváśvaḥ
stanzas.translation: They were not turned to us-wtrd, lofty Indra! while yet through lack of prayer they stood unharnessed. Ascend this chariot, thou whose hand wields thunder, and draw the rein, O Lord of noble horses.

translations.griffith: They were not turned to us-wtrd, lofty Indra! while yet through lack of prayer they stood unharnessed. Ascend this chariot, thou whose hand wields thunder, and draw the rein, O Lord of noble horses.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रू यत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ सन्त्यु॒क्था गवे॑ च॒कर्थो॒र्वरा॑सु॒ युध्य॑न् त॒त॒क्षे सूर्या॑य चि॒दोक॑सि॒ स्वे वृषा॑ स॒मत्सु॑ दा॒सस्य॒ नाम॑ चित्
stanzas.transliteration: purū́ yát ta indra sánty ukthā́ gáve cakárthorvárāsu yúdhyan tatakṣé sū́ryāya cid ókasi své vŕ̥ṣā samátsu dāsásya nā́ma cit
stanzas.translation: Thou, because many lauds are thine, O Indra, wast active warring in the fields for cattle. For Sûrya in his own abode thou, Hero, formedst in fights even a Dâsa's nature.

translations.griffith: Thou, because many lauds are thine, O Indra, wast active warring in the fields for cattle. For Sûrya in his own abode thou, Hero, formedst in fights even a Dâsa's nature.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं ते त॑ इन्द्र॒ ये च॒ नरः॒ शर्धो॑ जज्ञा॒ना या॒ताश्च॒ रथाः॑ आस्माञ्ज॑गम्यादहिशुष्म॒ सत्वा॒ भगो॒ न हव्यः॑ प्रभृ॒थेषु॒ चारुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ té ta indra yé ca náraḥ śárdho jajñānā́ yātā́ś ca ráthāḥ ā́smā́ñ jagamyād ahiśuṣma sátvā bhágo ná hávyaḥ prabhr̥théṣu cā́ruḥ
stanzas.translation: Thine are we, Indra; thine are all these people, conscious of might, whose cars are set in motion. Some hero come to us, O Strong as Ahi beauteous in war, to be invoked like Bhaga.

translations.griffith: Thine are we, Indra; thine are all these people, conscious of might, whose cars are set in motion. Some hero come to us, O Strong as Ahi beauteous in war, to be invoked like Bhaga.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒पृ॒क्षेण्य॑मिन्द्र॒ त्वे ह्योजो॑ नृ॒म्णानि॑ च नृ॒तमा॑नो॒ अम॑र्तः स न॒ एनीं॑ वसवानो र॒यिं दाः॒ प्रार्यः स्तु॑षे तुविम॒घस्य॒ दान॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: papr̥kṣéṇyam indra tvé hy ójo nr̥mṇā́ni ca nr̥támāno ámartaḥ sá na énīṃ vásavāno* rayíṃ dāḥ prā́ryá stuṣe tuvimaghásya dā́nam
stanzas.translation: Strength much to be desired is in thee, Indra: the Immortal dances forth his hero exploits. Such, Lord of Treasure, give us splendid riches. I praise the Friend's gift, his whose wealth is mighty.

translations.griffith: Strength much to be desired is in thee, Indra: the Immortal dances forth his hero exploits. Such, Lord of Treasure, give us splendid riches. I praise the Friend's gift, his whose wealth is mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा न॑ इन्द्रो॒तिभि॑रव पा॒हि गृ॑ण॒तः शू॑र का॒रून् उ॒त त्वचं॒ दद॑तो॒ वाज॑सातौ पिप्री॒हि मध्वः॒ सुषु॑तस्य॒ चारोः॑
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ na indrotíbhir ava pāhí gr̥ṇatáḥ śūra kārū́n utá tvácaṃ dádato vā́jasātau piprīhí mádhvaḥ súṣutasya cā́roḥ
stanzas.translation: Thus favour us, O Indra, with ihy succour; Hero, protect the bards who sing thy praises. Be friendly in the fray to those who offer the skin of beautiful and well-pressed Soma.

translations.griffith: Thus favour us, O Indra, with ihy succour; Hero, protect the bards who sing thy praises. Be friendly in the fray to those who offer the skin of beautiful and well-pressed Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्ये मा॑ पौरुकु॒त्स्यस्य॑ सू॒रेस्त्र॒सद॑स्योर्हिर॒णिनो॒ ररा॑णाः वह॑न्तु मा॒ दश॒ श्येता॑सो अस्य गैरिक्षि॒तस्य॒ क्रतु॑भि॒र्नु स॑श्चे
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyé mā paurukutsyásya sūrés trasádasyor hiraṇíno rárāṇāḥ váhantu mā dáśa śyétāso asya gairikṣitásya krátubhir nú saśce
stanzas.translation: And these ten steeds which Trasadasyu gives me, the goldrich chief, the son of Purukutsa, Resplendent in their brightness shall convey me. Gairikshita willed it and so came I hither.

translations.griffith: And these ten steeds which Trasadasyu gives me, the goldrich chief, the son of Purukutsa, Resplendent in their brightness shall convey me. Gairikshita willed it and so came I hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्ये मा॑ मारु॒ताश्व॑स्य॒ शोणाः॒ क्रत्वा॑मघासो वि॒दथ॑स्य रा॒तौ स॒हस्रा॑ मे॒ च्यव॑तानो॒ ददा॑न आनू॒कम॒र्यो वपु॑षे॒ नार्च॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyé mā mārutā́śvasya śóṇāḥ krátvāmaghāso vidáthasya rātaú sahásrā me cyávatāno dádānaḥ- ānūkám aryó vápuṣe nā́rcat
stanzas.translation: And these, bestowed as sacrificial guerdon, the powerful tawny steeds of Mârutâṣva; And thousands which kind Chyavatâna gave me, abundantly bestowed for my adornment.

translations.griffith: And these, bestowed as sacrificial guerdon, the powerful tawny steeds of Mârutâṣva; And thousands which kind Chyavatâna gave me, abundantly bestowed for my adornment.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्ये मा॑ ध्व॒न्य॑स्य॒ जुष्टा॑ लक्ष्म॒ण्य॑स्य सु॒रुचो॒ यता॑नाः म॒ह्ना रा॒यः सं॒वर॑णस्य॒ ऋषे॑र्व्र॒जं न गावः॒ प्रय॑ता॒ अपि॑ ग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyé mā dhvanyàsya júṣṭāḥ- lakṣmaṇyàsya surúco yátānāḥ mahnā́ rāyáḥ saṃváraṇasya ŕ̥ṣer vrajáṃ ná gā́vaḥ práyatā ápi gman
stanzas.translation: And these commended horses, bright and active, by Dhvanya son of Lakshmaṇa presented, Came unto me, as cows into the R̥ishi Samvaraṇa's stall, with magnitude of riches.

translations.griffith: And these commended horses, bright and active, by Dhvanya son of Lakshmaṇa presented, Came unto me, as cows into the R̥ishi Samvaraṇa's stall, with magnitude of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: अजा॑तशत्रुम॒जरा॒ स्व॑र्व॒त्यनु॑ स्व॒धामि॑ता द॒स्ममी॑यते सु॒नोत॑न॒ पच॑त॒ ब्रह्म॑वाहसे पुरुष्टु॒ताय॑ प्रत॒रं द॑धातन
stanzas.transliteration: ájātaśatrum ajárā svàrvatī ánu svadhā́mitā dasmám īyate sunótana pácata bráhmavāhase puruṣṭutā́ya prataráṃ dadhātana
stanzas.translation: BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds. Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.

translations.griffith: BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds. Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यः सोमे॑न ज॒ठर॒मपि॑प्र॒ताम॑न्दत म॒घवा॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सः यदीं॑ मृ॒गाय॒ हन्त॑वे म॒हाव॑धः स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिमु॒शना॑ व॒धं यम॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ sómena jaṭháram ápiprata- -ámandata maghávā mádhvo ándhasaḥ yád īm mr̥gā́ya hántave mahā́vadhaḥ sahásrabhr̥ṣṭim uśánā vadháṃ yámat
stanzas.translation: He who filled full his belly with the Soma's juice, Maghavan, was delighted with the meath's sweet draught, When Uṣanâ, that he might slay the monstrous beast, gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.

translations.griffith: He who filled full his belly with the Soma's juice, Maghavan, was delighted with the meath's sweet draught, When Uṣanâ, that he might slay the monstrous beast, gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अ॑स्मै घ्रं॒स उ॒त वा॒ य ऊध॑नि॒ सोमं॑ सु॒नोति॒ भव॑ति द्यु॒माँ अह॑ अपा॑प श॒क्रस्त॑त॒नुष्टि॑मूहति त॒नूशु॑भ्रं म॒घवा॒ यः क॑वास॒खः
stanzas.transliteration: yó asmai ghraṃsá utá vā yá ū́dhani sómaṃ sunóti bhávati dyumā́m̐ áha ápāpa śakrás tatanúṣṭim ūhati tanū́śubhram maghávā yáḥ kavāsakháḥ
stanzas.translation: Illustrious is the man whoever presseth out Soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain. The mighty Maghavan who is the sage's Friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.

translations.griffith: Illustrious is the man whoever presseth out Soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain. The mighty Maghavan who is the sage's Friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्याव॑धीत्पि॒तरं॒ यस्य॑ मा॒तरं॒ यस्य॑ श॒क्रो भ्रात॑रं॒ नात॑ ईषते वेतीद्व॑स्य॒ प्रय॑ता यतंक॒रो न किल्बि॑षादीषते॒ वस्व॑ आक॒रः
stanzas.transliteration: yásyā́vadhīt pitáraṃ yásya mātáraṃ yásya śakró bhrā́taraṃ nā́ta īṣate vétī́d v asya práyatā yataṃkaró ná kílbiṣād īṣate vásva ākaráḥ
stanzas.translation: The Strong God doth not flee away from him whose sire, whose mother or whose brother he hath done to death. He, the Avenger, seeketh this man's offered gifts: this God, the source of riches, doth not flee from sin.

translations.griffith: The Strong God doth not flee away from him whose sire, whose mother or whose brother he hath done to death. He, the Avenger, seeketh this man's offered gifts: this God, the source of riches, doth not flee from sin.

stanzas.sanskrit: न प॒ञ्चभि॑र्द॒शभि॑र्वष्ट्या॒रभं॒ नासु॑न्वता सचते॒ पुष्य॑ता च॒न जि॒नाति॒ वेद॑मु॒या हन्ति॑ वा॒ धुनि॒रा दे॑व॒युं भ॑जति॒ गोम॑ति व्र॒जे
stanzas.transliteration: ná pañcábhir daśábhir vaṣṭy ārábhaṃ nā́sunvatā sacate púṣyatā caná jinā́ti véd amuyā́ hánti vā dhúnir ā́ devayúm bhajati gómati vrajé
stanzas.translation: He seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid, nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering well. The Shaker conquers or slays in this way or that, and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.

translations.griffith: He seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid, nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering well. The Shaker conquers or slays in this way or that, and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒त्वक्ष॑णः॒ समृ॑तौ चक्रमास॒जोऽसु॑न्वतो॒ विषु॑णः सुन्व॒तो वृ॒धः इन्द्रो॒ विश्व॑स्य दमि॒ता वि॒भीष॑णो यथाव॒शं न॑यति॒ दास॒मार्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vitvákṣaṇaḥ sámr̥tau cakramāsajó -ásunvato víṣuṇaḥ sunvató vr̥dháḥ índro víśvasya damitā́ vibhī́ṣaṇo yathāvaśáṃ nayati dā́sam ā́ryaḥ
stanzas.translation: Exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel, and, hating him who pours not, prospers him who pours. Indra the terrible, tamer of every man, as Ârya leads away the Dâsa at his will.

translations.griffith: Exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel, and, hating him who pours not, prospers him who pours. Indra the terrible, tamer of every man, as Ârya leads away the Dâsa at his will.

stanzas.sanskrit: समीं॑ प॒णेर॑जति॒ भोज॑नं मु॒षे वि दा॒शुषे॑ भजति सू॒नरं॒ वसु॑ दु॒र्गे च॒न ध्रि॑यते॒ विश्व॒ आ पु॒रु जनो॒ यो अ॑स्य॒ तवि॑षी॒मचु॑क्रुधत्
stanzas.transliteration: sám īm paṇér ajati bhójanam muṣé ví dāśúṣe bhajati sūnáraṃ vásu durgé caná dhriyate víśva ā́ purú jáno yó asya táviṣīm ácukrudhat
stanzas.translation: He gathers up for plunder all the niggard's gear: excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts. Not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might.

translations.griffith: He gathers up for plunder all the niggard's gear: excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts. Not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं यज्जनौ॑ सु॒धनौ॑ वि॒श्वश॑र्धसा॒ववे॒दिन्द्रो॑ म॒घवा॒ गोषु॑ शु॒भ्रिषु॑ युजं॒ ह्य१॒॑न्यमकृ॑त प्रवेप॒न्युदीं॒ गव्यं॑ सृजते॒ सत्व॑भि॒र्धुनिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ yáj jánau sudhánau viśváśardhasāv áved índro maghávā góṣu śubhríṣu yújaṃ hy ànyám ákr̥ta pravepanī́- úd īṃ gávyaṃ sr̥jate sátvabhir dhúniḥ
stanzas.translation: When Indra Maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers, He who stirs all things takes one as his close ally, and, Shaker, with his Heroes, sends the kine to him.

translations.griffith: When Indra Maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers, He who stirs all things takes one as his close ally, and, Shaker, with his Heroes, sends the kine to him.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒ह॒स्र॒सामाग्नि॑वेशिं गृणीषे॒ शत्रि॑मग्न उप॒मां के॒तुम॒र्यः तस्मा॒ आपः॑ सं॒यतः॑ पीपयन्त॒ तस्मि॑न्क्ष॒त्रमम॑वत्त्वे॒षम॑स्तु
stanzas.transliteration: sahasrasā́m ā́gniveśiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe śátrim agna upamā́ṃ ketúm aryáḥ tásmā ā́paḥ saṃyátaḥ pīpayanta tásmin kṣatrám ámavat tveṣám astu
stanzas.translation: Agni! I laud the liberal Âgniveṣi, Ṣatri the type and standard of the pious. May the collected waters yield him plenty, and his be powerful and bright dominion.

translations.griffith: Agni! I laud the liberal Âgniveṣi, Ṣatri the type and standard of the pious. May the collected waters yield him plenty, and his be powerful and bright dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॒ साधि॒ष्ठोऽव॑स॒ इन्द्र॒ क्रतु॒ष्टमा भ॑र अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ चर्षणी॒सहं॒ सस्निं॒ वाजे॑षु दु॒ष्टर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yás te sā́dhiṣṭhó 'vase- índra krátuṣ ṭám ā́ bhara asmábhyaṃ carṣaṇīsáhaṃ sásniṃ vā́jeṣu duṣṭáram
stanzas.translation: INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine, Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.

translations.griffith: INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine, Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदि॑न्द्र ते॒ चत॑स्रो॒ यच्छू॑र॒ सन्ति॑ ति॒स्रः यद्वा॒ पञ्च॑ क्षिती॒नामव॒स्तत्सु न॒ आ भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: yád indra te cátasro yác chūra sánti tisráḥ yád vā páñca kṣitīnā́m ávas tát sú na ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three, Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.

translations.griffith: Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three, Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ तेऽवो॒ वरे॑ण्यं॒ वृष॑न्तमस्य हूमहे वृष॑जूति॒र्हि ज॑ज्ञि॒ष आ॒भूभि॑रिन्द्र तु॒र्वणिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ té 'vo váreṇyaṃ vŕ̥ṣantamasya hūmahe- vŕ̥ṣajūtir hí jajñiṣé ābhū́bhir indra turváṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: The aid most excellent of thee the Mightiest hitherward we call, For thou wast born with hero might, conquering, Indra, with the Strong.

translations.griffith: The aid most excellent of thee the Mightiest hitherward we call, For thou wast born with hero might, conquering, Indra, with the Strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॒ ह्यसि॒ राध॑से जज्ञि॒षे वृष्णि॑ ते॒ शवः॑ स्वक्ष॑त्रं ते धृ॒षन्मनः॑ सत्रा॒हमि॑न्द्र॒ पौंस्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā hy ási rā́dhase jajñiṣé vŕ̥ṣṇi te śávaḥ svákṣatraṃ te dhr̥ṣán mánaḥ satrāhám indra paúṃsyam
stanzas.translation: Mighty to prosper us wast thou born, and mighty is the strength thou hast. In native power thy soul is firm: thy valour, Indra, slays a host.

translations.griffith: Mighty to prosper us wast thou born, and mighty is the strength thou hast. In native power thy soul is firm: thy valour, Indra, slays a host.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं तमि॑न्द्र॒ मर्त्य॑ममित्र॒यन्त॑मद्रिवः स॒र्व॒र॒था श॑तक्रतो॒ नि या॑हि शवसस्पते
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ tám indra mártyam amitrayántam adrivaḥ sarvarathā́ śatakrato ní yāhi śavasas pate
stanzas.translation: O Ṣatakratu, Lord of Strength, O Indra, Caster of the Stone. With all thy chariot's force assail the man who shows himself thy foe.

translations.griffith: O Ṣatakratu, Lord of Strength, O Indra, Caster of the Stone. With all thy chariot's force assail the man who shows himself thy foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वामिद्वृ॑त्रहन्तम॒ जना॑सो वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः उ॒ग्रं पू॒र्वीषु॑ पू॒र्व्यं हव॑न्ते॒ वाज॑सातये
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m íd vr̥trahantama jánāso vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ ugrám pūrvī́ṣu pūrvyáṃ hávante vā́jasātaye
stanzas.translation: For, Mightiest Vr̥itra-slayer, thee, fierce, foremost among many, folk Whose sacred grass is trimmed invite to battle where the spoil is won.

translations.griffith: For, Mightiest Vr̥itra-slayer, thee, fierce, foremost among many, folk Whose sacred grass is trimmed invite to battle where the spoil is won.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र दु॒ष्टरं॑ पुरो॒यावा॑नमा॒जिषु॑ स॒यावा॑नं॒ धने॑धने वाज॒यन्त॑मवा॒ रथ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam indra duṣṭáram puroyā́vānam ājíṣu sayā́vānaṃ dháne-dhane vājayántam avā rátham
stanzas.translation: Indra, do thou protect our car that mingles foremost in the fights, That bears its part in every fray, invincible and seeking spoil.

translations.griffith: Indra, do thou protect our car that mingles foremost in the fights, That bears its part in every fray, invincible and seeking spoil.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मि॒न्द्रेहि॑ नो॒ रथ॑मवा॒ पुरं॑ध्या व॒यं श॑विष्ठ॒ वार्यं॑ दि॒वि श्रवो॑ दधीमहि दि॒वि स्तोमं॑ मनामहे
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam indréhi no rátham avā púraṃdhyā vayáṃ śaviṣṭha vā́ryaṃ diví śrávo dadhīmahi diví stómam manāmahe
stanzas.translation: Come to us, Indra, and protect our car with thine intelligence. May we, O Mightiest One, obtain excellent fame at break of day, and meditate our hymn at dawn.

translations.griffith: Come to us, Indra, and protect our car with thine intelligence. May we, O Mightiest One, obtain excellent fame at break of day, and meditate our hymn at dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: स आ ग॑म॒दिन्द्रो॒ यो वसू॑नां॒ चिके॑त॒द्दातुं॒ दाम॑नो रयी॒णाम् ध॒न्व॒च॒रो न वंस॑गस्तृषा॒णश्च॑कमा॒नः पि॑बतु दु॒ग्धमं॒शुम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ā́ gamad índro yó vásūnāṃ cíketad dā́tuṃ dā́mano rayīṇā́m dhanvacaró ná váṃsagas tr̥ṣāṇáś cakamānáḥ pibatu dugdhám aṃśúm
stanzas.translation: MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches. Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.

translations.griffith: MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches. Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॒ हनू॑ हरिवः शूर॒ शिप्रे॒ रुह॒त्सोमो॒ न पर्व॑तस्य पृ॒ष्ठे अनु॑ त्वा राज॒न्नर्व॑तो॒ न हि॒न्वन्गी॒र्भिर्म॑देम पुरुहूत॒ विश्वे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te hánū harivaḥ śūra śípre rúhat sómo ná párvatasya pr̥ṣṭhé ánu tvā rājann árvato ná hinván gīrbhír madema puruhūta víśve
stanzas.translation: Lord of Bay Horses, Hero, may the Soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountain-ridges. May we, O King, as he who driveth coursers, all joy in thee with hymns, invoked of many!

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Horses, Hero, may the Soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountain-ridges. May we, O King, as he who driveth coursers, all joy in thee with hymns, invoked of many!

stanzas.sanskrit: च॒क्रं न वृ॒त्तं पु॑रुहूत वेपते॒ मनो॑ भि॒या मे॒ अम॑ते॒रिद॑द्रिवः रथा॒दधि॑ त्वा जरि॒ता स॑दावृध कु॒विन्नु स्तो॑षन्मघवन्पुरू॒वसुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: cakráṃ ná vr̥ttám puruhūta vepate máno bhiyā́ me ámater íd adrivaḥ ráthād ádhi tvā jaritā́ sadāvr̥dha kuvín nú stoṣan maghavan purūvásuḥ
stanzas.translation: Invoked of many, Caster of the Stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury. Shall not Purûvasu the singer give thee praise, O ever-prospering Maghavan, mounted on thy car?

translations.griffith: Invoked of many, Caster of the Stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury. Shall not Purûvasu the singer give thee praise, O ever-prospering Maghavan, mounted on thy car?

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष ग्रावे॑व जरि॒ता त॑ इ॒न्द्रेय॑र्ति॒ वाचं॑ बृ॒हदा॑शुषा॒णः प्र स॒व्येन॑ मघव॒न्यंसि॑ रा॒यः प्र द॑क्षि॒णिद्ध॑रिवो॒ मा वि वे॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá grā́veva jaritā́ ta indra- -íyarti vā́cam br̥hád āśuṣāṇáḥ prá savyéna maghavan yáṃsi rāyáḥ prá dakṣiṇíd dharivo mā́ ví venaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like the press-stone is this thy praiser, Indra. Loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour. With thy left hand, O Maghavan, give us riches: with thy right, Lord of Bays, be not reluctant.

translations.griffith: Like the press-stone is this thy praiser, Indra. Loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour. With thy left hand, O Maghavan, give us riches: with thy right, Lord of Bays, be not reluctant.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॑ त्वा॒ वृष॑णं वर्धतु॒ द्यौर्वृषा॒ वृष॑भ्यां वहसे॒ हरि॑भ्याम् स नो॒ वृषा॒ वृष॑रथः सुशिप्र॒ वृष॑क्रतो॒ वृषा॑ वज्रि॒न्भरे॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā tvā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vardhatu dyaúr vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣabhyāṃ vahase háribhyām sá no vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣarathaḥ suśipra vŕ̥ṣakrato vŕ̥ṣā vajrin bháre dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: May the strong Heaven make thee the Strong wax stronger: Strong, thou art borne by thy two strong Bay Horses. So, fair of cheek, with mighty chariot, mighty, uphold us, strong-willed, thunderarmed, in battle.

translations.griffith: May the strong Heaven make thee the Strong wax stronger: Strong, thou art borne by thy two strong Bay Horses. So, fair of cheek, with mighty chariot, mighty, uphold us, strong-willed, thunderarmed, in battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो रोहि॑तौ वा॒जिनौ॑ वा॒जिनी॑वान्त्रि॒भिः श॒तैः सच॑माना॒वदि॑ष्ट यूने॒ सम॑स्मै क्षि॒तयो॑ नमन्तां श्रु॒तर॑थाय मरुतो दुवो॒या
stanzas.transliteration: yó róhitau vājínau vājínīvān tribhíḥ śataíḥ sácamānāv ádiṣṭa yū́ne sám asmai kṣitáyo namantāṃ śrutárathāya maruto duvoyā́
stanzas.translation: Maruts, let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful Ṣrutaratha, Who, rich in steeds, gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.

translations.griffith: Maruts, let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful Ṣrutaratha, Who, rich in steeds, gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं भा॒नुना॑ यतते॒ सूर्य॑स्या॒जुह्वा॑नो घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठः॒ स्वञ्चाः॑ तस्मा॒ अमृ॑ध्रा उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑च्छा॒न्य इन्द्रा॑य सु॒नवा॒मेत्याह॑
stanzas.transliteration: sám bhānúnā yatate sū́ryasya- -ājúhvāno ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭhaḥ sváñcāḥ tásmā ámr̥dhrā uṣáso vy ùchān yá índrāya sunávāméty ā́ha
stanzas.translation: BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Sûrya's beam in splendour. For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.

translations.griffith: BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Sûrya's beam in splendour. For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धाग्निर्वनवत्स्ती॒र्णब॑र्हिर्यु॒क्तग्रा॑वा सु॒तसो॑मो जराते ग्रावा॑णो॒ यस्ये॑षि॒रं वद॒न्त्यय॑दध्व॒र्युर्ह॒विषाव॒ सिन्धु॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddhāgnir vanavat stīrṇábarhir yuktágrāvā sutásomo jarāte grā́vāṇo yásyeṣiráṃ vádanti- áyad adhvaryúr havíṣā́va síndhum
stanzas.translation: With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted: And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.

translations.griffith: With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted: And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒धूरि॒यं पति॑मि॒च्छन्त्ये॑ति॒ य ईं॒ वहा॑ते॒ महि॑षीमिषि॒राम् आस्य॑ श्रवस्या॒द्रथ॒ आ च॑ घोषात्पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ परि॑ वर्तयाते
stanzas.transliteration: vadhū́r iyám pátim ichánty eti yá īṃ váhāte máhiṣīm iṣirā́m ā́sya śravasyād rátha ā́ ca ghoṣāt purū́ sahásrā pári vartayāte
stanzas.translation: This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort. Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.

translations.griffith: This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort. Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.

stanzas.sanskrit: न स राजा॑ व्यथते॒ यस्मि॒न्निन्द्र॑स्ती॒व्रं सोमं॒ पिब॑ति॒ गोस॑खायम् आ स॑त्व॒नैरज॑ति॒ हन्ति॑ वृ॒त्रं क्षेति॑ क्षि॒तीः सु॒भगो॒ नाम॒ पुष्य॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ná sá rā́jā vyathate yásminn índras tīvráṃ sómam píbati gósakhāyam ā́ satvanaír ájati hánti vr̥tráṃ kṣéti kṣitī́ḥ subhágo nā́ma púṣyan
stanzas.translation: No troubles vex that King in whose home Indra drinks the sharp Soma juice with milk commingled. With heroes he drives near, he slays the foeman: Blest, cherishing that name, he guards his people.

translations.griffith: No troubles vex that King in whose home Indra drinks the sharp Soma juice with milk commingled. With heroes he drives near, he slays the foeman: Blest, cherishing that name, he guards his people.

stanzas.sanskrit: पुष्या॒त्क्षेमे॑ अ॒भि योगे॑ भवात्यु॒भे वृतौ॑ संय॒ती सं ज॑याति प्रि॒यः सूर्ये॑ प्रि॒यो अ॒ग्ना भ॑वाति॒ य इन्द्रा॑य सु॒तसो॑मो॒ ददा॑शत्
stanzas.transliteration: púṣyāt kṣéme abhí yóge bhavāti- ubhé vŕ̥tau saṃyatī́ sáṃ jayāti priyáḥ sū́rye priyó agnā́ bhavāti yá índrāya sutásomo dádāśat
stanzas.translation: May he support in peace and win in battle: he masters both the hosts that meet together. Dear shall he be to Sûrya, dear to Agni, who with pressed Soma offers gifts to India.

translations.griffith: May he support in peace and win in battle: he masters both the hosts that meet together. Dear shall he be to Sûrya, dear to Agni, who with pressed Soma offers gifts to India.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रोष्ट॑ इन्द्र॒ राध॑सो वि॒भ्वी रा॒तिः श॑तक्रतो अधा॑ नो विश्वचर्षणे द्यु॒म्ना सु॑क्षत्र मंहय
stanzas.transliteration: uróṣ ṭa indra rā́dhaso vibhvī́ rātíḥ śatakrato ádhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā́ sukṣatra maṃhaya
stanzas.translation: WIDE, Indra Ṣatakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace: So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.

translations.griffith: WIDE, Indra Ṣatakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace: So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदी॑मिन्द्र श्र॒वाय्य॒मिषं॑ शविष्ठ दधि॒षे प॒प्र॒थे दी॑र्घ॒श्रुत्त॑मं॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्ण दु॒ष्टर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yád īm indra śravā́yyam íṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣé paprathé dīrghaśrúttamaṃ híraṇyavarṇa duṣṭáram
stanzas.translation: The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!

translations.griffith: The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!

stanzas.sanskrit: शुष्मा॑सो॒ ये ते॑ अद्रिवो मे॒हना॑ केत॒सापः॑ उ॒भा दे॒वाव॒भिष्ट॑ये दि॒वश्च॒ ग्मश्च॑ राजथः
stanzas.transliteration: śúṣmāso yé te adrivo mehánā ketasā́paḥ ubhā́ devā́v abhíṣṭaye diváś ca gmáś ca rājathaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Darter of the Stone, the powers which readily obey thy will,– Divinities, both thou and they, ye rule, to guard them, earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: O Darter of the Stone, the powers which readily obey thy will,– Divinities, both thou and they, ye rule, to guard them, earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तो नो॑ अ॒स्य कस्य॑ चि॒द्दक्ष॑स्य॒ तव॑ वृत्रहन् अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ नृ॒म्णमा भ॑रा॒स्मभ्यं॑ नृमणस्यसे
stanzas.transliteration: utó no asyá kásya cid dákṣasya táva vr̥trahan asmábhyaṃ nr̥mṇám ā́ bhara- -asmábhyaṃ nr̥maṇasyase
stanzas.translation: And from whatever power of thine, O Vr̥itra-slayer, it may be, Bring thou to us heroic strength: thou hast a man's regard for us.

translations.griffith: And from whatever power of thine, O Vr̥itra-slayer, it may be, Bring thou to us heroic strength: thou hast a man's regard for us.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू त॑ आ॒भिर॒भिष्टि॑भि॒स्तव॒ शर्म॑ञ्छतक्रतो इन्द्र॒ स्याम॑ सुगो॒पाः शूर॒ स्याम॑ सुगो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ta ābhír abhíṣṭibhis táva śármañ chatakrato índra syā́ma sugopā́ḥ śū́ra syā́ma sugopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: In thy protection, with these aids of thine, O Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, may we be guarded well, Hero, may we be guarded well.

translations.griffith: In thy protection, with these aids of thine, O Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, may we be guarded well, Hero, may we be guarded well.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदि॑न्द्र चित्र मे॒हनास्ति॒ त्वादा॑तमद्रिवः राध॒स्तन्नो॑ विदद्वस उभयाह॒स्त्या भ॑र
stanzas.transliteration: yád indra citra mehánā- -ásti tvā́dātam adrivaḥ rā́dhas tán no vidadvaso- ubhayāhasty ā́ bhara
stanzas.translation: STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee, That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.

translations.griffith: STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee, That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: यन्मन्य॑से॒ वरे॑ण्य॒मिन्द्र॑ द्यु॒क्षं तदा भ॑र वि॒द्याम॒ तस्य॑ ते व॒यमकू॑पारस्य दा॒वने॑
stanzas.transliteration: yán mányase váreṇyam índra dyukṣáṃ tád ā́ bhara vidyā́ma tásya te vayám ákūpārasya dāváne
stanzas.translation: Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven. So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.

translations.griffith: Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven. So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्ते॑ दि॒त्सु प्र॒राध्यं॒ मनो॒ अस्ति॑ श्रु॒तं बृ॒हत् तेन॑ दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑दद्रिव॒ आ वाजं॑ दर्षि सा॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: yát te ditsú prarā́dhyam máno ásti śrutám br̥hát téna dr̥ḷhā́ cid adrivaḥ- ā́ vā́jaṃ darṣi sātáye
stanzas.translation: Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,– With this thou rendest e'en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.

translations.griffith: Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,– With this thou rendest e'en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: मंहि॑ष्ठं वो म॒घोनां॒ राजा॑नं चर्षणी॒नाम् इन्द्र॒मुप॒ प्रश॑स्तये पू॒र्वीभि॑र्जुजुषे॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: máṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghónāṃ rā́jānaṃ carṣaṇīnā́m índram úpa práśastaye pūrvī́bhir jujuṣe gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame, Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.

translations.griffith: Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame, Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्मा॒ इत्काव्यं॒ वच॑ उ॒क्थमिन्द्रा॑य॒ शंस्य॑म् तस्मा॑ उ॒ ब्रह्म॑वाहसे॒ गिरो॑ वर्ध॒न्त्यत्र॑यो॒ गिरः॑ शुम्भ॒न्त्यत्र॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: ásmā ít kā́vyaṃ vácaḥ- ukthám índrāya śáṃsyaṃ tásmā u bráhmavāhase gíro vardhanty átrayo gíraḥ śumbhanty átrayaḥ
stanzas.translation: To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise. To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.

translations.griffith: To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise. To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॒ह्यद्रि॑भिः सु॒तं सोमं॑ सोमपते पिब वृष॑न्निन्द्र॒ वृष॑भिर्वृत्रहन्तम
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāhy ádribhiḥ sutáṃ sómaṃ somapate piba vŕ̥ṣann indra vŕ̥ṣabhir vr̥trahantama
stanzas.translation: COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord, Indra best Vr̥itra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.

translations.griffith: COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord, Indra best Vr̥itra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॒ ग्रावा॒ वृषा॒ मदो॒ वृषा॒ सोमो॑ अ॒यं सु॒तः वृष॑न्निन्द्र॒ वृष॑भिर्वृत्रहन्तम
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā grā́vā vŕ̥ṣā mádo vŕ̥ṣā sómo ayáṃ sutáḥ vŕ̥ṣann indra vŕ̥ṣabhir vr̥trahantama
stanzas.translation: Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed, Indra, best Vr̥itra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

translations.griffith: Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed, Indra, best Vr̥itra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॑ त्वा॒ वृष॑णं हुवे॒ वज्रि॑ञ्चि॒त्राभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ वृष॑न्निन्द्र॒ वृष॑भिर्वृत्रहन्तम
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā tvā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ huve vájriñ citrā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ vŕ̥ṣann indra vŕ̥ṣabhir vr̥trahantama
stanzas.translation: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids, Indra, best Vr̥itra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

translations.griffith: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids, Indra, best Vr̥itra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒जी॒षी व॒ज्री वृ॑ष॒भस्तु॑रा॒षाट् छु॒ष्मी राजा॑ वृत्र॒हा सो॑म॒पावा॑ यु॒क्त्वा हरि॑भ्या॒मुप॑ यासद॒र्वाङ्माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑ने मत्स॒दिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: r̥jīṣī́ vajrī́ vr̥ṣabhás turāṣā́ṭ -śuṣmī́ rā́jā vr̥trahā́ somapā́vā yuktvā́ háribhyām úpa yāsad arvā́ṅ mā́dhyaṃdine sávane matsad índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Impetuous, Thunderer, Strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vr̥itra-slayer, Soma-drinker, May he come hither with his yoked Bay Horses; may Indra gladden him at the noon libation.

translations.griffith: Impetuous, Thunderer, Strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vr̥itra-slayer, Soma-drinker, May he come hither with his yoked Bay Horses; may Indra gladden him at the noon libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्त्वा॑ सूर्य॒ स्व॑र्भानु॒स्तम॒सावि॑ध्यदासु॒रः अक्षे॑त्रवि॒द्यथा॑ मु॒ग्धो भुव॑नान्यदीधयुः
stanzas.transliteration: yát tvā sūrya svàrbhānus támasā́vidhyad āsuráḥ ákṣetravid yáthā mugdhó bhúvanāny adīdhayuḥ
stanzas.translation: O Sûrya, when the Asura's descendant Svarbhânu, pierced thee through and through with darkness, All creatures looked like one who is bewildered, who knoweth not the place where he is standing.

translations.griffith: O Sûrya, when the Asura's descendant Svarbhânu, pierced thee through and through with darkness, All creatures looked like one who is bewildered, who knoweth not the place where he is standing.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॑र्भानो॒रध॒ यदि॑न्द्र मा॒या अ॒वो दि॒वो वर्त॑माना अ॒वाह॑न् गू॒ळ्हं सूर्यं॒ तम॒साप॑व्रतेन तु॒रीये॑ण॒ ब्रह्म॑णाविन्द॒दत्रिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: svàrbhānor ádha yád indra māyā́ḥ- avó divó vártamānā avā́han gūḷháṃ sū́ryaṃ támasā́pavratena turī́yeṇa bráhmaṇāvindad átriḥ
stanzas.translation: What time thou smotest down Svarbhânu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky, O Indra, By his fourth sacred prayer Atri disoovered Sûrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.

translations.griffith: What time thou smotest down Svarbhânu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky, O Indra, By his fourth sacred prayer Atri disoovered Sûrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा मामि॒मं तव॒ सन्त॑मत्र इर॒स्या द्रु॒ग्धो भि॒यसा॒ नि गा॑रीत् त्वं मि॒त्रो अ॑सि स॒त्यरा॑धा॒स्तौ मे॒हाव॑तं॒ वरु॑णश्च॒ राजा॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ mā́m imáṃ táva sántam atre- irasyā́ drugdhó bhiyásā ní gārīt tvám mitró asi satyárādhās taú mehā́vataṃ váruṇaś ca rā́jā
stanzas.translation: Let not the oppressor with this dread, through anger swallow me up, for I am thine, O Atri. Mitra art thou, the sender of true blessings: thou and King Varuṇa be both my helpers.

translations.griffith: Let not the oppressor with this dread, through anger swallow me up, for I am thine, O Atri. Mitra art thou, the sender of true blessings: thou and King Varuṇa be both my helpers.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग्राव्णो॑ ब्र॒ह्मा यु॑युजा॒नः स॑प॒र्यन्की॒रिणा॑ दे॒वान्नम॑सोप॒शिक्ष॑न् अत्रिः॒ सूर्य॑स्य दि॒वि चक्षु॒राधा॒त्स्व॑र्भानो॒रप॑ मा॒या अ॑घुक्षत्
stanzas.transliteration: grā́vṇo brahmā́ yuyujānáḥ saparyán kīríṇā devā́n námasopaśíkṣan átriḥ sū́ryasya diví cákṣur ā́dhāt svàrbhānor ápa māyā́ aghukṣat
stanzas.translation: The Brahman Atri, as he set the press-stones, serving the Gods with praise and adoration, Established in the heaven the eye of Sûrya, and caused Svarbhânu's magic arts to vanish.

translations.griffith: The Brahman Atri, as he set the press-stones, serving the Gods with praise and adoration, Established in the heaven the eye of Sûrya, and caused Svarbhânu's magic arts to vanish.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं वै सूर्यं॒ स्व॑र्भानु॒स्तम॒सावि॑ध्यदासु॒रः अत्र॑य॒स्तमन्व॑विन्दन्न॒ह्य१॒॑न्ये अश॑क्नुवन्
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ vaí sū́ryaṃ svàrbhānus támasā́vidhyad āsuráḥ átrayas tám ánv avindan nahy ànyé áśaknuvan
stanzas.translation: The Atris found the Sun again, him whom Svarbhânu of the brood Of Asuras had pierced with gloom. This none besides had power to do.

translations.griffith: The Atris found the Sun again, him whom Svarbhânu of the brood Of Asuras had pierced with gloom. This none besides had power to do.

stanzas.sanskrit: को नु वां॑ मित्रावरुणावृता॒यन्दि॒वो वा॑ म॒हः पार्थि॑वस्य वा॒ दे ऋ॒तस्य॑ वा॒ सद॑सि॒ त्रासी॑थां नो यज्ञाय॒ते वा॑ पशु॒षो न वाजा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: kó nú vām mitrāvaruṇāv r̥tāyán divó vā maháḥ pā́rthivasya vā dé r̥tásya vā sádasi trā́sīthāṃ no yajñāyaté vā paśuṣó ná vā́jān
stanzas.translation: WHO, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven? Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.

translations.griffith: WHO, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven? Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो अर्य॒मायुरिन्द्र॑ ऋभु॒क्षा म॒रुतो॑ जुषन्त नमो॑भिर्वा॒ ये दध॑ते सुवृ॒क्तिं स्तोमं॑ रु॒द्राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ स॒जोषाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: té no mitró váruṇo aryamā́yúr índra r̥bhukṣā́ marúto juṣanta námobhir vā yé dádhate suvr̥ktíṃ stómaṃ rudrā́ya mīḷhúṣe sajóṣāḥ
stanzas.translation: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman, and Âyu, Indra R̥ibhukshan, and the Maruts, love us, And they who of one mind with bounteous Rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.

translations.griffith: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman, and Âyu, Indra R̥ibhukshan, and the Maruts, love us, And they who of one mind with bounteous Rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॒ येष्ठा॑श्विना हु॒वध्यै॒ वात॑स्य॒ पत्म॒न्रथ्य॑स्य पु॒ष्टौ उ॒त वा॑ दि॒वो असु॑राय॒ मन्म॒ प्रान्धां॑सीव॒ यज्य॑वे भरध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ yéṣṭhāśvinā huvádhyai vā́tasya pátman ráthyasya puṣṭaú utá vā divó ásurāya mánma prā́ndhāṃsīva yájyave bharadhvam
stanzas.translation: You will I call to feed the car-horse, Aṣvins, with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel: Or also to the Asura of heaven, Worshipful, bring a hymn as 'twere libation.

translations.griffith: You will I call to feed the car-horse, Aṣvins, with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel: Or also to the Asura of heaven, Worshipful, bring a hymn as 'twere libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र स॒क्षणो॑ दि॒व्यः कण्व॑होता त्रि॒तो दि॒वः स॒जोषा॒ वातो॑ अ॒ग्निः पू॒षा भगः॑ प्रभृ॒थे वि॒श्वभो॑जा आ॒जिं न ज॑ग्मुरा॒श्व॑श्वतमाः
stanzas.transliteration: prá sakṣáṇo divyáḥ káṇvahotā tritó diváḥ sajóṣā vā́to agníḥ pūṣā́ bhágaḥ prabhr̥thé viśvábhojāḥ- ājíṃ ná jagmur āśvàśvatamāḥ
stanzas.translation: The heavenly Victor, he whose priest is Kaṇva, Trita with Dyaus accordant, Vâta, Agni, All-feeding Pûshan, Bhaga sought the oblation, as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.

translations.griffith: The heavenly Victor, he whose priest is Kaṇva, Trita with Dyaus accordant, Vâta, Agni, All-feeding Pûshan, Bhaga sought the oblation, as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ र॒यिं यु॒क्ताश्वं॑ भरध्वं रा॒य एषेऽव॑से दधीत॒ धीः सु॒शेव॒ एवै॑रौशि॒जस्य॒ होता॒ ये व॒ एवा॑ मरुतस्तु॒राणा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo rayíṃ yuktā́śvam bharadhvaṃ rāyá éṣé 'vase dadhīta dhī́ḥ suśéva évair auśijásya hótā yé va évā marutas turā́ṇām
stanzas.translation: Bring ye your riches forward borne on horses: let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure. Blest he the priest of Auṣija through courses, the courses which are yours the fleet, O Maruts.

translations.griffith: Bring ye your riches forward borne on horses: let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure. Blest he the priest of Auṣija through courses, the courses which are yours the fleet, O Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ वा॒युं र॑थ॒युजं॑ कृणुध्वं॒ प्र दे॒वं विप्रं॑ पनि॒तार॑म॒र्कैः इ॒षु॒ध्यव॑ ऋत॒सापः॒ पुरं॑धी॒र्वस्वी॑र्नो॒ अत्र॒ पत्नी॒रा धि॒ये धुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo vāyúṃ rathayújaṃ kr̥ṇudhvam prá deváṃ vípram panitā́ram arkaíḥ iṣudhyáva r̥tasā́paḥ púraṃdhīr vásvīr no átra pátnīr ā́ dhiyé dhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Bring hither him who yokes the car, your Vâyu, who praises with his songs, the God and Singer; And, praying and devout, noble and prudent, may the Gods' Spouses in their thoughts retain us.

translations.griffith: Bring hither him who yokes the car, your Vâyu, who praises with his songs, the God and Singer; And, praying and devout, noble and prudent, may the Gods' Spouses in their thoughts retain us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ व॒ एषे॒ वन्द्ये॑भिः शू॒षैः प्र य॒ह्वी दि॒वश्चि॒तय॑द्भिर॒र्कैः उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ वि॒दुषी॑व॒ विश्व॒मा हा॑ वहतो॒ मर्त्या॑य य॒ज्ञम्
stanzas.transliteration: úpa va éṣe vándyebhiḥ śūṣaíḥ prá yahvī́ diváś citáyadbhir arkaíḥ uṣā́sānáktā vidúṣīva víśvam ā́ hā vahato mártyāya yajñám
stanzas.translation: I speed to you with powers that should be honoured, with songs distinguishing Heaven's mighty Daughters, Morning and Night, the Two, as 'twere all-knowing: these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.

translations.griffith: I speed to you with powers that should be honoured, with songs distinguishing Heaven's mighty Daughters, Morning and Night, the Two, as 'twere all-knowing: these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि वो॑ अर्चे पो॒ष्याव॑तो॒ नॄन्वास्तो॒ष्पतिं॒ त्वष्टा॑रं॒ ररा॑णः धन्या॑ स॒जोषा॑ धि॒षणा॒ नमो॑भि॒र्वन॒स्पतीँ॒रोष॑धी रा॒य एषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: abhí vo arce poṣyā́vato nr̥̄́n vā́stoṣ pátiṃ tváṣṭāraṃ rárāṇaḥ dhányā sajóṣā dhiṣáṇā námobhir vánaspátīm̐r óṣadhī rāyá éṣe
stanzas.translation: You I extol, the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts, Vâstoshpati and Tvashṭar- Rich Dhishaṇâ accords through our obeisance – andTrees and Plants, for the swift gain of riches.

translations.griffith: You I extol, the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts, Vâstoshpati and Tvashṭar- Rich Dhishaṇâ accords through our obeisance – andTrees and Plants, for the swift gain of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: तु॒जे न॒स्तने॒ पर्व॑ताः सन्तु॒ स्वैत॑वो॒ ये वस॑वो॒ न वी॒राः प॒नि॒त आ॒प्त्यो य॑ज॒तः सदा॑ नो॒ वर्धा॑न्नः॒ शंसं॒ नर्यो॑ अ॒भिष्टौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: tujé nas táne párvatāḥ santu svaítavo yé vásavo ná vīrā́ḥ panitá āptyó yajatáḥ sádā no várdhān naḥ śáṃsaṃ náryo abhíṣṭau
stanzas.translation: Ours be the Parvatas, even they, for offspring, free-moving, who are Heroes like the Vasus. May holy Âptya, Friend of man, exalted, strengthen our word for ever and be near us.

translations.griffith: Ours be the Parvatas, even they, for offspring, free-moving, who are Heroes like the Vasus. May holy Âptya, Friend of man, exalted, strengthen our word for ever and be near us.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृष्णो॑ अस्तोषि भू॒म्यस्य॒ गर्भं॑ त्रि॒तो नपा॑तम॒पां सु॑वृ॒क्ति गृ॒णी॒ते अ॒ग्निरे॒तरी॒ न शू॒षैः शो॒चिष्के॑शो॒ नि रि॑णाति॒ वना॑
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyásya gárbhaṃ tritó nápātam apā́ṃ suvr̥ktí gr̥ṇīté agnír etárī ná śūṣaíḥ śocíṣkeśo ní riṇāti vánā
stanzas.translation: Trita praised him, germ of the earthly hero, with pure songs him the Offspring of the Waters. Agn; with might neighs loudly like a charger: he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.
