translations.griffith: Trita praised him, germ of the earthly hero, with pure songs him the Offspring of the Waters. Agn; with might neighs loudly like a charger: he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था म॒हे रु॒द्रिया॑य ब्रवाम॒ कद्रा॒ये चि॑कि॒तुषे॒ भगा॑य आप॒ ओष॑धीरु॒त नो॑ऽवन्तु॒ द्यौर्वना॑ गि॒रयो॑ वृ॒क्षके॑शाः
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ mahé rudríyāya bravāma kád rāyé cikitúṣe bhágāya ā́pa óṣadhīr utá no 'vantu dyaúr vánā giráyo vr̥kṣákeśāḥ
stanzas.translation: How shall we speak to the great might of Rudra? How speak to Bhaga who takes thought for riches? May Plants, the Waters, and the Sky preserve us, and Woods and Mountains with their trees for tresses.

translations.griffith: How shall we speak to the great might of Rudra? How speak to Bhaga who takes thought for riches? May Plants, the Waters, and the Sky preserve us, and Woods and Mountains with their trees for tresses.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृ॒णोतु॑ न ऊ॒र्जां पति॒र्गिरः॒ स नभ॒स्तरी॑याँ इषि॒रः परि॑ज्मा शृ॒ण्वन्त्वापः॒ पुरो॒ न शु॒भ्राः परि॒ स्रुचो॑ बबृहा॒णस्याद्रेः॑
stanzas.transliteration: śr̥ṇótu na ūrjā́m pátir gíraḥ sá nábhas tárīyām̐ iṣiráḥ párijmā śr̥ṇvántv ā́paḥ púro ná śubhrā́ḥ pári srúco babr̥hāṇásyā́dreḥ
stanzas.translation: May the swift Wanderer, Lord of refreshments listen to our songs, who speeds throuih cloudy heaven: And may the Waters, bright like castles, hear us, as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.

translations.griffith: May the swift Wanderer, Lord of refreshments listen to our songs, who speeds throuih cloudy heaven: And may the Waters, bright like castles, hear us, as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒दा चि॒न्नु म॑हान्तो॒ ये व॒ एवा॒ ब्रवा॑म दस्मा॒ वार्यं॒ दधा॑नाः वय॑श्च॒न सु॒भ्व१॒॑ आव॑ यन्ति क्षु॒भा मर्त॒मनु॑यतं वध॒स्नैः
stanzas.transliteration: vidā́ cin nú mahānto yé va évāḥ- brávāma dasmā vā́ryaṃ dádhānāḥ váyaś caná subhvà ā́va yanti kṣubhā́ mártam ánuyataṃ vadhasnaíḥ
stanzas.translation: We know your ways, ye Mighty Ones receiving choice meed, ye Wonderful, we will proclaim it. Even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.

translations.griffith: We know your ways, ye Mighty Ones receiving choice meed, ye Wonderful, we will proclaim it. Even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ दैव्या॑नि॒ पार्थि॑वानि॒ जन्मा॒पश्चाच्छा॒ सुम॑खाय वोचम् वर्ध॑न्तां॒ द्यावो॒ गिर॑श्च॒न्द्राग्रा॑ उ॒दा व॑र्धन्ताम॒भिषा॑ता॒ अर्णाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ daívyāni pā́rthivāni jánma- -apáś cā́chā súmakhāya vocam várdhantāṃ dyā́vo gíraś candrā́grāḥ- udā́ vardhantām abhíṣātā árṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: Celestial and terrestrial generations, and Waters will I summon to the feasting. May days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper, and may the conquered streams increase their waters.

translations.griffith: Celestial and terrestrial generations, and Waters will I summon to the feasting. May days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper, and may the conquered streams increase their waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒देप॑दे मे जरि॒मा नि धा॑यि॒ वरू॑त्री वा श॒क्रा या पा॒युभि॑श्च सिष॑क्तु मा॒ता म॒ही र॒सा नः॒ स्मत्सू॒रिभि॑र्ऋजु॒हस्त॑ ऋजु॒वनिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: padé-pade me jarimā́ ní dhāyi várūtrī vā śakrā́ yā́ pāyúbhiś ca síṣaktu mātā́ mahī́ rasā́ naḥ smát sūríbhir r̥juhásta r̥juvániḥ
stanzas.translation: Duly to each one hath my laud been offered. Strong be Varûtrî with her powers to succour. May the great Mother Rasâ here befriend us, straight-handed, with the princes, striving forward.

translations.griffith: Duly to each one hath my laud been offered. Strong be Varûtrî with her powers to succour. May the great Mother Rasâ here befriend us, straight-handed, with the princes, striving forward.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒था दा॑शेम॒ नम॑सा सु॒दानू॑नेव॒या म॒रुतो॒ अच्छो॑क्तौ॒ प्रश्र॑वसो म॒रुतो॒ अच्छो॑क्तौ मा नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॑ रि॒षे धा॑द॒स्माकं॑ भूदुपमाति॒वनिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kathā́ dāśema námasā sudā́nūn evayā́ marúto áchoktau práśravaso marúto áchoktau mā́ nó 'hir budhnyò riṣé dhād asmā́kam bhūd upamātivániḥ
stanzas.translation: How may we serve the Liberal Ones with worship, the Maruts swift of course in invocation, the Maruts far-renowned in invocation? Let not the Dragon of the Deep annoy us, and gladly may he welcome our addresses.

translations.griffith: How may we serve the Liberal Ones with worship, the Maruts swift of course in invocation, the Maruts far-renowned in invocation? Let not the Dragon of the Deep annoy us, and gladly may he welcome our addresses.

stanzas.sanskrit: इति॑ चि॒न्नु प्र॒जायै॑ पशु॒मत्यै॒ देवा॑सो॒ वन॑ते॒ मर्त्यो॑ व॒ आ दे॑वासो वनते॒ मर्त्यो॑ वः अत्रा॑ शि॒वां त॒न्वो॑ धा॒सिम॒स्या ज॒रां चि॑न्मे॒ निर्ऋ॑तिर्जग्रसीत
stanzas.transliteration: íti cin nú prajā́yai paśumátyai dévāso vánate mártyo vaḥ- ā́ devāso vanate mártyo vaḥ átrā śivā́ṃ tanvò dhāsím asyā́ jarā́ṃ cin me nírr̥tir jagrasīta
stanzas.translation: Thus thinking, O ye Gods, the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle: the mortal wins him, O ye Gods, your favour. Here he wins wholesome food to feed this body: as for mine old age, Nirr̥iti consume it

translations.griffith: Thus thinking, O ye Gods, the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle: the mortal wins him, O ye Gods, your favour. Here he wins wholesome food to feed this body: as for mine old age, Nirr̥iti consume it

stanzas.sanskrit: तां वो॑ देवाः सुम॒तिमू॒र्जय॑न्ती॒मिष॑मश्याम वसवः॒ शसा॒ गोः सा नः॑ सु॒दानु॑र्मृ॒ळय॑न्ती दे॒वी प्रति॒ द्रव॑न्ती सुवि॒ताय॑ गम्याः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ṃ vo devāḥ sumatím ūrjáyantīm íṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śásā góḥ sā́ naḥ sudā́nur mr̥ḷáyantī devī́ práti drávantī suvitā́ya gamyāḥ
stanzas.translation: O Gods, may we obtain from you this favour, strengthening food through the Cow's praise, ye Vasus. May she who gives good gifts, the gracious Goddes. s, come speeding nigh to us for our well-being.

translations.griffith: O Gods, may we obtain from you this favour, strengthening food through the Cow's praise, ye Vasus. May she who gives good gifts, the gracious Goddes. s, come speeding nigh to us for our well-being.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि न॒ इळा॑ यू॒थस्य॑ मा॒ता स्मन्न॒दीभि॑रु॒र्वशी॑ वा गृणातु उ॒र्वशी॑ वा बृहद्दि॒वा गृ॑णा॒नाभ्यू॑र्ण्वा॒ना प्र॑भृ॒थस्या॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí na íḷā yūthásya mātā́ smán nadī́bhir urváśī vā gr̥ṇātu urváśī vā br̥haddivā́ gr̥ṇānā́- -abhyūrṇvānā́ prabhr̥thásyāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: May Iḷâ, Mother of the herds of cattle, and Urvaṣî with all the streams accept us; May Urvaṣî in lofty heaven accepting, as she partakes the oblation of the living,

translations.griffith: May Iḷâ, Mother of the herds of cattle, and Urvaṣî with all the streams accept us; May Urvaṣî in lofty heaven accepting, as she partakes the oblation of the living,

stanzas.sanskrit: सिष॑क्तु न ऊर्ज॒व्य॑स्य पु॒ष्टेः
stanzas.transliteration: síṣaktu na ūrjavyàsya puṣṭéḥ
stanzas.translation: Visit us while she shares Ûrjavya's food.

translations.griffith: Visit us while she shares Ûrjavya's food.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र शंत॑मा॒ वरु॑णं॒ दीधि॑ती॒ गीर्मि॒त्रं भग॒मदि॑तिं नू॒नम॑श्याः पृष॑द्योनिः॒ पञ्च॑होता शृणो॒त्वतू॑र्तपन्था॒ असु॑रो मयो॒भुः
stanzas.transliteration: prá śáṃtamā váruṇaṃ dī́dhitī gī́r mitrám bhágam áditiṃ nūnám aśyāḥ pŕ̥ṣadyoniḥ páñcahotā śr̥ṇotu- átūrtapanthā ásuro mayobhúḥ
stanzas.translation: Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuṇa, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga. May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.

translations.griffith: Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuṇa, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga. May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॑ मे॒ स्तोम॒मदि॑तिर्जगृभ्यात्सू॒नुं न मा॒ता हृद्यं॑ सु॒शेव॑म् ब्रह्म॑ प्रि॒यं दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यदस्त्य॒हं मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे॒ यन्म॑यो॒भु
stanzas.transliteration: práti me stómam áditir jagr̥bhyāt sūnúṃ ná mātā́ hŕ̥dyaṃ suśévam bráhma priyáṃ deváhitaṃ yád ásti- ahám mitré váruṇe yán mayobhú
stanzas.translation: May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her. The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuṇa and Mitra.

translations.griffith: May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her. The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuṇa and Mitra.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदी॑रय क॒वित॑मं कवी॒नामु॒नत्तै॑नम॒भि मध्वा॑ घृ॒तेन॑ स नो॒ वसू॑नि॒ प्रय॑ता हि॒तानि॑ च॒न्द्राणि॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता सु॑वाति
stanzas.transliteration: úd īraya kavítamaṃ kavīnā́m unáttainam abhí mádhvā ghr̥téna sá no vásūni práyatā hitā́ni candrā́ṇi deváḥ savitā́ suvāti
stanzas.translation: In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.

translations.griffith: In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑न्द्र णो॒ मन॑सा नेषि॒ गोभिः॒ सं सू॒रिभि॑र्हरिवः॒ सं स्व॒स्ति सं ब्रह्म॑णा दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यदस्ति॒ सं दे॒वानां॑ सुम॒त्या य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: sám indra ṇo mánasā neṣi góbhiḥ sáṃ sūríbhir harivaḥ sáṃ svastí sám bráhmaṇā deváhitaṃ yád ásti sáṃ devā́nāṃ sumatyā́ yajñíyānām
stanzas.translation: With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons; And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.

translations.griffith: With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons; And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वो भगः॑ सवि॒ता रा॒यो अंश॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रस्य॑ सं॒जितो॒ धना॑नाम् ऋ॒भु॒क्षा वाज॑ उ॒त वा॒ पुरं॑धि॒रव॑न्तु नो अ॒मृता॑सस्तु॒रासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: devó bhágaḥ savitā́ rāyó áṃśaḥ- índro vr̥trásya saṃjíto dhánānām r̥bhukṣā́ vā́ja utá vā púraṃdhir ávantu no amŕ̥tāsas turā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vr̥itra's treasures, And Vâja and R̥ibhukshan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!

translations.griffith: God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vr̥itra's treasures, And Vâja and R̥ibhukshan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒रुत्व॑तो॒ अप्र॑तीतस्य जि॒ष्णोरजू॑र्यतः॒ प्र ब्र॑वामा कृ॒तानि॑ न ते॒ पूर्वे॑ मघव॒न्नाप॑रासो॒ न वी॒र्यं१॒॑ नूत॑नः॒ कश्च॒नाप॑
stanzas.transliteration: marútvato ápratītasya jiṣṇór ájūryataḥ prá bravāmā kr̥tā́ni ná te pū́rve maghavan nā́parāso ná vīryàṃ nū́tanaḥ káś canā́pa
stanzas.translation: Let us declare his deeds, the undecaying unrivalled Victor whom the Maruts follow. None of old times, O Maghavan, nor later, none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.

translations.griffith: Let us declare his deeds, the undecaying unrivalled Victor whom the Maruts follow. None of old times, O Maghavan, nor later, none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ स्तुहि प्रथ॒मं र॑त्न॒धेयं॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॑ सनि॒तारं॒ धना॑नाम् यः शंस॑ते स्तुव॒ते शम्भ॑विष्ठः पुरू॒वसु॑रा॒गम॒ज्जोहु॑वानम्
stanzas.transliteration: úpa stuhi prathamáṃ ratnadhéyam bŕ̥haspátiṃ sanitā́raṃ dhánānām yáḥ śáṃsate stuvaté śámbhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvásur āgámaj jóhuvānam
stanzas.translation: Praise him the Chief who gives the boon of riches, Br̥ihaspati distributor of treasures, Who, blessing most the man who sings and praises, comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.

translations.griffith: Praise him the Chief who gives the boon of riches, Br̥ihaspati distributor of treasures, Who, blessing most the man who sings and praises, comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.

stanzas.sanskrit: तवो॒तिभिः॒ सच॑माना॒ अरि॑ष्टा॒ बृह॑स्पते म॒घवा॑नः सु॒वीराः॑ ये अ॑श्व॒दा उ॒त वा॒ सन्ति॑ गो॒दा ये व॑स्त्र॒दाः सु॒भगा॒स्तेषु॒ रायः॑
stanzas.transliteration: távotíbhiḥ sácamānā áriṣṭāḥ- bŕ̥haspate maghávānaḥ suvī́rāḥ yé aśvadā́ utá vā sánti godā́ḥ- yé vastradā́ḥ subhágās téṣu rā́yaḥ
stanzas.translation: Tended, Br̥ihaspati, with thy protections, the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes. Wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.

translations.griffith: Tended, Br̥ihaspati, with thy protections, the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes. Wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒स॒र्माणं॑ कृणुहि वि॒त्तमे॑षां॒ ये भु॒ञ्जते॒ अपृ॑णन्तो न उ॒क्थैः अप॑व्रतान्प्रस॒वे वा॑वृधा॒नान्ब्र॑ह्म॒द्विषः॒ सूर्या॑द्यावयस्व
stanzas.transliteration: visarmā́ṇaṃ kr̥ṇuhi vittám eṣāṃ yé bhuñjáte ápr̥ṇanto na ukthaíḥ ápavratān prasavé vāvr̥dhānā́n brahmadvíṣaḥ sū́ryād yāvayasva
stanzas.translation: Make their wealth flee who, through our hymns enjoying their riches, yield us not an ample guerdon. Far from the sun keep those who hate devotion, the godless, prospering in their vocation.

translations.griffith: Make their wealth flee who, through our hymns enjoying their riches, yield us not an ample guerdon. Far from the sun keep those who hate devotion, the godless, prospering in their vocation.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ओह॑ते र॒क्षसो॑ दे॒ववी॑तावच॒क्रेभि॒स्तं म॑रुतो॒ नि या॑त यो वः॒ शमीं॑ शशमा॒नस्य॒ निन्दा॑त्तु॒च्छ्यान्कामा॑न्करते सिष्विदा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: yá óhate rakṣáso devávītāv acakrébhis tám maruto ní yāta yó vaḥ śámīṃ śaśamānásya níndāt tuchyā́n kā́mān karate siṣvidānáḥ
stanzas.translation: With wheelless chariots drive down him, O Maruts, who at the feasts of Gods regards the demons. May he, though bathed in sweat, form empty wishes, who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.

translations.griffith: With wheelless chariots drive down him, O Maruts, who at the feasts of Gods regards the demons. May he, though bathed in sweat, form empty wishes, who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ ष्टुहि॒ यः स्वि॒षुः सु॒धन्वा॒ यो विश्व॑स्य॒ क्षय॑ति भेष॒जस्य॑ यक्ष्वा॑ म॒हे सौ॑मन॒साय॑ रु॒द्रं नमो॑भिर्दे॒वमसु॑रं दुवस्य
stanzas.transliteration: tám u ṣṭuhi yáḥ sviṣúḥ sudhánvā yó víśvasya kṣáyati bheṣajásya yákṣvā mahé saumanasā́ya rudráṃ námobhir devám ásuraṃ duvasya
stanzas.translation: Praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow, him who is Lord of every balm that bealeth. Worship thou Rudra for his great good favour: adore the Asura, God, with salutations.

translations.griffith: Praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow, him who is Lord of every balm that bealeth. Worship thou Rudra for his great good favour: adore the Asura, God, with salutations.

stanzas.sanskrit: दमू॑नसो अ॒पसो॒ ये सु॒हस्ता॒ वृष्णः॒ पत्नी॑र्न॒द्यो॑ विभ्वत॒ष्टाः सर॑स्वती बृहद्दि॒वोत रा॒का द॑श॒स्यन्ती॑र्वरिवस्यन्तु शु॒भ्राः
stanzas.transliteration: dámūnaso apáso yé suhástāḥ- vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ pátnīr nadyò vibhvataṣṭā́ḥ sárasvatī br̥haddivótá rākā́ daśasyántīr varivasyantu śubhrā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May the House-friends, the cunning-handed Artists, may the Steer's Wives, the streams carved out by Vibhvan, And may the fair Ones honour and befriend us, Sarasvatî, Br̥ihaddiva, and Râkâ.

translations.griffith: May the House-friends, the cunning-handed Artists, may the Steer's Wives, the streams carved out by Vibhvan, And may the fair Ones honour and befriend us, Sarasvatî, Br̥ihaddiva, and Râkâ.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र सू म॒हे सु॑शर॒णाय॑ मे॒धां गिरं॑ भरे॒ नव्य॑सीं॒ जाय॑मानाम् य आ॑ह॒ना दु॑हि॒तुर्व॒क्षणा॑सु रू॒पा मि॑ना॒नो अकृ॑णोदि॒दं नः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá sū́ mahé suśaraṇā́ya medhā́ṃ gíram bhare návyasīṃ jā́yamānām yá āhanā́ duhitúr vakṣáṇāsu rūpā́ minānó ákr̥ṇod idáṃ naḥ
stanzas.translation: My newest song, thought that now springs within me, I offer to the Great, the Sure Protector, Who made for us this All, in fond love laying each varied form within his Daughter's bosom.

translations.griffith: My newest song, thought that now springs within me, I offer to the Great, the Sure Protector, Who made for us this All, in fond love laying each varied form within his Daughter's bosom.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र सु॑ष्टु॒तिः स्त॒नय॑न्तं रु॒वन्त॑मि॒ळस्पतिं॑ जरितर्नू॒नम॑श्याः यो अ॑ब्दि॒माँ उ॑दनि॒माँ इय॑र्ति॒ प्र वि॒द्युता॒ रोद॑सी उ॒क्षमा॑णः
stanzas.transliteration: prá suṣṭutí stanáyantaṃ ruvántam iḷás pátiṃ jaritar nūnám aśyāḥ yó abdimā́m̐ udanimā́m̐ íyarti prá vidyútā ródasī ukṣámāṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, even now, may thy fair praise, O Singer, attain Idaspati who roars and thunders, Who, rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: Now, even now, may thy fair praise, O Singer, attain Idaspati who roars and thunders, Who, rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष स्तोमो॒ मारु॑तं॒ शर्धो॒ अच्छा॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नूँर्यु॑व॒न्यूँरुद॑श्याः कामो॑ रा॒ये ह॑वते मा स्व॒स्त्युप॑ स्तुहि॒ पृष॑दश्वाँ अ॒यासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá stómo mā́rutaṃ śárdho áchā rudrásya sūnū́m̐r yuvanyū́m̐r úd aśyāḥ kā́mo rāyé havate mā svastí- úpa stuhi pŕ̥ṣadaśvām̐ ayā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: May this my laud attain the troop of Maruts, those who are youths in act, the Sons of Rudra. The wish calls me to riches and well-being: praise the unwearied Ones whose steeds are dappled.

translations.griffith: May this my laud attain the troop of Maruts, those who are youths in act, the Sons of Rudra. The wish calls me to riches and well-being: praise the unwearied Ones whose steeds are dappled.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रैष स्तोमः॑ पृथि॒वीम॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वन॒स्पतीँ॒रोष॑धी रा॒ये अ॑श्याः दे॒वोदे॑वः सु॒हवो॑ भूतु॒ मह्यं॒ मा नो॑ मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी दु॑र्म॒तौ धा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: praíṣá stómaḥ pr̥thivī́m antárikṣaṃ vánaspátīm̐r óṣadhī rāyé aśyāḥ devó-devaḥ suhávo bhūtu máhyam mā́ no mātā́ pr̥thivī́ durmataú dhāt
stanzas.translation: May this my laud reach earth and air's mid-region, and forest trees and plants to win me riches. May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

translations.griffith: May this my laud reach earth and air's mid-region, and forest trees and plants to win me riches. May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रौ दे॑वा अनिबा॒धे स्या॑म
stanzas.transliteration: uraú devā anibādhé syāma
stanzas.translation: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

translations.griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
stanzas.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni
stanzas.translation: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ धे॒नवः॒ पय॑सा॒ तूर्ण्य॑र्था॒ अम॑र्धन्ती॒रुप॑ नो यन्तु॒ मध्वा॑ म॒हो रा॒ये बृ॑ह॒तीः स॒प्त विप्रो॑ मयो॒भुवो॑ जरि॒ता जो॑हवीति
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dhenávaḥ páyasā tū́rṇyarthāḥ- ámardhantīr úpa no yantu mádhvā mahó rāyé br̥hatī́ḥ saptá vípro mayobhúvo jaritā́ johavīti
stanzas.translation: MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness. The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.

translations.griffith: MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness. The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सु॑ष्टु॒ती नम॑सा वर्त॒यध्यै॒ द्यावा॒ वाजा॑य पृथि॒वी अमृ॑ध्रे पि॒ता मा॒ता मधु॑वचाः सु॒हस्ता॒ भरे॑भरे नो य॒शसा॑वविष्टाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ suṣṭutī́ námasā vartayádhyai dyā́vā vā́jāya pr̥thivī́ ámr̥dhre pitā́ mātā́ mádhuvacāḥ suhástā bháre-bhare no yaśásāv aviṣṭām
stanzas.translation: With reverence and fair praise will I bring hither, for sake of strength, exhaustless Earth and Heaven. Father and Mother, sweetof speech, fairhanded, may they, far-famed, in every fight protect us.

translations.griffith: With reverence and fair praise will I bring hither, for sake of strength, exhaustless Earth and Heaven. Father and Mother, sweetof speech, fairhanded, may they, far-famed, in every fight protect us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यवश्चकृ॒वांसो॒ मधू॑नि॒ प्र वा॒यवे॑ भरत॒ चारु॑ शु॒क्रम् होते॑व नः प्रथ॒मः पा॑ह्य॒स्य देव॒ मध्वो॑ ररि॒मा ते॒ मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryavaś cakr̥vā́ṃso mádhūni prá vāyáve bharata cā́ru śukrám hóteva naḥ prathamáḥ pāhy asyá déva mádhvo rarimā́ te mádāya
stanzas.translation: Adhvaryus, make the sweet libations ready, and bring the beautiful bright juice to Vâyu. God, as our Priest, be thou the first to drink it: we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.

translations.griffith: Adhvaryus, make the sweet libations ready, and bring the beautiful bright juice to Vâyu. God, as our Priest, be thou the first to drink it: we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: दश॒ क्षिपो॑ युञ्जते बा॒हू अद्रिं॒ सोम॑स्य॒ या श॑मि॒तारा॑ सु॒हस्ता॑ मध्वो॒ रसं॑ सु॒गभ॑स्तिर्गिरि॒ष्ठां चनि॑श्चदद्दुदुहे शु॒क्रमं॒शुः
stanzas.transliteration: dáśa kṣípo yuñjate bāhū́ ádriṃ sómasya yā́ śamitā́rā suhástā mádhvo rásaṃ sugábhastir giriṣṭhā́ṃ cániścadad duduhe śukrám aṃśúḥ
stanzas.translation: Two arms-the Soma's dexterous immo. lators-and the ten fingers set and fix the press-stone. The stalk hath poured, fair with its spreading branches, the mead's bright glittering juice that dwells on mountains.

translations.griffith: Two arms-the Soma's dexterous immo. lators-and the ten fingers set and fix the press-stone. The stalk hath poured, fair with its spreading branches, the mead's bright glittering juice that dwells on mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: असा॑वि ते जुजुषा॒णाय॒ सोमः॒ क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य बृह॒ते मदा॑य हरी॒ रथे॑ सु॒धुरा॒ योगे॑ अ॒र्वागिन्द्र॑ प्रि॒या कृ॑णुहि हू॒यमा॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: ásāvi te jujuṣāṇā́ya sómaḥ krátve dákṣāya br̥haté mádāya hárī ráthe sudhúrā yóge arvā́g índra priyā́ kr̥ṇuhi hūyámānaḥ
stanzas.translation: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, its lover, to give thee power and might and high enjoyment. Invoked, turn hither in thy car, O Indra, at need, thy two well-trained and dear Bay Horses.

translations.griffith: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, its lover, to give thee power and might and high enjoyment. Invoked, turn hither in thy car, O Indra, at need, thy two well-trained and dear Bay Horses.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ म॒हीम॒रम॑तिं स॒जोषा॒ ग्नां दे॒वीं नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्याम् मधो॒र्मदा॑य बृह॒तीमृ॑त॒ज्ञामाग्ने॑ वह प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no mahī́m arámatiṃ sajóṣāḥ- gnā́ṃ devī́ṃ námasā rātáhavyām mádhor mádāya br̥hatī́m r̥tajñā́m ā́gne vaha pathíbhir devayā́naiḥ
stanzas.translation: Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady, Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.

translations.griffith: Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady, Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ञ्जन्ति॒ यं प्र॒थय॑न्तो॒ न विप्रा॑ व॒पाव॑न्तं॒ नाग्निना॒ तप॑न्तः पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्र उ॒पसि॒ प्रेष्ठ॒ आ घ॒र्मो अ॒ग्निमृ॒तय॑न्नसादि
stanzas.transliteration: añjánti yám pratháyanto ná víprāḥ- vapā́vantaṃ nā́gnínā tápantaḥ pitúr ná putrá upási préṣṭhaḥ- ā́ gharmó agním r̥táyann asādi
stanzas.translation: As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron, Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.

translations.griffith: As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron, Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ म॒ही बृ॑ह॒ती शंत॑मा॒ गीर्दू॒तो न ग॑न्त्व॒श्विना॑ हु॒वध्यै॑ म॒यो॒भुवा॑ स॒रथा या॑तम॒र्वाग्ग॒न्तं नि॒धिं धुर॑मा॒णिर्न नाभि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: áchā mahī́ br̥hatī́ śáṃtamā gī́r dūtó ná gantv aśvínā huvádhyai mayobhúvā saráthā́ yātam arvā́g gantáṃ nidhíṃ dhúram āṇír ná nā́bhim
stanzas.translation: Hither, as herald to invite the Aṣvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant! Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.

translations.griffith: Hither, as herald to invite the Aṣvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant! Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र तव्य॑सो॒ नम॑उक्तिं तु॒रस्या॒हं पू॒ष्ण उ॒त वा॒योर॑दिक्षि या राध॑सा चोदि॒तारा॑ मती॒नां या वाज॑स्य द्रविणो॒दा उ॒त त्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: prá távyaso námaÅktiṃ turásya- -ahám pūṣṇá utá vāyór adikṣi yā́ rā́dhasā coditā́rā matīnā́ṃ yā́ vā́jasya draviṇodā́ utá tmán
stanzas.translation: I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pûshan and victorious Vâyu, Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.

translations.griffith: I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pûshan and victorious Vâyu, Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नाम॑भिर्म॒रुतो॑ वक्षि॒ विश्वा॒ना रू॒पेभि॑र्जातवेदो हुवा॒नः य॒ज्ञं गिरो॑ जरि॒तुः सु॑ष्टु॒तिं च॒ विश्वे॑ गन्त मरुतो॒ विश्व॑ ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ nā́mabhir marúto vakṣi víśvān ā́ rūpébhir jātavedo huvānáḥ yajñáṃ gíro jaritúḥ suṣṭutíṃ ca víśve ganta maruto víśva ūtī́
stanzas.translation: Invoked by us bring hither, Jâtavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures. Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!

translations.griffith: Invoked by us bring hither, Jâtavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures. Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः पर्व॑ता॒दा सर॑स्वती यज॒ता ग॑न्तु य॒ज्ञम् हवं॑ दे॒वी जु॑जुषा॒णा घृ॒ताची॑ श॒ग्मां नो॒ वाच॑मुश॒ती शृ॑णोतु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no divó br̥hatáḥ párvatād ā́ sárasvatī yajatā́ gantu yajñám hávaṃ devī́ jujuṣāṇā́ ghr̥tā́cī śagmā́ṃ no vā́cam uśatī́ śr̥ṇotu
stanzas.translation: From high heaven may Sarasvatî the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain. Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.

translations.griffith: From high heaven may Sarasvatî the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain. Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वे॒धसं॒ नील॑पृष्ठं बृ॒हन्तं॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ सद॑ने सादयध्वम् सा॒दद्यो॑निं॒ दम॒ आ दी॑दि॒वांसं॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णमरु॒षं स॑पेम
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vedhásaṃ nī́lapr̥ṣṭham br̥hántam bŕ̥haspátiṃ sádane sādayadhvam sādádyoniṃ dáma ā́ dīdivā́ṃsaṃ híraṇyavarṇam aruṣáṃ sapema
stanzas.translation: Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Br̥ihaspati the lofty, the Disposer. Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.

translations.griffith: Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Br̥ihaspati the lofty, the Disposer. Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ध॑र्ण॒सिर्बृ॒हद्दि॑वो॒ ररा॑णो॒ विश्वे॑भिर्ग॒न्त्वोम॑भिर्हुवा॒नः ग्ना वसा॑न॒ ओष॑धी॒रमृ॑ध्रस्त्रि॒धातु॑शृङ्गो वृष॒भो व॑यो॒धाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ dharṇasír br̥háddivo rárāṇo víśvebhir gantv ómabhir huvānáḥ gnā́ vásāna óṣadhīr ámr̥dhras tridhā́tuśr̥ṅgo vr̥ṣabhó vayodhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours, Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.

translations.griffith: May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours, Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा॒तुष्प॒दे प॑र॒मे शु॒क्र आ॒योर्वि॑प॒न्यवो॑ रास्पि॒रासो॑ अग्मन् सु॒शेव्यं॒ नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्याः॒ शिशुं॑ मृजन्त्या॒यवो॒ न वा॒से
stanzas.transliteration: mātúṣ padé paramé śukrá āyór vipanyávo rāspirā́so agman suśévyaṃ námasā rātáhavyāḥ śíśum mr̥janty āyávo ná vāsé
stanzas.translation: The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station. As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.

translations.griffith: The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station. As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हद्वयो॑ बृह॒ते तुभ्य॑मग्ने धिया॒जुरो॑ मिथु॒नासः॑ सचन्त दे॒वोदे॑वः सु॒हवो॑ भूतु॒ मह्यं॒ मा नो॑ मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी दु॑र्म॒तौ धा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hád váyo br̥haté túbhyam agne dhiyājúro mithunā́saḥ sacanta devó-devaḥ suhávo bhūtu máhyam mā́ no mātā́ pr̥thivī́ durmataú dhāt
stanzas.translation: Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee. May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

translations.griffith: Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee. May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रौ दे॑वा अनिबा॒धे स्या॑म
stanzas.transliteration: uraú devā anibādhé syāma
stanzas.translation: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

translations.griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
stanzas.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni
stanzas.translation: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

stanzas.sanskrit: तं प्र॒त्नथा॑ पू॒र्वथा॑ वि॒श्वथे॒मथा॑ ज्ये॒ष्ठता॑तिं बर्हि॒षदं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म् प्र॒ती॒ची॒नं वृ॒जनं॑ दोहसे गि॒राशुं जय॑न्त॒मनु॒ यासु॒ वर्ध॑से
stanzas.transliteration: tám pratnáthā pūrváthā viśváthemáthā jyeṣṭhátātim barhiṣádaṃ svarvídam pratīcīnáṃ vr̥jánaṃ dohase girā́- -āśúṃ jáyantam ánu yā́su várdhase
stanzas.translation: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with song, The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxeth strong.

translations.griffith: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with song, The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxeth strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रि॒ये सु॒दृशी॒रुप॑रस्य॒ याः स्व॑र्वि॒रोच॑मानः क॒कुभा॑मचो॒दते॑ सु॒गो॒पा अ॑सि॒ न दभा॑य सुक्रतो प॒रो मा॒याभि॑र्ऋ॒त आ॑स॒ नाम॑ ते
stanzas.transliteration: śriyé sudŕ̥śīr úparasya yā́ḥ svàr virócamānaḥ kakúbhām acodáte sugopā́ asi ná dábhāya sukrato paró māyā́bhir r̥tá āsa nā́ma te
stanzas.translation: Shining to him who leaves heaven's regions undisturbed, which to his sheen who is beneath show fair in light, Good guardian art thou, not to be deceived, Most Wise! Far from deceits thy name dwelleth in holy Law.

translations.griffith: Shining to him who leaves heaven's regions undisturbed, which to his sheen who is beneath show fair in light, Good guardian art thou, not to be deceived, Most Wise! Far from deceits thy name dwelleth in holy Law.

stanzas.sanskrit: अत्यं॑ ह॒विः स॑चते॒ सच्च॒ धातु॒ चारि॑ष्टगातुः॒ स होता॑ सहो॒भरिः॑ प्र॒सर्स्रा॑णो॒ अनु॑ ब॒र्हिर्वृषा॒ शिशु॒र्मध्ये॒ युवा॒जरो॑ वि॒स्रुहा॑ हि॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: átyaṃ havíḥ sacate sác ca dhā́tu ca- -áriṣṭagātuḥ sá hótā sahobháriḥ prasársrāṇo ánu barhír vŕ̥ṣā śíśur mádhye yúvājáro visrúhā hitáḥ
stanzas.translation: Truth waits upon oblation present and to come: naught checks him in his way, this vic torybringing Priest: The Mighty Child who glides along the sacred grass, the undecaying Youth set in the midst of plants.

translations.griffith: Truth waits upon oblation present and to come: naught checks him in his way, this vic torybringing Priest: The Mighty Child who glides along the sacred grass, the undecaying Youth set in the midst of plants.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र व॑ ए॒ते सु॒युजो॒ याम॑न्नि॒ष्टये॒ नीची॑र॒मुष्मै॑ य॒म्य॑ ऋता॒वृधः॑ सु॒यन्तु॑भिः सर्वशा॒सैर॒भीशु॑भिः॒ क्रिवि॒र्नामा॑नि प्रव॒णे मु॑षायति
stanzas.transliteration: prá va eté suyújo yā́mann iṣṭáye nī́cīr amúṣmai yamyà r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ suyántubhiḥ sarvaśāsaír abhī́śubhiḥ krívir nā́māni pravaṇé muṣāyati
stanzas.translation: These come, well-yoked, to you for furtherance in the rite: down come the twinborn strengtheners of Law for him, With reins easily guided and commanding all. In the deep fall the hide stealeth away their names.

translations.griffith: These come, well-yoked, to you for furtherance in the rite: down come the twinborn strengtheners of Law for him, With reins easily guided and commanding all. In the deep fall the hide stealeth away their names.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं॒जर्भु॑राण॒स्तरु॑भिः सुते॒गृभं॑ वया॒किनं॑ चि॒त्तग॑र्भासु सु॒स्वरुः॑ धा॒र॒वा॒केष्वृ॑जुगाथ शोभसे॒ वर्ध॑स्व॒ पत्नी॑र॒भि जी॒वो अ॑ध्व॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: saṃjárbhurāṇas tárubhiḥ sutegŕ̥bhaṃ vayākínaṃ cittágarbhāsu susváruḥ dhāravākéṣv r̥jugātha śobhase várdhasva pátnīr abhí jīvó adhvaré
stanzas.translation: Thou, moving beauteously in visibly pregnant ones, snatching with trees the branching plant that grasps the juice, Shinest, true Singer! mid the upholders of the voice. Increase thy Consorts thou, lively at sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Thou, moving beauteously in visibly pregnant ones, snatching with trees the branching plant that grasps the juice, Shinest, true Singer! mid the upholders of the voice. Increase thy Consorts thou, lively at sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: या॒दृगे॒व ददृ॑शे ता॒दृगु॑च्यते॒ सं छा॒यया॑ दधिरे सि॒ध्रया॒प्स्वा म॒हीम॒स्मभ्य॑मुरु॒षामु॒रु ज्रयो॑ बृ॒हत्सु॒वीर॒मन॑पच्युतं॒ सहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yādŕ̥g evá dádr̥śe tādŕ̥g ucyate sáṃ chāyáyā dadhire sidhráyāpsv ā́ mahī́m asmábhyam uruṣā́m urú jráyo br̥hát suvī́ram ánapacyutaṃ sáhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like as he is beheld such is he said to be. They with effectual splendour in the floods have made Earth yield us room enough and amply wide extent, great might invincible, with store of hero sons.

translations.griffith: Like as he is beheld such is he said to be. They with effectual splendour in the floods have made Earth yield us room enough and amply wide extent, great might invincible, with store of hero sons.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेत्यग्रु॒र्जनि॑वा॒न्वा अति॒ स्पृधः॑ समर्य॒ता मन॑सा॒ सूर्यः॑ क॒विः घ्रं॒सं रक्ष॑न्तं॒ परि॑ वि॒श्वतो॒ गय॑म॒स्माकं॒ शर्म॑ वनव॒त्स्वाव॑सुः
stanzas.transliteration: véty ágrur jánivān vā́ áti spŕ̥dhaḥ samaryatā́ mánasā sū́ryaḥ kavíḥ ghraṃsáṃ rákṣantam pári viśváto gáyam asmā́kaṃ śárma vanavat svā́vasuḥ
stanzas.translation: Sûrya the Sage, as if unwedded, with a Spouse, in battle-loving spirit moveth o'er the foes. May he, self-excellent, grant us a sheltering home, a house that wards the fierce heat off on every side.

translations.griffith: Sûrya the Sage, as if unwedded, with a Spouse, in battle-loving spirit moveth o'er the foes. May he, self-excellent, grant us a sheltering home, a house that wards the fierce heat off on every side.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज्यायां॑सम॒स्य य॒तुन॑स्य के॒तुन॑ ऋषिस्व॒रं च॑रति॒ यासु॒ नाम॑ ते या॒दृश्मि॒न्धायि॒ तम॑प॒स्यया॑ विद॒द्य उ॑ स्व॒यं वह॑ते॒ सो अरं॑ करत्
stanzas.transliteration: jyā́yāṃsam asyá yatúnasya ketúnā- r̥ṣisvaráṃ carati yā́su nā́ma te yādŕ̥śmin dhā́yi tám apasyáyā vidad yá u svayáṃ váhate só áraṃ karat
stanzas.translation: Thy name, sung forth by R̥ishis in these hymns of ours, goes to the loftier One with this swift mover's light. By skill he wins the boon whereon his heart is set: he who bestirs himself shall bring the thing to pass.

translations.griffith: Thy name, sung forth by R̥ishis in these hymns of ours, goes to the loftier One with this swift mover's light. By skill he wins the boon whereon his heart is set: he who bestirs himself shall bring the thing to pass.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मु॒द्रमा॑सा॒मव॑ तस्थे अग्रि॒मा न रि॑ष्यति॒ सव॑नं॒ यस्मि॒न्नाय॑ता अत्रा॒ न हार्दि॑ क्रव॒णस्य॑ रेजते॒ यत्रा॑ म॒तिर्वि॒द्यते॑ पूत॒बन्ध॑नी
stanzas.transliteration: samudrám āsām áva tasthe agrimā́ ná riṣyati sávanaṃ yásminn ā́yatā átrā ná hā́rdi kravaṇásya rejate yátrā matír vidyáte pūtabándhanī
stanzas.translation: The chief and best of these abideth in the sea, nor doth libation fail wherein it is prolonged. The heart of him who praiseth trembleth not in fear there where the hymn is found connected with the pure.

translations.griffith: The chief and best of these abideth in the sea, nor doth libation fail wherein it is prolonged. The heart of him who praiseth trembleth not in fear there where the hymn is found connected with the pure.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि क्ष॒त्रस्य॑ मन॒सस्य॒ चित्ति॑भिरेवाव॒दस्य॑ यज॒तस्य॒ सध्रेः॑ अ॒व॒त्सा॒रस्य॑ स्पृणवाम॒ रण्व॑भिः॒ शवि॑ष्ठं॒ वाजं॑ वि॒दुषा॑ चि॒दर्ध्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí kṣatrásya manasásya cíttibhir evāvadásya yajatásya sádhreḥ avatsārásya spr̥ṇavāma ráṇvabhiḥ śáviṣṭhaṃ vā́jaṃ vidúṣā cid árdhyam
stanzas.translation: For it is he: with though to of Kshatra, Mânasa, of Yajata, and Sadhri, and Evâvada, With Avatsâra's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should gain.

translations.griffith: For it is he: with though to of Kshatra, Mânasa, of Yajata, and Sadhri, and Evâvada, With Avatsâra's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should gain.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्ये॒न आ॑सा॒मदि॑तिः क॒क्ष्यो॒३॒॑ मदो॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य यज॒तस्य॑ मा॒यिनः॑ सम॒न्यम॑न्यमर्थय॒न्त्येत॑वे वि॒दुर्वि॒षाणं॑ परि॒पान॒मन्ति॒ ते
stanzas.transliteration: śyená āsām áditiḥ kakṣyò mádo viśvávārasya yajatásya māyínaḥ sám anyám-anyam arthayanty étave vidúr viṣā́ṇam paripā́nam ánti té
stanzas.translation: The Hawk is their full source, girth-stretching rapturous drink of Viṣvavâra, of Mayin, and Yajata. They ever seek a fresh draught so that they may come, know when thy time to halt and drink thy fill is near.

translations.griffith: The Hawk is their full source, girth-stretching rapturous drink of Viṣvavâra, of Mayin, and Yajata. They ever seek a fresh draught so that they may come, know when thy time to halt and drink thy fill is near.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒दा॒पृ॒णो य॑ज॒तो वि द्विषो॑ वधीद्बाहुवृ॒क्तः श्रु॑त॒वित्तर्यो॑ वः॒ सचा॑ उ॒भा स वरा॒ प्रत्ये॑ति॒ भाति॑ च॒ यदीं॑ ग॒णं भज॑ते सुप्र॒याव॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: sadāpr̥ṇó yajató ví dvíṣo vadhīd bāhuvr̥ktáḥ śrutavít táryo vaḥ sácā ubhā́ sá várā práty eti bhā́ti ca yád īṃ gaṇám bhájate suprayā́vabhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Sadâpr̥iṇa the holy, Tarya, Ṣrutavit, and Bâhuvr̥ikta, joined with you, have slain the foes. He gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shines-when he adores the host with welladvancing steeds.

translations.griffith: Sadâpr̥iṇa the holy, Tarya, Ṣrutavit, and Bâhuvr̥ikta, joined with you, have slain the foes. He gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shines-when he adores the host with welladvancing steeds.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒त॒म्भ॒रो यज॑मानस्य॒ सत्प॑ति॒र्विश्वा॑सा॒मूधः॒ स धि॒यामु॒दञ्च॑नः भर॑द्धे॒नू रस॑वच्छिश्रिये॒ पयो॑ऽनुब्रुवा॒णो अध्ये॑ति॒ न स्व॒पन्
stanzas.transliteration: sutambharó yájamānasya sátpatir víśvāsām ū́dhaḥ sá dhiyā́m udáñcanaḥ bhárad dhenū́ rásavac chiśriye páyo -anubruvāṇó ádhy eti ná svapán
stanzas.translation: The worshipper's defender is Sutambhara, producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts. The milch-cow brought, sweet-flavoured milk was dealt around. Who speaks the bidding text knows this, not he who sleeps.

translations.griffith: The worshipper's defender is Sutambhara, producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts. The milch-cow brought, sweet-flavoured milk was dealt around. Who speaks the bidding text knows this, not he who sleeps.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो जा॒गार॒ तमृचः॑ कामयन्ते॒ यो जा॒गार॒ तमु॒ सामा॑नि यन्ति यो जा॒गार॒ तम॒यं सोम॑ आह॒ तवा॒हम॑स्मि स॒ख्ये न्यो॑काः
stanzas.transliteration: yó jāgā́ra tám ŕ̥caḥ kāmayante yó jāgā́ra tám u sā́māni yanti yó jāgā́ra tám ayáṃ sóma āha távāhám asmi sakhyé nyòkāḥ
stanzas.translation: The sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches: to him who watches come the Sâma verses. This Soma saith unto the man who watches, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

translations.griffith: The sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches: to him who watches come the Sâma verses. This Soma saith unto the man who watches, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तमृचः॑ कामयन्ते॒ऽग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तमु॒ सामा॑नि यन्ति अ॒ग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तम॒यं सोम॑ आह॒ तवा॒हम॑स्मि स॒ख्ये न्यो॑काः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír jāgāra tám ŕ̥caḥ kāmayante -agnír jāgāra tám u sā́māni yanti agnír jāgāra tám ayáṃ sóma āha távāhám asmi sakhyé nyòkāḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni is watchful, and the gcas love him; Agni is watchful, Sâma verses seek him. Agni is watchful, to him saith this Soma, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

translations.griffith: Agni is watchful, and the gcas love him; Agni is watchful, Sâma verses seek him. Agni is watchful, to him saith this Soma, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒दा दि॒वो वि॒ष्यन्नद्रि॑मु॒क्थैरा॑य॒त्या उ॒षसो॑ अ॒र्चिनो॑ गुः अपा॑वृत व्र॒जिनी॒रुत्स्व॑र्गा॒द्वि दुरो॒ मानु॑षीर्दे॒व आ॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: vidā́ divó viṣyánn ádrim ukthaír āyatyā́ uṣáso arcíno guḥ ápāvr̥ta vrajínīr út svàr gād ví dúro mā́nuṣīr devá āvaḥ
stanzas.translation: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open. The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

translations.griffith: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open. The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि सूर्यो॑ अ॒मतिं॒ न श्रियं॑ सा॒दोर्वाद्गवां॑ मा॒ता जा॑न॒ती गा॑त् धन्व॑र्णसो न॒द्य१॒॑ः खादो॑अर्णाः॒ स्थूणे॑व॒ सुमि॑ता दृंहत॒ द्यौः
stanzas.transliteration: ví sū́ryo amátiṃ ná śríyaṃ sād órvā́d gávām mātā́ jānatī́ gāt dhánvarṇaso nadyàḥ khā́doarṇāḥ- sthū́ṇeva súmitā dr̥ṃhata dyaúḥ
stanzas.translation: Sûrya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable, To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

translations.griffith: Sûrya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable, To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मा उ॒क्थाय॒ पर्व॑तस्य॒ गर्भो॑ म॒हीनां॑ ज॒नुषे॑ पू॒र्व्याय॑ वि पर्व॑तो॒ जिही॑त॒ साध॑त॒ द्यौरा॒विवा॑सन्तो दसयन्त॒ भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́ ukthā́ya párvatasya gárbho mahī́nāṃ janúṣe pūrvyā́ya ví párvato jíhīta sā́dhata dyaúr āvívāsanto dasayanta bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

translations.griffith: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

stanzas.sanskrit: सू॒क्तेभि॑र्वो॒ वचो॑भिर्दे॒वजु॑ष्टै॒रिन्द्रा॒ न्व१॒॑ग्नी अव॑से हु॒वध्यै॑ उ॒क्थेभि॒र्हि ष्मा॑ क॒वयः॑ सुय॒ज्ञा आ॒विवा॑सन्तो म॒रुतो॒ यज॑न्ति
stanzas.transliteration: sūktébhir vo vácobhir devájuṣṭair índrā nv àgnī́ ávase huvádhyai ukthébhir hí ṣmā kaváyaḥ suyajñā́ḥ- āvívāsanto marúto yájanti
stanzas.translation: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour, For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

translations.griffith: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour, For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

stanzas.sanskrit: एतो॒ न्व१॒॑द्य सु॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ भवा॑म॒ प्र दु॒च्छुना॑ मिनवामा॒ वरी॑यः आ॒रे द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तर्द॑धा॒माया॑म॒ प्राञ्चो॒ यज॑मान॒मच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: éto nv àdyá sudhyò bhávāma prá duchúnām inavāmā várīyaḥ āré dvéṣāṃsi sanutár dadhāma- -áyāma prā́ñco yájamānam ácha
stanzas.translation: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune. Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

translations.griffith: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune. Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: एता॒ धियं॑ कृ॒णवा॑मा सखा॒योऽप॒ या मा॒ताँ ऋ॑णु॒त व्र॒जं गोः यया॒ मनु॑र्विशिशि॒प्रं जि॒गाय॒ यया॑ व॒णिग्व॒ङ्कुरापा॒ पुरी॑षम्
stanzas.transliteration: étā dhíyaṃ kr̥ṇávāmā sakhāyaḥ- -ápa yā́ mātā́m̐ r̥ṇutá vrajáṃ góḥ yáyā mánur viśiśipráṃ jigā́ya yáyā vaṇíg vaṅkúr ā́pā púrīṣam
stanzas.translation: Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open, That wherewith Manu conquered Viṣiṣipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.

translations.griffith: Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open, That wherewith Manu conquered Viṣiṣipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनू॑नो॒दत्र॒ हस्त॑यतो॒ अद्रि॒रार्च॒न्येन॒ दश॑ मा॒सो नव॑ग्वाः ऋ॒तं य॒ती स॒रमा॒ गा अ॑विन्द॒द्विश्वा॑नि स॒त्याङ्गि॑राश्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: ánūnod átra hástayato ádrir ā́rcan yéna dáśa māsó návagvāḥ r̥táṃ yatī́ sarámā gā́ avindad víśvāni satyā́ṅgirāś cakāra
stanzas.translation: Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises. Saramâ went aright and found the cattle. Angiras gave effect to all their labours.

translations.griffith: Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises. Saramâ went aright and found the cattle. Angiras gave effect to all their labours.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ अ॒स्या व्युषि॒ माहि॑नायाः॒ सं यद्गोभि॒रङ्गि॑रसो॒ नव॑न्त उत्स॑ आसां पर॒मे स॒धस्थ॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒था स॒रमा॑ विद॒द्गाः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve asyā́ vyúṣi mā́hināyāḥ sáṃ yád góbhir áṅgiraso návanta útsa āsām paramé sadhásthe- r̥tásya pathā́ sarámā vidad gā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Angirases all sang forth with the cattle,– Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,– Saramâ found the kine by Order's pathway.

translations.griffith: When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Angirases all sang forth with the cattle,– Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,– Saramâ found the kine by Order's pathway.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो॑ यातु स॒प्ताश्वः॒ क्षेत्रं॒ यद॑स्योर्वि॒या दी॑र्घया॒थे र॒घुः श्ये॒नः प॑तय॒दन्धो॒ अच्छा॒ युवा॑ क॒विर्दी॑दय॒द्गोषु॒ गच्छ॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sū́ryo yātu saptā́śvaḥ kṣétraṃ yád asyorviyā́ dīrghayāthé raghúḥ śyenáḥ patayad ándho áchā yúvā kavír dīdayad góṣu gáchan
stanzas.translation: Borne by his Coursers Seven may Sûrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey. Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.

translations.griffith: Borne by his Coursers Seven may Sûrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey. Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो॑ अरुहच्छु॒क्रमर्णोऽयु॑क्त॒ यद्ध॒रितो॑ वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठाः उ॒द्ना न नाव॑मनयन्त॒ धीरा॑ आशृण्व॒तीरापो॑ अ॒र्वाग॑तिष्ठन्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sū́ryo aruhac chukrám árṇaḥ- -áyukta yád dharíto vītápr̥ṣṭhāḥ udnā́ ná nā́vam anayanta dhī́rāḥ- āśr̥ṇvatī́r ā́po arvā́g atiṣṭhan
stanzas.translation: Sûrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses. The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.

translations.griffith: Sûrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses. The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: धियं॑ वो अ॒प्सु द॑धिषे स्व॒र्षां ययात॑र॒न्दश॑ मा॒सो नव॑ग्वाः अ॒या धि॒या स्या॑म दे॒वगो॑पा अ॒या धि॒या तु॑तुर्या॒मात्यंहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhíyaṃ vo apsú dadhiṣe svarṣā́ṃ yáyā́taran dáśa māsó návagvāḥ ayā́ dhiyā́ syāma devágopāḥ- ayā́ dhiyā́ tuturyāmā́ty áṃhaḥ
stanzas.translation: I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed. Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.

translations.griffith: I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed. Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.

stanzas.sanskrit: हयो॒ न वि॒द्वाँ अ॑युजि स्व॒यं धु॒रि तां व॑हामि प्र॒तर॑णीमव॒स्युव॑म् नास्या॑ वश्मि वि॒मुचं॒ नावृतं॒ पुन॑र्वि॒द्वान्प॒थः पु॑रए॒त ऋ॒जु ने॑षति
stanzas.transliteration: háyo ná vidvā́m̐ ayuji svayáṃ dhurí tā́ṃ vahāmi pratáraṇīm avasyúvam nā́syā vaśmi vimúcaṃ nā́vŕ̥tam púnar vidvā́n patháḥ puraetá r̥jú neṣati
stanzas.translation: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help. I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

translations.griffith: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help. I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्न॒ इन्द्र॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ देवाः॒ शर्धः॒ प्र य॑न्त॒ मारु॑तो॒त वि॑ष्णो उ॒भा नास॑त्या रु॒द्रो अध॒ ग्नाः पू॒षा भगः॒ सर॑स्वती जुषन्त
stanzas.transliteration: ágna índra váruṇa mítra dévāḥ śárdhaḥ prá yanta mā́rutotá viṣṇo ubhā́ nā́satyā rudró ádha gnā́ḥ pūṣā́ bhágaḥ sárasvatī juṣanta
stanzas.translation: O Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Vishṇu. May both Nâsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pûshan, Sarasvatî, Bhaga, accept us.

translations.griffith: O Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Vishṇu. May both Nâsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pûshan, Sarasvatî, Bhaga, accept us.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी मि॒त्रावरु॒णादि॑तिं॒ स्वः॑ पृथि॒वीं द्यां म॒रुतः॒ पर्व॑ताँ अ॒पः हु॒वे विष्णुं॑ पू॒षणं॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिं॒ भगं॒ नु शंसं॑ सवि॒तार॑मू॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: indrāgnī́ mitrā́váruṇā́ditiṃ svàḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m marútaḥ párvatām̐ apáḥ huvé víṣṇum pūṣáṇam bráhmaṇas pátim bhágaṃ nú śáṃsaṃ savitā́ram ūtáye
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven, Vishṇu I call, Pûshan, and Brahmaṇaspati, and Bhaga, Ṣaṅsa, Savitar that they may help.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven, Vishṇu I call, Pûshan, and Brahmaṇaspati, and Bhaga, Ṣaṅsa, Savitar that they may help.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नो॒ विष्णु॑रु॒त वातो॑ अ॒स्रिधो॑ द्रविणो॒दा उ॒त सोमो॒ मय॑स्करत् उ॒त ऋ॒भव॑ उ॒त रा॒ये नो॑ अ॒श्विनो॒त त्वष्टो॒त विभ्वानु॑ मंसते
stanzas.transliteration: utá no víṣṇur utá vā́to asrídho draviṇodā́ utá sómo máyas karat utá r̥bháva utá rāyé no aśvínā- -utá tváṣṭotá víbhvā́nu maṃsate
stanzas.translation: May Vishṇu also and Vâta who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy; And may the R̥ibhus and the Aṣvins, Tvashṭar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

translations.griffith: May Vishṇu also and Vâta who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy; And may the R̥ibhus and the Aṣvins, Tvashṭar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्यन्नो॒ मारु॑तं॒ शर्ध॒ आ ग॑मद्दिविक्ष॒यं य॑ज॒तं ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑ बृह॒स्पतिः॒ शर्म॑ पू॒षोत नो॑ यमद्वरू॒थ्यं१॒॑ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyán no mā́rutaṃ śárdha ā́ gamad divikṣayáṃ yajatám barhír āsáde bŕ̥haspátiḥ śárma pūṣótá no yamad varūthyàṃ váruṇo mitró aryamā́
stanzas.translation: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass; Br̥ihaspati and Pûshan grant us sure defence, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

translations.griffith: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass; Br̥ihaspati and Pûshan grant us sure defence, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्ये नः॒ पर्व॑तासः सुश॒स्तयः॑ सुदी॒तयो॑ न॒द्य१॒॑स्त्राम॑णे भुवन् भगो॑ विभ॒क्ता शव॒साव॒सा ग॑मदुरु॒व्यचा॒ अदि॑तिः श्रोतु मे॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyé naḥ párvatāsaḥ suśastáyaḥ sudītáyo nadyàs trā́maṇe bhuvan bhágo vibhaktā́ śávasā́vasā́ gamad uruvyácā áditiḥ śrotu me hávam
stanzas.translation: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm. May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

translations.griffith: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm. May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वानां॒ पत्नी॑रुश॒तीर॑वन्तु नः॒ प्राव॑न्तु नस्तु॒जये॒ वाज॑सातये याः पार्थि॑वासो॒ या अ॒पामपि॑ व्र॒ते ता नो॑ देवीः सुहवाः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत
stanzas.transliteration: devā́nām pátnīr uśatī́r avantu naḥ prā́vantu nas tujáye vā́jasātaye yā́ḥ pā́rthivāso yā́ apā́m ápi vraté tā́ no devīḥ suhavāḥ śárma yachata
stanzas.translation: May the Gods' Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil. Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

translations.griffith: May the Gods' Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil. Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त ग्ना व्य॑न्तु दे॒वप॑त्नीरिन्द्रा॒ण्य१॒॑ग्नाय्य॒श्विनी॒ राट् आ रोद॑सी वरुणा॒नी शृ॑णोतु॒ व्यन्तु॑ दे॒वीर्य ऋ॒तुर्जनी॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá gnā́ vyantu devápatnīr indrāṇy àgnā́yy aśvínī rā́ṭ ā́ ródasī varuṇānī́ śr̥ṇotu vyántu devī́r yá r̥túr jánīnām
stanzas.translation: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Râṭ, Aṣvinî, Agnâyî, and Indrânî. May Rodasî and Varuṇânî hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

translations.griffith: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Râṭ, Aṣvinî, Agnâyî, and Indrânî. May Rodasî and Varuṇânî hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒यु॒ञ्ज॒ती दि॒व ए॑ति ब्रुवा॒णा म॒ही मा॒ता दु॑हि॒तुर्बो॒धय॑न्ती आ॒विवा॑सन्ती युव॒तिर्म॑नी॒षा पि॒तृभ्य॒ आ सद॑ने॒ जोहु॑वाना
stanzas.transliteration: prayuñjatī́ divá eti bruvāṇā́ mahī́ mātā́ duhitúr bodháyantī āvívāsantī yuvatír manīṣā́ pitŕ̥bhya ā́ sádane jóhuvānā
stanzas.translation: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

translations.griffith: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒जि॒रास॒स्तद॑प॒ ईय॑माना आतस्थि॒वांसो॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म् अ॒न॒न्तास॑ उ॒रवो॑ वि॒श्वतः॑ सीं॒ परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी य॑न्ति॒ पन्थाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ajirā́sas tádapa ī́yamānāḥ- ātasthivā́ṃso amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim anantā́sa urávo viśvátaḥ sīm pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yanti pánthāḥ
stanzas.translation: Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal, On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.

translations.griffith: Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal, On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒क्षा स॑मु॒द्रो अ॑रु॒षः सु॑प॒र्णः पूर्व॑स्य॒ योनिं॑ पि॒तुरा वि॑वेश मध्ये॑ दि॒वो निहि॑तः॒ पृश्नि॒रश्मा॒ वि च॑क्रमे॒ रज॑सस्पा॒त्यन्तौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ukṣā́ samudró aruṣáḥ suparṇáḥ pū́rvasya yónim pitúr ā́ viveśa mádhye divó níhitaḥ pŕ̥śnir áśmā ví cakrame rájasas pāty ántau
stanzas.translation: Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father. A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.

translations.griffith: Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father. A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.

stanzas.sanskrit: च॒त्वार॑ ईं बिभ्रति क्षेम॒यन्तो॒ दश॒ गर्भं॑ च॒रसे॑ धापयन्ते त्रि॒धात॑वः पर॒मा अ॑स्य॒ गावो॑ दि॒वश्च॑रन्ति॒ परि॑ स॒द्यो अन्ता॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: catvā́ra īm bibhrati kṣemayánto dáśa gárbhaṃ caráse dhāpayante tridhā́tavaḥ paramā́ asya gā́vo diváś caranti pári sadyó ántān
stanzas.translation: Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel. His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.

translations.griffith: Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel. His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं वपु॑र्नि॒वच॑नं जनास॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ यन्न॒द्य॑स्त॒स्थुरापः॑ द्वे यदीं॑ बिभृ॒तो मा॒तुर॒न्ये इ॒हेह॑ जा॒ते य॒म्या॒३॒॑ सब॑न्धू
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ vápur nivácanaṃ janāsaś cáranti yán nadyàs tasthúr ā́paḥ dvé yád īm bibhr̥tó mātúr anyé ihéha jāté yamyā̀ sábandhū
stanzas.translation: Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing: That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.

translations.griffith: Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing: That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि त॑न्वते॒ धियो॑ अस्मा॒ अपां॑सि॒ वस्त्रा॑ पु॒त्राय॑ मा॒तरो॑ वयन्ति उ॒प॒प्र॒क्षे वृष॑णो॒ मोद॑माना दि॒वस्प॒था व॒ध्वो॑ य॒न्त्यच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví tanvate dhíyo asmā ápāṃsi vástrā putrā́ya mātáro vayanti upaprakṣé vŕ̥ṣaṇo módamānāḥ- divás pathā́ vadhvò yanty ácha
stanzas.translation: For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring. Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.

translations.griffith: For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring. Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद॑स्तु मित्रावरुणा॒ तद॑ग्ने॒ शं योर॒स्मभ्य॑मि॒दम॑स्तु श॒स्तम् अ॒शी॒महि॑ गा॒धमु॒त प्र॑ति॒ष्ठां नमो॑ दि॒वे बृ॑ह॒ते साद॑नाय
stanzas.transliteration: tád astu mitrāvaruṇā tád agne śáṃ yór asmábhyam idám astu śastám aśīmáhi gādhám utá pratiṣṭhā́ṃ námo divé br̥haté sā́danāya
stanzas.translation: Be this our praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni. May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!

translations.griffith: Be this our praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni. May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!

stanzas.sanskrit: कदु॑ प्रि॒याय॒ धाम्ने॑ मनामहे॒ स्वक्ष॑त्राय॒ स्वय॑शसे म॒हे व॒यम् आ॒मे॒न्यस्य॒ रज॑सो॒ यद॒भ्र आँ अ॒पो वृ॑णा॒ना वि॑त॒नोति॑ मा॒यिनी॑
stanzas.transliteration: kád u priyā́ya dhā́mne manāmahe svákṣatrāya sváyaśase mahé vayám āmenyásya rájaso yád abhrá ā́m̐ apó vr̥ṇānā́ vitanóti māyínī
stanzas.translation: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself, Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?

translations.griffith: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself, Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?

stanzas.sanskrit: ता अ॑त्नत व॒युनं॑ वी॒रव॑क्षणं समा॒न्या वृ॒तया॒ विश्व॒मा रजः॑ अपो॒ अपा॑ची॒रप॑रा॒ अपे॑जते॒ प्र पूर्वा॑भिस्तिरते देव॒युर्जनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ atnata vayúnaṃ vīrávakṣaṇaṃ samānyā́ vr̥táyā víśvam ā́ rájaḥ ápo ápācīr áparā ápejate prá pū́rvābhis tirate devayúr jánaḥ
stanzas.translation: O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength. Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are before.

translations.griffith: O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength. Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are before.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ग्राव॑भिरह॒न्ये॑भिर॒क्तुभि॒र्वरि॑ष्ठं॒ वज्र॒मा जि॑घर्ति मा॒यिनि॑ श॒तं वा॒ यस्य॑ प्र॒चर॒न्त्स्वे दमे॑ संव॒र्तय॑न्तो॒ वि च॑ वर्तय॒न्नहा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ grā́vabhir ahanyèbhir aktúbhir váriṣṭhaṃ vájram ā́ jigharti māyíni śatáṃ vā yásya pracáran své dáme saṃvartáyanto ví ca vartayann áhā
stanzas.translation: With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful One. Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.

translations.griffith: With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful One. Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.

stanzas.sanskrit: ताम॑स्य री॒तिं प॑र॒शोरि॑व॒ प्रत्यनी॑कमख्यं भु॒जे अ॑स्य॒ वर्प॑सः सचा॒ यदि॑ पितु॒मन्त॑मिव॒ क्षयं॒ रत्नं॒ दधा॑ति॒ भर॑हूतये वि॒शे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́m asya rītím paraśór iva práti- ánīkam akhyam bhujé asya várpasaḥ sácā yádi pitumántam iva kṣáyaṃ rátnaṃ dádhāti bhárahūtaye viśé
stanzas.translation: I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as 'twere an axe's edge, What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store of food.

translations.griffith: I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as 'twere an axe's edge, What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store of food.

stanzas.sanskrit: स जि॒ह्वया॒ चतु॑रनीक ऋञ्जते॒ चारु॒ वसा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो॒ यत॑न्न॒रिम् न तस्य॑ विद्म पुरुष॒त्वता॑ व॒यं यतो॒ भगः॑ सवि॒ता दाति॒ वार्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá jihváyā cáturanīka r̥ñjate cā́ru vásāno váruṇo yátann arím ná tásya vidma puruṣatvátā vayáṃ yáto bhágaḥ savitā́ dā́ti vā́ryam
stanzas.translation: Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuṇa, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue. Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.

translations.griffith: Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuṇa, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue. Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वं वो॑ अ॒द्य स॑वि॒तार॒मेषे॒ भगं॑ च॒ रत्नं॑ वि॒भज॑न्तमा॒योः आ वां॑ नरा पुरुभुजा ववृत्यां दि॒वेदि॑वे चिदश्विना सखी॒यन्
stanzas.transliteration: deváṃ vo adyá savitā́ram éṣe bhágaṃ ca rátnaṃ vibhájantam āyóḥ ā́ vāṃ narā purubhujā vavr̥tyāṃ divé-dive cid aśvinā sakhīyán
stanzas.translation: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals. You, Aṣvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

translations.griffith: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals. You, Aṣvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॑ प्र॒याण॒मसु॑रस्य वि॒द्वान्त्सू॒क्तैर्दे॒वं स॑वि॒तारं॑ दुवस्य उप॑ ब्रुवीत॒ नम॑सा विजा॒नञ्ज्येष्ठं॑ च॒ रत्नं॑ वि॒भज॑न्तमा॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: práti prayā́ṇam ásurasya vidvā́n sūktaír deváṃ savitā́raṃ duvasya úpa bruvīta námasā vijānáñ jyéṣṭhaṃ ca rátnaṃ vibhájantam āyóḥ
stanzas.translation: Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises. Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.

translations.griffith: Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises. Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒द॒त्र॒या द॑यते॒ वार्या॑णि पू॒षा भगो॒ अदि॑ति॒र्वस्त॑ उ॒स्रः इन्द्रो॒ विष्णु॒र्वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निरहा॑नि भ॒द्रा ज॑नयन्त द॒स्माः
stanzas.transliteration: adatrayā́ dayate vā́ryāṇi pūṣā́ bhágo áditir vásta usráḥ índro víṣṇur váruṇo mitró agnír áhāni bhadrā́ janayanta dasmā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Not for reward doth Pûshan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour. May Indra, Visniu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.

translations.griffith: Not for reward doth Pûshan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour. May Indra, Visniu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.

stanzas.sanskrit: तन्नो॑ अन॒र्वा स॑वि॒ता वरू॑थं॒ तत्सिन्ध॑व इ॒षय॑न्तो॒ अनु॑ ग्मन् उप॒ यद्वोचे॑ अध्व॒रस्य॒ होता॑ रा॒यः स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो॒ वाज॑रत्नाः
stanzas.transliteration: tán no anarvā́ savitā́ várūthaṃ tát síndhava iṣáyanto ánu gman úpa yád vóce adhvarásya hótā rāyáḥ syāma pátayo vā́jaratnāḥ
stanzas.translation: Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us. When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.

translations.griffith: Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us. When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ये वसु॑भ्य॒ ईव॒दा नमो॒ दुर्ये मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे सू॒क्तवा॑चः अवै॒त्वभ्वं॑ कृणु॒ता वरी॑यो दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योरव॑सा मदेम
stanzas.transliteration: prá yé vásubhya ī́vad ā́ námo dúr yé mitré váruṇe sūktávācaḥ ávaitv ábhvaṃ kr̥ṇutā́ várīyo diváspr̥thivyór ávasā madema
stanzas.translation: They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuṇa and Mitra, Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.

translations.griffith: They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuṇa and Mitra, Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ ने॒तुर्मर्तो॑ वुरीत स॒ख्यम् विश्वो॑ रा॒य इ॑षुध्यति द्यु॒म्नं वृ॑णीत पु॒ष्यसे॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvo devásya netúr márto vurīta sakhyám víśvo rāyá iṣudhyati dyumnáṃ vr̥ṇīta puṣyáse
stanzas.translation: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

translations.griffith: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते ते॑ देव नेत॒र्ये चे॒माँ अ॑नु॒शसे॑ ते रा॒या ते ह्या॒३॒॑पृचे॒ सचे॑महि सच॒थ्यैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: té te deva netar yé cemā́m̐ anuśáse té rāyā́ té hy ā̀pŕ̥ce sácemahi sacathyaìḥ
stanzas.translation: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us. As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

translations.griffith: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us. As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अतो॑ न॒ आ नॄनति॑थी॒नतः॒ पत्नी॑र्दशस्यत आ॒रे विश्वं॑ पथे॒ष्ठां द्वि॒षो यु॑योतु॒ यूयु॑विः
stanzas.transliteration: áto na ā́ nr̥̄́n átithīn átaḥ pátnīr daśasyata āré víśvam patheṣṭhā́ṃ dviṣó yuyotu yū́yuviḥ
stanzas.translation: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames. May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

translations.griffith: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames. May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॒ वह्नि॑र॒भिहि॑तो दु॒द्रव॒द्द्रोण्यः॑ प॒शुः नृ॒मणा॑ वी॒रप॒स्त्योऽर्णा॒ धीरे॑व॒ सनि॑ता
stanzas.transliteration: yátra váhnir abhíhito dudrávad dróṇyaḥ paśúḥ nr̥máṇā vīrápastyaḥ- -árṇā dhī́reva sánitā
stanzas.translation: Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough, He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.

translations.griffith: Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough, He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष ते॑ देव नेता॒ रथ॒स्पतिः॒ शं र॒यिः शं रा॒ये शं स्व॒स्तय॑ इषः॒स्तुतो॑ मनामहे देव॒स्तुतो॑ मनामहे
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá te deva netar- ráthaspátiḥ śáṃ rayíḥ śáṃ rāyé śáṃ svastáye iṣastúto manāmahe devastúto manāmahe
stanzas.translation: May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us, Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise the God.

translations.griffith: May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us, Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise the God.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॒ विश्वै॒रूमे॑भि॒रा ग॑हि दे॒वेभि॑र्ह॒व्यदा॑तये
stanzas.transliteration: ágne sutásya pītáye víśvair ū́mebhir ā́ gahi devébhir havyádātaye
stanzas.translation: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice; With Gods unto our sacred gifts.

translations.griffith: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice; With Gods unto our sacred gifts.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋत॑धीतय॒ आ ग॑त॒ सत्य॑धर्माणो अध्व॒रम् अ॒ग्नेः पि॑बत जि॒ह्वया॑
stanzas.transliteration: ŕ̥tadhītaya ā́ gata sátyadharmāṇo adhvarám agnéḥ pibata jihváyā
stanzas.translation: Come to the sacrifice, O ye whose ways are right, whose laws are true, And drink the draught with Agni's tongue.

translations.griffith: Come to the sacrifice, O ye whose ways are right, whose laws are true, And drink the draught with Agni's tongue.

stanzas.sanskrit: विप्रे॑भिर्विप्र सन्त्य प्रात॒र्याव॑भि॒रा ग॑हि दे॒वेभिः॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: víprebhir vipra santya prātaryā́vabhir ā́ gahi devébhiḥ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: O Singer, with the singers, O Gracious, with those who move at dawn, Come to the Soma-draught with Gods.

translations.griffith: O Singer, with the singers, O Gracious, with those who move at dawn, Come to the Soma-draught with Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं सोम॑श्च॒मू सु॒तोऽम॑त्रे॒ परि॑ षिच्यते प्रि॒य इन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ sómaś camū́ sutó -ámatre pári ṣicyate priyá índrāya vāyáve
stanzas.translation: To Indra and to Vâyu dear, this Soma, by the mortar pressed, Is now poured forth to fill the jar.

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Vâyu dear, this Soma, by the mortar pressed, Is now poured forth to fill the jar.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाय॒वा या॑हि वी॒तये॑ जुषा॒णो ह॒व्यदा॑तये पिबा॑ सु॒तस्यान्ध॑सो अ॒भि प्रयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vā́yav ā́ yāhi vītáye juṣāṇó havyádātaye píbā sutásyā́ndhaso abhí práyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Vâyu, come hither to the feast, wellpleased unto our sacred gifts: Drink of the Soma juice effused come to the food.

translations.griffith: Vâyu, come hither to the feast, wellpleased unto our sacred gifts: Drink of the Soma juice effused come to the food.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑श्च वायवेषां सु॒तानां॑ पी॒तिम॑र्हथः ताञ्जु॑षेथामरे॒पसा॑व॒भि प्रयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ sutā́nām pītím arhathaḥ tā́ñ juṣethām arepásāv abhí práyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye, Indra, Vâyu, well deserve to drink the juices pressed by us. Gladly accept them, spotless Pair come to the food.

translations.griffith: Ye, Indra, Vâyu, well deserve to drink the juices pressed by us. Gladly accept them, spotless Pair come to the food.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒ता इन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॒ सोमा॑सो॒ दध्या॑शिरः नि॒म्नं न य॑न्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ऽभि प्रयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sutā́ índrāya vāyáve sómāso dádhyāśiraḥ nimnáṃ ná yanti síndhavo abhí práyaḥ
stanzas.translation: For Indra and for Vâyu pressed are Soma juices blent with curd, As rivers to the lowland flow: come to the food.

translations.griffith: For Indra and for Vâyu pressed are Soma juices blent with curd, As rivers to the lowland flow: come to the food.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जूर्विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वेभि॑र॒श्विभ्या॑मु॒षसा॑ स॒जूः आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
stanzas.transliteration: sajū́r víśvebhir devébhir -aśvíbhyām uṣásā sajū́ḥ ā́ yāhy agne atrivát suté raṇa
stanzas.translation: Associate with all the Gods, come, with the Aṣvins and with Dawn, Agni, as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

translations.griffith: Associate with all the Gods, come, with the Aṣvins and with Dawn, Agni, as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जूर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णाभ्यां स॒जूः सोमे॑न॒ विष्णु॑ना आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
stanzas.transliteration: sajū́r mitrā́váruṇābhyāṃ sajū́ḥ sómena víṣṇunā ā́ yāhy agne atrivát suté raṇa
stanzas.translation: Associate with Varuṇa, with Mitra, Soma, Vishṇu, come, Agni, as erstwith Atri, so enjoy the juice.

translations.griffith: Associate with Varuṇa, with Mitra, Soma, Vishṇu, come, Agni, as erstwith Atri, so enjoy the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जूरा॑दि॒त्यैर्वसु॑भिः स॒जूरिन्द्रे॑ण वा॒युना॑ आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
stanzas.transliteration: sajū́r ādityaír vásubhiḥ sajū́r índreṇa vāyúnā ā́ yāhy agne atrivát suté raṇa
stanzas.translation: Associate with Vasus, with Âdityas, Indra, Viyu, come, Agni as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

translations.griffith: Associate with Vasus, with Âdityas, Indra, Viyu, come, Agni as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒स्ति नो॑ मिमीताम॒श्विना॒ भगः॑ स्व॒स्ति दे॒व्यदि॑तिरन॒र्वणः॑ स्व॒स्ति पू॒षा असु॑रो दधातु नः स्व॒स्ति द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी सु॑चे॒तुना॑
stanzas.transliteration: svastí no mimītām aśvínā bhágaḥ svastí devy áditir anarváṇaḥ svastí pūṣā́ ásuro dadhātu naḥ svastí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ sucetúnā
stanzas.translation: May Bhaga and the Aṣvins grant us health and wealth, and Goddess Adid and he whom none resist. The Asura Pûshan grant us all prosperity, and Heaven and Earth most wise vouchsafe us happiness.

translations.griffith: May Bhaga and the Aṣvins grant us health and wealth, and Goddess Adid and he whom none resist. The Asura Pûshan grant us all prosperity, and Heaven and Earth most wise vouchsafe us happiness.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒स्तये॑ वा॒युमुप॑ ब्रवामहै॒ सोमं॑ स्व॒स्ति भुव॑नस्य॒ यस्पतिः॑ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ सर्व॑गणं स्व॒स्तये॑ स्व॒स्तय॑ आदि॒त्यासो॑ भवन्तु नः
stanzas.transliteration: svastáye vāyúm úpa bravāmahai sómaṃ svastí bhúvanasya yás pátiḥ bŕ̥haspátiṃ sárvagaṇaṃ svastáye svastáya ādityā́so bhavantu naḥ
stanzas.translation: Let us solicit Vâyu for prosperity, and Soma who is Lord of all the world for weal; For weal Br̥ihaspati with all his company. May the Âdityas bring us health and happiness.

translations.griffith: Let us solicit Vâyu for prosperity, and Soma who is Lord of all the world for weal; For weal Br̥ihaspati with all his company. May the Âdityas bring us health and happiness.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा नो॑ अ॒द्या स्व॒स्तये॑ वैश्वान॒रो वसु॑र॒ग्निः स्व॒स्तये॑ दे॒वा अ॑वन्त्वृ॒भवः॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ रु॒द्रः पा॒त्वंह॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devā́ no adyā́ svastáye vaiśvānaró vásur agníḥ svastáye devā́ avantv r̥bhávaḥ svastáye svastí no rudráḥ pātv áṃhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: May all the Gods, may Agni the beneficent, God of all men, this day be with us for our weal. Help us the R̥ibhus, the Divine Ones, for our good. May Rudra bless and keep us from calamity.

translations.griffith: May all the Gods, may Agni the beneficent, God of all men, this day be with us for our weal. Help us the R̥ibhus, the Divine Ones, for our good. May Rudra bless and keep us from calamity.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒स्ति मि॑त्रावरुणा स्व॒स्ति प॑थ्ये रेवति स्व॒स्ति न॒ इन्द्र॑श्चा॒ग्निश्च॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ अदिते कृधि
stanzas.transliteration: svastí mitrāvaruṇā svastí pathye revati svastí na índraś cāgníś ca svastí no adite kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: Prosper us, Mitra, Varuṇa. O wealthy Pathyâ, prosper us. Indra and Agni, prosper us; prosper us thou, O Aditi.

translations.griffith: Prosper us, Mitra, Varuṇa. O wealthy Pathyâ, prosper us. Indra and Agni, prosper us; prosper us thou, O Aditi.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒स्ति पन्था॒मनु॑ चरेम सूर्याचन्द्र॒मसा॑विव पुन॒र्दद॒ताघ्न॑ता जान॒ता सं ग॑मेमहि
stanzas.transliteration: svastí pánthām ánu carema sūryācandramásāv iva púnar dádatā́ghnatā jānatā́ sáṃ gamemahi
stanzas.translation: Like Sun and Moon may we pursue in full prosperity our path, And meet with one who gives again, -who knows us well and slays us not.

translations.griffith: Like Sun and Moon may we pursue in full prosperity our path, And meet with one who gives again, -who knows us well and slays us not.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र श्या॑वाश्व धृष्णु॒यार्चा॑ म॒रुद्भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः ये अ॑द्रो॒घम॑नुष्व॒धं श्रवो॒ मद॑न्ति य॒ज्ञियाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá śyāvāśva dhr̥ṣṇuyā́- -árcā marúdbhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ yé adroghám anuṣvadháṃ śrávo mádanti yajñíyāḥ
stanzas.translation: SING boldly forth, Ṣyâvâṣva, with the Maruts who are loud in song, Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.

translations.griffith: SING boldly forth, Ṣyâvâṣva, with the Maruts who are loud in song, Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.
translations.müller: O Syâvâsva, sing boldly with 1 the Maruts, the singers who, worthy themselves of sacrifice, rejoice in their guileless glory 2 according to their nature.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते हि स्थि॒रस्य॒ शव॑सः॒ सखा॑यः॒ सन्ति॑ धृष्णु॒या ते याम॒न्ना धृ॑ष॒द्विन॒स्त्मना॑ पान्ति॒ शश्व॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: té hí sthirásya śávasaḥ sákhāyaḥ sánti dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ té yā́mann ā́ dhr̥ṣadvínas tmánā pānti śáśvataḥ
stanzas.translation: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength. They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.

translations.griffith: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength. They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.
translations.müller: They are indeed boldly the friends of strong power; they on their march protect all who by themselves are full of daring 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते स्य॒न्द्रासो॒ नोक्षणोऽति॑ ष्कन्दन्ति॒ शर्व॑रीः म॒रुता॒मधा॒ महो॑ दि॒वि क्ष॒मा च॑ मन्महे
