stanzas.transliteration: té syandrā́so nókṣáṇaḥ- -áti ṣkandanti śárvarīḥ marútām ádhā máho diví kṣamā́ ca manmahe
stanzas.translation: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights; And thus the Maruts' power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.

translations.griffith: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights; And thus the Maruts' power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.
translations.müller: Like rushing bulls, these Maruts spring over 1 the dark cows (the clouds) 2, and then we perceive the might of the Maruts in heaven and on earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒रुत्सु॑ वो दधीमहि॒ स्तोमं॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑ धृष्णु॒या विश्वे॒ ये मानु॑षा यु॒गा पान्ति॒ मर्त्यं॑ रि॒षः
stanzas.transliteration: marútsu vo dadhīmahi stómaṃ yajñáṃ ca dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ víśve yé mā́nuṣā yugā́ pā́nti mártyaṃ riṣáḥ
stanzas.translation: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.

translations.griffith: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.
translations.müller: Let us boldly offer praise and sacrifice to your Maruts, to all them who protect the generation of men, who protect the mortal from injury.

stanzas.sanskrit: अर्ह॑न्तो॒ ये सु॒दान॑वो॒ नरो॒ असा॑मिशवसः प्र य॒ज्ञं य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्यो दि॒वो अ॑र्चा म॒रुद्भ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: árhanto yé sudā́navo náro ásāmiśavasaḥ prá yajñáṃ yajñíyebhyo divó arcā marúdbhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength – To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength – To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.
translations.müller: They who are worthy, bounteous, men of perfect strength, to those heavenly Maruts who are worthy of sacrifice, praise the sacrifice!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ रु॒क्मैरा यु॒धा नर॑ ऋ॒ष्वा ऋ॒ष्टीर॑सृक्षत अन्वे॑नाँ॒ अह॑ वि॒द्युतो॑ म॒रुतो॒ जज्झ॑तीरिव भा॒नुर॑र्त॒ त्मना॑ दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ rukmaír ā́ yudhā́ náraḥ- r̥ṣvā́ r̥ṣṭī́r asr̥kṣata ánv enām̐ áha vidyúto marúto jájjhatīr iva bhānúr arta tmánā diváḥ
stanzas.translation: The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold. After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.

translations.griffith: The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold. After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.
translations.müller: The tall men 1, coming near with their bright chains, and their weapon, have hurled forth their spears. Behind these Maruts there came by itself the splendour of heaven, like laughing lightnings 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये वा॑वृ॒धन्त॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ य उ॒राव॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ आ वृ॒जने॑ वा न॒दीनां॑ स॒धस्थे॑ वा म॒हो दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: yé vāvr̥dhánta pā́rthivāḥ- yá urā́v antárikṣa ā́ vr̥jáne vā nadī́nāṃ sadhásthe vā mahó diváḥ
stanzas.translation: They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air, Or in the rivers' compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.

translations.griffith: They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air, Or in the rivers' compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.
translations.müller: Those who have grown up on earth, or in the wide sky, or in the realm of the rivers, or in the abode of the great heaven,

stanzas.sanskrit: शर्धो॒ मारु॑त॒मुच्छं॑स स॒त्यश॑वस॒मृभ्व॑सम् उ॒त स्म॒ ते शु॒भे नरः॒ प्र स्प॒न्द्रा यु॑जत॒ त्मना॑
stanzas.transliteration: śárdho mā́rutam úc chaṃsa satyáśavasam ŕ̥bhvasam utá sma té śubhé náraḥ prá syandrā́ yujata tmánā
stanzas.translation: Praise thou the Maruts' company, the valorous and truly strong, The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.

translations.griffith: Praise thou the Maruts' company, the valorous and truly strong, The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.
translations.müller: Praise that host of the Maruts, endowed with true strength and boldness 1, whether those rushing heroes have by themselves harnessed (their horses) for triumph,

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्म॒ ते परु॑ष्ण्या॒मूर्णा॑ वसत शु॒न्ध्यवः॑ उ॒त प॒व्या रथा॑ना॒मद्रिं॑ भिन्द॒न्त्योज॑सा
stanzas.transliteration: utá sma té páruṣṇyām ū́rṇā vasata śundhyávaḥ utá pavyā́ ráthānām ádrim bhindanty ójasā
stanzas.translation: Fair-gleaming, on Parushṇî they have clothed themselves in robes of wool, And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.

translations.griffith: Fair-gleaming, on Parushṇî they have clothed themselves in robes of wool, And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.
translations.müller: Or whether these brilliant Maruts have in the (speckled) cloud clothed themselves in wool 1, whether by their strength they cut the mountain asunder with the tire of their chariot;

stanzas.sanskrit: आप॑थयो॒ विप॑थ॒योऽन्त॑स्पथा॒ अनु॑पथाः ए॒तेभि॒र्मह्यं॒ नाम॑भिर्य॒ज्ञं वि॑ष्टा॒र ओ॑हते
stanzas.transliteration: ā́pathayo vípathayaḥ- -ántaspathā ánupathāḥ etébhir máhyaṃ nā́mabhir yajñáṃ viṣṭārá ohate
stanzas.translation: Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path, Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.

translations.griffith: Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path, Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.
translations.müller: Call them comers, or goers, or enterers, or followers, under all these names, they watch on the straw 1 for my sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ नरो॒ न्यो॑ह॒तेऽधा॑ नि॒युत॑ ओहते अधा॒ पारा॑वता॒ इति॑ चि॒त्रा रू॒पाणि॒ दर्श्या॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā náro ny òhate- -ádhā niyúta ohate ádhā pā́rāvatā íti citrā́ rūpā́ṇi dárśyā
stanzas.translation: To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this. Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Pârâvatas.

translations.griffith: To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this. Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Pârâvatas.
translations.müller: The men (the Maruts) watch, and their steeds watch. Then, so brilliant are their forms to be seen, that people say, Look at the strangers 1!

stanzas.sanskrit: छ॒न्दः॒स्तुभः॑ कुभ॒न्यव॒ उत्स॒मा की॒रिणो॑ नृतुः ते मे॒ के चि॒न्न ता॒यव॒ ऊमा॑ आसन्दृ॒शि त्वि॒षे
stanzas.transliteration: chandastúbhaḥ kubhanyávaḥ- útsam ā́ kīríṇo nr̥tuḥ té me ké cin ná tāyávaḥ- ū́mā āsan dr̥śí tviṣé
stanzas.translation: Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring. What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.

translations.griffith: Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring. What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.
translations.müller: In measured steps 1 and wildly shouting 2 the gleemen 3 have danced toward the well (the cloud). They who appeared one by one like thieves, were helpers to me to see the light 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ऋ॒ष्वा ऋ॒ष्टिवि॑द्युतः क॒वयः॒ सन्ति॑ वे॒धसः॑ तमृ॑षे॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं न॑म॒स्या र॒मया॑ गि॒रा
stanzas.transliteration: yá r̥ṣvā́ r̥ṣṭívidyutaḥ kaváyaḥ sánti vedhásaḥ tám r̥ṣe mā́rutaṃ gaṇáṃ namasyā́ ramáyā girā́
stanzas.translation: Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they. R̥ishi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.

translations.griffith: Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they. R̥ishi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.
translations.müller: Worship, therefore, O seer, that host of Maruts, and keep and delight them with your voice, they who are themselves wise 1 poets, tall heroes armed with lightning-spears.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छ॑ ऋषे॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं दा॒ना मि॒त्रं न यो॒षणा॑ दि॒वो वा॑ धृष्णव॒ ओज॑सा स्तु॒ता धी॒भिरि॑षण्यत
stanzas.transliteration: ácha r̥ṣe mā́rutaṃ gaṇáṃ dānā́ mitráṃ ná yoṣáṇā divó vā dhr̥ṣṇava ójasā stutā́ dhībhír iṣaṇyata
stanzas.translation: R̥ishi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend. From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.

translations.griffith: R̥ishi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend. From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.
translations.müller: Approach, O seer, the host of Maruts, as a woman approaches a friend, for a gift 1; and you, Maruts, bold in your strength 2, hasten hither, even from heaven, when you have been praised by our hymns.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू म॑न्वा॒न ए॑षां दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ न व॒क्षणा॑ दा॒ना स॑चेत सू॒रिभि॒र्याम॑श्रुतेभिर॒ञ्जिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ manvāná eṣāṃ devā́m̐ áchā ná vakṣáṇā dānā́ saceta sūríbhir yā́maśrutebhir añjíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods, And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.

translations.griffith: Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods, And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.
translations.müller: If he, after perceiving them, has approached them as gods with an offering, then may he for a gift remain united with the brilliant (Maruts), who by their ornaments are glorious on their march.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ये मे॑ बन्ध्वे॒षे गां वोच॑न्त सू॒रयः॒ पृश्निं॑ वोचन्त मा॒तर॑म् अधा॑ पि॒तर॑मि॒ष्मिणं॑ रु॒द्रं वो॑चन्त॒ शिक्व॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yé me bandhveṣé gā́ṃ vócanta sūráyaḥ pŕ̥śniṃ vocanta mātáram ádhā pitáram iṣmíṇaṃ rudráṃ vocanta śíkvasaḥ
stanzas.translation: Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Pr̥iṣni as their Mother-cow, And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.

translations.griffith: Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Pr̥iṣni as their Mother-cow, And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.
translations.müller: They, the wise 1 Maruts, the lords, who, when there was inquiry for their kindred, told me of the cow, they told me of Prisni as their mother, and of the strong Rudra as their father.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒प्त मे॑ स॒प्त शा॒किन॒ एक॑मेका श॒ता द॑दुः य॒मुना॑या॒मधि॑ श्रु॒तमुद्राधो॒ गव्यं॑ मृजे॒ नि राधो॒ अश्व्यं॑ मृजे
stanzas.transliteration: saptá me saptá śākínaḥ- ékam-ekā śatā́ daduḥ yamúnāyām ádhi śrutám úd rā́dho gávyam mr̥je ní rā́dho áśvyam mr̥je
stanzas.translation: The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts. I have obtained on Yamunâ famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.

translations.griffith: The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts. I have obtained on Yamunâ famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.
translations.müller: The seven and seven heroes 1 gave me each a hundred. On the Yamunâ I clear off glorious wealth in cows, I clear wealth in horses.

stanzas.sanskrit: को वे॑द॒ जान॑मेषां॒ को वा॑ पु॒रा सु॒म्नेष्वा॑स म॒रुता॑म् यद्यु॑यु॒ज्रे कि॑ला॒स्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kó veda jā́nam eṣāṃ kó vā purā́ sumnéṣv āsa marútām yád yuyujré kilāsyàḥ
stanzas.translation: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts' favour in the days of old What time their spotted deer were yoked?

translations.griffith: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts' favour in the days of old What time their spotted deer were yoked?
translations.müller: Who knows their birth? or who was of yore in the favour of the Maruts, when they harnessed the spotted deer 1?

stanzas.sanskrit: ऐतान्रथे॑षु त॒स्थुषः॒ कः शु॑श्राव क॒था य॑युः कस्मै॑ सस्रुः सु॒दासे॒ अन्वा॒पय॒ इळा॑भिर्वृ॒ष्टयः॑ स॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: aítā́n rátheṣu tasthúṣaḥ káḥ śuśrāva kathā́ yayuḥ kásmai sasruḥ sudā́se ánv āpáyaḥ- íḷābhir vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ sahá
stanzas.translation: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went? Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

translations.griffith: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went? Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?
translations.müller: Who has heard them when they had mounted their chariots, how they went forth? For the sake of what liberal giver (Sudâs) did they run, and their comrades followed 1, (as) streams of rain (filled) with food?

stanzas.sanskrit: ते म॑ आहु॒र्य आ॑य॒युरुप॒ द्युभि॒र्विभि॒र्मदे॑ नरो॒ मर्या॑ अरे॒पस॑ इ॒मान्पश्य॒न्निति॑ ष्टुहि
stanzas.transliteration: té ma āhur yá āyayúr úpa dyúbhir víbhir máde náro máryā arepásaḥ- imā́n páśyann íti ṣṭuhi
stanzas.translation: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught, Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;

translations.griffith: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught, Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;
translations.müller: They themselves said to me when day by day 1 they came to the feast with their birds 2: they (the Maruts) are manly youths and blameless; seeing them, praise them thus;

stanzas.sanskrit: ये अ॒ञ्जिषु॒ ये वाशी॑षु॒ स्वभा॑नवः स्र॒क्षु रु॒क्मेषु॑ खा॒दिषु॑ श्रा॒या रथे॑षु॒ धन्व॑सु
stanzas.transliteration: yé añjíṣu yé vā́śīṣu svábhānavaḥ srakṣú rukméṣu khādíṣu śrāyā́ rátheṣu dhánvasu
stanzas.translation: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths, Arrayed on chariots and with bows.

translations.griffith: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths, Arrayed on chariots and with bows.
translations.müller: They who shine by themselves in their ornaments 1, their daggers, their garlands, their golden chains, their rings, going 2 on their chariots and on dry land.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒ष्माकं॑ स्मा॒ रथाँ॒ अनु॑ मु॒दे द॑धे मरुतो जीरदानवः वृ॒ष्टी द्यावो॑ य॒तीरि॑व
stanzas.transliteration: yuṣmā́kaṃ smā ráthām̐ ánu mudé dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ vr̥ṣṭī́ dyā́vo yatī́r iva
stanzas.translation: O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars, Like splendours coming through the rain.

translations.griffith: O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars, Like splendours coming through the rain.
translations.müller: O Maruts, givers of quickening rain, I am made to rejoice, following after your chariots, as after days 1 going with rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यं नरः॑ सु॒दान॑वो ददा॒शुषे॑ दि॒वः कोश॒मचु॑च्यवुः वि प॒र्जन्यं॑ सृजन्ति॒ रोद॑सी॒ अनु॒ धन्व॑ना यन्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáṃ náraḥ sudā́navo dadāśúṣe diváḥ kóśam ácucyavuḥ ví parjányaṃ sr̥janti ródasī ánu dhánvanā yanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof: They set the storm-cloud free tostream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o'er desert spots.

translations.griffith: Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof: They set the storm-cloud free tostream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o'er desert spots.
translations.müller: The bucket which the bounteous heroes shook down from heaven for their worshipper, that cloud they send 1 along heaven and earth, and showers follow on the dry land.

stanzas.sanskrit: त॒तृ॒दा॒नाः सिन्ध॑वः॒ क्षोद॑सा॒ रजः॒ प्र स॑स्रुर्धे॒नवो॑ यथा स्य॒न्ना अश्वा॑ इ॒वाध्व॑नो वि॒मोच॑ने॒ वि यद्वर्त॑न्त ए॒न्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tatr̥dānā́ḥ síndhavaḥ kṣódasā rájaḥ prá sasrur dhenávo yathā syannā́ áśvā ivā́dhvano vimócane ví yád vártanta enyàḥ
stanzas.translation: The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o'er the firmament. Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.

translations.griffith: The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o'er the firmament. Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.
translations.müller: The rivers having pierced 1 the air with a rush of water, went forth like milk-cows; when your spotted deer roll about 2 like horses that have hasted to the resting-place on their road.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑त मरुतो दि॒व आन्तरि॑क्षाद॒मादु॒त माव॑ स्थात परा॒वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāta maruto diváḥ- ā́ntárikṣād amā́d utá mā́va sthāta parāvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand Tarry not far away from us.

translations.griffith: Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand Tarry not far away from us.
translations.müller: Come hither, O Maruts, from heaven, from the sky, even from near 1; do not go far away!

stanzas.sanskrit: मा वो॑ र॒सानि॑तभा॒ कुभा॒ क्रुमु॒र्मा वः॒ सिन्धु॒र्नि री॑रमत् मा वः॒ परि॑ ष्ठात्स॒रयुः॑ पुरी॒षिण्य॒स्मे इत्सु॒म्नम॑स्तु वः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ vo rasā́nitabhā kúbhā krúmur mā́ vaḥ síndhur ní rīramat mā́ vaḥ pári ṣṭhāt saráyuḥ purīṣíṇī- asmé ít sumnám astu vaḥ
stanzas.translation: So let not Rasâ, Krumu, or Anitabhâ, Kubhâ, or Sindhu hold you back. Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.

translations.griffith: So let not Rasâ, Krumu, or Anitabhâ, Kubhâ, or Sindhu hold you back. Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.
translations.müller: Let not the Rasâ, the Anitabhâ, the Kubhâ, the Krumu, let not the Sindhu delay you! Let not the marshy Sarayu prevent you! May your favour be with us alone!

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वः॒ शर्धं॒ रथा॑नां त्वे॒षं ग॒णं मारु॑तं॒ नव्य॑सीनाम् अनु॒ प्र य॑न्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ śárdhaṃ ráthānāṃ tveṣáṃ gaṇám mā́rutaṃ návyasīnām ánu prá yanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones, The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.

translations.griffith: That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones, The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.
translations.müller: The showers come forth after the host of your chariots, after the terrible Marut-host of the ever-youthful heroes 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: शर्धं॑शर्धं व एषां॒ व्रातं॑व्रातं ग॒णंग॑णं सुश॒स्तिभिः॑ अनु॑ क्रामेम धी॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: śárdhaṃ-śardhaṃ va eṣāṃ vrā́taṃ-vrātaṃ gaṇáṃ-gaṇaṃ suśastíbhir ánu krāmema dhītíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band, And company by company.

translations.griffith: With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band, And company by company.
translations.müller: Let us then follow with our praises and our prayers each host of yours, each troop, each company 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: कस्मा॑ अ॒द्य सुजा॑ताय रा॒तह॑व्याय॒ प्र य॑युः ए॒ना यामे॑न म॒रुतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kásmā adyá sújātāya rātáhavyāya prá yayuḥ enā́ yā́mena marútaḥ
stanzas.translation: To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped The Maruts on this course to-day?

translations.griffith: To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped The Maruts on this course to-day?
translations.müller: To what well-born generous worshipper have the Maruts gone to-day on that march,

stanzas.sanskrit: येन॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय धा॒न्यं१॒॑ बीजं॒ वह॑ध्वे॒ अक्षि॑तम् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्ध॑त्तन॒ यद्व॒ ईम॑हे॒ राधो॑ वि॒श्वायु॒ सौभ॑गम्
stanzas.transliteration: yéna tokā́ya tánayāya dhānyàm bī́jaṃ váhadhve ákṣitam asmábhyaṃ tád dhattana yád va ī́mahe rā́dho viśvā́yu saúbhagam
stanzas.translation: Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny, Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny, Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.
translations.müller: On which you bring to kith and kin the never-failing seed of corn? Give us that for which we ask you, wealth and everlasting happiness!

stanzas.sanskrit: अती॑याम नि॒दस्ति॒रः स्व॒स्तिभि॑र्हि॒त्वाव॒द्यमरा॑तीः वृ॒ष्ट्वी शं योराप॑ उ॒स्रि भे॑ष॒जं स्याम॑ मरुतः स॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: átīyāma nidás tiráḥ svastíbhir hitvā́vadyám árātīḥ vr̥ṣṭvī́ śáṃ yór ā́pa usrí bheṣajáṃ syā́ma marutaḥ sahá
stanzas.translation: May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate. Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.

translations.griffith: May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate. Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.
translations.müller: Let us safely pass through our revilers, leaving behind the unspeakable and the enemies. Let us be with you when in the morning 1 you shower down health, wealth 2, water, and medicine, O Maruts!

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒दे॒वः स॑महासति सु॒वीरो॑ नरो मरुतः॒ स मर्त्यः॑ यं त्राय॑ध्वे॒ स्याम॒ ते
stanzas.transliteration: sudeváḥ samahāsati suvī́ro naro marutaḥ sá mártyaḥ yáṃ trā́yadhve syā́ma té
stanzas.translation: Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons, Whom ye protect. Such may we be.

translations.griffith: Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons, Whom ye protect. Such may we be.
translations.müller: That mortal, O men, O Maruts, whom you protect, may well be always beloved by the gods, and rich in valiant offspring. May we be such!

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒हि भो॒जान्त्स्तु॑व॒तो अ॑स्य॒ याम॑नि॒ रण॒न्गावो॒ न यव॑से य॒तः पूर्वाँ॑ इव॒ सखीँ॒रनु॑ ह्वय गि॒रा गृ॑णीहि का॒मिनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: stuhí bhojā́n stuvató asya yā́mani ráṇan gā́vo ná yávase yatáḥ pū́rvām̐ iva sákhīm̐r ánu hvaya girā́ gr̥ṇīhi kāmínaḥ
stanzas.translation: Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead. So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.

translations.griffith: Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead. So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.
translations.müller: Praise the liberal Maruts, and may they delight on the path of this man here who praises them, like cows in fodder. When they go, call after them as for old friends, praise them who love you, with your song!

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र शर्धा॑य॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वभा॑नव इ॒मां वाच॑मनजा पर्वत॒च्युते॑ घ॒र्म॒स्तुभे॑ दि॒व आ पृ॑ष्ठ॒यज्व॑ने द्यु॒म्नश्र॑वसे॒ महि॑ नृ॒म्णम॑र्चत
stanzas.transliteration: prá śárdhāya mā́rutāya svábhānave- imā́ṃ vā́cam anajā parvatacyúte gharmastúbhe divá ā́ pr̥ṣṭhayájvane dyumnáśravase máhi nr̥mṇám arcata
stanzas.translation: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down. Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.

translations.griffith: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down. Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.
translations.müller: You have fashioned 1 this speech for the brilliant Marut-host which shakes the mountains: celebrate then the great manhood in honour of that host who praises the warm milk (of the sacrifice), and sacrifices on the height of heaven 2, whose glory is brilliant.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ मरुतस्तवि॒षा उ॑द॒न्यवो॑ वयो॒वृधो॑ अश्व॒युजः॒ परि॑ज्रयः सं वि॒द्युता॒ दध॑ति॒ वाश॑ति त्रि॒तः स्वर॒न्त्यापो॒ऽवना॒ परि॑ज्रयः
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo marutas taviṣā́ udanyávo vayovŕ̥dho aśvayújaḥ párijrayaḥ sáṃ vidyútā dádhati vā́śati tritáḥ sváranty ā́po 'vánā párijrayaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far. Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.

translations.griffith: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far. Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.
translations.müller: O Maruts, your powerful men (came) forth searching for water, invigorating, harnessing their horses, swarming around. When they aim with the lightning, Trita shouts, and the waters murmur, running around on their course.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒द्युन्म॑हसो॒ नरो॒ अश्म॑दिद्यवो॒ वात॑त्विषो म॒रुतः॑ पर्वत॒च्युतः॑ अ॒ब्द॒या चि॒न्मुहु॒रा ह्रा॑दुनी॒वृतः॑ स्त॒नय॑दमा रभ॒सा उदो॑जसः
stanzas.transliteration: vidyúnmahaso náro áśmadidyavo vā́tatviṣo marútaḥ parvatacyútaḥ abdayā́ cin múhur ā́ hrādunīvŕ̥taḥ- stanáyadamā rabhasā́ údojasaḥ
stanzas.translation: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills, Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.

translations.griffith: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills, Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.
translations.müller: These Maruts are men brilliant with lightning, they shoot with thunderbolts, they blaze with the wind, they shake the mountains, and suddenly, when wishing to give water 1, they whirl the hail; they have thundering strength, they are robust, they are ever-powerful.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्य१॒॑क्तून्रु॑द्रा॒ व्यहा॑नि शिक्वसो॒ व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वि रजां॑सि धूतयः वि यदज्राँ॒ अज॑थ॒ नाव॑ ईं यथा॒ वि दु॒र्गाणि॑ मरुतो॒ नाह॑ रिष्यथ
stanzas.transliteration: vy àktū́n rudrā vy áhāni śikvaso vy àntárikṣaṃ ví rájāṃsi dhūtayaḥ ví yád ájrām̐ ájatha nā́va īṃ yathā ví durgā́ṇi maruto nā́ha riṣyatha
stanzas.translation: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all, When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e'en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.

translations.griffith: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all, When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e'en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.
translations.müller: When you drive forth 1 the nights, O Rudras, the days, O powerful men, the sky, the mists, ye shakers, the plains, like ships, and the strongholds, O Maruts, you suffer nowhere.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्वी॒र्यं॑ वो मरुतो महित्व॒नं दी॒र्घं त॑तान॒ सूर्यो॒ न योज॑नम् एता॒ न यामे॒ अगृ॑भीतशोचि॒षोऽन॑श्वदां॒ यन्न्यया॑तना गि॒रिम्
stanzas.transliteration: tád vīryàṃ vo maruto mahitvanáṃ dīrgháṃ tatāna sū́ryo ná yójanam étā ná yā́me ágr̥bhītaśociṣaḥ- -ánaśvadāṃ yán ny áyātanā girím
stanzas.translation: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o'er a lengthened way, When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.

translations.griffith: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o'er a lengthened way, When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.
translations.müller: That strength of yours, O Maruts, that greatness extended far as the sun extends its daily course, when you, like your deer on their march, went down to the (western) mountain with untouched splendour 1

stanzas.sanskrit: अभ्रा॑जि॒ शर्धो॑ मरुतो॒ यद॑र्ण॒सं मोष॑था वृ॒क्षं क॑प॒नेव॑ वेधसः अध॑ स्मा नो अ॒रम॑तिं सजोषस॒श्चक्षु॑रिव॒ यन्त॒मनु॑ नेषथा सु॒गम्
stanzas.transliteration: ábhrāji śárdho maruto yád arṇasám móṣathā vr̥kṣáṃ kapanéva vedhasaḥ ádha smā no arámatiṃ sajoṣasaś cákṣur iva yántam ánu neṣathā sugám
stanzas.translation: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it. Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.

translations.griffith: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it. Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.
translations.müller: Your host, O Maruts, shone forth when, O sages, you strip, like a caterpillar, the waving tree 1 Conduct then, O friends, our service 2 to a good end, as the eye conducts the man in walking.

stanzas.sanskrit: न स जी॑यते मरुतो॒ न ह॑न्यते॒ न स्रे॑धति॒ न व्य॑थते॒ न रि॑ष्यति नास्य॒ राय॒ उप॑ दस्यन्ति॒ नोतय॒ ऋषिं॑ वा॒ यं राजा॑नं वा॒ सुषू॑दथ
stanzas.transliteration: ná sá jīyate maruto ná hanyate ná sredhati ná vyathate ná riṣyati nā́sya rā́ya úpa dasyanti nótáyaḥ- ŕ̥ṣiṃ vā yáṃ rā́jānaṃ vā súṣūdatha
stanzas.translation: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne'er is distressed or harmed; His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or R̥ishi, ye direct.

translations.griffith: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne'er is distressed or harmed; His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or R̥ishi, ye direct.
translations.müller: That man, O Maruts, is not overpowered, he is not killed, he does not fail, he does not shake, he does not drop, his goods do not perish, nor his protections, if you lead him rightly, whether he be a seer or a king.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि॒युत्व॑न्तो ग्राम॒जितो॒ यथा॒ नरो॑ऽर्य॒मणो॒ न म॒रुतः॑ कब॒न्धिनः॑ पिन्व॒न्त्युत्सं॒ यदि॒नासो॒ अस्व॑र॒न्व्यु॑न्दन्ति पृथि॒वीं मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सा
stanzas.transliteration: niyútvanto grāmajíto yáthā náro -aryamáṇo ná marútaḥ kabandhínaḥ pínvanty útsaṃ yád inā́so ásvaran vy ùndanti pr̥thivī́m mádhvo ándhasā
stanzas.translation: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their watercasks, Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.

translations.griffith: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their watercasks, Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.
translations.müller: The men with their steeds, like conquerors of clans, like Aryaman (Mitra and Varuna) 1, the Maruts, carrying waterskins 2, fill the well; when the strong ones roar, they moisten the earth with the juice of sweetness 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒वत्व॑ती॒यं पृ॑थि॒वी म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ प्र॒वत्व॑ती॒ द्यौर्भ॑वति प्र॒यद्भ्यः॑ प्र॒वत्व॑तीः प॒थ्या॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष्याः प्र॒वत्व॑न्तः॒ पर्व॑ता जी॒रदा॑नवः
stanzas.transliteration: pravátvatīyám pr̥thivī́ marúdbhyaḥ pravátvatī dyaúr bhavati prayádbhyaḥ pravátvatīḥ pathyā̀ antárikṣyāḥ pravátvantaḥ párvatā jīrádānavaḥ
stanzas.translation: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents. The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.

translations.griffith: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents. The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.
translations.müller: When the Maruts come forth this earth bows, the heaven bows, the paths in the sky bow, and the cloud-mountains with their quickening rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: यन्म॑रुतः सभरसः स्वर्णरः॒ सूर्य॒ उदि॑ते॒ मद॑था दिवो नरः न वोऽश्वाः॑ श्रथय॒न्ताह॒ सिस्र॑तः स॒द्यो अ॒स्याध्व॑नः पा॒रम॑श्नुथ
stanzas.transliteration: yán marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sū́rya údite mádathā divo naraḥ ná vó 'śvāḥ śrathayantā́ha sísrataḥ sadyó asyā́dhvanaḥ pārám aśnutha
stanzas.translation: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky, Your coursers weary not when speeding on.their way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.

translations.griffith: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky, Your coursers weary not when speeding on.their way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.
translations.müller: When you rejoice at sunrise, O Maruts, toiling together 1, men of Svar (sun-light), men of Dyu (heaven), your horses never tire in running, and you quickly reach the end of your journey.

stanzas.sanskrit: अंसे॑षु व ऋ॒ष्टयः॑ प॒त्सु खा॒दयो॒ वक्षः॑सु रु॒क्मा म॑रुतो॒ रथे॒ शुभः॑ अ॒ग्निभ्रा॑जसो वि॒द्युतो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः॒ शिप्राः॑ शी॒र्षसु॒ वित॑ता हिर॒ण्ययीः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áṃseṣu va r̥ṣṭáyaḥ patsú khādáyo vákṣassu rukmā́ maruto ráthe śúbhaḥ agníbhrājaso vidyúto gábhastyoḥ śíprāḥ śīrṣásu vítatā hiraṇyáyīḥ
stanzas.translation: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car. Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.

translations.griffith: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car. Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.
translations.müller: On your shoulders are the spears, on your feet rings, on your chests golden chains, O Maruts, on your chariot gems; fiery lightnings in your fists, and golden headbands tied round your heads 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं नाक॑म॒र्यो अगृ॑भीतशोचिषं॒ रुश॒त्पिप्प॑लं मरुतो॒ वि धू॑नुथ सम॑च्यन्त वृ॒जनाति॑त्विषन्त॒ यत्स्वर॑न्ति॒ घोषं॒ वित॑तमृता॒यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ nā́kam aryó ágr̥bhītaśociṣaṃ rúśat píppalam maruto ví dhūnutha sám acyanta vr̥jánā́titviṣanta yát sváranti ghóṣaṃ vítatam r̥tāyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit. They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a farresounding shout.

translations.griffith: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit. They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a farresounding shout.
translations.müller: O Maruts, you shake the red apple 1 from the firmament, whose splendour no enemy 2 can touch; the hamlets bowed when the Maruts blazed, and the pious people (the Maruts) intoned their far-reaching shout.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒ष्माद॑त्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रा॒यः स्या॑म र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ वय॑स्वतः न यो युच्छ॑ति ति॒ष्यो॒३॒॑ यथा॑ दि॒वो॒३॒॑ऽस्मे रा॑रन्त मरुतः सह॒स्रिण॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yuṣmā́dattasya maruto vicetaso rāyáḥ syāma rathyò váyasvataḥ ná yó yúchati tiṣyò yáthā diváḥ- -asmé rāranta marutaḥ sahasríṇam
stanzas.translation: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you. O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.

translations.griffith: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you. O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.
translations.müller: O wise Maruts, let us carry off 1 the wealth of food which you have bestowed on us; give us 2, O Maruts, such thousandfold wealth as never fails 3, like the star Tishya 4 from heaven!

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं र॒यिं म॑रुतः स्पा॒र्हवी॑रं यू॒यमृषि॑मवथ॒ साम॑विप्रम् यू॒यमर्व॑न्तं भर॒ताय॒ वाजं॑ यू॒यं ध॑त्थ॒ राजा॑नं श्रुष्टि॒मन्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ rayím maruta spārhávīraṃ yūyám ŕ̥ṣim avatha sā́mavipram yūyám árvantam bharatā́ya vā́jaṃ yūyáṃ dhattha rā́jānaṃ śruṣṭimántam
stanzas.translation: Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the R̥ishi skilled in chanted verses. Ye give the Bharata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.

translations.griffith: Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the R̥ishi skilled in chanted verses. Ye give the Bharata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.
translations.müller: O Maruts, you protect our wealth of excellent men, and the seer, clever in song; you give to Bharata (the warrior) 1 a strong horse 2, you make the king to be obeyed 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्वो॑ यामि॒ द्रवि॑णं सद्यऊतयो॒ येना॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण त॒तना॑म॒ नॄँर॒भि इ॒दं सु मे॑ मरुतो हर्यता॒ वचो॒ यस्य॒ तरे॑म॒ तर॑सा श॒तं हिमाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tád vo yāmi dráviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yénā svàr ṇá tatánāma nr̥̄́m̐r abhí idáṃ sú me maruto haryatā váco yásya tárema tárasā śatáṃ hímāḥ
stanzas.translation: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun. Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.

translations.griffith: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun. Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.
translations.müller: O you who are quickly ready to help, I implore you for wealth whereby we may overshadow all men, like the sky. O Maruts, be pleased with this word of mine, and let us speed by its speed over a hundred winters!

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रय॑ज्यवो म॒रुतो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयो बृ॒हद्वयो॑ दधिरे रु॒क्मव॑क्षसः ईय॑न्ते॒ अश्वैः॑ सु॒यमे॑भिरा॒शुभिः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: práyajyavo marúto bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayo br̥hád váyo dadhire rukmávakṣasaḥ ī́yante áśvaiḥ suyámebhir āśúbhiḥ śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of life. They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of life. They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: The chasing 1 Maruts with gleaming spears, the golden-breasted, have gained great strength, they move along on quick well-broken horses;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒यं द॑धिध्वे॒ तवि॑षीं॒ यथा॑ वि॒द बृ॒हन्म॑हान्त उर्वि॒या वि रा॑जथ उ॒तान्तरि॑क्षं ममिरे॒ व्योज॑सा॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: svayáṃ dadhidhve táviṣīṃ yáthā vidá br̥hán mahānta urviyā́ ví rājatha utā́ntárikṣam mamire vy ójasā śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Ye, as ye wist, have gained of your own selves your power: high, O ye Mighty Ones, and wide ye shine abroad. They with their strength have even measured out the sky. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Ye, as ye wist, have gained of your own selves your power: high, O ye Mighty Ones, and wide ye shine abroad. They with their strength have even measured out the sky. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: You have yourselves, you know, acquired power; you shine bright and wide, you great ones. They have even measured the sky with their strength;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा॒कं जा॒ताः सु॒भ्वः॑ सा॒कमु॑क्षि॒ताः श्रि॒ये चि॒दा प्र॑त॒रं वा॑वृधु॒र्नरः॑ वि॒रो॒किणः॒ सूर्य॑स्येव र॒श्मयः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: sākáṃ jātā́ḥ subhvàḥ sākám ukṣitā́ḥ śriyé cid ā́ prataráṃ vāvr̥dhur náraḥ virokíṇaḥ sū́ryasyeva raśmáyaḥ śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Strong, born together, they together have waxed great: the Heroes more and more have grown to majesty Resplendent as the Sun's beams in their light are they. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Strong, born together, they together have waxed great: the Heroes more and more have grown to majesty Resplendent as the Sun's beams in their light are they. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: The strong heroes, born together, and nourished together, have further grown to real beauty. They shine brilliantly like the rays of the sun;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒भू॒षेण्यं॑ वो मरुतो महित्व॒नं दि॑दृ॒क्षेण्यं॒ सूर्य॑स्येव॒ चक्ष॑णम् उ॒तो अ॒स्माँ अ॑मृत॒त्वे द॑धातन॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: ābhūṣéṇyaṃ vo maruto mahitvanáṃ didr̥kṣéṇyaṃ sū́ryasyeva cákṣaṇam utó asmā́m̐ amr̥tatvé dadhātana śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Maruts, your mightiness deserves to be adored, sight to be longed for like the shining of the Sun. So lead us with your aid to immortality. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Maruts, your mightiness deserves to be adored, sight to be longed for like the shining of the Sun. So lead us with your aid to immortality. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: Your greatness, O Maruts, is to be honoured, it is to be yearned for like the sight of the sun. Place us also in immortality;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदी॑रयथा मरुतः समुद्र॒तो यू॒यं वृ॒ष्टिं व॑र्षयथा पुरीषिणः न वो॑ दस्रा॒ उप॑ दस्यन्ति धे॒नवः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: úd īrayathā marutaḥ samudrató yūyáṃ vr̥ṣṭíṃ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ ná vo dasrā úpa dasyanti dhenávaḥ śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: O Maruts, from the Ocean ye uplift the rain, and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down. Never, ye Wonder-Workers, are your Milch-kine dry. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: O Maruts, from the Ocean ye uplift the rain, and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down. Never, ye Wonder-Workers, are your Milch-kine dry. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: O Maruts you raise 1 the rain from the sea, and rain it down, O yeomen 2! Your milch-cows, O destroyers 3, are never destroyed;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदश्वा॑न्धू॒र्षु पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वं हिर॒ण्यया॒न्प्रत्यत्काँ॒ अमु॑ग्ध्वम् विश्वा॒ इत्स्पृधो॑ मरुतो॒ व्य॑स्यथ॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: yád áśvān dhūrṣú pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvaṃ hiraṇyáyān práty átkām̐ ámugdhvam víśvā ít spŕ̥dho maruto vy àsyatha śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: When to your car-poles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds, and put your golden mantles on, O Maruts, ye disperse all enemies abroad. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: When to your car-poles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds, and put your golden mantles on, O Maruts, ye disperse all enemies abroad. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: When you have joined the deer as horses 1 to the shafts, and have clothed yourselves in golden garments, then, O Maruts, you scatter all enemies;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: न पर्व॑ता॒ न न॒द्यो॑ वरन्त वो॒ यत्राचि॑ध्वं मरुतो॒ गच्छ॒थेदु॒ तत् उ॒त द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी या॑थना॒ परि॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: ná párvatā ná nadyò varanta vo yátrā́cidhvam maruto gáchathéd u tát utá dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yāthanā pári śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back: whither ye have resolved thither ye, Maruts, go. Ye compass round about even the heaven and earth. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory. Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back: whither ye have resolved thither ye, Maruts, go. Ye compass round about even the heaven and earth. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory. Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: Not mountains, not rivers have kept you back, wherever you see, O Maruts, there you go. You go even round heaven and earth;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्पू॒र्व्यं म॑रुतो॒ यच्च॒ नूत॑नं॒ यदु॒द्यते॑ वसवो॒ यच्च॑ श॒स्यते॑ विश्व॑स्य॒ तस्य॑ भवथा॒ नवे॑दसः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: yát pūrvyám maruto yác ca nū́tanaṃ yád udyáte vasavo yác ca śasyáte víśvasya tásya bhavathā návedasaḥ śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: Be it old, O Maruts, or be it new, be it spoken, O Vasus, or be it recited, you take cognisance of it all;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: मृ॒ळत॑ नो मरुतो॒ मा व॑धिष्टना॒स्मभ्यं॒ शर्म॑ बहु॒लं वि य॑न्तन अधि॑ स्तो॒त्रस्य॑ स॒ख्यस्य॑ गातन॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
stanzas.transliteration: mr̥ḷáta no maruto mā́ vadhiṣṭana- -asmábhyaṃ śárma bahuláṃ ví yantana ádhi stotrásya sakhyásya gātana śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata
stanzas.translation: Be gracious unto us, ye Maruts, slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort. Pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

translations.griffith: Be gracious unto us, ye Maruts, slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort. Pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.
translations.müller: Have mercy on us, O Maruts, do not strike us, extend to us your manifold protection. Do remember the praise, the friendship;—when they went in triumph, the chariots followed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यम॒स्मान्न॑यत॒ वस्यो॒ अच्छा॒ निरं॑ह॒तिभ्यो॑ मरुतो गृणा॒नाः जु॒षध्वं॑ नो ह॒व्यदा॑तिं यजत्रा व॒यं स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो रयी॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yūyám asmā́n nayata vásyo áchā nír aṃhatíbhyo maruto gr̥ṇānā́ḥ juṣádhvaṃ no havyádātiṃ yajatrāḥ- vayáṃ syāma pátayo rayīṇā́m
stanzas.translation: O Maruts, lead us on to higher fortune deliver us, when lauded, from afflictions. Accept, ye Holy Ones, the gifts we bring you. May we be masters of abundant riches.

translations.griffith: O Maruts, lead us on to higher fortune deliver us, when lauded, from afflictions. Accept, ye Holy Ones, the gifts we bring you. May we be masters of abundant riches.
translations.müller: Lead us, O Maruts, towards greater wealth, and out of tribulations, when you have been praised. O worshipful Maruts, accept our offering, and let us be lords of treasures!

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ शर्ध॑न्त॒मा ग॒णं पि॒ष्टं रु॒क्मेभि॑र॒ञ्जिभिः॑ विशो॑ अ॒द्य म॒रुता॒मव॑ ह्वये दि॒वश्चि॑द्रोच॒नादधि॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne śárdhantam ā́ gaṇám piṣṭáṃ rukmébhir añjíbhiḥ víśo adyá marútām áva hvaye diváś cid rocanā́d ádhi
stanzas.translation: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold, The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.

translations.griffith: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold, The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.
translations.müller: O Agni, on to the strong host (of the Maruts), bedecked with golden chains and ornaments 1. Today I call the folk of the Maruts down from the light of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॑ चि॒न्मन्य॑से हृ॒दा तदिन्मे॑ जग्मुरा॒शसः॑ ये ते॒ नेदि॑ष्ठं॒ हव॑नान्या॒गम॒न्तान्व॑र्ध भी॒मसं॑दृशः
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā cin mányase hr̥dā́ tád ín me jagmur āśásaḥ yé te nédiṣṭhaṃ hávanāny āgáman tā́n vardha bhīmásaṃdr̥śaḥ
stanzas.translation: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend. Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.

translations.griffith: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend. Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.
translations.müller: As thou (Agni) thinkest in thine heart, to the same object my wishes have gone. Strengthen thou these Maruts, terrible to behold, who have come nearest to thy invocations.

stanzas.sanskrit: मी॒ळ्हुष्म॑तीव पृथि॒वी परा॑हता॒ मद॑न्त्येत्य॒स्मदा ऋक्षो॒ न वो॑ मरुतः॒ शिमी॑वाँ॒ अमो॑ दु॒ध्रो गौरि॑व भीम॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: mīḷhúṣmatīva pr̥thivī́ párāhatā mádanty ety asmád ā́ ŕ̥kṣo ná vo marutaḥ śímīvām̐ ámo dudhró gaúr iva bhīmayúḥ
stanzas.translation: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us. Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..

translations.griffith: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us. Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..
translations.müller: Like a bountiful lady 1, the earth comes towards us, staggering, yet rejoicing; for your onslaught, O Maruts, is vigorous, like a bear, and fearful, like a wild bull.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि ये रि॒णन्त्योज॑सा॒ वृथा॒ गावो॒ न दु॒र्धुरः॑ अश्मा॑नं चित्स्व॒र्यं१॒॑ पर्व॑तं गि॒रिं प्र च्या॑वयन्ति॒ याम॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ní yé riṇánty ójasā vŕ̥thā gā́vo ná durdhúraḥ áśmānaṃ cit svaryàm párvataṃ girím prá cyāvayanti yā́mabhiḥ
stanzas.translation: They who with mighty strength o'erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke, Cause e'en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.

translations.griffith: They who with mighty strength o'erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke, Cause e'en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.
translations.müller: They who by their strength disperse wildly 1 like bulls, impatient of the yoke, they by their marches make the heavenly stone, the rocky mountain (cloud) 2 to shake.

stanzas.sanskrit: उत्ति॑ष्ठ नू॒नमे॑षां॒ स्तोमैः॒ समु॑क्षितानाम् म॒रुतां॑ पुरु॒तम॒मपू॑र्व्यं॒ गवां॒ सर्ग॑मिव ह्वये
stanzas.transliteration: út tiṣṭha nūnám eṣāṃ stómaiḥ sámukṣitānām marútām purutámam ápūrvyaṃ gávāṃ sárgam iva hvaye
stanzas.translation: Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company, Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.

translations.griffith: Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company, Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.
translations.müller: Arise, for now I call with my hymns 1 the troop of these Maruts, grown strong together, the manifold, the incomparable, as if calling a drove of bulls.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं ह्यरु॑षी॒ रथे॑ यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं रथे॑षु रो॒हितः॑ यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं हरी॑ अजि॒रा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे॒ वहि॑ष्ठा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: yuṅgdhváṃ hy áruṣī ráthe yuṅgdhváṃ rátheṣu rohítaḥ yuṅgdhváṃ hárī ajirā́ dhurí vóḷhave váhiṣṭhā dhurí vóḷhave
stanzas.translation: Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car. Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.

translations.griffith: Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car. Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.
translations.müller: Harness the red mares to the chariot, harness the ruddy horses to the chariots, harness the two bays, ready to drive in the yoke, most vehement to drive in the yoke.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य वा॒ज्य॑रु॒षस्तु॑वि॒ष्वणि॑रि॒ह स्म॑ धायि दर्श॒तः मा वो॒ यामे॑षु मरुतश्चि॒रं क॑र॒त्प्र तं रथे॑षु चोदत
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá vājy àruṣás tuviṣváṇir ihá sma dhāyi darśatáḥ mā́ vo yā́meṣu marutaś ciráṃ karat prá táṃ rátheṣu codata
stanzas.translation: Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see, Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.

translations.griffith: Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see, Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.
translations.müller: And this red stallion too, loudly neighing, has been placed here, beautiful to behold; may it not cause you delay on your marches, O Maruts; spur him forth on your chariots.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथं॒ नु मारु॑तं व॒यं श्र॑व॒स्युमा हु॑वामहे आ यस्मि॑न्त॒स्थौ सु॒रणा॑नि॒ बिभ्र॑ती॒ सचा॑ म॒रुत्सु॑ रोद॒सी
stanzas.transliteration: ráthaṃ nú mā́rutaṃ vayáṃ śravasyúm ā́ huvāmahe ā́ yásmin tasthaú suráṇāni bíbhratī sácā marútsu rodasī́
stanzas.translation: The Maruts' chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke, Which Rodasî hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.

translations.griffith: The Maruts' chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke, Which Rodasî hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.
translations.müller: We call towards us the glorious chariot of the Maruts, whereon there stands also Rodasî 1, carrying delightful gifts, among the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वः॒ शर्धं॑ रथे॒शुभं॑ त्वे॒षं प॑न॒स्युमा हु॑वे यस्मि॒न्त्सुजा॑ता सु॒भगा॑ मही॒यते॒ सचा॑ म॒रुत्सु॑ मीळ्हु॒षी
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ śárdhaṃ ratheśúbhaṃ tveṣám panasyúm ā́ huve yásmin sújātā subhágā mahīyáte sácā marútsu mīḷhuṣī́
stanzas.translation: I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.

translations.griffith: I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.
translations.müller: I call hither this your host, brilliant on chariots, terrible and glorious, among which she, the wellborn and fortunate, the bounteous lady, is also magnified among the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ रु॑द्रास॒ इन्द्र॑वन्तः स॒जोष॑सो॒ हिर॑ण्यरथाः सुवि॒ताय॑ गन्तन इ॒यं वो॑ अ॒स्मत्प्रति॑ हर्यते म॒तिस्तृ॒ष्णजे॒ न दि॒व उत्सा॑ उद॒न्यवे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ rudrāsa índravantaḥ sajóṣaso híraṇyarathāḥ suvitā́ya gantana iyáṃ vo asmát práti haryate matís tr̥ṣṇáje ná divá útsā udanyáve
stanzas.translation: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity. An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs.

translations.griffith: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity. An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs.
translations.müller: O Rudras, joined by Indra, friends on golden chariots, come hither for our welfare! This prayer from us is acceptable to you like the springs of heaven to a thirsty soul longing for water.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाशी॑मन्त ऋष्टि॒मन्तो॑ मनी॒षिणः॑ सु॒धन्वा॑न॒ इषु॑मन्तो निष॒ङ्गिणः॑ स्वश्वाः॑ स्थ सु॒रथाः॑ पृश्निमातरः स्वायु॒धा म॑रुतो याथना॒ शुभ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vā́śīmanta r̥ṣṭimánto manīṣíṇaḥ sudhánvāna íṣumanto niṣaṅgíṇaḥ sváśvā stha suráthāḥ pr̥śnimātaraḥ svāyudhā́ maruto yāthanā śúbham
stanzas.translation: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows, Good horses and good cars have ye, O Pr̥iṣni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.

translations.griffith: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows, Good horses and good cars have ye, O Pr̥iṣni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.
translations.müller: O you sons of Prisni, you are armed with daggers and spears, you are wise, carrying good bows and arrows and quivers, possessed of good horses and chariots. With your good weapons, O Maruts, you go to triumph!

stanzas.sanskrit: धू॒नु॒थ द्यां पर्व॑तान्दा॒शुषे॒ वसु॒ नि वो॒ वना॑ जिहते॒ याम॑नो भि॒या को॒पय॑थ पृथि॒वीं पृ॑श्निमातरः शु॒भे यदु॑ग्राः॒ पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: dhūnuthá dyā́m párvatān dāśúṣe vásu ní vo vánā jihate yā́mano bhiyā́ kopáyatha pr̥thivī́m pr̥śnimātaraḥ śubhé yád ugrāḥ pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvam
stanzas.translation: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down. Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Pr̥iṣni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.

translations.griffith: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down. Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Pr̥iṣni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.
translations.müller: You shake 1 the sky and the mountains (clouds) for wealth to the liberal giver; the forests bend down out of your way from fear 2. O sons of Prisni, you rouse the earth when you, O terrible ones, have harnessed the spotted deer for triumph!

stanzas.sanskrit: वात॑त्विषो म॒रुतो॑ व॒र्षनि॑र्णिजो य॒मा इ॑व॒ सुस॑दृशः सु॒पेश॑सः पि॒शङ्गा॑श्वा अरु॒णाश्वा॑ अरे॒पसः॒ प्रत्व॑क्षसो महि॒ना द्यौरि॑वो॒रवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vā́tatviṣo marúto varṣánirṇijo yamā́ iva súsadr̥śaḥ supéśasaḥ piśáṅgāśvā aruṇā́śvā arepásaḥ prátvakṣaso mahinā́ dyaúr ivorávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form, The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.

translations.griffith: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form, The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.
translations.müller: The Maruts, blazing with the wind, clothed in rain, are as like one another as twins, and well adorned. They have tawny horses, and red horses, they are faultless, endowed with exceeding vigour; they are in greatness wide as the heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रु॒द्र॒प्सा अ॑ञ्जि॒मन्तः॑ सु॒दान॑वस्त्वे॒षसं॑दृशो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धसः सु॒जा॒तासो॑ ज॒नुषा॑ रु॒क्मव॑क्षसो दि॒वो अ॒र्का अ॒मृतं॒ नाम॑ भेजिरे
stanzas.transliteration: purudrapsā́ añjimántaḥ sudā́navas tveṣásaṃdr̥śo anavabhrárādhasaḥ sujātā́so janúṣā rukmávakṣaso divó arkā́ amŕ̥taṃ nā́ma bhejire
stanzas.translation: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure, Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.

translations.griffith: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure, Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.
translations.müller: Rich in rain-drops, well adorned, bounteous, terrible to behold, of inexhaustible wealth, noble by birth, golden-breasted, these singers of the sky 1 have obtained their immortal name 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒ष्टयो॑ वो मरुतो॒ अंस॑यो॒रधि॒ सह॒ ओजो॑ बा॒ह्वोर्वो॒ बलं॑ हि॒तम् नृ॒म्णा शी॒र्षस्वायु॑धा॒ रथे॑षु वो॒ विश्वा॑ वः॒ श्रीरधि॑ त॒नूषु॑ पिपिशे
stanzas.transliteration: r̥ṣṭáyo vo maruto áṃsayor ádhi sáha ójo bāhvór vo bálaṃ hitám nr̥mṇā́ śīrṣásv ā́yudhā rátheṣu vo víśvā vaḥ śrī́r ádhi tanū́ṣu pipiśe
stanzas.translation: Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and

translations.griffith: Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and
translations.müller: Spears are on your two shoulders, in your arms are placed strength, power, and might. Manly thoughts dwell in your heads, on your chariots are weapons, and every beauty has been laid on your bodies.

stanzas.sanskrit: गोम॒दश्वा॑व॒द्रथ॑वत्सु॒वीरं॑ च॒न्द्रव॒द्राधो॑ मरुतो ददा नः प्रश॑स्तिं नः कृणुत रुद्रियासो भक्षी॒य वोऽव॑सो॒ दैव्य॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: gómad áśvāvad ráthavat suvī́raṃ candrávad rā́dho maruto dadā naḥ práśastiṃ naḥ kr̥ṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīyá vó 'vaso daívyasya
stanzas.translation: Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes. Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes. Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.
translations.müller: O Maruts, you have given us wealth of cows, horses, chariots, and heroes, golden wealth! O men of Rudra, bestow on us great praise, and may I enjoy your divine protection!

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒ये नरो॒ मरु॑तो मृ॒ळता॑ न॒स्तुवी॑मघासो॒ अमृ॑ता॒ ऋत॑ज्ञाः सत्य॑श्रुतः॒ कव॑यो॒ युवा॑नो॒ बृह॑द्गिरयो बृ॒हदु॒क्षमा॑णाः
stanzas.transliteration: hayé náro máruto mr̥ḷátā nas túvīmaghāso ámr̥tā ŕ̥tajñāḥ sátyaśrutaḥ kávayo yúvāno bŕ̥hadgirayo br̥hád ukṣámāṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

translations.griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.
translations.müller: Hark, O heroes, O Maruts! Be gracious to us! You who are of great bounty, immortal, righteous, truly listening to us, poets, young, dwelling on mighty mountains 1, and grown mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ नू॒नं तवि॑षीमन्तमेषां स्तु॒षे ग॒णं मारु॑तं॒ नव्य॑सीनाम् य आ॒श्व॑श्वा॒ अम॑व॒द्वह॑न्त उ॒तेशि॑रे अ॒मृत॑स्य स्व॒राजः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám u nūnáṃ táviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣé gaṇám mā́rutaṃ návyasīnām yá āśvàśvā ámavad váhante- utéśire amŕ̥tasya svarā́jaḥ
stanzas.translation: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts, Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amrit.

translations.griffith: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts, Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amrit.
translations.müller: I praise 1 now the powerful company of these ever-young Maruts, who drive violently along with quick horses; aye, the sovereigns are lords of Amrita (the immortal).

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे॒षं ग॒णं त॒वसं॒ खादि॑हस्तं॒ धुनि॑व्रतं मा॒यिनं॒ दाति॑वारम् म॒यो॒भुवो॒ ये अमि॑ता महि॒त्वा वन्द॑स्व विप्र तुवि॒राध॑सो॒ नॄन्
stanzas.transliteration: tveṣáṃ gaṇáṃ tavásaṃ khā́dihastaṃ dhúnivratam māyínaṃ dā́tivāram mayobhúvo yé ámitā mahitvā́ vándasva vipra tuvirā́dhaso nr̥̄́n
stanzas.translation: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness, With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,– these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.

translations.griffith: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness, With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,– these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.
translations.müller: The terrible company, the powerful, adorned with quoits on their hands, given to roaring, potent, dispensing treasures, they who are beneficent, infinite in greatness, praise, O poet, these men of great wealth!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वो॑ यन्तूदवा॒हासो॑ अ॒द्य वृ॒ष्टिं ये विश्वे॑ म॒रुतो॑ जु॒नन्ति॑ अ॒यं यो अ॒ग्निर्म॑रुतः॒ समि॑द्ध ए॒तं जु॑षध्वं कवयो युवानः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vo yantūdavāhā́so adyá vr̥ṣṭíṃ yé víśve marúto junánti ayáṃ yó agnír marutaḥ sámiddhaḥ- etáṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ
stanzas.translation: This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us. This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.

translations.griffith: This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us. This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.
translations.müller: May your water-carriers come here to-day, all the Maruts who stir up the rain. That fire which has been lighted for you, O Maruts, accept it, O young singers

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं राजा॑न॒मिर्यं॒ जना॑य विभ्वत॒ष्टं ज॑नयथा यजत्राः यु॒ष्मदे॑ति मुष्टि॒हा बा॒हुजू॑तो यु॒ष्मत्सद॑श्वो मरुतः सु॒वीरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ rā́jānam íryaṃ jánāya vibhvataṣṭáṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ yuṣmád eti muṣṭihā́ bāhújūto yuṣmád sádaśvo marutaḥ suvī́raḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned. Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.

translations.griffith: Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned. Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.
translations.müller: O worshipful Maruts, you create for man an active king, fashioned by Vibhvan 1; from you comes the man who can fight with his fist, and is quick with his arm, from you the man with good horses and valiant heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒रा इ॒वेदच॑रमा॒ अहे॑व॒ प्रप्र॑ जायन्ते॒ अक॑वा॒ महो॑भिः पृश्नेः॑ पु॒त्रा उ॑प॒मासो॒ रभि॑ष्ठाः॒ स्वया॑ म॒त्या म॒रुतः॒ सं मि॑मिक्षुः
stanzas.transliteration: arā́ ivéd ácaramā áheva prá-pra jāyante ákavā máhobhiḥ pŕ̥śneḥ putrā́ upamā́so rábhiṣṭhāḥ sváyā matyā́ marútaḥ sám mimikṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in order. Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Pr̥iṣni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.

translations.griffith: They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in order. Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Pr̥iṣni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.
translations.müller: Like the spokes of a wheel, no one is last, like the days they are born on and on, not deficient in might. The very high sons of Prisni are full of fury, the Marut cling firmly to their own will 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्प्राया॑सिष्ट॒ पृष॑तीभि॒रश्वै॑र्वीळुप॒विभि॑र्मरुतो॒ रथे॑भिः क्षोद॑न्त॒ आपो॑ रिण॒ते वना॒न्यवो॒स्रियो॑ वृष॒भः क्र॑न्दतु॒ द्यौः
stanzas.transliteration: yát prā́yāsiṣṭa pŕ̥ṣatībhir áśvair vīḷupavíbhir maruto ráthebhiḥ kṣódanta ā́po riṇaté vánāni- ávosríyo vr̥ṣabháḥ krandatu dyaúḥ
stanzas.translation: When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies, The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.

translations.griffith: When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies, The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.
translations.müller: When you have come forth with your speckled deer as horses 1 on strong-fellied chariots, O Maruts, the waters gush, the forests go asunder 2;—let Dyu 3 (Sky) roar down, the bull of the Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रथि॑ष्ट॒ याम॑न्पृथि॒वी चि॑देषां॒ भर्ते॑व॒ गर्भं॒ स्वमिच्छवो॑ धुः वाता॒न्ह्यश्वा॑न्धु॒र्या॑युयु॒ज्रे व॒र्षं स्वेदं॑ चक्रिरे रु॒द्रिया॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: práthiṣṭa yā́man pr̥thivī́ cid eṣām bhárteva gárbhaṃ svám íc chávo dhuḥ vā́tān hy áśvān dhury ā̀yuyujré varṣáṃ svédaṃ cakrire rudríyāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her. They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra.

translations.griffith: Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her. They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra.
translations.müller: At their approach, even the earth opened wide, and they placed (sowed) their own 1 strength (the rain), as a husband the germ. Indeed they have harnessed the winds as horses to the yoke, and the men of Rudra have changed their sweat into rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒ये नरो॒ मरु॑तो मृ॒ळता॑ न॒स्तुवी॑मघासो॒ अमृ॑ता॒ ऋत॑ज्ञाः सत्य॑श्रुतः॒ कव॑यो॒ युवा॑नो॒ बृह॑द्गिरयो बृ॒हदु॒क्षमा॑णाः
stanzas.transliteration: hayé náro máruto mr̥ḷátā nas túvīmaghāso ámr̥tā ŕ̥tajñāḥ sátyaśrutaḥ kávayo yúvāno bŕ̥hadgirayo br̥hád ukṣámāṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

translations.griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.
translations.müller: Hark, O heroes, O Maruts! Be gracious to us! You who are of great bounty, immortal, righteous, truly listening to us, poets, young, dwelling on mighty mountains, and grown mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वः॒ स्पळ॑क्रन्त्सुवि॒ताय॑ दा॒वनेऽर्चा॑ दि॒वे प्र पृ॑थि॒व्या ऋ॒तं भ॑रे उ॒क्षन्ते॒ अश्वा॒न्तरु॑षन्त॒ आ रजोऽनु॒ स्वं भा॒नुं श्र॑थयन्ते अर्ण॒वैः
stanzas.transliteration: prá va spáḷ akran suvitā́ya dāváne- -árcā divé prá pr̥thivyā́ r̥tám bhare ukṣánte áśvān táruṣanta ā́ rájaḥ- -ánu svám bhānúṃ śrathayante arṇavaíḥ
stanzas.translation: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice. They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.

translations.griffith: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice. They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.
translations.müller: They truly 1 tried to make you grant them welfare. Do thou sing 2 praises to Heaven (Dyu), I offer sacrifice (rita) to the Earth. The Maruts wash their horses and race to the air, they soften their splendour by waving mists.

stanzas.sanskrit: अमा॑देषां भि॒यसा॒ भूमि॑रेजति॒ नौर्न पू॒र्णा क्ष॑रति॒ व्यथि॑र्य॒ती दू॒रे॒दृशो॒ ये चि॒तय॑न्त॒ एम॑भिर॒न्तर्म॒हे वि॒दथे॑ येतिरे॒ नरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ámād eṣām bhiyásā bhū́mir ejati naúr ná pūrṇā́ kṣarati vyáthir yatī́ dūredŕ̥śo yé citáyanta émabhir antár mahé vidáthe yetire náraḥ
stanzas.translation: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in. Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.

translations.griffith: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in. Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.
translations.müller: The earth trembles with fear from their onset. She sways like a full ship, that goes rolling 1. The heroes who appear on their marches, visible from afar, strive together within the great (sacrificial) assembly 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: गवा॑मिव श्रि॒यसे॒ शृङ्ग॑मुत्त॒मं सूर्यो॒ न चक्षू॒ रज॑सो वि॒सर्ज॑ने अत्या॑ इव सु॒भ्व१॒॑श्चार॑वः स्थन॒ मर्या॑ इव श्रि॒यसे॑ चेतथा नरः
stanzas.transliteration: gávām iva śriyáse śŕ̥ṅgam uttamáṃ sū́ryo ná cákṣū rájaso visárjane átyā iva subhvàś cā́rava sthana máryā iva śriyáse cetathā naraḥ
stanzas.translation: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse, Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.

translations.griffith: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse, Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.
translations.müller: Your horn is exalted for glory 1, as the horns of cows; your eye is like the sun 2, when the mist is scattered. Like strong racers, you are beautiful, O heroes, you think of glory, like manly youths 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: को वो॑ म॒हान्ति॑ मह॒तामुद॑श्नव॒त्कस्काव्या॑ मरुतः॒ को ह॒ पौंस्या॑ यू॒यं ह॒ भूमिं॑ कि॒रणं॒ न रे॑जथ॒ प्र यद्भर॑ध्वे सुवि॒ताय॑ दा॒वने॑
stanzas.transliteration: kó vo mahā́nti mahatā́m úd aśnavat kás kā́vyā marutaḥ kó ha paúṃsyā yūyáṃ ha bhū́miṃ kiráṇaṃ ná rejatha prá yád bháradhve suvitā́ya dāváne
stanzas.translation: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds? Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,

translations.griffith: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds? Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,
translations.müller: Who could reach, O Maruts, the great wise thoughts, who the great manly deeds of you, great ones? You shake the earth like a speck of dust, when you are carried forth for granting welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वा॑ इ॒वेद॑रु॒षासः॒ सब॑न्धवः॒ शूरा॑ इव प्र॒युधः॒ प्रोत यु॑युधुः मर्या॑ इव सु॒वृधो॑ वावृधु॒र्नरः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ चक्षुः॒ प्र मि॑नन्ति वृ॒ष्टिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áśvā ivéd aruṣā́saḥ sábandhavaḥ śū́rā iva prayúdhaḥ prótá yuyudhuḥ máryā iva suvŕ̥dho vāvr̥dhur náraḥ sū́ryasya cákṣuḥ prá minanti vr̥ṣṭíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van. The Heroes have waxed strong like well-grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,

translations.griffith: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van. The Heroes have waxed strong like well-grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,
translations.müller: These kinsmen 1 (the Maruts) are like red horses, like heroes eager for battle, and they have rushed forward to fight. They are like well-grown manly youths, and the men have grown strong, with streams of rain they dim the eye of the sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते अ॑ज्ये॒ष्ठा अक॑निष्ठास उ॒द्भिदोऽम॑ध्यमासो॒ मह॑सा॒ वि वा॑वृधुः सु॒जा॒तासो॑ ज॒नुषा॒ पृश्नि॑मातरो दि॒वो मर्या॒ आ नो॒ अच्छा॑ जिगातन
stanzas.transliteration: té ajyeṣṭhā́ ákaniṣṭhāsa udbhídaḥ- -ámadhyamāso máhasā ví vāvr̥dhuḥ sujātā́so janúṣā pŕ̥śnimātaro divó máryā ā́ no áchā jigātana
stanzas.translation: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlemost, preeminent they have waxed in might, These Sons of Pr̥iṣni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitherward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.

translations.griffith: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlemost, preeminent they have waxed in might, These Sons of Pr̥iṣni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitherward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.
translations.müller: At their outbreak there is none among them who is the eldest, or the youngest, or the middle: they have grown by their own might, these sons of Prisni, noble by birth, the boys of Dyaus; come hither to us!

stanzas.sanskrit: वयो॒ न ये श्रेणीः॑ प॒प्तुरोज॒सान्ता॑न्दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः सानु॑न॒स्परि॑ अश्वा॑स एषामु॒भये॒ यथा॑ वि॒दुः प्र पर्व॑तस्य नभ॒नूँर॑चुच्यवुः
stanzas.transliteration: váyo ná yé śréṇīḥ paptúr ójasā- -ántān divó br̥hatáḥ sā́nunas pári áśvāsa eṣām ubháye yáthā vidúḥ prá párvatasya nabhanū́m̐r acucyavuḥ
stanzas.translation: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky. The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend.

translations.griffith: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky. The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend.
translations.müller: Those who like birds flew with strength in rows 1 from the ridge of the mighty heaven to its ends, their horses shook the springs 2 of the mountain (cloud) so that people on both sides 3 knew it.

stanzas.sanskrit: मिमा॑तु॒ द्यौरदि॑तिर्वी॒तये॑ नः॒ सं दानु॑चित्रा उ॒षसो॑ यतन्ताम् आचु॑च्यवुर्दि॒व्यं कोश॑मे॒त ऋषे॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ म॒रुतो॑ गृणा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: mímātu dyaúr áditir vītáye naḥ sáṃ dā́nucitrā uṣáso yatantām ā́cucyavur divyáṃ kóśam eté ŕ̥ṣe rudrásya marúto gr̥ṇānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture. Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O R̥ishi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.

translations.griffith: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture. Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O R̥ishi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.
translations.müller: May 1 Dyaus Aditi (the unbounded) 2 roar for our feast, may the dew-lighted Dawns come striving together; these, the Maruts, O poet, (the sons) of Rudra, have shaken the heavenly bucket (cloud), when they had been praised.

stanzas.sanskrit: ईळे॑ अ॒ग्निं स्वव॑सं॒ नमो॑भिरि॒ह प्र॑स॒त्तो वि च॑यत्कृ॒तं नः॑ रथै॑रिव॒ प्र भ॑रे वाज॒यद्भिः॑ प्रदक्षि॒णिन्म॒रुतां॒ स्तोम॑मृध्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: ī́ḷe agníṃ svávasaṃ námobhir ihá prasattó ví cayat kr̥táṃ naḥ ráthair iva prá bhare vājayádbhiḥ pradakṣiṇín marútāṃ stómam r̥dhyām
stanzas.translation: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us. As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.

translations.griffith: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us. As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.
translations.müller: I implore 1 Agni, the gracious, with salutations, may he sit down here, and gather what we have made 2. I offer 3 (him sacrifice) as with racing chariots; may I, turning to the right, accomplish this hymn to the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ये त॒स्थुः पृष॑तीषु श्रु॒तासु॑ सु॒खेषु॑ रु॒द्रा म॒रुतो॒ रथे॑षु वना॑ चिदुग्रा जिहते॒ नि वो॑ भि॒या पृ॑थि॒वी चि॑द्रेजते॒ पर्व॑तश्चित्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yé tasthúḥ pŕ̥ṣatīṣu śrutā́su sukhéṣu rudrā́ marúto rátheṣu vánā cid ugrā jihate ní vo bhiyā́ pr̥thivī́ cid rejate párvataś cit
stanzas.translation: The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,– Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.

translations.griffith: The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,– Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.
translations.müller: Those who approached on their glorious deer, on their easy chariots, the Rudras, the Maruts,—through fear of you, ye terrible ones, the forests even bend down, the earth shakes, and also the mountain (cloud).

stanzas.sanskrit: पर्व॑तश्चि॒न्महि॑ वृ॒द्धो बि॑भाय दि॒वश्चि॒त्सानु॑ रेजत स्व॒ने वः॑ यत्क्रीळ॑थ मरुत ऋष्टि॒मन्त॒ आप॑ इव स॒ध्र्य॑ञ्चो धवध्वे
stanzas.transliteration: párvataś cin máhi vr̥ddhó bibhāya diváś cit sā́nu rejata svané vaḥ yát krī́ḷatha maruta r̥ṣṭimántaḥ- ā́pa iva sadhryàñco dhavadhve
