stanzas.translation: Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.

translations.griffith: Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.
translations.müller: At your shouting, even the mountain (cloud), grown large, fears, and the ridge of heaven trembles. When you play together, O Maruts, armed with spears, you run together like waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒रा इ॒वेद्रै॑व॒तासो॒ हिर॑ण्यैर॒भि स्व॒धाभि॑स्त॒न्वः॑ पिपिश्रे श्रि॒ये श्रेयां॑सस्त॒वसो॒ रथे॑षु स॒त्रा महां॑सि चक्रिरे त॒नूषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: varā́ ivéd raivatā́so híraṇyair abhí svadhā́bhis tanvàḥ pipiśre śriyé śréyāṃsas taváso rátheṣu satrā́ máhāṃsi cakrire tanū́ṣu
stanzas.translation: They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies. Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.

translations.griffith: They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies. Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.
translations.müller: Like rich suitors the Maruts have themselves 1 adorned their bodies with golden ornaments; more

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ज्ये॒ष्ठासो॒ अक॑निष्ठास ए॒ते सं भ्रात॑रो वावृधुः॒ सौभ॑गाय युवा॑ पि॒ता स्वपा॑ रु॒द्र ए॑षां सु॒दुघा॒ पृश्निः॑ सु॒दिना॑ म॒रुद्भ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ajyeṣṭhā́so ákaniṣṭhāsa eté sám bhrā́taro vāvr̥dhuḥ saúbhagāya yúvā pitā́ svápā rudrá eṣāṃ sudúghā pŕ̥śniḥ sudínā marúdbhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune. May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Pr̥iṣni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.

translations.griffith: None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune. May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Pr̥iṣni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.
translations.müller: As brothers, no one being the eldest or the youngest, they have grown up together to happiness. Young is their clever father Rudra, flowing with plenty is Prisni (their mother), always kind to the Maruts.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदु॑त्त॒मे म॑रुतो मध्य॒मे वा॒ यद्वा॑व॒मे सु॑भगासो दि॒वि ष्ठ अतो॑ नो रुद्रा उ॒त वा॒ न्व१॒॑स्याग्ने॑ वि॒त्ताद्ध॒विषो॒ यद्यजा॑म
stanzas.transliteration: yád uttamé maruto madhyamé vā yád vāvamé subhagāso diví ṣṭhá áto no rudrā utá vā nv àsya- -ágne vittā́d dhavíṣo yád yájāma
stanzas.translation: Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven, Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.

translations.griffith: Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven, Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.
translations.müller: O happy Maruts, whether you are in the highest, or in the middle, or in the lowest heaven, from thence, O Rudras, or thou also, O Agni. take notice of this libation which we offer.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निश्च॒ यन्म॑रुतो विश्ववेदसो दि॒वो वह॑ध्व॒ उत्त॑रा॒दधि॒ ष्णुभिः॑ ते म॑न्दसा॒ना धुन॑यो रिशादसो वा॒मं ध॑त्त॒ यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
stanzas.transliteration: agníś ca yán maruto viśvavedaso divó váhadhva úttarād ádhi ṣṇúbhiḥ té mandasānā́ dhúnayo riśādaso vāmáṃ dhatta yájamānāya sunvaté
stanzas.translation: O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights, Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.

translations.griffith: O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights, Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.
translations.müller: When Agni, and you, wealthy Maruts, drive down from the higher heaven over the ridges, give then, if pleased, you roarers, O destroyers of enemies 1, wealth to the sacrificer who prepares (Soma juice).

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ म॒रुद्भिः॑ शु॒भय॑द्भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब मन्दसा॒नो ग॑ण॒श्रिभिः॑ पा॒व॒केभि॑र्विश्वमि॒न्वेभि॑रा॒युभि॒र्वैश्वा॑नर प्र॒दिवा॑ के॒तुना॑ स॒जूः
stanzas.transliteration: ágne marúdbhiḥ śubháyadbhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ sómam piba mandasānó gaṇaśríbhiḥ pāvakébhir viśvaminvébhir āyúbhir vaíśvānara pradívā ketúnā sajū́ḥ
stanzas.translation: O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice; With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaiṣvânara, from of old.

translations.griffith: O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice; With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaiṣvânara, from of old.
translations.müller: Agni, be pleased to drink Soma with the brilliant Maruts, the singers, approaching in companies 1, with the men (Âyus 2), who brighten and enliven everything; do this, O Vaisvânara (Agni), thou who art always endowed with splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: के ष्ठा॑ नरः॒ श्रेष्ठ॑तमा॒ य एक॑एक आय॒य प॒र॒मस्याः॑ परा॒वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ké ṣṭhā naraḥ śréṣṭhatamāḥ- yá éka-eka āyayá paramásyāḥ parāvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come Forth from a region most remote?

translations.griffith: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come Forth from a region most remote?
translations.müller: Who are you, O men, the very best, who have approached one by one, from the furthest distance 1?

stanzas.sanskrit: क्व१॒॑ वोऽश्वाः॒ क्वा॒३॒॑भीश॑वः क॒थं शे॑क क॒था य॑य पृ॒ष्ठे सदो॑ न॒सोर्यमः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kvà vó 'śvāḥ kvā̀bhī́śavaḥ katháṃ śeka kathā́ yaya pr̥ṣṭhé sádo nasór yámaḥ
stanzas.translation: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power? Rein was on nose and seat on back.

translations.griffith: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power? Rein was on nose and seat on back.
translations.müller: Where are your horses, where the bridles? How could you, how did you come?—the seat on the back, the rein in the nostrils?

stanzas.sanskrit: ज॒घने॒ चोद॑ एषां॒ वि स॒क्थानि॒ नरो॑ यमुः पु॒त्र॒कृ॒थे न जन॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: jagháne códa eṣāṃ ví sakthā́ni náro yamuḥ putrakr̥thé ná jánayaḥ
stanzas.translation: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart, Like women when the babe is born.

translations.griffith: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart, Like women when the babe is born.
translations.müller: Their goad is on the croup 1, the heroes stretched their legs apart 2…

stanzas.sanskrit: परा॑ वीरास एतन॒ मर्या॑सो॒ भद्र॑जानयः अ॒ग्नि॒तपो॒ यथास॑थ
stanzas.transliteration: párā vīrāsa etana máryāso bhádrajānayaḥ agnitápo yáthā́satha
stanzas.translation: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse That ye may warm you at the fire.

translations.griffith: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse That ye may warm you at the fire.
translations.müller: Move along, heroes, young men, the sons of an excellent mother 1, so that you may warm yourselves at our fire 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: सन॒त्साश्व्यं॑ प॒शुमु॒त गव्यं॑ श॒ताव॑यम् श्या॒वाश्व॑स्तुताय॒ या दोर्वी॒रायो॑प॒बर्बृ॑हत्
stanzas.transliteration: sánat sā́śvyam paśúm utá gávyaṃ śatā́vayam śyāvā́śvastutāya yā́ dór vīrā́yopabárbr̥hat
stanzas.translation: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine, Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.

translations.griffith: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine, Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.
translations.müller: (1.) May the woman, if she stretched out her arm 1 as a rest for the hero, praised by Syâvâsva 2, gain cattle consisting of horses, cows, and a hundred sheep.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्वा॒ स्त्री शशी॑यसी पुं॒सो भ॑वति॒ वस्य॑सी अदे॑वत्रादरा॒धसः॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá tvā strī́ śáśīyasī puṃsó bhavati vásyasī ádevatrād arādhásaḥ
stanzas.translation: Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns Away from Gods, andoffers not.

translations.griffith: Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns Away from Gods, andoffers not.
translations.müller: (2.) Many a woman is even more often kindlier than a godless and miserly man,

stanzas.sanskrit: वि या जा॒नाति॒ जसु॑रिं॒ वि तृष्य॑न्तं॒ वि का॒मिन॑म् दे॒व॒त्रा कृ॑णु॒ते मनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví yā́ jānā́ti jásuriṃ ví tŕ̥ṣyantaṃ ví kāmínam devatrā́ kr̥ṇuté mánaḥ
stanzas.translation: She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want She sets her mind upon the Gods.

translations.griffith: She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want She sets her mind upon the Gods.
translations.müller: (3.) A woman who finds out the weak, the thirsty, the needy, and is mindful of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त घा॒ नेमो॒ अस्तु॑तः॒ पुमाँ॒ इति॑ ब्रुवे प॒णिः स वैर॑देय॒ इत्स॒मः
stanzas.transliteration: utá ghā némo ástutaḥ púmām̐ íti bruve paṇíḥ sá vaíradeya ít samáḥ
stanzas.translation: And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man: Only in weregild is he such.

translations.griffith: And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man: Only in weregild is he such.
translations.müller: (4.) Even though many an unpraiseworthy miser (Pani) is called a man, she is worth as much in weregild.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त मे॑ऽरपद्युव॒तिर्म॑म॒न्दुषी॒ प्रति॑ श्या॒वाय॑ वर्त॒निम् वि रोहि॑ता पुरुमी॒ळ्हाय॑ येमतु॒र्विप्रा॑य दी॒र्घय॑शसे
stanzas.transliteration: utá me 'rapad yuvatír mamandúṣī práti śyāvā́ya vartaním ví róhitā purumīḷhā́ya yematur víprāya dīrgháyaśase
stanzas.translation: And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Ṣyâva, yea, to me. Two red steeds carried me to Purumîḷha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,

translations.griffith: And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Ṣyâva, yea, to me. Two red steeds carried me to Purumîḷha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,
translations.müller: (5.) Also the young woman joyfully whispered to me, to Syâva, the road,—and the two bays went straight to Purumîlha 1, the wise, the far-famed,

stanzas.sanskrit: यो मे॑ धेनू॒नां श॒तं वैद॑दश्वि॒र्यथा॒ दद॑त् त॒र॒न्त इ॑व मं॒हना॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó me dhenūnā́ṃ śatáṃ vaídadaśvir yáthā dádat tarantá iva maṃhánā
stanzas.translation: Him who, like Vaidadaṣvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me A hundred cows in liberal gift.

translations.griffith: Him who, like Vaidadaṣvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me A hundred cows in liberal gift.
translations.müller: (6.) Who gave me a hundred cows, like Vaidadasvi, like Taranta, in magnificence.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ईं॒ वह॑न्त आ॒शुभिः॒ पिब॑न्तो मदि॒रं मधु॑ अत्र॒ श्रवां॑सि दधिरे
stanzas.transliteration: yá īṃ váhanta āśúbhiḥ píbanto madirám mádhu átra śrávāṃsi dadhire
stanzas.translation: They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight, They have attained high glories here.

translations.griffith: They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight, They have attained high glories here.
translations.müller: (1.) The Maruts, who drive on their quick horses, drinking the delightful mead, have gained glory here;

stanzas.sanskrit: येषां॑ श्रि॒याधि॒ रोद॑सी वि॒भ्राज॑न्ते॒ रथे॒ष्वा दि॒वि रु॒क्म इ॑वो॒परि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yéṣāṃ śriyā́dhi ródasī vibhrā́jante rátheṣv ā́ diví rukmá ivopári
stanzas.translation: They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars As the gold gleams above in heaven.

translations.griffith: They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars As the gold gleams above in heaven.
translations.müller: (2.) They on whose chariots Rodasî 1 glitters in glory 2, like the golden disk above in heaven;

stanzas.sanskrit: युवा॒ स मारु॑तो ग॒णस्त्वे॒षर॑थो॒ अने॑द्यः शु॒भं॒यावाप्र॑तिष्कुतः
stanzas.transliteration: yúvā sá mā́ruto gaṇás tveṣáratho ánedyaḥ śubhaṃyā́vā́pratiṣkutaḥ
stanzas.translation: That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable, Moving to victory, checked by none.

translations.griffith: That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable, Moving to victory, checked by none.
translations.müller: (3.) That youthful company of the Maruts, with blazing chariots, blameless, triumphant, irresistible.

stanzas.sanskrit: को वे॑द नू॒नमे॑षां॒ यत्रा॒ मद॑न्ति॒ धूत॑यः ऋ॒तजा॑ता अरे॒पसः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kó veda nūnám eṣāṃ yátrā mádanti dhū́tayaḥ r̥tájātā arepásaḥ
stanzas.translation: Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight, Born, spotless, after sacred Law?

translations.griffith: Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight, Born, spotless, after sacred Law?
translations.müller: (4.) Who now knows of them where the strikers rejoice, the well-born, the faultless?

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं मर्तं॑ विपन्यवः प्रणे॒तार॑ इ॒त्था धि॒या श्रोता॑रो॒ याम॑हूतिषु
stanzas.transliteration: yūyám mártaṃ vipanyavaḥ praṇetā́ra itthā́ dhiyā́ śrótāro yā́mahūtiṣu
stanzas.translation: Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn, And hearers when he cries for help.

translations.griffith: Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn, And hearers when he cries for help.
translations.müller: (5.) You who are fond of praise, become the leaders of the mortal, listening to his imploring invocations, thus is my thought 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते नो॒ वसू॑नि॒ काम्या॑ पुरुश्च॒न्द्रा रि॑शादसः आ य॑ज्ञियासो ववृत्तन
stanzas.transliteration: té no vásūni kā́myā puruścandrā́ riśādasaḥ ā́ yajñiyāso vavr̥ttana
stanzas.translation: Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright, Send down the treasures that we crave.

translations.griffith: Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright, Send down the treasures that we crave.
translations.müller: (6.) Bring then to us delightful and resplendent 1 treasures, ye worshipful Maruts, destroyers of enemies.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तं मे॒ स्तोम॑मूर्म्ये दा॒र्भ्याय॒ परा॑ वह गिरो॑ देवि र॒थीरि॑व
stanzas.transliteration: etám me stómam ūrmye dārbhyā́ya párā vaha gíro devi rathī́r iva
stanzas.translation: OUrmya, bear thou far away to Dârbhya this my hymn of praise, Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.

translations.griffith: OUrmya, bear thou far away to Dârbhya this my hymn of praise, Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.
translations.müller: (1.) O night, like a charioteer, carry away this hymn to Dârbhya, and these songs, O goddess.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त मे॑ वोचता॒दिति॑ सु॒तसो॑मे॒ रथ॑वीतौ न कामो॒ अप॑ वेति मे
stanzas.transliteration: utá me vocatād íti sutásome ráthavītau ná kā́mo ápa veti me
stanzas.translation: From me to Rathavîti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice, The wish I had departeth not.

translations.griffith: From me to Rathavîti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice, The wish I had departeth not.
translations.müller: (2.) And then tell him thus from me, 'When Rathavîti offers Soma, my desire never goes away from me.'

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष क्षे॑ति॒ रथ॑वीतिर्म॒घवा॒ गोम॑ती॒रनु॑ पर्व॑ते॒ष्वप॑श्रितः
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá kṣeti ráthavītir maghávā gómatīr ánu párvateṣv ápaśritaḥ
stanzas.translation: This wealthy Rathavîti dwells among the people rich in kine, Among the mountains, far withdrawn.

translations.griffith: This wealthy Rathavîti dwells among the people rich in kine, Among the mountains, far withdrawn.
translations.müller: (3.) That mighty Rathavîti dwells among people rich in cattle 1, retired among the mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒तमपि॑हितं ध्रु॒वं वां॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ यत्र॑ विमु॒चन्त्यश्वा॑न् दश॑ श॒ता स॒ह त॑स्थु॒स्तदेकं॑ दे॒वानां॒ श्रेष्ठं॒ वपु॑षामपश्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥téna r̥tám ápihitaṃ dhruváṃ vāṃ sū́ryasya yátra vimucánty áśvān dáśa śatā́ sahá tasthus tád ékaṃ devā́nāṃ śréṣṭhaṃ vápuṣām apaśyam
stanzas.translation: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Sûrya's horses. Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

translations.griffith: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Sûrya's horses. Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: तत्सु वां॑ मित्रावरुणा महि॒त्वमी॒र्मा त॒स्थुषी॒रह॑भिर्दुदुह्रे विश्वाः॑ पिन्वथः॒ स्वस॑रस्य॒ धेना॒ अनु॑ वा॒मेकः॑ प॒विरा व॑वर्त
stanzas.transliteration: tát sú vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvám īrmā́ tasthúṣīr áhabhir duduhre víśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svásarasya dhénāḥ- ánu vām ékaḥ pavír ā́ vavarta
stanzas.translation: This, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted. Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.

translations.griffith: This, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted. Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑रयतं पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां मित्र॑राजाना वरुणा॒ महो॑भिः व॒र्धय॑त॒मोष॑धीः॒ पिन्व॑तं॒ गा अव॑ वृ॒ष्टिं सृ॑जतं जीरदानू
stanzas.transliteration: ádhārayatam pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m mítrarājānā varuṇā máhobhiḥ vardháyatam óṣadhīḥ pínvataṃ gā́ḥ- áva vr̥ṣṭíṃ sr̥jataṃ jīradānū
stanzas.translation: O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven, Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rainflood.

translations.griffith: O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven, Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rainflood.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वा॒मश्वा॑सः सु॒युजो॑ वहन्तु य॒तर॑श्मय॒ उप॑ यन्त्व॒र्वाक् घृ॒तस्य॑ नि॒र्णिगनु॑ वर्तते वा॒मुप॒ सिन्ध॑वः प्र॒दिवि॑ क्षरन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vām áśvāsaḥ suyújo vahantu yatáraśmaya úpa yantv arvā́k ghr̥tásya nirṇíg ánu vartate vām úpa síndhavaḥ pradívi kṣaranti
stanzas.translation: Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly. A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.

translations.griffith: Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly. A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॑ श्रु॒ताम॒मतिं॒ वर्ध॑दु॒र्वीं ब॒र्हिरि॑व॒ यजु॑षा॒ रक्ष॑माणा नम॑स्वन्ता धृतद॒क्षाधि॒ गर्ते॒ मित्रासा॑थे वरु॒णेळा॑स्व॒न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: ánu śrutā́m amátiṃ várdhad urvī́m barhír iva yájuṣā rákṣamāṇā námasvantā dhr̥tadakṣā́dhi gárte mítrā́sāthe varuṇéḷāsv antáḥ
stanzas.translation: To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration, Ye, Mitra-Varuṇa, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.

translations.griffith: To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration, Ye, Mitra-Varuṇa, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: अक्र॑विहस्ता सु॒कृते॑ पर॒स्पा यं त्रासा॑थे वरु॒णेळा॑स्व॒न्तः राजा॑ना क्ष॒त्रमहृ॑णीयमाना स॒हस्र॑स्थूणं बिभृथः स॒ह द्वौ
stanzas.transliteration: ákravihastā sukŕ̥te paraspā́ yáṃ trā́sāthe varuṇéḷāsv antáḥ rā́jānā kṣatrám áhr̥ṇīyamānā sahásrasthūṇam bibhr̥thaḥ sahá dvaú
stanzas.translation: With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni3, ye save amid oblations. Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.

translations.griffith: With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni3, ye save amid oblations. Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यनिर्णि॒गयो॑ अस्य॒ स्थूणा॒ वि भ्रा॑जते दि॒व्य१॒॑श्वाज॑नीव भ॒द्रे क्षेत्रे॒ निमि॑ता॒ तिल्वि॑ले वा स॒नेम॒ मध्वो॒ अधि॑गर्त्यस्य
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyanirṇig áyo asya sthū́ṇā ví bhrājate divy àśvā́janīva bhadré kṣétre nímitā tílvile vā sanéma mádhvo ádhigartyasya
stanzas.translation: Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses; Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your carseat.

translations.griffith: Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses; Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your carseat.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यरूपमु॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टा॒वयः॑स्थूण॒मुदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य आ रो॑हथो वरुण मित्र॒ गर्त॒मत॑श्चक्षाथे॒ अदि॑तिं॒ दितिं॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyarūpam uṣáso vyùṣṭāv áyasthūṇam úditā sū́ryasya ā́ rohatho varuṇa mitra gártam átaś cakṣāthe áditiṃ dítiṃ ca
stanzas.translation: Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting, And from that place, O Varuṇa and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.

translations.griffith: Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting, And from that place, O Varuṇa and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्बंहि॑ष्ठं॒ नाति॒विधे॑ सुदानू॒ अच्छि॑द्रं॒ शर्म॑ भुवनस्य गोपा तेन॑ नो मित्रावरुणावविष्टं॒ सिषा॑सन्तो जिगी॒वांसः॑ स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: yád báṃhiṣṭhaṃ nā́tivídhe sudānū áchidraṃ śárma bhuvanasya gopā téna no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ síṣāsanto jigīvā́ṃsaḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless, Aid us with that, O Varuṇa and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.

translations.griffith: Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless, Aid us with that, O Varuṇa and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋत॑स्य गोपा॒वधि॑ तिष्ठथो॒ रथं॒ सत्य॑धर्माणा पर॒मे व्यो॑मनि यमत्र॑ मित्रावरु॒णाव॑थो यु॒वं तस्मै॑ वृ॒ष्टिर्मधु॑मत्पिन्वते दि॒वः
stanzas.transliteration: ŕ̥tasya gopāv ádhi tiṣṭhatho ráthaṃ sátyadharmāṇā paramé vyòmani yám átra mitrāvaruṇā́vatho yuváṃ tásmai vr̥ṣṭír mádhumat pinvate diváḥ
stanzas.translation: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend. O Mitra-Varuṇa whomsoe'er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

translations.griffith: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend. O Mitra-Varuṇa whomsoe'er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒म्राजा॑व॒स्य भुव॑नस्य राजथो॒ मित्रा॑वरुणा वि॒दथे॑ स्व॒र्दृशा॑ वृ॒ष्टिं वां॒ राधो॑ अमृत॒त्वमी॑महे॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि च॑रन्ति त॒न्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: samrā́jāv asyá bhúvanasya rājatho mítrāvaruṇā vidáthe svardŕ̥śā vr̥ṣṭíṃ vāṃ rā́dho amr̥tatvám īmahe dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ví caranti tanyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light. We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

translations.griffith: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light. We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒म्राजा॑ उ॒ग्रा वृ॑ष॒भा दि॒वस्पती॑ पृथि॒व्या मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ विच॑र्षणी चि॒त्रेभि॑र॒भ्रैरुप॑ तिष्ठथो॒ रवं॒ द्यां व॑र्षयथो॒ असु॑रस्य मा॒यया॑
stanzas.transliteration: samrā́jā ugrā́ vr̥ṣabhā́ divás pátī pr̥thivyā́ mitrā́váruṇā vícarṣaṇī citrébhir abhraír úpa tiṣṭhatho rávaṃ dyā́ṃ varṣayatho ásurasya māyáyā
stanzas.translation: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, ye ever active Ones, Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

translations.griffith: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, ye ever active Ones, Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा॒या वां॑ मित्रावरुणा दि॒वि श्रि॒ता सूर्यो॒ ज्योति॑श्चरति चि॒त्रमायु॑धम् तम॒भ्रेण॑ वृ॒ष्ट्या गू॑हथो दि॒वि पर्ज॑न्य द्र॒प्सा मधु॑मन्त ईरते
stanzas.transliteration: māyā́ vām mitrāvaruṇā diví śritā́ sū́ryo jyótiś carati citrám ā́yudham tám abhréṇa vr̥ṣṭyā́ gūhatho diví párjanya drapsā́ mádhumanta īrate
stanzas.translation: Your magic, Mitra-Varuṇa, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light. Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

translations.griffith: Your magic, Mitra-Varuṇa, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light. Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथं॑ युञ्जते म॒रुतः॑ शु॒भे सु॒खं शूरो॒ न मि॑त्रावरुणा॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु रजां॑सि चि॒त्रा वि च॑रन्ति त॒न्यवो॑ दि॒वः स॑म्राजा॒ पय॑सा न उक्षतम्
stanzas.transliteration: ráthaṃ yuñjate marútaḥ śubhé sukháṃ śū́ro ná mitrāvaruṇā gáviṣṭiṣu rájāṃsi citrā́ ví caranti tanyávo diváḥ samrājā páyasā na ukṣatam
stanzas.translation: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuṇa, as a hero in the wars. The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

translations.griffith: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuṇa, as a hero in the wars. The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाचं॒ सु मि॑त्रावरुणा॒विरा॑वतीं प॒र्जन्य॑श्चि॒त्रां व॑दति॒ त्विषी॑मतीम् अ॒भ्रा व॑सत म॒रुतः॒ सु मा॒यया॒ द्यां व॑र्षयतमरु॒णाम॑रे॒पस॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vā́caṃ sú mitrāvaruṇāv írāvatīm parjányaś citrā́ṃ vadati tvíṣīmatīm abhrā́ vasata marútaḥ sú māyáyā dyā́ṃ varṣayatam aruṇā́m arepásam
stanzas.translation: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuṇa: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice. With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

translations.griffith: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuṇa: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice. With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

stanzas.sanskrit: धर्म॑णा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता व्र॒ता र॑क्षेथे॒ असु॑रस्य मा॒यया॑ ऋ॒तेन॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ वि रा॑जथः॒ सूर्य॒मा ध॑त्थो दि॒वि चित्र्यं॒ रथ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dhármaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā́ rakṣethe ásurasya māyáyā r̥téna víśvam bhúvanaṃ ví rājathaḥ sū́ryam ā́ dhattho diví cítryaṃ rátham
stanzas.translation: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuṇa. Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

translations.griffith: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuṇa. Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

stanzas.sanskrit: वरु॑णं वो रि॒शाद॑समृ॒चा मि॒त्रं ह॑वामहे परि॑ व्र॒जेव॑ बा॒ह्वोर्ज॑ग॒न्वांसा॒ स्व॑र्णरम्
stanzas.transliteration: váruṇaṃ vo riśā́dasam r̥cā́ mitráṃ havāmahe pári vrajéva bāhvór jaganvā́ṃsā svàrṇaram
stanzas.translation: You, foeman-slaying Varuṇa and Mitra, we invoke with song, Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

translations.griffith: You, foeman-slaying Varuṇa and Mitra, we invoke with song, Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता बा॒हवा॑ सुचे॒तुना॒ प्र य॑न्तमस्मा॒ अर्च॑ते शेवं॒ हि जा॒र्यं॑ वां॒ विश्वा॑सु॒ क्षासु॒ जोगु॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ bāhávā sucetúnā prá yantam asmā árcate śévaṃ hí jāryàṃ vāṃ víśvāsu kṣā́su jóguve
stanzas.translation: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns, For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.

translations.griffith: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns, For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.

stanzas.sanskrit: यन्नू॒नम॒श्यां गतिं॑ मि॒त्रस्य॑ यायां प॒था अस्य॑ प्रि॒यस्य॒ शर्म॒ण्यहिं॑सानस्य सश्चिरे
stanzas.transliteration: yán nūnám aśyā́ṃ gátim mitrásya yāyām pathā́ ásya priyásya śármaṇi- áhiṃsānasya saścire
stanzas.translation: That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path. Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.

translations.griffith: That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path. Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वाभ्यां॑ मित्रावरुणोप॒मं धे॑यामृ॒चा यद्ध॒ क्षये॑ म॒घोनां॑ स्तोतॄ॒णां च॑ स्पू॒र्धसे॑
stanzas.transliteration: yuvā́bhyām mitrāvaruṇā- -upamáṃ dheyām r̥cā́ yád dha kṣáye maghónāṃ stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ ca spūrdháse
stanzas.translation: Mitra and Varuṇa, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed. That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.

translations.griffith: Mitra and Varuṇa, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed. That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ मित्र सुदी॒तिभि॒र्वरु॑णश्च स॒धस्थ॒ आ स्वे क्षये॑ म॒घोनां॒ सखी॑नां च वृ॒धसे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no mitra sudītíbhir váruṇaś ca sadhástha ā́ své kṣáye maghónāṃ sákhīnāṃ ca vr̥dháse
stanzas.translation: With your fair splendours, Varuṇa and Mitra, to our gathering come, That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.

translations.griffith: With your fair splendours, Varuṇa and Mitra, to our gathering come, That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वं नो॒ येषु॑ वरुण क्ष॒त्रं बृ॒हच्च॑ बिभृ॒थः उ॒रु णो॒ वाज॑सातये कृ॒तं रा॒ये स्व॒स्तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: yuváṃ no yéṣu varuṇa kṣatrám br̥hác ca bibhr̥tháḥ urú ṇo vā́jasātaye kr̥táṃ rāyé svastáye
stanzas.translation: With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy, Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.

translations.griffith: With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy, Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒च्छन्त्यां॑ मे यज॒ता दे॒वक्ष॑त्रे॒ रुश॑द्गवि सु॒तं सोमं॒ न ह॒स्तिभि॒रा प॒ड्भिर्धा॑वतं नरा॒ बिभ्र॑तावर्च॒नान॑सम्
stanzas.transliteration: uchántyām me yajatā́ devákṣatre rúśadgavi sutáṃ sómaṃ ná hastíbhir ā́ paḍbhír dhāvataṃ narā bíbhratāv arcanā́nasam
stanzas.translation: When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods' realm where white Cows shine, Supporting Archanânas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.

translations.griffith: When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods' realm where white Cows shine, Supporting Archanânas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: यश्चि॒केत॒ स सु॒क्रतु॑र्देव॒त्रा स ब्र॑वीतु नः वरु॑णो॒ यस्य॑ दर्श॒तो मि॒त्रो वा॒ वन॑ते॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáś cikéta sá sukrátur devatrā́ sá bravītu naḥ váruṇo yásya darśató mitró vā vánate gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: FULL wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the Gods,– The man whose praise-songs Varuṇa the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.

translations.griffith: FULL wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the Gods,– The man whose praise-songs Varuṇa the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता हि श्रेष्ठ॑वर्चसा॒ राजा॑ना दीर्घ॒श्रुत्त॑मा ता सत्प॑ती ऋता॒वृध॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ना॒ जने॑जने
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ hí śréṣṭhavarcasā rā́jānā dīrghaśrúttamā tā́ sátpatī r̥tāvŕ̥dhā- r̥tā́vānā jáne-jane
stanzas.translation: For they are Kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread; Lords of the brave, who strengthen Law, the Holy Ones with every race.

translations.griffith: For they are Kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread; Lords of the brave, who strengthen Law, the Holy Ones with every race.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वा॑मिया॒नोऽव॑से॒ पूर्वा॒ उप॑ ब्रुवे॒ सचा॑ स्वश्वा॑सः॒ सु चे॒तुना॒ वाजाँ॑ अ॒भि प्र दा॒वने॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vām iyānó 'vase pū́rvā úpa bruve sácā sváśvāsaḥ sú cetúnā vā́jām̐ abhí prá dāváne
stanzas.translation: Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first We who have good steeds call on you, Most Sage, to give us strength besides.

translations.griffith: Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first We who have good steeds call on you, Most Sage, to give us strength besides.

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒त्रो अं॒होश्चि॒दादु॒रु क्षया॑य गा॒तुं व॑नते मि॒त्रस्य॒ हि प्र॒तूर्व॑तः सुम॒तिरस्ति॑ विध॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: mitró aṃhóś cid ā́d urú kṣáyāya gātúṃ vanate mitrásya hí pratū́rvataḥ sumatír ásti vidhatáḥ
stanzas.translation: E'en out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case, For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van. '

translations.griffith: E'en out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case, For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van. '

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं मि॒त्रस्याव॑सि॒ स्याम॑ स॒प्रथ॑स्तमे अ॒ने॒हस॒स्त्वोत॑यः स॒त्रा वरु॑णशेषसः
stanzas.transliteration: vayám mitrásyā́vasi syā́ma sapráthastame anehásas tvótayaḥ satrā́ váruṇaśeṣasaḥ
stanzas.translation: In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell, Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuṇa.

translations.griffith: In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell, Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuṇa.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वं मि॑त्रे॒मं जनं॒ यत॑थः॒ सं च॑ नयथः मा म॒घोनः॒ परि॑ ख्यतं॒ मो अ॒स्माक॒मृषी॑णां गोपी॒थे न॑ उरुष्यतम्
stanzas.transliteration: yuvám mitremáṃ jánaṃ yátathaḥ sáṃ ca nayathaḥ mā́ maghónaḥ pári khyatam mó asmā́kam ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ gopīthé na uruṣyatam
stanzas.translation: Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways. Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the R̥ishis: be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.

translations.griffith: Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways. Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the R̥ishis: be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ चि॑कितान सु॒क्रतू॑ दे॒वौ म॑र्त रि॒शाद॑सा वरु॑णाय ऋ॒तपे॑शसे दधी॒त प्रय॑से म॒हे
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ cikitāna sukrátū devaú marta riśā́dasā váruṇāya r̥tápeśase dadhītá práyase mahé
stanzas.translation: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe. For Varuṇa, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

translations.griffith: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe. For Varuṇa, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता हि क्ष॒त्रमवि॑ह्रुतं स॒म्यग॑सु॒र्य१॒॑माशा॑ते अध॑ व्र॒तेव॒ मानु॑षं॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण धा॑यि दर्श॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ hí kṣatrám ávihrutaṃ samyág asuryàm ā́śāte ádha vratéva mā́nuṣaṃ svàr ṇá dhāyi darśatám
stanzas.translation: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine. And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

translations.griffith: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine. And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वा॒मेषे॒ रथा॑नामु॒र्वीं गव्यू॑तिमेषाम् रा॒तह॑व्यस्य सुष्टु॒तिं द॒धृक्स्तोमै॑र्मनामहे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vām éṣe ráthānām urvī́ṃ gávyūtim eṣām rātáhavyasya suṣṭutíṃ dadhŕ̥k stómair manāmahe
stanzas.translation: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours- You who accept the eulogy of Râtahavya with his hymns.

translations.griffith: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours- You who accept the eulogy of Râtahavya with his hymns.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ हि काव्या॑ यु॒वं दक्ष॑स्य पू॒र्भिर॑द्भुता नि के॒तुना॒ जना॑नां चि॒केथे॑ पूतदक्षसा
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā hí kā́vyā yuváṃ dákṣasya pūrbhír adbhutā ní ketúnā jánānāṃ cikéthe pūtadakṣasā
stanzas.translation: And ye show wMom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence. By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.

translations.griffith: And ye show wMom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence. By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.

stanzas.sanskrit: तदृ॒तं पृ॑थिवि बृ॒हच्छ्र॑वए॒ष ऋषी॑णाम् ज्र॒य॒सा॒नावरं॑ पृ॒थ्वति॑ क्षरन्ति॒ याम॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: tád r̥tám pr̥thivi br̥hác -śravaeṣá ŕ̥ṣīṇām jrayasānā́v áram pr̥thú- áti kṣaranti yā́mabhiḥ
stanzas.translation: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the R̥ishis' toil for fame The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

translations.griffith: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the R̥ishis' toil for fame The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यद्वा॑मीयचक्षसा॒ मित्र॑ व॒यं च॑ सू॒रयः॑ व्यचि॑ष्ठे बहु॒पाय्ये॒ यते॑महि स्व॒राज्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yád vām īyacakṣasā mítra vayáṃ ca sūráyaḥ vyáciṣṭhe bahupā́yye yátemahi svarā́jye
stanzas.translation: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

translations.griffith: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

stanzas.sanskrit: बळि॒त्था दे॑व निष्कृ॒तमादि॑त्या यज॒तं बृ॒हत् वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑म॒न्वर्षि॑ष्ठं क्ष॒त्रमा॑शाथे
stanzas.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ deva niṣkr̥tám ā́dityā yajatám br̥hát váruṇa mítrā́ryaman várṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatrám āśāthe
stanzas.translation: YE Gods, Âdityas, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Mitra, verily Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

translations.griffith: YE Gods, Âdityas, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Mitra, verily Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यद्योनिं॑ हिर॒ण्ययं॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ सद॑थः ध॒र्तारा॑ चर्षणी॒नां य॒न्तं सु॒म्नं रि॑शादसा
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yád yóniṃ hiraṇyáyaṃ váruṇa mítra sádathaḥ dhartā́rā carṣaṇīnā́m yantáṃ sumnáṃ riśādasā
stanzas.translation: When, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place, Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.

translations.griffith: When, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place, Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॒ हि वि॒श्ववे॑दसो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा व्र॒ता प॒देव॑ सश्चिरे॒ पान्ति॒ मर्त्यं॑ रि॒षः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve hí viśvávedaso váruṇo mitró aryamā́ vratā́ padéva saścire pā́nti mártyaṃ riṣáḥ
stanzas.translation: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

translations.griffith: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते हि स॒त्या ऋ॑त॒स्पृश॑ ऋ॒तावा॑नो॒ जने॑जने सु॒नी॒थासः॑ सु॒दान॑वों॒ऽहोश्चि॑दुरु॒चक्र॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: té hí satyā́ r̥taspŕ̥śaḥ- r̥tā́vāno jáne-jane sunīthā́saḥ sudā́navo -aṃhóś cid urucákrayaḥ
stanzas.translation: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race, Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

translations.griffith: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race, Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

stanzas.sanskrit: को नु वां॑ मि॒त्रास्तु॑तो॒ वरु॑णो वा त॒नूना॑म् तत्सु वा॒मेष॑ते म॒तिरत्रि॑भ्य॒ एष॑ते म॒तिः
stanzas.transliteration: kó nú vām mitrā́stuto váruṇo vā tanū́nām tát sú vām éṣate matír átribhya éṣate matíḥ
stanzas.translation: Which of your persons, Varuṇa or Mitra, merits not our praise? Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

translations.griffith: Which of your persons, Varuṇa or Mitra, merits not our praise? Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ मि॒त्राय॑ गायत॒ वरु॑णाय वि॒पा गि॒रा महि॑क्षत्रावृ॒तं बृ॒हत्
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo mitrā́ya gāyata váruṇāya vipā́ girā́ máhikṣatrāv r̥tám br̥hát
stanzas.translation: SING forth unto your Varuṇa and Mitra with a song inspired. They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

translations.griffith: SING forth unto your Varuṇa and Mitra with a song inspired. They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒म्राजा॒ या घृ॒तयो॑नी मि॒त्रश्चो॒भा वरु॑णश्च दे॒वा दे॒वेषु॑ प्रश॒स्ता
stanzas.transliteration: samrā́jā yā́ ghr̥táyonī mitráś cobhā́ váruṇaś ca devā́ devéṣu praśastā́
stanzas.translation: Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuṇa, the Twain, Gods glorified among the Gods.

translations.griffith: Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuṇa, the Twain, Gods glorified among the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता नः॑ शक्तं॒ पार्थि॑वस्य म॒हो रा॒यो दि॒व्यस्य॑ महि॑ वां क्ष॒त्रं दे॒वेषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ naḥ śaktam pā́rthivasya mahó rāyó divyásya máhi vāṃ kṣatráṃ devéṣu
stanzas.translation: So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth: Vast is your sway among the Gods.

translations.griffith: So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth: Vast is your sway among the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तमृ॒तेन॒ सप॑न्तेषि॒रं दक्ष॑माशाते अ॒द्रुहा॑ दे॒वौ व॑र्धेते
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tám r̥téna sápantā- -iṣiráṃ dákṣam āśāte adrúhā devaú vardhete
stanzas.translation: Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might. The two Gods wax devoid of guile.

translations.griffith: Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might. The two Gods wax devoid of guile.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृ॒ष्टिद्या॑वा री॒त्या॑पे॒षस्पती॒ दानु॑मत्याः बृ॒हन्तं॒ गर्त॑माशाते
stanzas.transliteration: vr̥ṣṭídyāvā rītyā̀pā- -iṣás pátī dā́numatyāḥ br̥hántaṃ gártam āśāte
stanzas.translation: With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts, A lofty seat have they attained.

translations.griffith: With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts, A lofty seat have they attained.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्री रो॑च॒ना व॑रुण॒ त्रीँरु॒त द्यून्त्रीणि॑ मित्र धारयथो॒ रजां॑सि वा॒वृ॒धा॒नाव॒मतिं॑ क्ष॒त्रिय॒स्यानु॑ व्र॒तं रक्ष॑माणावजु॒र्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ rocanā́ varuṇa trī́m̐r utá dyū́n trī́ṇi mitra dhārayatho rájāṃsi vāvr̥dhānā́v amátiṃ kṣatríyasya- -ánu vratáṃ rákṣamāṇāv ajuryám
stanzas.translation: THREE spheres of light, O Varuṇa, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

translations.griffith: THREE spheres of light, O Varuṇa, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: इरा॑वतीर्वरुण धे॒नवो॑ वां॒ मधु॑मद्वां॒ सिन्ध॑वो मित्र दुह्रे त्रय॑स्तस्थुर्वृष॒भास॑स्तिसृ॒णां धि॒षणा॑नां रेतो॒धा वि द्यु॒मन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: írāvatīr varuṇa dhenávo vām mádhumad vāṃ síndhavo mitra duhre tráyas tasthur vr̥ṣabhā́sas tisr̥ṇā́ṃ dhiṣáṇānāṃ retodhā́ ví dyumántaḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye, Varuṇa, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness. There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

translations.griffith: Ye, Varuṇa, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness. There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒तर्दे॒वीमदि॑तिं जोहवीमि म॒ध्यंदि॑न॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य रा॒ये मि॑त्रावरुणा स॒र्वता॒तेळे॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः
stanzas.transliteration: prātár devī́m áditiṃ johavīmi madhyáṃdina úditā sū́ryasya rāyé mitrāvaruṇā sarvátātā- -ī́ḷe tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ
stanzas.translation: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting. I pray, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

translations.griffith: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting. I pray, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

stanzas.sanskrit: या ध॒र्तारा॒ रज॑सो रोच॒नस्यो॒तादि॒त्या दि॒व्या पार्थि॑वस्य न वां॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॒ आ मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तानि॑ मित्रावरुणा ध्रु॒वाणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ dhartā́rā rájaso rocanásya- -utā́dityā́ divyā́ pā́rthivasya ná vāṃ devā́ amŕ̥tā ā́ minanti vratā́ni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvā́ṇi
stanzas.translation: Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Âdityas, The Immortal Gods, O Varuṇa and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.

translations.griffith: Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Âdityas, The Immortal Gods, O Varuṇa and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रू॒रुणा॑ चि॒द्ध्यस्त्यवो॑ नू॒नं वां॑ वरुण मित्र॒ वंसि॑ वां सुम॒तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: purūrúṇā cid dhy ásti- ávo nūnáṃ vāṃ varuṇa mítra váṃsi vāṃ sumatím
stanzas.translation: EVEN far and wide, O Varuṇa and Mitra, doth your grace extend. May I obtain your kind good-will.

translations.griffith: EVEN far and wide, O Varuṇa and Mitra, doth your grace extend. May I obtain your kind good-will.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वां॑ स॒म्यग॑द्रुह्वा॒णेष॑मश्याम॒ धाय॑से व॒यं ते रु॑द्रा स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ samyág adruhvāṇā- -íṣam aśyāma dhā́yase vayáṃ té rudrā syāma
stanzas.translation: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance. Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

translations.griffith: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance. Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

stanzas.sanskrit: पा॒तं नो॑ रुद्रा पा॒युभि॑रु॒त त्रा॑येथां सुत्रा॒त्रा तु॒र्याम॒ दस्यू॑न्त॒नूभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: pātáṃ no rudrā pāyúbhir utá trāyethāṃ sutrātrā́ turyā́ma dásyūn tanū́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar4 save us, ye skilled to save, my we Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

translations.griffith: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar4 save us, ye skilled to save, my we Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

stanzas.sanskrit: मा कस्या॑द्भुतक्रतू य॒क्षं भु॑जेमा त॒नूभिः॑ मा शेष॑सा॒ मा तन॑सा
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ kásyādbhutakratū yakṣám bhujemā tanū́bhiḥ mā́ śéṣasā mā́ tánasā
stanzas.translation: Or ne'er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast, Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

translations.griffith: Or ne'er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast, Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ गन्तं रिशादसा॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॑ ब॒र्हणा॑ उपे॒मं चारु॑मध्व॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no gantaṃ riśādasā váruṇa mítra barháṇā úpemáṃ cā́rum adhvarám
stanzas.translation: O Varuṇa and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might To this our goodly sacrifice.

translations.griffith: O Varuṇa and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might To this our goodly sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि प्र॑चेतसा॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ राज॑थः ई॒शा॒ना पि॑प्यतं॒ धियः॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśvasya hí pracetasā váruṇa mítra rā́jathaḥ īśānā́ pipyataṃ dhíyaḥ
stanzas.translation: For, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all. Fill full our songs, for this ye can.

translations.griffith: For, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all. Fill full our songs, for this ye can.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ नः सु॒तमा ग॑तं॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॑ दा॒शुषः॑ अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: úpa naḥ sutám ā́ gataṃ váruṇa mítra dāśúṣaḥ asyá sómasya pītáye
stanzas.translation: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuṇa, Mitra, come to drink This Soma of the worshipper.

translations.griffith: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuṇa, Mitra, come to drink This Soma of the worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे व॒यं गी॒र्भिर्जु॑हुमो अत्रि॒वत् नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतं॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ mitré váruṇe vayáṃ gīrbhír juhumo atrivát ní barhíṣi sadataṃ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: To Varuṇa and Mitra we offerwith songs, as Atri did. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: To Varuṇa and Mitra we offerwith songs, as Atri did. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्र॒तेन॑ स्थो ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मा॒ धर्म॑णा यात॒यज्ज॑ना नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतं॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: vraténa stho dhruvákṣemā dhármaṇā yātayájjanā ní barhíṣi sadataṃ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒त्रश्च॑ नो॒ वरु॑णश्च जु॒षेतां॑ य॒ज्ञमि॒ष्टये॑ नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतां॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: mitráś ca no váruṇaś ca juṣétāṃ yajñám iṣṭáye ní barhíṣi sadatāṃ sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: May Varuṇa and Mitra, for our help, accept the sacrifice. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: May Varuṇa and Mitra, for our help, accept the sacrifice. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद॒द्य स्थः प॑रा॒वति॒ यद॑र्वा॒वत्य॑श्विना यद्वा॑ पु॒रू पु॑रुभुजा॒ यद॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ आ ग॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: yád adyá stháḥ parāváti yád arvāváty aśvinā yád vā purū́ purubhujā yád antárikṣa ā́ gatam
stanzas.translation: WHETHER, O Aṣvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand, In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

translations.griffith: WHETHER, O Aṣvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand, In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ह त्या पु॑रु॒भूत॑मा पु॒रू दंसां॑सि॒ बिभ्र॑ता व॒र॒स्या या॒म्यध्रि॑गू हु॒वे तु॒विष्ट॑मा भु॒जे
stanzas.transliteration: ihá tyā́ purubhū́tamā purū́ dáṃsāṃsi bíbhratā varasyā́ yāmy ádhrigū huvé tuvíṣṭamā bhujé
stanzas.translation: These here, who show o'er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act, Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

translations.griffith: These here, who show o'er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act, Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒र्मान्यद्वपु॑षे॒ वपु॑श्च॒क्रं रथ॑स्य येमथुः पर्य॒न्या नाहु॑षा यु॒गा म॒ह्ना रजां॑सि दीयथः
stanzas.transliteration: īrmā́nyád vápuṣe vápuś cakráṃ ráthasya yemathuḥ páry anyā́ nā́huṣā yugā́ mahnā́ rájāṃsi dīyathaḥ
stanzas.translation: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car. With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

translations.griffith: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car. With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

stanzas.sanskrit: तदू॒ षु वा॑मे॒ना कृ॒तं विश्वा॒ यद्वा॒मनु॒ ष्टवे॑ नाना॑ जा॒ताव॑रे॒पसा॒ सम॒स्मे बन्धु॒मेय॑थुः
stanzas.transliteration: tád ū ṣú vām enā́ kr̥táṃ víśvā yád vām ánu ṣṭáve nā́nā jātā́v arepásā sám asmé bándhum éyathuḥ
stanzas.translation: That deed of yours that is extolled, Viṣvas! hath all been done with this. Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.

translations.griffith: That deed of yours that is extolled, Viṣvas! hath all been done with this. Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यद्वां॑ सू॒र्या रथं॒ तिष्ठ॑द्रघु॒ष्यदं॒ सदा॑ परि॑ वामरु॒षा वयो॑ घृ॒णा व॑रन्त आ॒तपः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yád vāṃ sūryā́ ráthaṃ tíṣṭhad raghuṣyádaṃ sádā pári vām aruṣā́ váyo ghr̥ṇā́ varanta ātápaḥ
stanzas.translation: When Sûryâ mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly, Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.

translations.griffith: When Sûryâ mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly, Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वोरत्रि॑श्चिकेतति॒ नरा॑ सु॒म्नेन॒ चेत॑सा घ॒र्मं यद्वा॑मरे॒पसं॒ नास॑त्या॒स्ना भु॑र॒ण्यति॑
stanzas.transliteration: yuvór átriś ciketati nárā sumnéna cétasā gharmáṃ yád vām arepásaṃ nā́satyāsnā́ bhuraṇyáti
stanzas.translation: Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind, What time, Nâsatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.

translations.griffith: Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind, What time, Nâsatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ग्रो वां॑ ककु॒हो य॒यिः शृ॒ण्वे यामे॑षु संत॒निः यद्वां॒ दंसो॑भिरश्वि॒नात्रि॑र्नराव॒वर्त॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: ugró vāṃ kakuhó yayíḥ śr̥ṇvé yā́meṣu saṃtaníḥ yád vāṃ dáṃsobhir aśvinā́- -átrir narāvavártati
stanzas.translation: Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course When by your great deeds, Atyins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.

translations.griffith: Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course When by your great deeds, Atyins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.

stanzas.sanskrit: मध्व॑ ऊ॒ षु म॑धूयुवा॒ रुद्रा॒ सिष॑क्ति पि॒प्युषी॑ यत्स॑मु॒द्राति॒ पर्ष॑थः प॒क्वाः पृक्षो॑ भरन्त वाम्
stanzas.transliteration: mádhva ū ṣú madhūyuvā rúdrā síṣakti pipyúṣī yát samudrā́ti párṣathaḥ pakvā́ḥ pŕ̥kṣo bharanta vām
stanzas.translation: Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you. When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.

translations.griffith: Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you. When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्यमिद्वा उ॑ अश्विना यु॒वामा॑हुर्मयो॒भुवा॑ ता याम॑न्याम॒हूत॑मा॒ याम॒न्ना मृ॑ळ॒यत्त॑मा
stanzas.transliteration: satyám íd vā́ u aśvinā yuvā́m āhur mayobhúvā tā́ yā́man yāmahū́tamā yā́mann ā́ mr̥ḷayáttamā
stanzas.translation: Aṣvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity; At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Aṣvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity; At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वर्ध॑ना॒श्विभ्यां॑ सन्तु॒ शंत॑मा या तक्षा॑म॒ रथाँ॑ इ॒वावो॑चाम बृ॒हन्नमः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ bráhmāṇi várdhanā- -aśvíbhyāṃ santu śáṃtamā yā́ tákṣāma ráthām̐ iva- -ávocāma br̥hán námaḥ
stanzas.translation: Most pleasing to the Aṣvins be these prayers which magnify their might, Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.

translations.griffith: Most pleasing to the Aṣvins be these prayers which magnify their might, Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.

stanzas.sanskrit: कूष्ठो॑ देवावश्विना॒द्या दि॒वो म॑नावसू तच्छ्र॑वथो वृषण्वसू॒ अत्रि॑र्वा॒मा वि॑वासति
stanzas.transliteration: kū́ ṣṭho devāv aśvinā- -adyā́ divó manāvasū tác chravatho vr̥ṣaṇvasū átrir vām ā́ vivāsati
stanzas.translation: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Aṣvins, rich in constancy? Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

translations.griffith: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Aṣvins, rich in constancy? Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

stanzas.sanskrit: कुह॒ त्या कुह॒ नु श्रु॒ता दि॒वि दे॒वा नास॑त्या कस्मि॒न्ना य॑तथो॒ जने॒ को वां॑ न॒दीनां॒ सचा॑
stanzas.transliteration: kúha tyā́ kúha nú śrutā́ diví devā́ nā́satyā kásminn ā́ yatatho jáne kó vāṃ nadī́nāṃ sácā
stanzas.translation: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nâsatyas, Gods in heaven? Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

translations.griffith: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nâsatyas, Gods in heaven? Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

stanzas.sanskrit: कं या॑थः॒ कं ह॑ गच्छथः॒ कमच्छा॑ युञ्जाथे॒ रथ॑म् कस्य॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि रण्यथो व॒यं वा॑मुश्मसी॒ष्टये॑
stanzas.transliteration: káṃ yāthaḥ káṃ ha gachathaḥ kám áchā yuñjāthe rátham kásya bráhmāṇi raṇyatho vayáṃ vām uśmasīṣṭáye
stanzas.translation: Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car? With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.

translations.griffith: Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car? With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.

stanzas.sanskrit: पौ॒रं चि॒द्ध्यु॑द॒प्रुतं॒ पौर॑ पौ॒राय॒ जिन्व॑थः यदीं॑ गृभी॒तता॑तये सिं॒हमि॑व द्रु॒हस्प॒दे
stanzas.transliteration: pauráṃ cid dhy ùdaprútam paúra paurā́ya jínvathaḥ yád īṃ gr̥bhītátātaye siṃhám iva druhás padé
stanzas.translation: Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood, Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.

translations.griffith: Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood, Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र च्यवा॑नाज्जुजु॒रुषो॑ व॒व्रिमत्कं॒ न मु॑ञ्चथः युवा॒ यदी॑ कृ॒थः पुन॒रा काम॑मृण्वे व॒ध्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá cyávānāj jujurúṣo vavrím átkaṃ ná muñcathaḥ yúvā yádī kr̥tháḥ púnar ā́ kā́mam r̥ṇve vadhvàḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye from Chyavâna worn with age removed his skin as 'twere a robe. So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.

translations.griffith: Ye from Chyavâna worn with age removed his skin as 'twere a robe. So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्ति॒ हि वा॑मि॒ह स्तो॒ता स्मसि॑ वां सं॒दृशि॑ श्रि॒ये नू श्रु॒तं म॒ आ ग॑त॒मवो॑भिर्वाजिनीवसू
stanzas.transliteration: ásti hí vām ihá stotā́ smási vāṃ saṃdŕ̥śi śriyé nū́ śrutám ma ā́ gatam ávobhir vājinīvasū
stanzas.translation: Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here. Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.

translations.griffith: Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here. Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: को वा॑म॒द्य पु॑रू॒णामा व॑व्ने॒ मर्त्या॑नाम् को विप्रो॑ विप्रवाहसा॒ को य॒ज्ञैर्वा॑जिनीवसू
stanzas.transliteration: kó vām adyá purūṇā́m ā́ vavne mártyānām kó vípro vipravāhasā kó yajñaír vājinīvasū
stanzas.translation: Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself? What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?

translations.griffith: Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself? What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॒ रथो॒ रथा॑नां॒ येष्ठो॑ यात्वश्विना पु॒रू चि॑दस्म॒युस्ति॒र आ॑ङ्गू॒षो मर्त्ये॒ष्वा
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho ráthānāṃ yéṣṭho yātv aśvinā purū́ cid asmayús tiráḥ- āṅgūṣó mártyeṣv ā́
stanzas.translation: O Aṣvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed. Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.

translations.griffith: O Aṣvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed. Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.

stanzas.sanskrit: शमू॒ षु वां॑ मधूयुवा॒स्माक॑मस्तु चर्कृ॒तिः अ॒र्वा॒ची॒ना वि॑चेतसा॒ विभिः॑ श्ये॒नेव॑ दीयतम्
stanzas.transliteration: śám ū ṣú vām madhūyuvā- -asmā́kam astu carkr̥tíḥ arvācīnā́ vicetasā víbhiḥ śyenéva dīyatam
stanzas.translation: May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you. Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.

translations.griffith: May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you. Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वि॑ना॒ यद्ध॒ कर्हि॑ चिच्छुश्रू॒यात॑मि॒मं हव॑म् वस्वी॑रू॒ षु वां॒ भुजः॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्ति॒ सु वां॒ पृचः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áśvinā yád dha kárhi cic -śuśrūyā́tam imáṃ hávam vásvīr ū ṣú vām bhújaḥ pr̥ñcánti sú vām pŕ̥caḥ
stanzas.translation: O Aṣvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine, For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.

translations.griffith: O Aṣvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine, For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॑ प्रि॒यत॑मं॒ रथं॒ वृष॑णं वसु॒वाह॑नम् स्तो॒ता वा॑मश्विना॒वृषिः॒ स्तोमे॑न॒ प्रति॑ भूषति॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: práti priyátamaṃ ráthaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vasuvā́hanam stotā́ vām aśvināv ŕ̥ṣiḥ- stómena práti bhūṣati mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us, Aṣvins, the R̥ishi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us, Aṣvins, the R̥ishi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒त्याया॑तमश्विना ति॒रो विश्वा॑ अ॒हं सना॑ दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी॒ सुषु॑म्ना॒ सिन्धु॑वाहसा॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: atyā́yātam aśvinā tiró víśvā aháṃ sánā dásrā híraṇyavartanī súṣumnā síndhuvāhasā mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Pass, O ye Aṣvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men, Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: Pass, O ye Aṣvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men, Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॒ रत्ना॑नि॒ बिभ्र॑ता॒वश्वि॑ना॒ गच्छ॑तं यु॒वम् रुद्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी जुषा॒णा वा॑जिनीवसू॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no rátnāni bíbhratāv áśvinā gáchataṃ yuvám rúdrā híraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā́ vājinīvasū mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Come to us, O ye Aṣvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: Come to us, O ye Aṣvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒ष्टुभो॑ वां वृषण्वसू॒ रथे॒ वाणी॒च्याहि॑ता उ॒त वां॑ ककु॒हो मृ॒गः पृक्षः॑ कृणोति वापु॒षो माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: suṣṭúbho vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū ráthe vā́ṇīcy ā́hitā utá vāṃ kakuhó mr̥gáḥ pŕ̥kṣaḥ kr̥ṇoti vāpuṣó mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car. And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car. And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: बो॒धिन्म॑नसा र॒थ्ये॑षि॒रा ह॑वन॒श्रुता॑ विभि॒श्च्यवा॑नमश्विना॒ नि या॑थो॒ अद्व॑याविनं॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: bodhínmanasā rathyā̀- -iṣirā́ havanaśrútā víbhiś cyávānam aśvinā ní yātho ádvayāvinam mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry, Aṣvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to Chyavâna void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry, Aṣvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to Chyavâna void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॑ नरा मनो॒युजोऽश्वा॑सः प्रुषि॒तप्स॑वः वयो॑ वहन्तु पी॒तये॑ स॒ह सु॒म्नेभि॑रश्विना॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ narā manoyújaḥ- -áśvāsaḥ pruṣitápsavaḥ váyo vahantu pītáye sahá sumnébhir aśvinā mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought, Your flying steeds, O Aṣvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought, Your flying steeds, O Aṣvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वि॑ना॒वेह ग॑च्छतं॒ नास॑त्या॒ मा वि वे॑नतम् ति॒रश्चि॑दर्य॒या परि॑ व॒र्तिर्या॑तमदाभ्या॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: áśvināv éhá gachataṃ nā́satyā mā́ ví venatam tiráś cid aryayā́ pári vartír yātam adābhyā mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: O Aṣvins, hither come to us; Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

translations.griffith: O Aṣvins, hither come to us; Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे अ॑दाभ्या जरि॒तारं॑ शुभस्पती अ॒व॒स्युम॑श्विना यु॒वं गृ॒णन्त॒मुप॑ भूषथो॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: asmín yajñé adābhyā jaritā́raṃ śubhas patī avasyúm aśvinā yuváṃ gr̥ṇántam úpa bhūṣatho mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice. Beside the singer, Aṣvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

translations.griffith: Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice. Beside the singer, Aṣvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: अभू॑दु॒षा रुश॑त्पशु॒राग्निर॑धाय्यृ॒त्वियः॑ अयो॑जि वां वृषण्वसू॒ रथो॑ दस्रा॒वम॑र्त्यो॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ábhūd uṣā́ rúśatpaśur ā́gnír adhāyy r̥tvíyaḥ áyoji vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū rátho dasrāv ámartyaḥ mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam
stanzas.translation: Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed. Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

translations.griffith: Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed. Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ भा॑त्य॒ग्निरु॒षसा॒मनी॑क॒मुद्विप्रा॑णां देव॒या वाचो॑ अस्थुः अ॒र्वाञ्चा॑ नू॒नं र॑थ्ये॒ह या॑तं पीपि॒वांस॑मश्विना घ॒र्ममच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ bhāty agnír uṣásām ánīkam úd víprāṇāṃ devayā́ vā́co asthuḥ arvā́ñcā nūnáṃ rathyehá yātam pīpivā́ṃsam aśvinā gharmám ácha
stanzas.translation: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended. Borne on your chariot, Aṣvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

translations.griffith: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended. Borne on your chariot, Aṣvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: न सं॑स्कृ॒तं प्र मि॑मीतो॒ गमि॒ष्ठान्ति॑ नू॒नम॒श्विनोप॑स्तुते॒ह दिवा॑भिपि॒त्वेऽव॒साग॑मिष्ठा॒ प्रत्यव॑र्तिं दा॒शुषे॒ शम्भ॑विष्ठा
stanzas.transliteration: ná saṃskr̥tám prá mimīto gámiṣṭhā- -ánti nūnám aśvínópastutehá dívābhipitvé 'vasā́gamiṣṭhā práty ávartiṃ dāśúṣe śámbhaviṣṭhā
stanzas.translation: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Aṣvins are beside us. With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

translations.griffith: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Aṣvins are beside us. With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ता या॑तं संग॒वे प्रा॒तरह्नो॑ म॒ध्यंदि॑न॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य दिवा॒ नक्त॒मव॑सा॒ शंत॑मेन॒ नेदानीं॑ पी॒तिर॒श्विना त॑तान
stanzas.transliteration: utā́ yātaṃ saṃgavé prātár áhno madhyáṃdina úditā sū́ryasya dívā náktam ávasā śáṃtamena nédā́nīm pītír aśvínā́ tatāna
stanzas.translation: Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting, By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Aṣvins.

translations.griffith: Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting, By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Aṣvins.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं हि वां॑ प्र॒दिवि॒ स्थान॒मोक॑ इ॒मे गृ॒हा अ॑श्विने॒दं दु॑रो॒णम् आ नो॑ दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः पर्व॑ता॒दाद्भ्यो या॑त॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ता
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ hí vām pradívi sthā́nam ókaḥ- imé gr̥hā́ aśvinedáṃ duroṇám ā́ no divó br̥hatáḥ párvatād ā́ -adbhyó yātam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantā
stanzas.translation: For this place, Aṣvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation. Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.

translations.griffith: For this place, Aṣvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation. Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
stanzas.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni
stanzas.translation: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णा प्रथ॒मा य॑जध्वं पु॒रा गृध्रा॒दर॑रुषः पिबातः प्रा॒तर्हि य॒ज्ञम॒श्विना॑ द॒धाते॒ प्र शं॑सन्ति क॒वयः॑ पूर्व॒भाजः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prātaryā́vāṇā prathamā́ yajadhvam purā́ gŕ̥dhrād áraruṣaḥ pibātaḥ prātár hí yajñám aśvínā dadhā́te prá śaṃsanti kaváyaḥ pūrvabhā́jaḥ
stanzas.translation: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard. The Aṣvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

translations.griffith: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard. The Aṣvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रा॒तर्य॑जध्वम॒श्विना॑ हिनोत॒ न सा॒यम॑स्ति देव॒या अजु॑ष्टम् उ॒तान्यो अ॒स्मद्य॑जते॒ वि चावः॒ पूर्वः॑पूर्वो॒ यज॑मानो॒ वनी॑यान्
stanzas.transliteration: prātár yajadhvam aśvínā hinota ná sāyám asti devayā́ ájuṣṭam utā́nyó asmád yajate ví cā́vaḥ pū́rvaḥ-pūrvo yájamāno vánīyān
stanzas.translation: Worship at dawn and instigate the Aṣvins:nor is the worshipper at eve rejected. Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

translations.griffith: Worship at dawn and instigate the Aṣvins:nor is the worshipper at eve rejected. Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यत्व॒ङ्मधु॑वर्णो घृ॒तस्नुः॒ पृक्षो॒ वह॒न्ना रथो॑ वर्तते वाम् मनो॑जवा अश्विना॒ वात॑रंहा॒ येना॑तिया॒थो दु॑रि॒तानि॒ विश्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyatvaṅ mádhuvarṇo ghr̥tásnuḥ pŕ̥kṣo váhann ā́ rátho vartate vām mánojavā aśvinā vā́taraṃhāḥ- yénātiyāthó duritā́ni víśvā
stanzas.translation: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither, Swift as thought, Aṣvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

translations.griffith: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither, Swift as thought, Aṣvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो भूयि॑ष्ठं॒ नास॑त्याभ्यां वि॒वेष॒ चनि॑ष्ठं पि॒त्वो रर॑ते विभा॒गे स तो॒कम॑स्य पीपर॒च्छमी॑भि॒रनू॑र्ध्वभासः॒ सद॒मित्तु॑तुर्यात्
stanzas.transliteration: yó bhū́yiṣṭhaṃ nā́satyābhyāṃ vivéṣa cániṣṭham pitvó rárate vibhāgé sá tokám asya pīparac chámībhir ánūrdhvabhāsaḥ sádam ít tuturyāt
stanzas.translation: He who hath served most often the Nâsatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution, Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

translations.griffith: He who hath served most often the Nâsatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution, Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

stanzas.sanskrit: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
stanzas.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni
stanzas.translation: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy ildance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy ildance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वि॑ना॒वेह ग॑च्छतं॒ नास॑त्या॒ मा वि वे॑नतम् हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
stanzas.transliteration: áśvināv éhá gachataṃ nā́satyā mā́ ví venatam haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa
stanzas.translation: YE Aṣvins, hither come to us: Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

translations.griffith: YE Aṣvins, hither come to us: Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वि॑ना हरि॒णावि॑व गौ॒रावि॒वानु॒ यव॑सम् हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
stanzas.transliteration: áśvinā hariṇā́v iva gaurā́v ivā́nu yávasam haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa
stanzas.translation: O Aṣvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

translations.griffith: O Aṣvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वि॑ना वाजिनीवसू जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञमि॒ष्टये॑ हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
stanzas.transliteration: áśvinā vājinīvasū juṣéthāṃ yajñám iṣṭáye haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa
stanzas.translation: O Aṣvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

translations.griffith: O Aṣvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अत्रि॒र्यद्वा॑मव॒रोह॑न्नृ॒बीस॒मजो॑हवी॒न्नाध॑मानेव॒ योषा॑ श्ये॒नस्य॑ चि॒ज्जव॑सा॒ नूत॑ने॒नाग॑च्छतमश्विना॒ शंत॑मेन
stanzas.transliteration: átrir yád vām avaróhann r̥bī́sam ájohavīn nā́dhamāneva yóṣā śyenásya cij jávasā nū́tanena- -ā́gachatam aśvinā śáṃtamena
stanzas.translation: As Atri when descending to the cavem called on you loudly like a wailing woman. Ye came to him, O Aṣvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

translations.griffith: As Atri when descending to the cavem called on you loudly like a wailing woman. Ye came to him, O Aṣvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि जि॑हीष्व वनस्पते॒ योनिः॒ सूष्य॑न्त्या इव श्रु॒तं मे॑ अश्विना॒ हवं॑ स॒प्तव॑ध्रिं च मुञ्चतम्
stanzas.transliteration: ví jihīṣva vanaspate yóniḥ sū́ṣyantyā iva śrutám me aśvinā hávaṃ saptávadhriṃ ca muñcatam
stanzas.translation: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child. Ye Aṣvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

translations.griffith: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child. Ye Aṣvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

stanzas.sanskrit: भी॒ताय॒ नाध॑मानाय॒ ऋष॑ये स॒प्तव॑ध्रये मा॒याभि॑रश्विना यु॒वं वृ॒क्षं सं च॒ वि चा॑चथः
stanzas.transliteration: bhītā́ya nā́dhamānāya ŕ̥ṣaye saptávadhraye māyā́bhir aśvinā yuváṃ vr̥kṣáṃ sáṃ ca ví cācathaḥ
stanzas.translation: For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wafled, Ye, Aṣvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.

translations.griffith: For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wafled, Ye, Aṣvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॒ वातः॑ पुष्क॒रिणीं॑ समि॒ङ्गय॑ति स॒र्वतः॑ ए॒वा ते॒ गर्भ॑ एजतु नि॒रैतु॒ दश॑मास्यः
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā vā́taḥ puṣkaríṇīṃ samiṅgáyati sarvátaḥ evā́ te gárbha ejatu niraítu dáśamāsyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses, So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.

translations.griffith: Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses, So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॒ वातो॒ यथा॒ वनं॒ यथा॑ समु॒द्र एज॑ति ए॒वा त्वं द॑शमास्य स॒हावे॑हि ज॒रायु॑णा
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā vā́to yáthā vánaṃ yáthā samudrá éjati evā́ tváṃ daśamāsya sahā́vehi jarā́yuṇā
stanzas.translation: Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir, So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.

translations.griffith: Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir, So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.

stanzas.sanskrit: दश॒ मासा॑ञ्छशया॒नः कु॑मा॒रो अधि॑ मा॒तरि॑ नि॒रैतु॑ जी॒वो अक्ष॑तो जी॒वो जीव॑न्त्या॒ अधि॑
stanzas.transliteration: dáśa mā́sāñ chaśayānáḥ kumāró ádhi mātári niraítu jīvó ákṣato jīvó jī́vantyā ádhi
stanzas.translation: The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,– May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, livingfrorn the living dame.

translations.griffith: The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,– May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, livingfrorn the living dame.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हे नो॑ अ॒द्य बो॑ध॒योषो॑ रा॒ये दि॒वित्म॑ती यथा॑ चिन्नो॒ अबो॑धयः स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: mahé no adyá bodhaya- -úṣo rāyé divítmatī yáthā cin no ábodhayaḥ satyáśravasi vāyyé sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: या सु॑नी॒थे शौ॑चद्र॒थे व्यौच्छो॑ दुहितर्दिवः सा व्यु॑च्छ॒ सही॑यसि स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ sunīthé śaucadrathé vy aúcho duhitar divaḥ sā́ vy ùcha sáhīyasi satyáśravasi vāyyé sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunîtha Ṣuchadratha's son, So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunîtha Ṣuchadratha's son, So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: सा नो॑ अ॒द्याभ॒रद्व॑सु॒र्व्यु॑च्छा दुहितर्दिवः यो व्यौच्छः॒ सही॑यसि स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
