stanzas.transliteration: sā́ no adyā́bharádvasur vy ùchā duhitar divaḥ yó vy aúchaḥ sáhīyasi satyáśravasi vāyyé sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky, As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky, As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि ये त्वा॑ विभावरि॒ स्तोमै॑र्गृ॒णन्ति॒ वह्न॑यः म॒घैर्म॑घोनि सु॒श्रियो॒ दाम॑न्वन्तः सुरा॒तयः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: abhí yé tvā vibhāvari stómair gr̥ṇánti váhnayaḥ maghaír maghoni suśríyo dā́manvantaḥ surātáyaḥ sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns, And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns, And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: यच्चि॒द्धि ते॑ ग॒णा इ॒मे छ॒दय॑न्ति म॒घत्त॑ये परि॑ चि॒द्वष्ट॑यो दधु॒र्दद॑तो॒ राधो॒ अह्र॑यं॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: yác cid dhí te gaṇā́ imé chadáyanti magháttaye pári cid váṣṭayo dadhur dádato rā́dho áhrayaṃ sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth, E'en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne'er are reft away, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth, E'en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne'er are reft away, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: ऐषु॑ धा वी॒रव॒द्यश॒ उषो॑ मघोनि सू॒रिषु॑ ये नो॒ राधां॒स्यह्र॑या म॒घवा॑नो॒ अरा॑सत॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: aíṣu dhā vīrávad yáśaḥ úṣo maghoni sūríṣu yé no rā́dhāṃsy áhrayā maghávāno árāsata sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons, To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne'er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons, To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne'er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: तेभ्यो॑ द्यु॒म्नं बृ॒हद्यश॒ उषो॑ मघो॒न्या व॑ह ये नो॒ राधां॒स्यश्व्या॑ ग॒व्या भज॑न्त सू॒रयः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: tébhyo dyumnám br̥hád yáśaḥ- úṣo maghony ā́ vaha yé no rā́dhāṃsy áśvyā gavyā́ bhájanta sūráyaḥ sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नो॒ गोम॑ती॒रिष॒ आ व॑हा दुहितर्दिवः सा॒कं सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॑ शु॒क्रैः शोच॑द्भिर॒र्चिभिः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: utá no gómatīr íṣaḥ- ā́ vahā duhitar divaḥ sākáṃ sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ śukraíḥ śócadbhir arcíbhiḥ sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine, Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine, Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: व्यु॑च्छा दुहितर्दिवो॒ मा चि॒रं त॑नुथा॒ अपः॑ नेत्त्वा॑ स्ते॒नं यथा॑ रि॒पुं तपा॑ति॒ सूरो॑ अ॒र्चिषा॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: vy ùchā duhitar divaḥ mā́ ciráṃ tanuthā ápaḥ nét tvā stenáṃ yáthā ripúṃ tápāti sū́ro arcíṣā sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task. Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds!

translations.griffith: O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task. Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ताव॒द्वेदु॑ष॒स्त्वं भूयो॑ वा॒ दातु॑मर्हसि या स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ विभावर्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ न प्र॒मीय॑से॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
stanzas.transliteration: etā́vad véd uṣas tvám bhū́yo vā dā́tum arhasi yā́ stotŕ̥bhyo vibhāvari- uchántī ná pramī́yase sújāte áśvasūnr̥te
stanzas.translation: So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow, Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

translations.griffith: So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow, Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यु॒तद्या॑मानं बृह॒तीमृ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒ताव॑रीमरु॒णप्सुं॑ विभा॒तीम् दे॒वीमु॒षसं॒ स्व॑रा॒वह॑न्तीं॒ प्रति॒ विप्रा॑सो म॒तिभि॑र्जरन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: dyutádyāmānam br̥hatī́m r̥téna r̥tā́varīm aruṇápsuṃ vibhātī́m devī́m uṣásaṃ svàr āváhantīm práti víprāso matíbhir jarante
stanzas.translation: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight, Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

translations.griffith: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight, Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा जनं॑ दर्श॒ता बो॒धय॑न्ती सु॒गान्प॒थः कृ॑ण्व॒ती या॒त्यग्रे॑ बृ॒ह॒द्र॒था बृ॑ह॒ती वि॑श्वमि॒न्वोषा ज्योति॑र्यच्छ॒त्यग्रे॒ अह्ना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ jánaṃ darśatā́ bodháyantī sugā́n patháḥ kr̥ṇvatī́ yāty ágre br̥hadrathā́ br̥hatī́ viśvaminvā́- -uṣā́ jyótir yachaty ágre áhnām
stanzas.translation: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled. High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

translations.griffith: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled. High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा गोभि॑ररु॒णेभि॑र्युजा॒नास्रे॑धन्ती र॒यिमप्रा॑यु चक्रे प॒थो रद॑न्ती सुवि॒ताय॑ दे॒वी पु॑रुष्टु॒ता वि॒श्ववा॑रा॒ वि भा॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ góbhir aruṇébhir yujānā́- -ásredhantī rayím áprāyu cakre pathó rádantī suvitā́ya devī́ puruṣṭutā́ viśvávārā ví bhāti
stanzas.translation: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches. Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

translations.griffith: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches. Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा व्ये॑नी भवति द्वि॒बर्हा॑ आविष्कृण्वा॒ना त॒न्वं॑ पु॒रस्ता॑त् ऋ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑ति सा॒धु प्र॑जान॒तीव॒ न दिशो॑ मिनाति
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ vyènī bhavati dvibárhāḥ- āviṣkr̥ṇvānā́ tanvàm purástāt r̥tásya pánthām ánv eti sādhú prajānatī́va ná díśo mināti
stanzas.translation: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body. She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

translations.griffith: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body. She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा शु॒भ्रा न त॒न्वो॑ विदा॒नोर्ध्वेव॑ स्ना॒ती दृ॒शये॑ नो अस्थात् अप॒ द्वेषो॒ बाध॑माना॒ तमां॑स्यु॒षा दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता ज्योति॒षागा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ śubhrā́ ná tanvò vidānā́- -ūrdhvéva snātī́ dr̥śáye no asthāt ápa dvéṣo bā́dhamānā támāṃsi- uṣā́ divó duhitā́ jyótiṣā́gāt
stanzas.translation: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as 'twere, erect that we may see her. Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

translations.griffith: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as 'twere, erect that we may see her. Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा प्र॑ती॒ची दु॑हि॒ता दि॒वो नॄन्योषे॑व भ॒द्रा नि रि॑णीते॒ अप्सः॑ व्यू॒र्ण्व॒ती दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि॒ पुन॒र्ज्योति॑र्युव॒तिः पू॒र्वथा॑कः
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ pratīcī́ duhitā́ divó nr̥̄́n yóṣeva bhadrā́ ní riṇīte ápsaḥ vyūrṇvatī́ dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi púnar jyótir yuvatíḥ pūrváthākaḥ
stanzas.translation: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward. The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

translations.griffith: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward. The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒ञ्जते॒ मन॑ उ॒त यु॑ञ्जते॒ धियो॒ विप्रा॒ विप्र॑स्य बृह॒तो वि॑प॒श्चितः॑ वि होत्रा॑ दधे वयुना॒विदेक॒ इन्म॒ही दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः परि॑ष्टुतिः
stanzas.transliteration: yuñjáte mána utá yuñjate dhíyo víprā víprasya br̥ható vipaścítaḥ ví hótrā dadhe vayunāvíd éka ít- mahī́ devásya savitúḥ páriṣṭutiḥ
stanzas.translation: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts. He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

translations.griffith: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts. He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑ रू॒पाणि॒ प्रति॑ मुञ्चते क॒विः प्रासा॑वीद्भ॒द्रं द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे वि नाक॑मख्यत्सवि॒ता वरे॒ण्योऽनु॑ प्र॒याण॑मु॒षसो॒ वि रा॑जति
stanzas.transliteration: víśvā rūpā́ṇi práti muñcate kavíḥ prā́sāvīd bhadráṃ dvipáde cátuṣpade ví nā́kam akhyat savitā́ váreṇyaḥ- -ánu prayā́ṇam uṣáso ví rājati
stanzas.translation: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good. Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

translations.griffith: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good. Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ प्र॒याण॒मन्व॒न्य इद्य॒युर्दे॒वा दे॒वस्य॑ महि॒मान॒मोज॑सा यः पार्थि॑वानि विम॒मे स एत॑शो॒ रजां॑सि दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता म॑हित्व॒ना
stanzas.transliteration: yásya prayā́ṇam ánv anyá íd yayúr devā́ devásya mahimā́nam ójasā yáḥ pā́rthivāni vimamé sá étaśo rájāṃsi deváḥ savitā́ mahitvanā́
stanzas.translation: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might, He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

translations.griffith: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might, He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त या॑सि सवित॒स्त्रीणि॑ रोच॒नोत सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॒ समु॑च्यसि उ॒त रात्री॑मुभ॒यतः॒ परी॑यस उ॒त मि॒त्रो भ॑वसि देव॒ धर्म॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: utá yāsi savitas trī́ṇi rocanā́- -utá sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ sám ucyasi utá rā́trīm ubhayátaḥ párīyase- utá mitró bhavasi deva dhármabhiḥ
stanzas.translation: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee. Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

translations.griffith: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee. Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तेशि॑षे प्रस॒वस्य॒ त्वमेक॒ इदु॒त पू॒षा भ॑वसि देव॒ याम॑भिः उ॒तेदं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ वि रा॑जसि श्या॒वाश्व॑स्ते सवितः॒ स्तोम॑मानशे
stanzas.transliteration: utéśiṣe prasavásya tvám éka íd utá pūṣā́ bhavasi deva yā́mabhiḥ utédáṃ víśvam bhúvanaṃ ví rājasi śyāvā́śvas te savita stómam ānaśe
stanzas.translation: Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pûshan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth. Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Ṣyâvâṣva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,

translations.griffith: Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pûshan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth. Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Ṣyâvâṣva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,

stanzas.sanskrit: तत्स॑वि॒तुर्वृ॑णीमहे व॒यं दे॒वस्य॒ भोज॑नम् श्रेष्ठं॑ सर्व॒धात॑मं॒ तुरं॒ भग॑स्य धीमहि
stanzas.transliteration: tát savitúr vr̥ṇīmahe vayáṃ devásya bhójanam śréṣṭhaṃ sarvadhā́tamaṃ túram bhágasya dhīmahi
stanzas.translation: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed. The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

translations.griffith: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed. The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्य॒ हि स्वय॑शस्तरं सवि॒तुः कच्च॒न प्रि॒यम् न मि॒नन्ति॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ásya hí sváyaśastaraṃ savitúḥ kác caná priyám ná minánti svarā́jyam
stanzas.translation: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all, No one diminisheth in aught.

translations.griffith: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all, No one diminisheth in aught.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑ सु॒वाति॑ सवि॒ता भगः॑ तं भा॒गं चि॒त्रमी॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí rátnāni dāśúṣe suvā́ti savitā́ bhágaḥ tám bhāgáṃ citrám īmahe
stanzas.translation: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper. That wondrous portion we implore.

translations.griffith: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper. That wondrous portion we implore.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒द्या नो॑ देव सवितः प्र॒जाव॑त्सावीः॒ सौभ॑गम् परा॑ दु॒ष्ष्वप्न्यं॑ सुव
stanzas.transliteration: adyā́ no deva savitaḥ prajā́vat sāvīḥ saúbhagam párā duṣvápnyaṃ suva
stanzas.translation: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny. Drive thou the evil dream away.

translations.griffith: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny. Drive thou the evil dream away.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑नि देव सवितर्दुरि॒तानि॒ परा॑ सुव यद्भ॒द्रं तन्न॒ आ सु॑व
stanzas.transliteration: víśvāni deva savitar duritā́ni párā suva yád bhadráṃ tán na ā́ suva
stanzas.translation: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities, And send us only what is good.

translations.griffith: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities, And send us only what is good.

stanzas.sanskrit: अना॑गसो॒ अदि॑तये दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः स॒वे विश्वा॑ वा॒मानि॑ धीमहि
stanzas.transliteration: ánāgaso áditaye devásya savitúḥ savé víśvā vāmā́ni dhīmahi
stanzas.translation: Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence, May we obtain all lovely things.

translations.griffith: Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence, May we obtain all lovely things.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वि॒श्वदे॑वं॒ सत्प॑तिं सू॒क्तैर॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे स॒त्यस॑वं सवि॒तार॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ viśvádevaṃ sátpatiṃ sūktaír adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe satyásavaṃ savitā́ram
stanzas.translation: We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good, Savitar whose decrees are true.

translations.griffith: We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good, Savitar whose decrees are true.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इ॒मे उ॒भे अह॑नी पु॒र एत्यप्र॑युच्छन् स्वा॒धीर्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: yá imé ubhé áhanī purá éty áprayuchan svādhī́r deváḥ savitā́
stanzas.translation: He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night, Is Savitar the thoughtful God.

translations.griffith: He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night, Is Savitar the thoughtful God.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इ॒मा विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्या॑श्रा॒वय॑ति॒ श्लोके॑न प्र च॑ सु॒वाति॑ सवि॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: yá imā́ víśvā jātā́ni- āśrāváyati ślókena prá ca suvā́ti savitā́
stanzas.translation: He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song, And brings them forth, is Savitar.

translations.griffith: He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song, And brings them forth, is Savitar.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ वद त॒वसं॑ गी॒र्भिरा॒भिः स्तु॒हि प॒र्जन्यं॒ नम॒सा वि॑वास कनि॑क्रदद्वृष॒भो जी॒रदा॑नू॒ रेतो॑ दधा॒त्योष॑धीषु॒ गर्भ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: áchā vada tavásaṃ gīrbhír ābhíḥ- stuhí parjányaṃ námasā́ vivāsa kánikradad vr̥ṣabhó jīrádānuḥ- réto dadhāty óṣadhīṣu gárbham
stanzas.translation: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya. The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.

translations.griffith: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya. The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.
translations.macdonell: Invoke the mighty god with songs of welcome; Parjanya praise: with homage seek to win him. He, roaring like a bull, with streams that quicken, A seed to germinate in plants deposits.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि वृ॒क्षान्ह॑न्त्यु॒त ह॑न्ति र॒क्षसो॒ विश्वं॑ बिभाय॒ भुव॑नं म॒हाव॑धात् उ॒ताना॑गा ईषते॒ वृष्ण्या॑वतो॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ स्त॒नय॒न्हन्ति॑ दु॒ष्कृतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví vr̥kṣā́n hanty utá hanti rakṣáso víśvam bibhāya bhúvanam mahā́vadhāt utā́nāgā īṣate vŕ̥ṣṇyāvato yát parjánya stanáyan hánti duṣkŕ̥taḥ
stanzas.translation: He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon. From him exceeding strong fices e'en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.

translations.griffith: He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon. From him exceeding strong fices e'en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.
translations.macdonell: The trees he shatters and he smites the demon host: The whole world trembles at his mighty weapon's stroke, The guiltless man himself flees from the potent god, When miscreants Parjanya with his thunder strikes.

stanzas.sanskrit: र॒थीव॒ कश॒याश्वाँ॑ अभिक्षि॒पन्ना॒विर्दू॒तान्कृ॑णुते व॒र्ष्याँ॒३॒॑ अह॑ दू॒रात्सिं॒हस्य॑ स्त॒नथा॒ उदी॑रते॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ कृणु॒ते व॒र्ष्यं१॒॑ नभः॑
stanzas.transliteration: rathī́va káśayā́śvām̐ abhikṣipánn āvír dūtā́n kr̥ṇute varṣyā̀m̐ áha dūrā́t siṃhásya stanáthā úd īrate yát parjányaḥ kr̥ṇuté varṣyàṃ nábhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward. Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.

translations.griffith: Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward. Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.
translations.macdonell: Like charioteer his horses lashing with a whip, The god makes manifest his messengers of rain. From far away the roaring of the lion sounds, What time Parjanya veils the firmament with rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वाता॒ वान्ति॑ प॒तय॑न्ति वि॒द्युत॒ उदोष॑धी॒र्जिह॑ते॒ पिन्व॑ते॒ स्वः॑ इरा॒ विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय जायते॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ पृथि॒वीं रेत॒साव॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: prá vā́tā vā́nti patáyanti vidyútaḥ- úd óṣadhīr jíhate pínvate svàḥ írā víśvasmai bhúvanāya jāyate yát parjányaḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ rétasā́vati
stanzas.translation: Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streaming. Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.

translations.griffith: Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streaming. Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.
translations.macdonell: The winds blow forth; to earth the quivering lightnings fall, The plants shoot up; with moisture streams the realm of light. For all the world abundant nourishment is born, When by Parjanya Earth is fertilized with seed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ व्र॒ते पृ॑थि॒वी नन्न॑मीति॒ यस्य॑ व्र॒ते श॒फव॒ज्जर्भु॑रीति यस्य॑ व्र॒त ओष॑धीर्वि॒श्वरू॑पाः॒ स नः॑ पर्जन्य॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ
stanzas.transliteration: yásya vraté pr̥thivī́ nánnamīti yásya vraté śaphávaj járbhurīti yásya vratá óṣadhīr viśvárūpāḥ sá naḥ parjanya máhi śárma yacha
stanzas.translation: Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror, At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.

translations.griffith: Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror, At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.
translations.macdonell: O thou at whose behest the earth bows downward, O thou at whose behest hoofed creatures quiver, At whose behest by plants all shapes are taken: As such, Parjanya, grant to us strong shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वो नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिं म॑रुतो ररीध्वं॒ प्र पि॑न्वत॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्व॑स्य॒ धाराः॑ अ॒र्वाङे॒तेन॑ स्तनयि॒त्नुनेह्य॒पो नि॑षि॒ञ्चन्नसु॑रः पि॒ता नः॑
stanzas.transliteration: divó no vr̥ṣṭím maruto rarīdhvam prá pinvata vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvasya dhā́rāḥ arvā́ṅ eténa stanayitnúnéhi- apó niṣiñcánn ásuraḥ pitā́ naḥ
stanzas.translation: Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents. Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.

translations.griffith: Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents. Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.
translations.macdonell: The rain of heaven bestow, O Maruts, on us, Of your strong steed pour forth the streams abundant. With this thy thundering roar do thou come hither, And shed the waters as our heavenly father.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि क्र॑न्द स्त॒नय॒ गर्भ॒मा धा॑ उद॒न्वता॒ परि॑ दीया॒ रथे॑न दृतिं॒ सु क॑र्ष॒ विषि॑तं॒ न्य॑ञ्चं स॒मा भ॑वन्तू॒द्वतो॑ निपा॒दाः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí kranda stanáya gárbham ā́ dhāḥ- udanvátā pári dīyā ráthena dŕ̥tiṃ sú karṣa víṣitaṃ nyàñcaṃ samā́ bhavantūdváto nipādā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen. Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.

translations.griffith: Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen. Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.
translations.macdonell: With roar and thunder now the germ deposit, Fly round us with thy water-bearing chariot. Turn well thy water-skin unloosened downward, Make, with the waters, heights and hollows level.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हान्तं॒ कोश॒मुद॑चा॒ नि षि॑ञ्च॒ स्यन्द॑न्तां कु॒ल्या विषि॑ताः पु॒रस्ता॑त् घृ॒तेन॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी व्यु॑न्धि सुप्रपा॒णं भ॑वत्व॒घ्न्याभ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́ntaṃ kóśam úd acā ní ṣiñca syándantāṃ kulyā́ víṣitāḥ purástāt ghr̥téna dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ vy ùndhi suprapāṇám bhavatv aghnyā́bhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward. Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.

translations.griffith: Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward. Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.
translations.macdonell: Draw the great bucket up and pour it downward, And let the liberated streams flow forward. On all sides drench both heaven and earth with fatness; Let there be for the cows fair pools for drinking.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्प॑र्जन्य॒ कनि॑क्रदत्स्त॒नय॒न्हंसि॑ दु॒ष्कृतः॑ प्रती॒दं विश्वं॑ मोदते॒ यत्किं च॑ पृथि॒व्यामधि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yát parjanya kánikradat stanáyan háṃsi duṣkŕ̥taḥ prátīdáṃ víśvam modate yát kíṃ ca pr̥thivyā́m ádhi
stanzas.translation: When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down, This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.

translations.griffith: When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down, This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.
translations.macdonell: When, O Parjanya, roaring loud, Thou slay'st with thunder wicked men, This universe rejoices then, And everything that is on earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑र्षीर्व॒र्षमुदु॒ षू गृ॑भा॒याक॒र्धन्वा॒न्यत्ये॑त॒वा उ॑ अजी॑जन॒ ओष॑धी॒र्भोज॑नाय॒ कमु॒त प्र॒जाभ्यो॑ऽविदो मनी॒षाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ávarṣīr varṣám úd u ṣū́ gr̥bhāya- -ákar dhánvāny átyetavā́ u ájījana óṣadhīr bhójanāya kám utá prajā́bhyo 'vido manīṣā́m
stanzas.translation: Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel. Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.

translations.griffith: Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel. Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.
translations.macdonell: Thou hast shed rain; pray now withhold it wholly; Thou hast made passable all desert places. To serve as food thou hast made plants to flourish: And hast received the gratitude of creatures.

stanzas.sanskrit: बळि॒त्था पर्व॑तानां खि॒द्रं बि॑भर्षि पृथिवि प्र या भूमिं॑ प्रवत्वति म॒ह्ना जि॒नोषि॑ महिनि
stanzas.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ párvatānāṃ khidrám bibharṣi pr̥thivi prá yā́ bhū́mim pravatvati mahnā́ jinóṣi mahini
stanzas.translation: THOU, of a truth,O Pr̥ithivî, bearest the tool that rends the hills: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.

translations.griffith: THOU, of a truth,O Pr̥ithivî, bearest the tool that rends the hills: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.
translations.macdonell: Thou bearest truly, Pṛthivī, The burden of the mountains' weight; With might, O thou of many streams, Thou quickenest, potent one, the soil.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तोमा॑सस्त्वा विचारिणि॒ प्रति॑ ष्टोभन्त्य॒क्तुभिः॑ प्र या वाजं॒ न हेष॑न्तं पे॒रुमस्य॑स्यर्जुनि
stanzas.transliteration: stómāsas tvā vicāriṇi práti ṣṭobhanty aktúbhiḥ prá yā́ vā́jaṃ ná héṣantam perúm ásyasy arjuni
stanzas.translation: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day, Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.

translations.griffith: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day, Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.
translations.macdonell: With flowers of speech our songs of praise Resound to thee, far-spreading one, Who sendest forth the swelling cloud, O bright one, like propelling speed;

stanzas.sanskrit: दृ॒ळ्हा चि॒द्या वन॒स्पती॑न्क्ष्म॒या दर्ध॒र्ष्योज॑सा यत्ते॑ अ॒भ्रस्य॑ वि॒द्युतो॑ दि॒वो वर्ष॑न्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dr̥ḷhā́ cid yā́ vánaspátīn kṣmayā́ dárdharṣy ójasā yát te abhrásya vidyúto divó várṣanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e'en the strong sovrans of the wood, When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.

translations.griffith: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e'en the strong sovrans of the wood, When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.
translations.macdonell: Who, steadfast, holdest with thy might, The forest-trees upon the ground, When, from the lightning of thy cloud, The rain-floods of the sky pour down.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र स॒म्राजे॑ बृ॒हद॑र्चा गभी॒रं ब्रह्म॑ प्रि॒यं वरु॑णाय श्रु॒ताय॑ वि यो ज॒घान॑ शमि॒तेव॒ चर्मो॑प॒स्तिरे॑ पृथि॒वीं सूर्या॑य
stanzas.transliteration: prá samrā́je br̥hád arcā gabhīrám bráhma priyáṃ váruṇāya śrutā́ya ví yó jaghā́na śamitéva cárma- -upastíre pr̥thivī́ṃ sū́ryāya
stanzas.translation: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuṇa, imperial Ruler, Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Sûrya.

translations.griffith: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuṇa, imperial Ruler, Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Sûrya.

stanzas.sanskrit: वने॑षु॒ व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं ततान॒ वाज॒मर्व॑त्सु॒ पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑सु हृ॒त्सु क्रतुं॒ वरु॑णो अ॒प्स्व१॒॑ग्निं दि॒वि सूर्य॑मदधा॒त्सोम॒मद्रौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: váneṣu vy àntárikṣaṃ tatāna vā́jam árvatsu páya usríyāsu hr̥tsú krátuṃ váruṇo apsv àgníṃ diví sū́ryam adadhāt sómam ádrau
stanzas.translation: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses, Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

translations.griffith: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses, Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

stanzas.sanskrit: नी॒चीन॑बारं॒ वरु॑णः॒ कव॑न्धं॒ प्र स॑सर्ज॒ रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् तेन॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॒ यवं॒ न वृ॒ष्टिर्व्यु॑नत्ति॒ भूम॑
stanzas.transliteration: nīcī́nabāraṃ váruṇaḥ kávandham prá sasarja ródasī antárikṣam téna víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā yávaṃ ná vr̥ṣṭír vy ùnatti bhū́ma
stanzas.translation: Varuṇa lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's midregion. Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

translations.griffith: Varuṇa lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's midregion. Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒नत्ति॒ भूमिं॑ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां य॒दा दु॒ग्धं वरु॑णो॒ वष्ट्यादित् सम॒भ्रेण॑ वसत॒ पर्व॑तासस्तविषी॒यन्तः॑ श्रथयन्त वी॒राः
stanzas.transliteration: unátti bhū́mim pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́ṃ yadā́ dugdháṃ váruṇo váṣṭy ā́d ít sám abhréṇa vasata párvatāsas taviṣīyántaḥ śrathayanta vīrā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: When Varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation. Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose them.

translations.griffith: When Varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation. Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose them.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मामू॒ ष्वा॑सु॒रस्य॑ श्रु॒तस्य॑ म॒हीं मा॒यां वरु॑णस्य॒ प्र वो॑चम् माने॑नेव तस्थि॒वाँ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ वि यो म॒मे पृ॑थि॒वीं सूर्ये॑ण
stanzas.transliteration: imā́m ū ṣv ā̀surásya śrutásya mahī́m māyā́ṃ váruṇasya prá vocam mā́neneva tasthivā́m̐ antárikṣe ví yó mamé pr̥thivī́ṃ sū́ryeṇa
stanzas.translation: I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuṇa the Lord Immortal, Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.

translations.griffith: I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuṇa the Lord Immortal, Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मामू॒ नु क॒वित॑मस्य मा॒यां म॒हीं दे॒वस्य॒ नकि॒रा द॑धर्ष एकं॒ यदु॒द्ना न पृ॒णन्त्येनी॑रासि॒ञ्चन्ती॑र॒वन॑यः समु॒द्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: imā́m ū nú kavítamasya māyā́m mahī́ṃ devásya nákir ā́ dadharṣa ékaṃ yád udnā́ ná pr̥ṇánty énīr āsiñcántīr avánayaḥ samudrám
stanzas.translation: None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic, Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.

translations.griffith: None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic, Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्य॒म्यं॑ वरुण मि॒त्र्यं॑ वा॒ सखा॑यं वा॒ सद॒मिद्भ्रात॑रं वा वे॒शं वा॒ नित्यं॑ वरु॒णार॑णं वा॒ यत्सी॒माग॑श्चकृ॒मा शि॒श्रथ॒स्तत्
stanzas.transliteration: aryamyàṃ varuṇa mitryàṃ vā sákhāyaṃ vā sádam íd bhrā́taraṃ vā veśáṃ vā nítyaṃ varuṇā́raṇaṃ vā yát sīm ā́gaś cakr̥mā́ śiśráthas tát
stanzas.translation: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade, The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuṇa, remove from us the trespass.

translations.griffith: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade, The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuṇa, remove from us the trespass.

stanzas.sanskrit: कि॒त॒वासो॒ यद्रि॑रि॒पुर्न दी॒वि यद्वा॑ घा स॒त्यमु॒त यन्न वि॒द्म सर्वा॒ ता वि ष्य॑ शिथि॒रेव॑ दे॒वाधा॑ ते स्याम वरुण प्रि॒यासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kitavā́so yád riripúr ná dīví yád vā ghā satyám utá yán ná vidmá sárvā tā́ ví ṣya śithiréva deva- -ádhā te syāma varuṇa priyā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose, Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.

translations.griffith: If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose, Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ यमव॑थ उ॒भा वाजे॑षु॒ मर्त्य॑म् दृ॒ळ्हा चि॒त्स प्र भे॑दति द्यु॒म्ना वाणी॑रिव त्रि॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī yám ávathaḥ- ubhā́ vā́jeṣu mártyam dr̥ḷhā́ cit sá prá bhedati dyumnā́ vā́ṇīr iva tritáḥ
stanzas.translation: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight, Breaks through e'en strongly-guarded wealth as Trita burst his way through reeds.

translations.griffith: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight, Breaks through e'en strongly-guarded wealth as Trita burst his way through reeds.

stanzas.sanskrit: या पृत॑नासु दु॒ष्टरा॒ या वाजे॑षु श्र॒वाय्या॑ या पञ्च॑ चर्ष॒णीर॒भी॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी ता ह॑वामहे
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ pŕ̥tanāsu duṣṭárā yā́ vā́jeṣu śravā́yyā yā́ páñca carṣaṇī́r abhí- indrāgnī́ tā́ havāmahe
stanzas.translation: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays, Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

translations.griffith: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays, Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

stanzas.sanskrit: तयो॒रिदम॑व॒च्छव॑स्ति॒ग्मा दि॒द्युन्म॒घोनोः॑ प्रति॒ द्रुणा॒ गभ॑स्त्यो॒र्गवां॑ वृत्र॒घ्न एष॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: táyor íd ámavac chávas tigmā́ didyún maghónoḥ práti drúṇā gábhastyor gávāṃ vr̥traghná éṣate
stanzas.translation: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair, Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vr̥itra's slayer for the kine.

translations.griffith: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair, Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vr̥itra's slayer for the kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वा॒मेषे॒ रथा॑नामिन्द्रा॒ग्नी ह॑वामहे पती॑ तु॒रस्य॒ राध॑सो वि॒द्वांसा॒ गिर्व॑णस्तमा
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vām éṣe ráthānām indrāgnī́ havāmahe pátī turásya rā́dhaso vidvā́ṃsā gírvaṇastamā
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वृ॒धन्ता॒वनु॒ द्यून्मर्ता॑य दे॒वाव॒दभा॑ अर्ह॑न्ता चित्पु॒रो द॒धेंऽशे॑व दे॒वावर्व॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vr̥dhántāv ánu dyū́n mártāya devā́v adábhā árhantā cit puró dadhe- -áṃśeva devā́v árvate
stanzas.translation: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man, Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

translations.griffith: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man, Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वेन्द्रा॒ग्निभ्या॒महा॑वि ह॒व्यं शू॒ष्यं॑ घृ॒तं न पू॒तमद्रि॑भिः ता सू॒रिषु॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हद्र॒यिं गृ॒णत्सु॑ दिधृत॒मिषं॑ गृ॒णत्सु॑ दिधृतम्
stanzas.transliteration: evéndrāgníbhyām áhāvi havyáṃ śūṣyàṃ ghr̥táṃ ná pūtám ádribhiḥ tā́ sūríṣu śrávo br̥hád rayíṃ gr̥ṇátsu didhr̥tam íṣaṃ gr̥ṇátsu didhr̥tam
stanzas.translation: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones. Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

translations.griffith: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones. Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ म॒हे म॒तयो॑ यन्तु॒ विष्ण॑वे म॒रुत्व॑ते गिरि॒जा ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् प्र शर्धा॑य॒ प्रय॑ज्यवे सुखा॒दये॑ त॒वसे॑ भ॒न्ददि॑ष्टये॒ धुनि॑व्रताय॒ शव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo mahé matáyo yantu víṣṇave marútvate girijā́ evayā́marut prá śárdhāya práyajyave sukhādáye taváse bhandádiṣṭaye dhúnivratāya śávase
stanzas.translation: To Vishṇu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut; To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.

translations.griffith: To Vishṇu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut; To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.
translations.müller: Let your voice-born 1 prayers go forth to the great Vishnu, accompanied by the Maruts, Evayâmarut, and to the chasing host, adorned with good rings, the strong, in their jubilant throng, to the shouting power (of the Maruts).

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ये जा॒ता म॑हि॒ना ये च॒ नु स्व॒यं प्र वि॒द्मना॑ ब्रु॒वत॑ एव॒याम॑रुत् क्रत्वा॒ तद्वो॑ मरुतो॒ नाधृषे॒ शवो॑ दा॒ना म॒ह्ना तदे॑षा॒मधृ॑ष्टासो॒ नाद्र॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yé jātā́ mahinā́ yé ca nú svayám prá vidmánā bruváta evayā́marut krátvā tád vo maruto nā́dhŕ̥ṣe śávo dānā́ mahnā́ tád eṣām ádhr̥ṣṭāso nā́drayaḥ
stanzas.translation: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut. Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless as the mountains.

translations.griffith: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut. Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless as the mountains.
translations.müller: O Maruts, you who are born great, and proclaim it yourselves by knowledge, Evayâmarut, that power of yours cannot be approached by wisdom, that (power) of theirs (cannot be approached) by gift or might 1; they are like unapproachable mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ये दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः शृ॑ण्वि॒रे गि॒रा सु॒शुक्वा॑नः सु॒भ्व॑ एव॒याम॑रुत् न येषा॒मिरी॑ स॒धस्थ॒ ईष्ट॒ आँ अ॒ग्नयो॒ न स्ववि॑द्युतः॒ प्र स्य॒न्द्रासो॒ धुनी॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: prá yé divó br̥hatáḥ śr̥ṇviré girā́ suśúkvānaḥ subhvà evayā́marut ná yéṣām írī sadhástha ī́ṣṭa ā́m̐ agnáyo ná svávidyutaḥ prá syandrā́so dhúnīnām
stanzas.translation: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamarut; In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roaring rivers.

translations.griffith: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamarut; In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roaring rivers.
translations.müller: They who are heard with their voice from the high heaven, the brilliant and strong, Evayâmarut, in whose council no tyrant 1 reigns, the rushing chariots 2 of these roaring Maruts come forth 3, like fires with their own lightning.

stanzas.sanskrit: स च॑क्रमे मह॒तो निरु॑रुक्र॒मः स॑मा॒नस्मा॒त्सद॑स एव॒याम॑रुत् य॒दायु॑क्त॒ त्मना॒ स्वादधि॒ ष्णुभि॒र्विष्प॑र्धसो॒ विम॑हसो॒ जिगा॑ति॒ शेवृ॑धो॒ नृभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá cakrame maható nír urukramáḥ samānásmāt sádasa evayā́marut yadā́yukta tmánā svā́d ádhi ṣṇúbhir víṣpardhaso vímahaso jígāti śévr̥dho nŕ̥bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in common. When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the Heroes.

translations.griffith: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in common. When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the Heroes.
translations.müller: The wide-striding (Vishnu) 1 strode forth from the great common seat, Evayâmarut. When he has started by himself from his own place along the ridges, O ye striving, mighty 2 Maruts, he goes together with the heroes (the Maruts), conferring blessings.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒नो न वोऽम॑वान्रेजय॒द्वृषा॑ त्वे॒षो य॒यिस्त॑वि॒ष ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् येना॒ सह॑न्त ऋ॒ञ्जत॒ स्वरो॑चिषः॒ स्थार॑श्मानो हिर॒ण्ययाः॑ स्वायु॒धास॑ इ॒ष्मिणः॑
stanzas.transliteration: svanó ná vó 'mavān rejayad vŕ̥ṣā tveṣó yayís taviṣá evayā́marut yénā sáhanta r̥ñjáta svárociṣaḥ- sthā́raśmāno hiraṇyáyāḥ svāyudhā́sa iṣmíṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayamarut, Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and well-weaponed.

translations.griffith: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayamarut, Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and well-weaponed.
translations.müller: Impetuous, like your own shout, the strong one (Vishnu) made everything tremble, the terrible, the wanderer 1, the mighty, Evayâmarut; strong with him you advanced self-luminous, with firm reins, golden coloured, well-armed 2, speeding along.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पा॒रो वो॑ महि॒मा वृ॑द्धशवसस्त्वे॒षं शवो॑ऽवत्वेव॒याम॑रुत् स्थाता॑रो॒ हि प्रसि॑तौ सं॒दृशि॒ स्थन॒ ते न॑ उरुष्यता नि॒दः शु॑शु॒क्वांसो॒ नाग्नयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: apāró vo mahimā́ vr̥ddhaśavasas tveṣáṃ śávo 'vatv evayā́marut sthā́tāro hí prásitau saṃdŕ̥śi sthána té na uruṣyatā nidáḥ śuśukvā́ṃso nā́gnáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut; For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and insult.

translations.griffith: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut; For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and insult.
translations.müller: Your greatness is infinite, ye Maruts, endowed with full power, may that terrible power help, Evayâmarut. In your raid 1 you are indeed to be seen as charioteers; deliver us therefore from the enemy, like shining fires.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते रु॒द्रासः॒ सुम॑खा अ॒ग्नयो॑ यथा तुविद्यु॒म्ना अ॑वन्त्वेव॒याम॑रुत् दी॒र्घं पृ॒थु प॑प्रथे॒ सद्म॒ पार्थि॑वं॒ येषा॒मज्मे॒ष्वा म॒हः शर्धां॒स्यद्भु॑तैनसाम्
stanzas.transliteration: té rudrā́saḥ súmakhā agnáyo yathā tuvidyumnā́ avantv evayā́marut dīrghám pr̥thú paprathe sádma pā́rthivaṃ yéṣām ájmeṣv ā́ maháḥ śárdhāṃsy ádbhutainasām
stanzas.translation: So may the Rudras, mighty warriors, Evayamarut, with splendid brilliancy, like fires, be our protectors; They whose terrestrial dwelling-place is wide-extended, whom none suspect of sin, whose bands have lofty courage.

translations.griffith: So may the Rudras, mighty warriors, Evayamarut, with splendid brilliancy, like fires, be our protectors; They whose terrestrial dwelling-place is wide-extended, whom none suspect of sin, whose bands have lofty courage.
translations.müller: May then these Rudras, lively like fires and with vigorous shine, help, Evayâmarut. The seat of the earth is stretched out far and wide 1, when the hosts of these faultless Maruts come quickly to the races.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒द्वे॒षो नो॑ मरुतो गा॒तुमेत॑न॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ जरि॒तुरे॑व॒याम॑रुत् विष्णो॑र्म॒हः स॑मन्यवो युयोतन॒ स्मद्र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न दं॒सनाप॒ द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: adveṣó no maruto gātúm étana śrótā hávaṃ jaritúr evayā́marut víṣṇor maháḥ samanyavo yuyotana smád rathyò ná daṃsánā- -ápa dvéṣāṃsi sanutáḥ
stanzas.translation: Come in a friendly spirit, come to us, O Maruts, and hear his call who praises you, Evayamarut. Like car-borne men, one-minded with the mighty Vishṇu, keep enmity far from us with your deeds of wonder.

translations.griffith: Come in a friendly spirit, come to us, O Maruts, and hear his call who praises you, Evayamarut. Like car-borne men, one-minded with the mighty Vishṇu, keep enmity far from us with your deeds of wonder.
translations.müller: Come kindly on your path, O Maruts, listen to the call of him who praises you, Evayâmarut. Confidants of the great Vishnu, may you together, like charioteers, keep all hateful things far 1, by your wonderful skill.

stanzas.sanskrit: गन्ता॑ नो य॒ज्ञं य॑ज्ञियाः सु॒शमि॒ श्रोता॒ हव॑मर॒क्ष ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् ज्येष्ठा॑सो॒ न पर्व॑तासो॒ व्यो॑मनि यू॒यं तस्य॑ प्रचेतसः॒ स्यात॑ दु॒र्धर्त॑वो नि॒दः
stanzas.transliteration: gántā no yajñáṃ yajñiyāḥ suśámi śrótā hávam arakṣá evayā́marut jyéṣṭhāso ná párvatāso vyòmani yūyáṃ tásya pracetasaḥ syā́ta durdhártavo nidáḥ
stanzas.translation: Come to our sacrifice, ye Hnly Ones, to bless it, and, free from demons, hear our call, Evayamarut. Most excellent, like mountains in the air's raid-region, be irresistible, ye, Wise, to this man'a hater.

translations.griffith: Come to our sacrifice, ye Hnly Ones, to bless it, and, free from demons, hear our call, Evayamarut. Most excellent, like mountains in the air's raid-region, be irresistible, ye, Wise, to this man'a hater.
translations.müller: Come zealously 1 to our sacrifice, ye worshipful, hear our guileless call, Evayâmarut. Like the oldest mountains in the sky, O wise guardians, prove yourselves for him irresistible to the enemy.
